title: I'll be back!
text: Came here for a conference and left pleasantly surprised! I was met at the front desk by Silas (very proffesional), who was able to get me checked-in early with no problem!. Jose was amazing and provided a list of stuff to do in the surrounding area. I will be back for sure, room was clean and comfortable could use a tad of TLC.

title: Our NYC home away from home for a week!
text: We really enjoyed staying at Ink 48.  The staff was so attentive, pleasant, and helpful.  We want to give special kudos to Silas, Ivan, and Renee.  Our only disappointment was that the restaurant and bar were both closed for renovation during our stay, otherwise our review would be 5 stars!

title: Not great but not all bad
text:
This was a very mixed experience. Ink 48 was a  reasonably good location but very noisy  and dirty surrounding area. Prefer to live in Midtown area.
Close to all amenities but prepare for lots of walking.
Room was awful in terms of poor standard. There was no dust and bathroom spotless but it was shabby and in need of tlc. That was apparently an upgrade they gave us. I could not sleep in the bed it was surrounded by disgusting marks. Took sheets from linen cupboard and slept on couch instead. 
I am sure when Kimpton group owned this hotel it was lovely at one point.
Would I use again not sure.
Customer service on arrival was met with a lady who had obviously had a bad day. Not friendly. However on departure the male on reception was great even stored our cases for us until departure. He had excellent customer skills. Apologised for our experience of room.

title: Located near Time Square
text:
Good hotel which is very centrally located - 10 minutes walk to Times Square. The hotel has a rooftop bar which was unfortunately closed when we were there 😞, but we got a discount on the price because of it - great.

Lovely service, very courteous and friendly.

Conclusion: highly recommended

title: Best Views in the City
text: Awesome boutique experience with great views! Being on the west side of midtown allows for great views of the NYC skyline. Convenient mini bar in room as well! From the beverage options to snacks available.

title: That Exceptional employee/experience!!!
text:
I’ve had 2 stays within 2 weeks…Chris (concierge/security) has been amazing on so many regards.  I would likely not recommend this hotel (ambassador level with Marriott)…but Chris is that employee that can “bring a customer over”.  Hard worker, customer centric, compassionate and frankly “very kind” in the setting of NYC.

I would recommend this hotel solely because of Chris…everything else is average and adequate…but Chris has been exceptional.

Thank you Ink 48 for raising the bar of my NYC experience…I’d steal him for my company any day!!!

title: Choose this hotel, you won’t regret
text: It’s a clean hotel. Everything is very reasonable. Staffs are nice. Because of my believes, there were certain rooms I don’t really want to have, Ebony, the receptionist made arrangements for me to have another room. She acted patiently and professionally. The customer service in this hotel is worth 5 stars.

title: Good but not great
text: The hotel is located on 48th Street, which means being a 10-minute walk from Times Square despite 11th Avenue being slightly off-centre. The area is a bit isolated, you are surrounded by car dealers and depots. the hotel is actually a bit old. We encountered various critical issues such as the heating not working, electricity sockets hanging on the wall, non-soundproof windows from which the cold entered due to drafts. The noise was consequently notable, starting from the noises of the street up to hearing the music of the places in the surrounding area... personally I expected better, but still acceptable.

title: Near the cruise port
text: Hotel very well located, 1 block from the port for my cruise. Also very close to Time Square. We arrived in the morning, we were able to leave our suitcases there to go visit the city. This was much appreciated as check in was only in the afternoon. Super clean hotel, very warm welcome and very friendly valets.

title: So Sad
text: I am super, super sad to see this hotel go down the tubes.  Ink 48 was always my "go to" hotel when I was in NY and I've advised countless friends to stay there.  The rooms are lovely.  The roof deck/lounge was amazing (now closed).  Print restaurant was great and a good place to meet up with friends (also now closed).  No room service.  No food to be found at the hotel whatsoever.  Almost no staff.  Only beverages are the mini bar.  When asked for a drinking glass or glass for mini bar beverage, was told the hotel only has plastic cups. (?!?) Feels like a hotel quickly going into free fall never to return.  Such a bummer.  And I can't get a copy of my bill.  Have emailed several times, tried calling.....nothing....no answer...no response.... Again, clearly a hotel on life support.

title: Thank you DANA, MUSA and staff!
text: We stayed for a night in the city and WOW just WOW! Firstly, upon arrival we were greeted and assisted with all of our bags before I could even look for help. Musa was right there to help me. He was kind, and assisted me to my room, and help me carry all of my things, because one of my bags had broken and I didn’t even have to ask.  The hotel is beautiful! But when we arrived to the room, I was taken away by how clean it was! It was absolutely excellent. I can tell housekeeping really made an effort to make us feel at home and also provide a safe and clean environment these days it’s really hard to find a hotel that is spotless, but our room was absolutely spotless.   The room was stylish and modern. Upon departure Dana had assisted us with checking out. She was so helpful.  We were running late and she was so kind and understanding. I really wish that there were more people like Dana in hospitality.  Me and my boyfriend both agreed that for New York City, we were blown away by the service, especially from Dana and Musa.  They helped us have a great stay! 10/10 would recommend!

title: Good Stay!
text: The staff was respectful and gave good service. The room was clean and was very roomy. The room was also very large along with the bathroom being roomy. The beds were comfortable and they supplied nice amenities in the room.

title: Worst and nasty hotel ever ,they have tics and they don't clean ,they just said sorry, but get full amount paid
text:
Staid 1 week ,found 2 tics in bathroom and bed ,told the concierge at hotel and just said sorry ..but they get paid in full ...
U wants to stay in hotel full of tics ...
Also  homeless people sleeping in front of hotel 
And they don't do nothing ...
Well ,is disgusting...

title: Not great
text: Not a great experience. The front desk staff and valet/door team were very pleasant, even let me borrow an umbrella but that's about all the positives. View from room nonexistent. No restaurant or bar - they look permanently closed. Not good in a neighborhood like this with literally no great options close by. "No coffee on Monday or Tuesday" in the lobby - what? Every Hampton Inn in America has at least lobby coffee. Rooms are just ok - not the cleanest, and had no new towels or room cleaning one day. Not four stars, maybe two. Also - I still don't have my final bill two days later. I won't be back.

title: city view with a sh
text: The view from the room was terrible and we paid for a city View. The Shower was broken.  Yellow water from bath. Great roof top bar. Good location. Road Noisy kept me awake.  No coffee in room.  No towels on arrival.  Telephoned reception and waited on hold for ages.  I would new new go again.  Staff made aware of all the problems.  Just no where near good enough.

title: Mixed Bag this time around
text: This is normally one of my favorite hotels to stay in NY and it had been a long time since I stayed there.  On Feb. 26, I decided to stay there when I came to town for a private tv show screening with my son.  Unfortunately, it was a mixed bag this time.  The hotel is still fabulous but after I raved and raved to my son about the roof top lounge and the panoramic views,  since this was his first time staying there, I found out the rooftop is closed for renovations until May. 🙄 I also learned that Kimpton no longer owns the property, which is also a negative because anyone who’s stayed at Kimpton hotels knows they are known for their luxurious experience and boutique hotels.  Finally, my son & I were placed in a handicapped accessible room and we experienced a leak while my son was showering.  The good news is that Ink 48 made things right to moving us to a fabulous room on the 12th floor with great views, where we should have been in the first place.  I’m told the hotel, the restaurant and rooftop lounge are all under new management.  Hopefully, the hotel can get back to the hotel I knew and loved.

title: Poor service would not recommend
text:
I spent 6 days at Ink48 with my daughter . On arrival at Ink48  31/01/2024 we were informed that the rooftop bar and restaurant  were closing the next day we should have been informed of this prior as it was one of the reasons I chose to stay here .We were place in room 1706 for the first night . Nice room although some wear and tear but great views . Whilst out site seeing in the second day we were  called by management saying they had to  move us to room 1705 due to engineering issues which I have no idea what that was about as the next night we heard other couple staying in the room .
Also on arrival I was informed that we had to pay a room security deposit of USD 657.93 which would be placed back in my account after we left . I have only recieved a refund of USD 275.40 so far which was paid on 06/02/2023 . We didn't touch the mini bar or cause any damage . I have sent over 15 emails to question this and have received two replies saying the money had been released but it hasn't . They still haven't responded to my other 13 emails .  
This is supposed to be a 4 star hotel which should mean high customer service . This hotel lacks customer service in all aspects . Really disappointing would not recommend

title: Good for a quick weekend
text: The hotel was okay. I am not sure quite 4 stars. We had a few issues. Hotel was either hot or freezing. There was a constant draft when heat was not blowing. The room could have used a refresh. The curtains were in bad shape. Off track and damaged. Constant smell of marijuana day and night. We were right on corner and had constant street noise. Amenities were nice. Bed comfortable. Bathroom was okay.  Staff was polite and helpful. Location was pretty good. We could walk to show and some dinners.

title: Chris Ortiz at Ink 48
text: At a hotel in which I liked everything—the room was big, the beds were comfortable, coffee was available in the lobby in the morning—one aspect stood out.  Chris Ortiz, the bellman, was amazing!  He was so helpful and positive.  I’d come back to stay at the hotel just to see him!  Thanks for everything!

title: This hotel stole my money
text:
Still haven’t received my 700 dollar deposit back. It’s been 2 months…
I’ve been contacting the hotel via email few times, called them and got no response.
This level of customer service is unacceptable and ridiculous. Wouldn’t recommend this hotel.

Ivan was a great help at the front desk with getting me checked in my room. It was very a Fast and easy process and He showed us great hospitality and was very welcoming. Also the hotel was lovely, 10/10 experience! I will definitely be back for my next trip

title: Rude and horrible customer service - Reasons why hotels close and go out of business
text: The customer service at this hotel is terrible. The only nice thing this hotel has are the bathtubs. The people who work here hate the customers, they hate their jobs and overall make the hotel a horrible place to stay. It is no surprise the bar and the restaurant have gone out of business. The hotel will be next. My experience was with the night time pair who checked me bungled their system and charged  me twice at check in for a room that was prepaid was pitiful.  They seemed to find it funny the fact it was midnight and they said that I can't be checked into a prepaid room after paying for it at check in again and again. I am certain the hotel will justify the financials all well and good. They have no hope of justifying the customer service of the two trolls at the desk over night. This building will stand a long time and the people working here at the start of 2024 are nothing more than an ink stain that will be whited out very soon I'm sure.  Javon when you loose your current job and we both know it will be soon... I hope you find yourself left in the cold. You are not a good person and you will get what is coming to you and it will be deserved

title: Staff entered my room without knocking, probably thinking we were at dinner, but I had just gotten out of the shower.
text: Horrible experience. What looked like semen all over the bathroom door and handle and the after cleaning it, housekeeping manager came into our room after getting off shift with her keys and without knocking. She was shocked we were in the room when she entered.

title: Disappointed
text:
I have loved staying here in the past. Comfortable and well appointed rooms. However, I would have liked to know before I booked that the rooftop bar, the restaurant and lobby bar are all closed for the foreseeable future. . No way to make room coffee, nor is it offered in the lobby. They used have a wine happy hour in the lobby but no more. The vibes were just not here.

I

title: Great Customer Service!!!
text:
I arrived at NYC earlier than expected. Check-in for this hotel is 3pm and I arrived around 7am. When I tell you the amazing customer service I received from Javon and Jose C. is definitely worth mentioning. They checked me in, helped with my concerns, and funny! Not a lot of people have that energy early in the morning.

I used to manage bars and restaurants in DC a few years back. Those of us who manage in the industry know, we always hear the bad and rarely the good. You have an amazing staff!

title: Need more security
text: No real security and man non-guest tried to follow me to my room. No one checked on my safety although I told the front desk. Limited food options. My upgrade was not honored but they took the money anyway.

title: Not what I expected or was advertised
text: Hudson room is advertised as a great view but our room on 7th floor was primarily a rooftop and then river was in the distance.  Rooftop bar is advertised and beautiful but 2 of the 3 days it was closed to a private event and was told the rooftop bar and restaurant are not part of the hotel and there's no guarantee of usage.  The view and rooftop were two of the main reasons I booked it so very disappointed on both fronts

title: Great location for cruisers!
text: Ink 48 is less than a 5 minute walk to Pier 88. The hotel has great vies and amazing staff! You a walk from Time Square and located near many great restaurants. If you forget something you need, it’s available within a ten minute walk.

title: ink 48 hotel
text: We frequent Ink 48 Hotel.  We love the rooms (we always book a room facing the Hudson River). We drive into Manhattan from Western Ma. and the location is perfect for that.  Easy location from the Henry Hudson so we don't have to do much driving in the city.  We love Sullivan bakery, just a half block away, for coffee, breakfast treats or lunch.  We are big walkers and find we can get wherever we want from this location.

title: Excellent value.
text: We stayed one night before a cruise and it was very convenient. We drove to the hotel and had no issues navigating to it. There was enough space on the street to park and unload without feeling rushed while checking in. We then drove to a parking garage of our choice, but they also offer valet. The service was excellent.

title: Great Stay but Far Too Many Mistakes
text: We loved the location, staff and room at the hotel. We did not love the inconvenience of accidentally being checked out a day early and then subsequently being overcharged for a night that we didn't stay. I've called at least four times to get a resolution and I'm still waiting. It's a real shame because otherwise, we were thrilled about finding a place we could stay on every visit to NYC.

title: Location is great
text: Walking distance to the Port if you are going on a cruise. It is also a very short distance to Time Square and restaurants, bars and other activities. Food a little expensive if you are traveling with kids but the place is great.

title: Wish I would’ve enjoyed my stay
text: Over priced for terrible service. Looked at online reviews and a lot of people can relate. All this place has to offer to everyone’s reviews was the same answer about apologizing for their service. Won’t be staying here again.

title: Great views, so-so service.
text: Some great and some not-so-great with this hotel.  The location and views are perfect, and the room was very comfortable.  We loved our corner view with comfy bed and great bathroom.  The downside was that service seemed basically non-existent.  No doorman assisted with the heavy front doors, when coming or leaving, despite staff standing around chatting to each other.  Front desk host was casual and nice, but lacked professionalism.  All in all, It was a nice stay.

title: Very nice hotel but a few negatives
text: Very nice hotel (beautiful room, clean and functional) with a wonderful staff (very friendly and helpful - especially Chris).  I dropped it one star for three reasons: it's far from tourist action, very noisy HVAC (my pet peeve with hotels), and I was flabbergasted to pay for drip coffee (out of an urn) in the morning (and coffee makers are not supplied in the room unless you ask for it). We'll not likely return since when we are in NYC we want to be closer to Broadway, Central Park and Times Square, but for business travelers, it may be a fine location.

title: Excellent Staff All Around
text:
From the Bellman Chris Ortiz, to front Desk Cilas, to security, to the housekeeping staff; I could not find one bad thing to say, only great things! They are all very kind, professional, welcoming, work hard to make sure all guests are feeling their best. I highly recommend Ink 48 Hotel not only for their prices but the staff! They really make you feel heard, seen, and well taken care of. This is a gem, I will be coming back here in my future visits, and will recommend all family, friends, and encourage future potential guests to choose Ink 48 Hotel. 

One negative I have to say is not about Ink 48 Hotel, it is about The Press Lounge roof top and their staff. They were horrible and I would not wish anyone who wants to have a great memory of New York to go visit there. From their staff to manager, they were horrible. When I took a short moment to step away from my drink, they threw it away and then refused to make me the drink. Initially, I tried to be understanding, but they were the ones who treated me poorly. I even agreed to not have the drink and just for a refund of my drink for $21, and yet they also refused that. Push came to shove, and they offered me to chug down 3 shots instead. I said no, then they offered me a cheap margarita, but want to still charge me $21 for it. It was completely absurd and down right disrespectful. The staff was all male, and I believe they discriminated me for being a woman as well.

title: Lovely hotel & staff. Not ideal location
text:
Hotel and staff so nice and lovely. Room was clean and large but needs a hook for the towels near the shower. 

Shame it’s so far from the subway so if you plan to use it for tourism I would not recommend. Probably great for Business.

title: Dirty and overpriced
text: Not sure how other travelers found this hotel satisfactory. It is perhaps the worst NYC hotel we've ever stayed in, certainly for the money. When we arrived we were greeted with a used toilet brush in the middle of the room. The rest of the room was filthy. The room is noisy, the sheets are old, everything seems to be run down.

title: Horrible valet experience
text: Trip was fine until departure. Was advised to call 45 minutes prior to receive our car, called at 1009 for an 11am departure. Did not get our car until 12pm, in which I missed one hour of my graduation ceremony. Very inconvenient. Even offered to walk/Uber to the lot myself to get it and was told “no just 2 more minutes” when the car was nowhere in sight for another hour. Very frustrating experience.

title: Faulty towers
text:
Nightmare hotel.

 Booked a king suite city view room with booking.com. spacious and visually appealing. No city view. Photo provided 

Room 303 should be out of service. See list

Windows -  The noise from the traffic woke us from 0745 in the morning and continued all day . At night the noise from surrounding bars disturbed us past midnight. The windows offered no sound proof. 

Yellow water - the bath water ran yellow.

Shower - The shower was broken and dribbled from the shower hose. The majority of water ran down the wall leaking from the pipes. This was reported and not fixed. 

Towels - No towels in room on arrival .

No coffee making facilities. Provided on request.  Coffee/milk  not topped up .

Charging facilities and bedside plugs out of order both sides of the bed. 

Telephoning reception took so long it was faster to go down in the lift.  Call on hold for minutes. 

Do not go off photos. The hotel looks very nice but it's in need of maintenance.

title: Terrible Hotel
text: Please if you have a plan to stay in New York please stay away from these people they will get your money for nothing. This is not a hotel to stay unless you want to waste money. The simple TV is not working in the room. After spending $400 for a night. This was ridiculous anyway

title: Spacious room and friendly staff
text:
Best part of this hotel is Jose. He was so helpful with all my luggage and boxes. He gave me lots of tips for getting around and was so friendly and gentlemanly. 

The bad:
- No easy way to load in and out. There are some big black suvs often in the way. Some guy was sleeping in his and hogging up the "designated" hotel pick up spot. I went around the block 2 times just trying to look for a place to park the car to unload.

- No storage space. They couldn't even hold three boxes for me and instead I had to take it to the room.

- Understaffed at night. The heater in our room didn't work at all and it took many phone calls before someone even picked up the phone at the front desk. The technician reset the heater and when it didn't work, he had to open up the panel to find out the heater wasn't on at all because it was turned off from the inside. Seems like a weird thing to turn off in late November. 

- They do offer slippers here but definitely cheap and not plush for a hotel of this caliber. 

The good:
- Rooms are spacious. Definitely on the bigger side for hotels in Manhattan. 

- We had a north facing room so the view was gorgeous.

- Bathroom was spacious, really liked the ledge to sit on though the frosted glass panel into the sleeping area was an interesting choice

- Staff was friendly and personable but Jose was the best of them all.

title: Achtung: Kreditkartenbetrug!
text:
ACHTUNG: Haben 183$ (!) von der als Sicherheit dagelassenen Kreditkarte abgebucht, obwohl Hotel bei Booking komplett bezahlt war (was uns beim Einchecken auch so bestätigt wurde).

Null Konsum im Hotel.

xxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxx

title: Great hotel for a real value
text: Outstanding hotel for a rational price. Much better than most famous chains. Clean rooms, well equipped, friendly staff. Location is not perfect, but easy walk to most places. Only suggestion is to add a coffee machine to the rooms.

title: Felt like coming home to a peaceful getaway in the middle if the city that never sleeps…
text: Even though there was construction across the street in the front which is loud at times and the usual sirens we slept in comfort . The staff was fun to interact with and the housekeeping over 5 days was impeccable.Cant forget the views from the rooftop lounge !

title: INK48
text: Would not stay here again.  Good location to Javitz but outdated, neglected property with no real dining options.  Tiny shower, small, round desk for working, dark decor.  Fitness center was the worst - old, outdated equipment that did not work, no towels or hand sanitizer.

title: Disappointment Abounds!
text: Room was fine, AC didn't work, street construction at 4am. It was just OK. Front desk didn't seem to really give a crap about my 4am wake up, not even a "Oh gosh, I'm so sorry. Can I get you a cup of coffee?" Learn some fundamental hospitality since this is a hotel.

title: What was a great stay ended on a negative note due to poor parking service at hotel
text: I had an overall lovely stay at the ink 48 last week. The property is clean and feels new! However, I was disappointed with the valet service. It took too long to receive my car so I ended up walking 8 or so blocks to get my car. This resulted in missing my flight. What was a great stay ended on a negative note. I recommend if you stay at the Ink48 and driving that you park on your own at a closer garage to the hotel.

title: An Escape Sanctuary from NYC Hul-la-ba-loo.
text:
The Ink 48 Hotel is marvelously located in the creative hob of NYC, Hell's Kitchen, and near the shopping mecca of Hudson Yards with abundant views of the Hudson River and the Manhattan skyline. My Premier Studio was homey with a sitting area embracing a sofa, chair and utilitarian table. The large windows afforded me empowering cityscape views and the room was outfitted with the usual high-tech room appliances.  The bath was well endowed with double vanity, tub and spa-like shower. The Print is a split personality facility, one part, a grab n go breakfast convenience center and the other, an in-house restaurant, open daily for lunch and dinner. which delights guests and locals with it's farm-to-table culinary offerings . The Press Lounge rooftop is an ideal place to sip a cocktail while enjoying panoramic views of Manhattan. Due to timing, I was not able to try the food here. Other Ink perks include a spa, a complimenting fitness center and ambitious event space.

So, if you are looking for a Hell's Kitchen hotel that shields you from the chaos of centerfold Big Apple.................then try the .................Ink 48 Hotel.....................
............an escape sanctuary from NYC hul-la-ba-loo.

title: Scammers
text: Charged me 600 in extra fees when we arrived. Stayed for four nights, and asked for an itemized receipt. They kept saying that the would give it to me after i checked out. This was suspicous. It dropped down to 200.... room was dirty and dusty, expired snacks and drinks in the snack bar, unhelpful staff. Genuinely one of the worst hotels I've stayed at.

title: Beware the NOISE
text: We love the views and the location, staff are very friendly and the room was spotless, but the street noise transmitted to our 9th floor room made for 3 nights of very poor sleep. Sadly, we won't stay here again. One last comment - you have to buy your morning coffee at $4 a cup. . . I can't remember ever doing this in a supposedly high-end hotel.

title: Spacious and comfortable room
text:
We were a family of 4 and were thankful to be upgraded to a spacious room with a king bed and a queen sofa bed.  There was a dressing table area and a large bathroom.  We appreciated the refrigerator but missed having a coffee maker.  We were members of the American Express Fine Hotels and were given $100 in credit which we used at the take out type breakfast area. 
We went to the rooftop bar in the evening to enjoy New York City from above.  The cocktails were good and mostly $20 plus.
This hotel is in the Hell’s Kitchen district.  Would recommend going to Becca’s Italian restaurant which was a few blocks away.

title: Not worth the prince
text:
Pros
The room is big and it is nicely decorated.
The lobby and restaurant are elegant and nice.
It is easy to find parking on the streets nearby.
Cons
The bathrooms are dated, with mold.
There are nightclubs nearby so it is noisy during the night.

title: I’m impressed!
text: I’ve been to NYC many times and this is definitely the biggest hotel room I’ve stayed in. Way bigger than the usual NYC rooms. I’m really impressed! Service is great and it’s easy to get here from EWR and very close to the cruise ship port. Will definitely be staying here again!

title: Could have been better in my home city
text: Started out really well and then got weird energy from the bell man. Most of the staff is nice, my sheets had stains on them the first night. Outside of that one encounter, my stay was pleasant. The cleaners were pleasant and the staff behind the counter were nice as well.

title: Not worth the money
text: This hotel was not worth the money. Dirty room. Rude staff. No one went an extra mile except door man. Location is good but I would never stay here again. Try and find a better a place that is cleaner!

title: I would give this hotel zero stars if I could
text:
I booked a stay at this hotel through Amex points. We were due to check in Oct. 13th and ended up deciding to reschedule our trip. I reached out to Amex on Oct. 9th to have them cancel and I was told I’d be charged a penalty. Not sure why since I was supposed to check in 4 whole days from then so I had them call the hotel to see if they could waive the penalty fee.  This would be the start of a two week long ordeal of me calling the hotel and waiting on hold for upwards of 30 plus minutes each time to cancel a reservation that I was charged for and did not even show up for. 

Every single time I call there is no way to actually reach the front desk. I’ve been assured by the reservation agent multiple times that they have sent messages and emails to a manager letting them know of my issue and that they will call me. No one ever calls and no one ever picks up the phone at the front desk. I have never experienced such a poor level of customer service at a hotel and I have stayed in hotels internationally of all different price points. Just based off this experience alone I am deterred from EVER booking with this hotel ever again. I can only imagine how horrible it is to actually stay there after going through this ridiculousness just to cancel a booking. 

Run far away from this hotel.

title: Who invited you?
text: It is a lovely property but the staff act as if they are surprised to see someone so un-hip like you checking into their fabulous hotel. The front desk clerks were laughing at some inside joke for a minute before they deigned to serve you.

title: Ink 48- July 2023
text: My husband and i stayed at this hotel for 2 nights in July, overall the hotel is very clean and the rooms are nice snd spacious. Our check in and check out was seamless and took less than 5 minutes. The hotel is located just 10 minute walk from Time Square so it’s definitely located in a convenient spot without the rush. They also have a rooftop lounge/bar upstairs, the view and drinks were amazing! Pink panther was one of the best drinks they served at the bar. Overall we had a great stay and would definitely return.

title: Ink hotel NYC
text: We chose this hotel because of the location to the port. The price is way overpriced for the room. Limited breakfast. Snacks in room were overpriced. If you want a convenient place to stay before your cruise and your ok with the price then this place is for you.

title: Avoid, not we’ll run
text:
Avoid, not set up for business travel 

Let’s start with the basics - the sheets were so old they had holes in them when I arrived.

There is no tea or coffee making in the room; and if you want coffee you have to buy it in the lobby. 

My colleague wanted water at night and he had none left in his mini bar - front desk told him he would have to by some in the nearest supermarket.

I had a problem with my card that it was charged but didn’t go through and just showed as pending, I needed them to send a very simple email to my bank and I spoke  with multiple members of the team about and it has taken days. The management are very stretched and customer service is poor.

title: Disappointing
text:
We selected this hotel for our long weekend in NYC because of the rooftop bar. We planned to have friends visiting us during our stay, and we thought the bar was perfect to entertain our friends.

Unfortunately, the bar was closed the Friday and Saturday night of our stay. There was no notice posted or provided to guests; we only discovered that the roof was closed upon walking up to the bouncer with our friends. The hotel customer service agent said that the rooftop closure was entirely out of their hands because that area is a separate business from the bar. They said that I should have called the bar when I booked the trip to confirm availability on my dates. However, the bar is advertised on the hotel website, so how would I have known to call? 

I was very disappointed that this key amenity, my purpose for booking the hotel, was closed during my stay. I was even more disappointed that the hotel staff insinuated that it was my fault for not having called the bar repeatedly ahead of my stay to confirm that it was not rented out by a private party. Why not notify guests of the bar schedule, so I would have known not to book this hotel?

title: Poor Experience: This Is Not a 4-Star Customer Experience
text:
This hotel has really declined in terms of customer service and experience since changing ownership. There is no longer room service as an amenity. Many of the previous toiletries are no longer available. The heater in my room was broken and one of the metal trash cans inside the room was tarnished (not a big deal, but it should be replaced).

The onsite restaurant food quality was decent, but it was amazing previously. I also had to witness a restaurant manager reprimanding an employee in front of me in the bar area.  It's like the staff had no clue that they were talking about restaurant issues right in front of customers. 

One time during my stay, I called the front desk, and the employee had a tone as if I was inconveniencing them. When I checked out, no one asked me if I enjoyed my stay. They just told me they would email me a receipt when my email wasn't even in their system --- I told the front desk this, and while they said they took down my email I still never received a receipt to my inbox.  Luckily, I asked for a printed copy to be safe. 

Customer service training and employee experience are absolutely linked to customer satisfaction and retention in service industries. While this hotel is still listed as a 4-star hotel, it's really more like a 3-star for based on amenities, quality, and customer service.   

On the positive side,  when I reported my AC was broken, the on-staff engineer fixed it within minutes of me raising the issue. He was wonderful and provided the best service of my stay. 

Management --- ask the owners for more customer service training/budget for your staff and invest in your culture, values, and how staff are treated.  Tough to hear, I know, but customers who don't complain, don't come back.

title: Great location but Roof-Top Patio not for the under 21 set
text:
The Good: Amazing location and really nice bright rooms with a view. Some of the staff were very friendly (Hi Chris!).

The Warnings: This hotel seems to overbook. We waited an hour while they tried to figure out where to put us. There were others in the lobby in the same boat, not sure what happened to them, but we were appreciative of getting our rooms. I notice other reviews have also noted this, so beware.

Also, the rooftop patio is really a night club (and might be rented for a private function, which they do warn you about). If you read the small print, people under 21 are only allowed up between the hours of 5 and 6. We did not read the small print and our 18 and 20 years olds had to miss out. As it was one of the reasons we booked the hotel, we were disappointed.

Otherwise, a pleasant place to stay.

title: Do not assume that rooms are clean when you check in
text:
The room was not clean after I checked in. I entered my room late in the evening to find out that beds are not made, garbage all over, and filthy bathroom. I reported it to the front desk. They sent housekeeping. They cannot fully clean the room as usual since it is late at night. They made the bed, haul the garbage, and clean the bathroom sink. That's it. 
Good thing I was only staying one night. It was not only me who experience this my other colleagues checked in to an unclean room as well.

title: Brilliant
text: Our experience was truly the best. Two couples flew in for the weekend to meet us when we arrived via the Queen Mary 2. The hotel had no idea what a rare reunion it was but when we said it was special they went out of their way to ensure we were catered for- found a room overlooking the water, space for us to meet up, ice bucket and extra glasses and even a great table for dinner- thank you for the amazing location, incredible views and wonderful friendly staff.  As a final tribute, the lifts have a back wall made of horsehair dating back to the days this was a printing factory… it makes an amazing relax massage for your back!  Thank you to all the staff and we will return!

title: “The Stink 48”
text: This place is terrible, and we are reasonable people. Front of house is not up to par. Rooms stink. It feels dirty and dingy. The mini fridge items were expired. There is nothing open in the hotel to get coffee, lunch or food during the day, until 5pm. (The “breakfast” was just black coffee in a self serve carafe, stale pastries and brown bananas). I could not wait to move hotels.

title: Wonderful lengthy stay
text: Fantastic hotel & service! I just spent several nights on business at Ink48, and the hotel rooms, staff, restaurant, and overall hospitality was amazing. Dominick went above & beyond to make our group feel welcomed, accommodated appropriately, looked for solutions to things that came up, and Chris the bellhop/service attendant was super attentive & thoughtful. Great views from all the rooms, classy, and  awesome roof deck experience in the evening with a healthy cocktail list and vibe.

title: Overbooked Warning.
text: Reservation was cancelled due to being told it was overbooked.  This happened the day before arrival.    Called two days prior to confirm reservation and was told it was all set.   Once someone calls to confirm their reservation......why are they on the cancellation list?

title: Awful front desk experience
text: The hotel is a good location. I was there for Broadway and I was close enough to it all but also far away from the crowds. The rooms a re surprisingly large though the hotel is dated. Every one  was nice except one person at checkout who was rude and sarcastic  to me when I asked if I needed to check out. I was only asking to see if there was anything I needed to address as far as my bill was concerned and was returning my key.  Wjen I pointed out to him that I did not appreciate his demenour in a collected manner, he raised his voice and started screaming at me. “What comment is that?” He kept on raising his voice saying I was having a bad day and said I was being patronizing. It was uncalled for and very rude.

title: Worst hotel in NY
text: Worst hotel I’ve ever been in. Noise from cantina next door is ear splitting. Service sucks and restaurant is never open and terrible. They have to solve the noise problem or they will go broke.. rooms suck as well

title: Not a good experience
text:
Not a good experience. Some of the staff (front desk) were rude. Not helpful with questions. 
No restaurant for breakfast. 
Wouldn't stay there again for sure
Wouldn't recommend stay there for others as well.

title: Would recommend
text: Had a good stay here..hotel views are lovely. Location is pretty good, not far from timebsquare about 15min walk. Best of all was the hotel staff. Housekeeping was so lovely. Front desk staff, Darnell, was amazing. He was so friendly and willing to help with recommendations and questions we had. The staff makes this hotel great.

title: Treasure of a Hotel...
text: Had a wonderful stay at Ink48.  Staff was amazing and helpful, room was large and overlooked the Hudson.  It was a quick walk through Hell's Kitchen to Times Square and Midtown, but felt completely out of the hustle and bustle.  Also close to Hudson Yards and the Hi-line.  Highly recommend Ink 48 for those who love NYC but not the craziness of Times Square.

title: Not the hotel it used to be.
text:
I’ve stayed at Ink48 several times and always enjoyed both the hotel and the location, but won’t be back after our latest experience here.  We checked in to our room and noticed a strange smell that got worse the longer we stayed in the room - we realized someone had vomited on the carpet next to the bed and it was not cleaned properly.  

We were heading out, so stopped by the front desk to report the issue.  We were told the hotel was fully booked so they couldn’t give us a new room, but they would send someone up to clean it.  We arrived back to the room later that night and found that the smell was worse, and housekeeping had opened the windows to try to mitigate it.  So now the room was cold, damp and smelly.  After being told by housekeeping again that there was nothing more they could do, we went to the front desk to insist on a new room.  They finally relented and gave us what they claimed was an “upgraded” room on a higher floor, but it was smaller with a strange layout.  We were just glad to be away from the smell, but irritated we weren’t offered a new room to begin with.  

Also, there is now a very loud club across the street that blasts music on Friday and Saturday nights until 4am, shaking the windows of the room even 10 floors up.  Not sure exactly what the $40 nightly amenity fee is for aside from a cash grab.  It’s a shame this place has gone downhill since leaving the Kimpton family.

title: NYC visit from DC
text: I miss the Kimpton touch to this hotel. Service at the front desk is lacking, roof top bar is dated with lounge furniture uncomfortable, and no heads up regarding the very loud club next door that kept us up until 4 am.

title: Loved the hotel but not the noise
text: We loved this hotel. It is a little worn but has a lot of character, the staff were super friendly and nice, the rooftop bar had amazing views, our Hudson suite was spacious with great views over the river, it’s a central location within walking distance to so many things, and the restaurant had an impressive and creative menu. But the noise! There is the usual honking, which is a lot, but there’s also some club or venue nearby (maybe the Cantina) blasting music so loud, DJ screaming, crowd roaring, bass thumping past 2 am both Friday and Saturday night. It was really hard to sleep even with earplugs and a sound machine app. That will sadly keep us from returning.

title: Wonderful NYC Stay
text: The hotel is topnotch.  The staff is very friendly and quick to help with any needs.  Rooms are very comfortable and clean.  Location provides easy access to all the NYC has to offer.  Make sure you check out the rooftop bar.  Fantastic views!

title: What a great hotel!
text:
My daughter and I stayed at the Ink 48 Hotel 9/23 for a special mother/daughter trip in NYC. We had such a wonderful experience.  We stayed here about 12 years ago and decided to book again for this trip. 
Upon arrival we were greeted by Chris, the doorman.  He had a huge smile on his face and was so genuine!  He gave us some information on local stores for items we needed and walking directions to the stores. He started our experience off in such a great way at Ink 48!  
As we were checking in we were told the room we booked had HVAC issues and we were immediately upgraded to a king suite.  What a surprise! Made our trip all the more special! Through the week we had many encounters with some great staff...Jose, Moosa (doormen) always opened the door for us with a warm greeting.  The front desk staff Daniel and Christian were the best.  They were beyond nice and very helpful.  I ended up having such a nice conversation with Christian about theatre and dining in New York City.  He gave me some great recommendations on shows (Moulin Rouge...THE BEST!!) and local restaurants (Aria in Hells Kitchen area). Christian could easily be one of my friends back home.  Such a great person!   
Our room was VERY clean and comfortable.  The housekeeping staff kept everything tidy each day.  We loved returning to Ink 48 each afternoon as it is in a quiet area (does not have the busyness of Times Square).  It was nice to take a break from the crowds of NYC.  As in any big city we were cautious at night and used Ubers to return to the hotel. Overall an A+ for us. Thank you for everything!  We'll definitely be back!    

Some suggestions:  Please provided complimentary coffee in the lobby in the morning. Having to leave the property to grab a quick cup of coffee is inconvenient.  There is a restaurant on property for breakfast...we chose to skip the sit down and get right to the city.  Coffee on the way out would have been nice. 
Bring back the wine hour 5-6pm : )  

One last thought...Kindness goes a long way.  Treat people with respect and kindness and they will respond in the same way.  NYC big city with a lot of people.  Sometimes people just need a smile.  : )

title: Comically Bad
text:
The two queen bed room we reserved had a failed air conditioner, they were unable to fix or move us night one. The room was 82 degrees and humid, it was awful. Night two we were told we would be moved to a 1 king + sofa pull out room. When we arrived in the new room it was just a single bed, again they were unable to move us to a two bed room, so we had to share a bed (we are not on bed sharing terms). Had to stay there again night three. Night four we were moved to a functional 2 bed room with AC. That means only 1 out of 4 nights did we receive the accommodation we paid for.

Additionally the showers in every room were not clean (someone else's hair and fuzz), wipeable black stuff on floor and walls. The first room, I kid you not, had a wet spot on the carpet that soggied my socks. I wore shoes after that.

We interacted with four front desk people during our troubleshooting. Three of four were great, one was awful, unsympathetic, and unhelpful. That really stood out to me as a deal breaker, I mean, I understand being at capacity and a mechanicals failure, but there's really no excuse for poor treatment from staff. He was not just rude to us, but to others as well. One woman came down to the lobby to ask how she might get some hot water for tea, and he responded "I don't boil water." 

The associated restaurants were really good though, so I do recommend eating there, just not sleeping there.

title: Misses the mark by a long way
text: I so wanted to like Ink 48, but it just doesn’t work. There is a weird tension between the hotel and the on-site restaurant and bar. Breakfast is expensive and only a grab and go option, even though there’s a decent sized restaurant (different owners?); the roof top bar lacks any atmosphere, but don’t worry if you have any under 21s with you, you aren’t allowed to stay after the first hour of opening hour and don’t think about ordering an alcoholic drink, you are not allowed?! We paid extra for a room upgrade, but while a great size it looked into a wall and a car park. There are so many better places to stay in NY that offer a better range of hotel facilities.

title: Good Hotel in great location
text: We really enjoyed our stay. The room was clean and spacious. Location was very good. The nightclub opposite did concern us but we couldn't hear it after we changed rooms. I would recommend to anyone staying in NYC

title: Convenience with Caveats: Missing Amenities and Rooftop Bar Limitations
text:
The location is convenient for accessing popular areas while avoiding the NYC chaos. 

That said, the stay had several limitations. Room amenities were noticeably lacking—no coffee maker and an overpriced minibar with no space for personal items. The bathroom had a glass door without a lock, compromising privacy and lighting up the whole room during nighttime visits.

The hotel does boast an impressive rooftop bar with a great view, but this came with its own set of constraints. After 5 PM, the space becomes a 21+ upscale club open to the public. We were traveling with a minor and found ourselves restricted to visiting the rooftop between 4-5 PM. Furthermore, we weren't allowed to purchase alcoholic beverages during that 1-hour window due to the minor's presence.

Given the limitations and lack of flexibility, especially concerning the rooftop bar, we will explore other options for the next visit to NYC. For those prioritizing location and a hip vibe, it might work, but there are significant trade-offs to consider. Safe travels!

title: Surprise in Hells Kitchen - Ink48 great place to stay
text: We stayed for business - 3 nights. Check in was easy and the staff are very helpful, friendly and warm. There is a roof top bar with one of the best night time views of city - worth the look. The hotel was value for money. Having stayed in NYC a few times, in comparison the hotel was clean, safe and not overcrowded, near great restaurants.

title: Loved Loved Loved it
text:
I usually don’t write reviews and this time I decided to take the time and do it. It has been a fabulous experience to stay at Ink 48. Everybody from the staff has been wonderful and I want to especially mention Sergio at the front desk! A true gentleman, went above and beyond to welcome me, super nice and friendly! 
My room was beautiful, with an amazing view and I loved this part of the city, less crowded and noisy; and still plenty of amazing places/restaurants/bars nearby. 
I’ll be coming back soon!

title: Amazing view
text: This is the perfect spot for a weekend trip with friends and family. The hotel has an amazing view of the water and at a very convenient spot for restaurants and cafe. The hotel manager, Ryan, is also very helpful with recommendations and accommodations. This is definitely the best hotel that I’ve stayed at in NYC so far. The beautiful lounge is definitely a must if you’re staying here.

title: Best Stay!
text: We had a really good stay here & had really good hospitality. Ryan the hotel manager helped me and my friends checked in and did such a good job explaining the amenities & proving us tips around our trip to New York City! I recommend staying here and asking Ryan for help!!

title: Staff untangled a difficult situation
text:
We chose to stay at this hotel because of its proximety to the NY cruise terminal --- easy walking distance.  This would normally have been a GOOD decision because it would have avoided the need of a NY taxi.  Alas the ship was not berthed as close as expected.  So a taxi was required.  
STAFF:  Praise for "Andrew"  who untangled a difficult situation with the franchisee breakfast service and arranged for in-suite delivery.

title: Average Hotel
text: The hotel is very expensive and has basic rooms. We didn't eat here because you have far better options elsewhere at a fraction of the price. The rooftop bar is awesome, but the drinks are expensive and average. I will choose another hotel next time.

title: Sneaky Amenity Fee
text:
Charges a $40/night “Amenity fee” 
But there aren’t amenities. Just slow (10Mbps) internet and a gym. And to add insult to injury, they’ll charge you an extra $5-10/night for faster internet. No pool. No business center. No spa/sauna.

No kettle/tea in room

Curtains do not block light. Terrible for non-morning people.

title: Unpleasant and expensive
text:
Oh dear - trying to think of a positive here is difficult. Showing signs of its age , little or no views  of the hudson  , rude staff , mis management  of booking , but the worst is we booked this hotel for that roof which we never got to access . It’s closed until 4 pm, although it serves food under 21’s not allowed up. No take away bar option. Ans huge queues at weekend in a waiting line to even get up. Paid extra for high floor which never happened . 
No complimentary  eater and no coffee facilities in room . Bed not even properly made . Tiny and slightly strange smell in room. 
Staff .. rude , impatient . Unhelpful . Restaurant awful . Breakfast (a stale pastry ) to go . This hotel needs to do a lot of work . The 200 hold on card not even returned (3 days later) which is usually returned on check out .

title: Awesome hotel
text: My stay at this boutique hotel was amazing.  I can’t say enough about the staff, cleanliness of the room and excellent location of the hotel. We were in NY to take a cruise out of the port of NY, the location was one block away, an easy walk to the shop.  It was so close to Times Square too!  Love the huge windows, so much natural light flowing into the room.

title: Brilliant stay
text: Nice trendy hotel, the reception area was lovely with the nicest doorman Chris/Kris, very friendly who helped myself and my mum to our room 1516! All the staff were lovely and helpful. The bar area was very nice with amazing views of the city. The hotel was in a quieter area of the city but walking distance to more lively areas. I look forward to coming back to the hotel!

title: Amazing Boutique Hotel Gorgeous Hudson Views!!
text: This is a very friendly, modern, and impeccably clean hotel!  Hotel were friendly and funny.  The bar staff at the rooftop patio were so nice, didn't annoy anyone to order drinks, and were gave great recommendations for drinks - seemed to genuinely care to enhance our experience.  Absolute Gorgeous Views of both Times Sqaure side and Hudson River side.  LOVE this hotel.  The Suites are so modern with all glass you almost odnt want to leave the room.  WORTH every penny!

title: Ink 48
text: Rooftop bar views amazing and the cocktails were delicious. We did not try the restaurant but have heard good things. Staff is friendly and knowledgeable. Large, spacious rooms, big showers, good location for the price. Cleanliness could be improved.

title: One of the best views of the City.
text: Ink 48 is a gem.  Beautiful all the way around.  Staff was helpful and attentive.  The rooms were clean and fully stocked.  Press Lounge is a must see during the day and during the night!  The food at Print was amazing.

title: No coffee
text: This is still a lovely hotel with an amazing rooftop bar, but I have noticed that so many high end hotels have gotten rid of coffee makers in rooms—please bring them back! Ink 48 doesn’t even provide free coffee in the lobby—you have to pay $5 per cup at their “grab and go concept” bakery. It would be great if guests had coffee included as part of the $40/day amenity fee.

title: Exceptional Staff and accommodations
text: We stayed at the Ink Hotel as it had great reviews and is walking distance from the Javits Center.  Our accommodations were lovely, the room was spacious, with plenty of draws and a roomy closet.  The bathroom was indeed gleaming and also spacious and the sheets were crisp and felt luxurious. The staff was exceptional, they were all authentically friendly, very accommodating and hospitable!

title: Hells Kitchen hidden gem hotel
text:
We truly lucked out with our room and floor. Our room was just lovely and large for New York City standards. It was clean and modern and quite luxurious and comfortable. 

All of the staff were helpful and super nice. 

The only recommendation I have is being able to have a cup of coffee in the morning when I wake up. Other than that I love the location and hotel. 

The roof top lounge was fabulous too. 

Location is 11th Ave and 48th Street- Hells Kitchen - I appreciated being away from the scene in midtown. I prefer a walk and more of a local flavor in a non-touristy part of NYC.

title: Great location.
text:
Great location. Other things are not so great! No room service; no water, no coffee maker…
 I stayed in the Hudson suit, so Intrepid museum was underneath.
Gym was small.
Air conditioning in the gym didn’t work.

title: Terrible
text: If you go there for the rooftop, it's not even part of the hotel. They make it seem so. But you'll be turned away at the entrance if they think your outfit isn't classy enough for them. What's more, they say the bar closes at 2 a.m., but it closes when it wants to. We once came at 1.30 a.m. and were still refused entry. The rest of the hotel isn't worth much. The fitness room is obsolete. Three of the machines are broken. There's nothing worth it, go to a cheaper hotel and you'll get the same thing only better.

title: Stunning views… Other things are mediocre.
text:
I am in the hotel right now.
Hudson view suit.
The views are really great.
I can see Intrepid museum from my window.
No need to go there -I can see all planes with my binoculars!
Unfortunately, other things are not do pretty.
Many outlets in the room don’t work.
It took me three phone calls to get a coffe maker.
No water provided.
Wi-fi is very slow.
There is water in the gym(very small, air conditioning doesn’t work), but no cups.
No soap in the bathroom.
I had ti wash my hands with a shampoo.
I can continue with the list…
A huge disappointment!
However, the views are good.

title: Beautiful hotel with wonderful staff
text:
Absolutely loved our stay there. We were there for 3 nights and had a wonderful time. The staff was extremely friendly (Ivan and Sergio in particular). The lobby is beautiful. The rooms are well appointed. Everything was clean. 

Two small items to point out. They only provide one bar of soap for the entire bathroom. Sink, shower, and tub. Not a huge issue at all but one of those small weird things I noticed. The other was that the shower door didn’t close completely. This let quite a bit of water onto the bathroom floor. Again, not a big deal. 

This was my 18th trip to NYC in the last 12 years. We have stayed at 5 different hotels on those trips. This was by far our favorite hotel and the hotel that we will continue to come to for future visits. We loved the vibe of the hotel and Hell’s Kitchen is just the right mix of NYC for us. Far enough away from the tourist traps that you can really feel the city. FYI…there is a deli across the street and one block north. Great great sandwiches. 

I want to say thank you again to Ivan and Sergio for their hospitality. Everyone that worked there really, but those two in particular.

title: Beautiful team, room and super pet friendly~!
text: The team at Ink48 were absolutely fantastic. Ryan and the staff were amazing, really helpful throughout and we extended our stay a couple of times. Our other guest (our 20lb dog) was well taken care of too as she enjoyed the complimentary dog treats and welcome pets from all the lovely staff. Thank you all and we would really recommend to anyone considering a stay in NYC.

title: Great New Years Trip
text:
Room was gorgeous, front desk staff were so kind they even called us shortly after check-in to see if we like the room. (Maybe that happens at other hotels? I never experienced that before, lol)
Breathtaking view
They offer laundry, but the pricing was a bit ridiculous, they charged at least $5 for every article of clothing (Like $6 per sock)

title: Pleasantly Surprised
text: My first time staying at Ink 48 was wonderful. From the check in desk to bell men and security- staff were attentive and accommodating. Nothing was too much trouble and they made my party feel welcomed and safe. Relaxed vibe throughout the hotel and a complimentary upgrade made the trip even more enjoyable and memorable. Location was perfect as it wasn’t totally on the hustle and bustle of Hell’s Kitchen / Times Square however was still easy to access transport, taxi’s and walk to certain attractions and night life. Would certainly stay here again.

title: Una experiencia bastante recomendable
text: Fuimos en Mayo una semana a New York y nos quedamos en este hotel, nada más llegar una chica llamada Lynn super amable nos explico todo genial y los chicos de recepción también super simpáticos todos, el hotel muy bien y ha unos veinte minutos del time scuare en general cerca de todo lo que queríamos ver, la habitación bastante grande las camas muy bien y la limpieza también estaba bien, lo aconsejo quedamos muy contentos.

title: No Loyalty
text: After staying at this property for years and staying 8 days in June and coming back in July. The king premier room we were given was very small and the bathroom was a shoe closet. The AC in the room stopped working and the front desk staff was not emphatic.

title: Reasonable prices, great views, close to restaurants
text: We stayed at Ink 48 for about a week. The hotel is nice, has great views, comfortable beds, an excellent houskeeping staff, a very nice doorman, and excellent bellmen. The hotel has coffee makers and microwaves upon request. There's also a breakfast bar downstairs for $. It's walking distance to the Metro and Time Square if you don't mind walking :15-20. Lots of good restaurants on 9th St and Restaurant Row on 46th St. Many Ubers/Lyfts/taxis nearby if you don't feel like walking. Citibike rental within a couple of blocks. We felt safe walking around, even at night, except a little to the south near the Lincoln Tunnel and bus station. Overall, a great experience. Would stay here again but may choose to explore a different area the next time we visit NYC.

title: Amazing Stay!
text: This hotel is a fantastic find. Beautiful room with a STUNNING city view, it was a dream. Comfortable, spacious and clean room. Very friendly staff here too. Walkable to Times Square, Waterfront, Rockefeller Center, Central Park. The rooftop bar here, the Press Lounge, is to die for. Gorgeous views of the city and the Hudson. Very elegant decor and vibes. My local friend met me there and was very impressed with what a gem it is. Can't wait to come back!

title: Great views and helpful customer service
text:
The views of the Hudson River are gorgeous and truly helped add to my family's stay. The rooms are large and spacious, especially for a Midtown NYC hotel. 

I want to especially shout-out Foday at the front desk who was extremely friendly and helped accommodate my family's needs. 

Definitely check out the rooftop bar, The Press Lounge, for the gorgeous views and great drinks. 

The only negative we experienced was that the carpets in the room were quite stained and need to be steam cleaned. 

Overall, a great stay and we will be back.

title: Ink48 - Highly Recommend
text: Rooms very roomy for NYC.  Was a really hot weekend and the ac worked great.  Rooftop bar is excellent as is the on-site restaurant.  I'd definitely stay here again. Convenient location.  The staff was very attentive and friendly.

title: Hudson River View
text:
The front desk service was excellent and kind.  Rooms were spacious and clean. 
The roof top bar was a bonus and provided a beautiful view of the city.  The rooms facing the Hudson river provided a lovely view at night. BUT... ask for the coffee maker in your room, the mini fridge, microwave if needed.  They provide them free of charge.

title: Best friends take NYC
text: My friend and had a great time staying at the ink 48. We had positive interactions with the staff, specifically Darnell at the front desk and the gentleman who took our bags. I would rate their customer service a 200%. Darnell was really kind to recommend the beet bagels in NYC. The hotel was very clean and they honored my request for a high floor. The subway and rye hustle and bustle of the city is around a 17 min walk from the hotel.

title: Good stay, great staff
text: Very helpful, accommodating staff. Positive interactions with everyone I talked to who worked at Ink 48. Would be happy to stay here again. Stayed in a suite and room size was amazing, especially compared to other Manhattan hotels.

title: Great location, great value
text:
We are super pleased with our decision to stay at the Ink 48 Hotel during our trip to New York City this summer. Don’t let its affordable  price scare you away. It is simply a great value for your money!

The Ink 48 Hotel is in a great location—less than a 15 minute walk from Times Square. It is staffed with truly kind and welcoming employees—special thanks to Ivan and Ryan for helping us out! And it offers one of the best views of the city skyline in its very own rooftop bar—the Press Lounge. It is also very clean and gives off a hip, modern vibe. We will be sure to choose Ink 48 for our next stay in NYC.

title: Great Place to Stay
text: We really enjoyed our stay at Ink 48. The hotel has a beautiful lobby, delicious restaurants, and a beautiful rooftop.  The rooms are clean and spacious.  I think the gym is clean and is perfect for business travelers. Excellent customer service as well!

title: Disappointing but OK
text: They should remove images of the beautiful roof top bar, we stayed 4 nights and it was let out to a private event all but one night … there is no pre warning of this so it was a bit disappointing to try to use it three times and not be able to. Hotel is Ok, fairly clean. No tea or coffee services in room but they will bring to you. Rooms are smaller than expected but they kindly upgraded us so we were close to our family. I wouldn’t stay here again, you can get better hotels with more amenities for the same price.

title: Great place to stay in NYC
text: This was our second stay at the Ink 48 and we will return again.  The location is great. The staff are very nice.  Last time I was in the city (March 2023) we stayed at a large hotel and decided to return to this smaller boutique hotel for this recent trip.  So glad we did.

title: New York’s finest waterfront hotel
text: The hotel stay was fantastic. We stayed in a Hudson suite and it was well worth it for the views. The staff from the front desk to housekeeping to the Press Room rooftop bar were all outstanding. Thank you to all for your attentiveness. You helped make this a better trip than I even expected

title: Poor accounting
text:
