title: INK 48 hotel is the best
text: The rooms are large and beautiful.  The service was impeccable.  I could not have asked for a better group of people. My alumni association stayed for a conference and the staff was so helpful and available to make our stay a joyful one. I will definitely go back.  Matter of fact, I plan to go back in a few months to bring another group of people. Oh, and by the way the mini bar has everything you need to have a great weekend.

title: very recomendable top hotel! :-)
text: very nice hotel and what a view! we are a family of 3 and will definitely return one day! we‘d recomend it to everyone! and above all, jose colon made our experience even better - thank you so much! :-)

title: Ink 48 Hotel
text: Best hotel I have ever stayed in New York.  Great staff and very helpful.  Rooms are larger than most in New York.  Penthouse suite Is fabulous with 2 balconies and rooftop patio.  Rooftop bar has great view of city

title: Not worth the money
text: The hotel has a pleasure kit which gives the perception that it's a sex hotel. Other then the rooftop which you can visit even if you're not staying there and the size of the hotel room, there wasn't much to explain the value. And be careful of additional fees they will charge you at arrival. This is different for every room but the one I stayed in had a nasty smell, but good think I didn't have to spend much time in the hotel

title: Awesome hotel
text: This hotel was amazing the staff always friendly and welcoming.  Nothing is ever too big too nor small for the staff to resolve. It is such a great hotel.  I give it full 5* views are great.  Location near everything. I have stayed there many many times no complaints.

title: Not everything that is advertised..
text: The room wasn't what was in the pictures for a king suite. I traveled to the hotel from Pennsylvania checked in by 12am. I payed close to $400 dollars for one night to celebrate a birthday on the rooftop. With my wife and some family. Actually the only reson i chose this hotel. To be told it was closed. Which the website posted that it doesn't close till 2am on Saturday.

title: Beyond what was expected!
text:
The front desk greeting agents Ryan & Darnell set the ethe expectation for the weekend stay.  The hospitality from the duo showed their season experience in the hotel duo arena.  

The housekeeping staff kept the same pace of service.  There wasn't a coffee maker in the room and I didn't know to ask for one.  The housekeeper offered to provide it for the room. 

Our room view ☆

title: GREAT SERVICE!!
text: We had such an amazing stay at Ink 48 in our suite celebrating our 2 year anniversary. We loved the views of the city and Hudson river and the exceptional service during the stay. Thank you so much Ryan for the lovely experience.

title: Hip Hotel for couples
text:
Ink48 is an amazing hotel, close to the river and located close to a really cool rooftop bar and restaurant. We stayed in a suite and had great views of the Hudson. Their shower was also amazing with her massage along the wall.

The staff is also super amazing, we were able to store our luggage for the entire day during check in and check out. Ryan the manager was also super accommodating to our situation and just an overall great guy!

title: Very rude head of security
text: Just arrived, came up stairs to the terrace for a drink and a random member of staff started being very aggressive for us vaping, (we where told we could vape by a member staff on arrival) and was incredibly rude and aggressive. Totally un professional and a joke of place. I highly recommend not coming here.

title: Post cruise stay.
text: The hotel is conveniently located near pier 88 so was ideal for a post cruise stay. They nicely accomodated an early check in. The food in the restaurant was interesting and good. The city vista was good.

title: Not great for business travelers
text:
This place was a mixed bag. Hotel itself was fine, rooms were small but fine and its location, for us, was good and that was about it. Got in late after hours on a plane and wanted to get something to eat and a drink. All I could find was the roof top bar that was listed as "elegant". So that would mean after traveling all day I needed to go to my room and dress "elegant" for just a drink and meal!? No thanks.
Then I was on the side with what appeared to be a roof top Mexican Cantina. Even though its website said their hours were till 10 pm there was music coming from there until 2 am! Then there was someone who appeared to be on a bullhorn in the streets in the middle of the night! So between what seemed to be nightly noise and not the most comfortable beds, it just wasnt a great stay. The mini bar did give me a chuckle as not only did it offer drinks and snacks but also a toy kit of sexual items! I dont know, they are apparently consider themselves a boutique hotel and very involved with the Pride movement so maybe they are more boutique than business. Next time I will stay in a more business friendly hotel.

title: Bloodstained sheets
text: I woke up to find blood stained sheets which I had not noticed the night before. The sheets had been washed but the stains were obvious. When I reported it to the front desk manager, he assured me that their inspection process would have picked this up. I can only assume he was suggesting I had made the stains. When I requested restitution for the experience, they offered to comp the amenities charges worth about $80. This on a $314 room plus taxes squalling almost $400. Needless to say, I will look elsewhere on my next visit to Manhattan.

title: AC Problems and Yellow Water
text: Our AC worked intermittently and on the last night it just didn’t work. The water from the faucet also came out brown / yellow every now and again. It just kept getting worse the longer we stayed in our room.

title: Ideal Hotel for a New York Visit
text:
I have been staying at Ink48 for a few years now and I can't express enough how much I love this hotel. From the friendly staff and personal service to the large rooms and amenities - it truly can't be beat!

This past stay in June was especially wonderful because of the amazing service by Ryan - Director of Front Office - and Darnell! They went above and beyond to make sure my stay was perfect in every way - and worked with me to ensure I was able to relax and spend time with my grandchild who lives nearby!

I highly recommend choosing Ink48 for your stay in New York.  You will not be disappointed!

title: Excellent
text: A very nice staff, José Colon, is a special one. The concierge received us at 3:00am and made our check-in experience super easy.  The room was very clean and it complied with all our necessities.  Definitely will be staying again.

title: Wonderful hotrl
text: Amazing service! Everything was smooth and easy. They even bumped my room up to the 15th floor. Then I left my Taco Bell overnight at the front desk because I fell asleep and the next morning they let me warm it up in the office. I even got a nice convenient late checkout with no issues. Highly recommend it, it’s also very afforsdsbke

title: TOP NOTCH!
text:
From start to finish, how staycation at INK 48 was flawless.
The front desk staff, Ivan and Foday were extremely hospitable and helpful.
We booked dinner the first night at the hotel restaurant “Print” and while the portions were small, the food was delicious(endive salad and Duck were superb!).
You are walking distance from the high line and an amazing Bakery.
We had the room 916 which is the Hudson River suite, absolutely enormous, with a huge soaking tub and separate shower as well.
Beds were very comfortable and the views were fantastic!
Downside-ready to not be able to hit the rooftop bar often, our first night there was an event until 9, the second night had an event until 12(so we didn’t get to experience that space).
All said and done, we will be back!
❤️

title: 10 stars if I could!
text: Would give it 10 stars if I could. An amazing hotel! Very clean, spacious, new, and above and beyond staff. Darnell and Ryanat the front desk is so friendly and helped me out with a major printing job that I needed for work (a tedious job he made easy). Will be coming back just for the 10/10 service!

title: Hiring practices are not fit for hospitality
text:
Except for the delightful housekeeping team serving my floor, your employees were rude and unhelpful. 
- I tried to check a bag in the evening and was told there was no bellman. The man at the front desk said he couldn't do it due to union rules. It's unimaginable that a NYC at your price doesn't have 24 help to take a bag.
- I'm nearly 60 years old. Your person at the elevator asked to see my ID and wouldn't take a scanned image. So, I went to my room to get my ID which was inconvenient but not a problem. When I returned to the elevator, I showed my ID and asked your man if he was checking my age. He looked me in the eye and ignored me ... very rude.
- Once up in the bar area, my host asked your staff for the location of the restroom. Upon his return, he was accosted by a large masked in front of his guests/customers (I am his customer) man demanding to know why he was in the area and how did he get up to the bar. Your man continued to interrogate my host in front of everyone while my host was explaining he was sent there by your staff and asked him to stop making a scene. Ultimately, your guy said something like I'm talking to you man-to-man and he didn't like how my host was telling him how to do his job. 

Facilities management is subpar
- The diet cokes were all spoiled, presumably due to heat or old age
- The penthouse dinner area was not prepared for our timely arrival, and the serving area was cluttered.

We're not friends meeting on the street; we're paying you and your team for professional service. Our requests were all reasonable and asked kindly. Ultimately, I asked the other people if this hotel had a gimmick to be rude, given its location on the edges of Hell's Kitchen.

title: Perfect customer service
text:
Foday went out of their way to move us to a beautiful room overlooking the New York skyline after a wedding party had left. Foday then had us leave the bags in our previous room, which were then brought to our new room for us by the time we arrived back after a day out. 

Cannot fault the service at all. And the food at PRINT was excellent too. The chef’s there have done a tremendous job of creating beautiful seasonal dishes that taste as good as they look. Served by attentive but not overbearing waiting staff, I’d highly recommend a visit too, even if you’re not staying at the hotel.

title: Sauberes und ruhiges Hotel.
text: Familienfreundliches sauberes Haus. Da es am Hudson River liegt, ist es ruhig. Liegt nicht Zentral, jedoch ist man schnell am Times Square. Immer wieder gerne. Wenn was fehlt wird dies sehr schnell erledigt und besorgt.

title: Ghetto hotel that scam you !
text: What a ghetto hotel ! From the customer service on the phone,  to the receptionist and to the "manager housekeeping". I came 10 years ago and it was a luxury hotel, here is just a scam hotel that will charge fees on the mini-bar for no-reason, etc... They will try to make you book a "TAXI" that is a shared mini-var for $120 to the airport when you can book a REVEL or Uber for just $67. I really don't recommend this place anymore !!!

title: Very underwhelmed, GREAT STAFF though!
text:
Staff was INCREDIBLY cordial and friendly! Every issue that I came across they were quick to fix, and happy to help. The room was nice, nothing exceptional, and the amenities were very lacking. No microwave, there was no fridge other than the mini bar fridge, and the minibar fridge did not get cold no matter how much I turned it up. The heating and cooling worked flawlessly, sheets and bed were clean and cozy. My room was not cleaned once during my 4 night stay, I was in the room every time staff came and I told them come back later tonight but they never did. I was left without conditioner for 3 days, and kept forgetting to ask the front desk for it ahaha, which is on me. My stay was very average, I don’t regret it, but I wish it was better. The staff really made my experience.

Shout outs to Ivan at the front desk!

-Cat :)

title: Location, comfortable beds and great rooftop view
text: Would definitely stay here again. Easy to walk where I needed to go for this particular visit. Lots of food nearby. Also, Darrell at front desk is a rockstar! Super welcoming and a vibrant, kind personality.

title: Honest review
text: This place was great pre-pandemic but it's not what it use to be. No updates have been made to the rooms, its just older and more worn out and the resturant is no longer full service (grab and go select options and closed at odd times). My biggest complaint was the room being infusd with what smelled like cigarette smoke. It was fine when I walked in but the longer the ac/fan ran the worse it got. After calling the front desk (they said someone would be up to check it out but never showed) and I turned off the air/fan and opened a window the smell dissipated after several hrs but left me with a headache. I'm  not picky nor do I usually complain (this is the first time I've felt the need to write a negative review) but if I'm paying $500 for a room I expect I certainly level of cleanliness and responsiveness. Everyone is very nice but the service was sub-par. I question how they won the 2023 Condé Naste award they have proudly displayed on their website.

title: Wunderschönes Hotel - tolle Lage
text:
Tolles Hotel, 15 min vom Times Square und Broadway und 3 min von Hudson River entfernt.  Sehr aufmerksames Personal, toller Service, Wünsche werden sofort umgesetzt… ich kann jedem das Hotel nur empfehlen.
Auf der einen Seite ist eine Bar, in der immer was los ist!
Das Restaurant im Hotel ist auch für Esser mit Unverträglichkeiten mehr als perfekt und die Rooftop Bar (Minderjährige dürfen nur von 16-17 Uhr rauf- Eltern dürfen dann nichts bestellen) ist mit dem Ausblick der Hammer.

title: Hands down the best service among NYC hotels
text: As a frequent traveler, I’ve been through many luxury hotels around the world, but very few compare to the level of service I was provided at ink 48. From checking in to later upgrading my room, the front desk (namely, Ivan, Lynn, and Ryan) were exceptionally accommodating and polite. They did it all with a smile on their face and were extremely patient with my requests. I’ve heard great things about this hotel from my friends that have previously stayed, and I now understand why. The hotel itself is very beautiful, modern, clean, with all the amenities you expect from a luxury hotel. But what makes it special are the dedicated staff members who go above and make the place feel like home.

title: Terrace View Suite
text: My stay at the Ink 48 hotel was incredible! The staff are all very friendly and helpful. They also went above and beyond to help me have my proposal at the suite. The terrace view suite was an amazing space with lots of room and a view that is to die for.

title: Basically perfect
text: I stay in Kimpton often.  This is a nice one.  Very cool/trendy location.  I had a wonderful room with a nice view.  Reasonably quiet for ny.  The staff was fast and very helpful.  Price is about what you’d expect for the neighborhood, which was fine for work, but I don’t think much of interest for a tourist is nearby.

title: Major Disappointment
text:
When this hotel was owned by Kimpton it was my favorite, go-to hotel in New York.  I returned last weekend for the first time since it has new ownership and was extremely disappointed.  I took my daughter to celebrate her 34th birthday.  I booked a Premier Studio Room which was supposed to have a king sized bed.  No, it did not.  The bed was queen sized. I paid over $600.
The Kimpton owned hotel included a free coffee bar in the morning and a 5:00 wine reception.  This hotel had neither.  The staff was haughty. It appeared that  their main guests are tour groups.  
I will not return and will never recommend to friends.

title: Amazing hotel, fantastic staff!
text: I travelled to NY with my fiancé and stayed at the Ink48 hotel for the weekend. The rooms are outstanding (you wont regret splurging on the upgrade, the view is outstanding). Big shout out to Foday at front desk for making our stay super memorable and Daniel for being very helpful. Can’t go wrong staying here, highly recommended!!

title: Couldn't have been better!
text: Great overall experience! Staff was kind, amenities were top notch, and the location was a perfect fit. I would recommend anyone who is looking at this area to book this hotel. You will not regret it!

title: Excellent Service and Location!
text: Overall, I had a great experience at Ink 48 Hotel; staff was incredibly helpful, and the amenities were great. The room was wonderful, clean, and perfect for my quick business trip in the city. I would definitely stay again.

title: Great location and large rooms
text:
Large rooms, great location.
We enjoyed staying in Hell's kitchen - a part of the city we've never explored. It's a great hotel in the heart of this lively neighbourhood.
Our room was lovely and large - I loved the high ceilings and big windows. The bathroom was large and housekeeping kept everything neat and tidy.
There is a restaurant on the main level which was tasty, and their rooftop bar has an awesome view.
We stayed on the 9th floor and the Mexican restaurant next door does pump out their music...but it stops around 10PM. As the hotel is location on a main road...the honking can be intense around rush hour - but that's NYC!!

title: What is more worth in your opinion, your belongings or the view from the terrace of your hotel?
text: Nice hotel, spectacular overview from roof top but very poor management. I forgot my sweater in the closet and never found it again. They suggest me to subscribe to a web site that could help me to find it. Seriously?!! It’s not just about the value of the item, question is that any of your belongings could disappear at any time of your stay if the people that have access to your room and these that receive them in custody are not exactly honest!

title: NOT as advertised!
text: DO NOT BOOK!  Hotel not as advertised, room is dirty and outrageously priced. Here for 24 hours with 3 grown kids who traveled from Europe to celebrate a bday. Third floor room faces dilapidated building, Windows are  filthy, A  single chair is frayed and stained. Ditto for bed frames. For 4 guests we find 3 towels and 2 glasses. Total cost including hidden “resort fee” over $600. A 5 star hotel on Central Park aware of our situation. has  offered a 2 queen room for an additional $70!!!! Totally dissatisfied with Hotels.com for refusing a refund.

title: Ryan & Darnell at Front Desk! :)
text:
Ryan and Darnell at the front desk could not have been more exceptional! They anticipated my every need and made me instantly feel at home (but in a more luxurious way ;)) 

Ink48 — keep these two gentlemen at all costs!

title: Better avoid this hotel unless you must stay here
text: I would not recommend this hotel as it had so many failures in my recent stay that it cannot be a just one off mistake but rather a total lack of attention to detail on behalf of the management team.  On arriving no one at the front desk acknowledged us for several minutes.  On entering the room the prior guests dirty towels were lying in the sink.  The all on - all off light switch by the door did not work.  On the right wall there was a bracket hanging from the wall but the shelf or mirror that was supposed to be there was missing.  The light switch for the bathroom is obscured by the towels so we had a hard timing finding light in the bath.  The Premier Room that we had booked at a premier price was not very good at all.  It lacked a in room coffee machine, it had no desk to work at, the extra space was mostly wasted by an oversized bathtub in the room (note the grout was falling out from between the stone slabs so bath water went where it was not supposed to).  The breakfast offering was abysmal - a "grab and go" offering better suited to a bus station than a hotel.  In fact the restaurants in the hotel building are not managed by the hotel so they give no benefits to the guests.

title: Ink 48, a great place!
text: I chose the Ink 48 Hotel solely due to its close proximity to the annual The Explorers Club dinner. I wanted to be able to walk back afterwards and knew it would be late. The hotel used to be some kind of printing establishment and is in the Hell's Kitchen neighborhood. While the neighborhoods name came from its infamous history it's a nice place now. Check in was fantastic and I noted right away the professionalism and friendliness of the hotels staff. Check in was friendly, fast and efficient. I had a minor catastrophe when I noted a button on the jacket, I was wearing to the ECAD was coming off. I asked Ivan at the desk for help, and he found me a small sewing kit which saved the day. Thanks Ivan! The room was very nice clean, modern and well laid out. The staff really makes the place and that tells me they have a great General Manager. I was able to talk to "Ponzie "who serves as the initial security screening for the beautiful bar restaurant they have on the roof. He is a very interesting fellow and does a great job preventing problems. The place would be fantastic for anyone who will be cruising from the port here. Although I prefer historic and traditional versus modern, I really loved the place!

title: Exceptional Service and Location!!
text:
What a great place--Every Single Person we interacted with was smiling, helpful, pleasant and seemed genuinely happy to have us there. We were in NYC to visit our son who lives in Hell's Kitchen. From the moment we stepped out of our taxi, we were treated as VIPS--the doormen were amazing and friendly, the front desk at check in was fantastic--Thank you Lynn for giving us a wonderful first impression of Ink 48 and for our fabulous corner room with views of the Hudson and 48th St (and funny, the back of our son's apartment!)

We went to the Press Lounge on Saturday night and had an equally positive experience there--excellent doormen, fantastic waitress. We had difficulty finding seats and one of the doorman found a place for us and brought us to the seats--I felt that was above and beyond and much appreciated! The food was delicious and so were the cocktails.

The room was bright and clean, the bed was super comfortable and the bathroom spacious. As mentioned above, the views were spectacular. Loved the blinds---room darkening as well as light filtering.

The location was perfect for us--half a block from our son's apartment, lots of terrific restaurants within easy walking distance and the theatre district just a few blocks away.

Check out was as positive as check in---Darnell was helpful, friendly and professional. And the wonderful doormen waved us goodbye :)

Start to finish, an exceptional experience--I highly recommend this hotel!

title: One  Night at the INK
text:
The Room view was not as advertised , the Location is a little noise Room is clean  the price is good 
but the booze are over priced .but otherwise the stay was average compare to others. the check in and the Staff were very good

title: Review of Ink 48 Hotel
text: The room was excellent with a vast view of the city. The roof bar is great fun with spectacular views but there is noise from the bar on the 17th floor. The staff was very helpful and checkin was very easy. Great location. Hope the restaurant service continues. Overall good experience.

title: Not what I was expecting
text: The shower smelled like sewer and we had to move rooms. The carpet was filthy. Needs a big time refurbishment. The elevators are dark and need a big updating. The doormen were fantastic. Other than that, not so much for the staff.

title: sigh - it felt like they had given up
text: Beautiful views from my roomv...as long as kept I looking outside. Inside was a different story. Problems included a blood-stained carpet, a moldy shower, and a dust-filled vent.  Disappointed in the hotel and in the Hotel Collection of which they are a part.

title: Best hotel in New York
text:
This hotel is amazing. We loved our room - it was huge and bright with incredible views of the city skyline. 
I was travelling with my young daughter and we wanted somewhere we could bring supper back and relax - the room was big enough to have a seperate dining area and a bathtub! It couldn't have been more perfect! 
The location is ideal. Quiet and away from the hustle and bustle but only a 10 min walk to Times Square. One block away there are a couple of streets with loads of great eat out and takeaway options - foodie heaven of Hells Kitchen. 
The team running the hotel make it special - big smiles greeted us at check in from both the door team and the front desk team and continued all week.
We loved it here! We will definitely return!

title: Great Hotel
text: Other than it being a 10-15 minute walk to the nearest metro station, the location was great. Everything about the hotel is great. Just wish it had a jacuzzi or something of the sort. Since I'm not 18 i wasn't able to access the rooftop bar.

title: Upscale pad with downtown prices
text: This really is a great place.  Very clean and nice decor and Amenities. The staff was very friendly, every one of them.  Would definitely stay again and just a few blocks to the theater district.  Well worth it.

title: Rooms with a view
text: Great hotel accommodated in a great building. Rooms are nice, all with a view to Manhattan skyline and/or the Hudson. Walk to the sub at 50th og 52nd in 12 minutes, Time square or Cenbtral Park in 112-15 minutes.

title: Amazing location, rooms and the staff went above and beyond
text: This hotel is top notch, so elegant and luxurious with a nice rooftop bar. Our room was beautiful, spacious with a nice tub  and great view of the city. Even more impressive than the hotel itself is the exceptional service you'll receive from the staff. Foday is the gentleman that checked us in and went above and beyond to make sure our stay went well! The service was outstanding from the moment we arrived until we checked out. Thank you for making this weekend memorable!

title: Gorgeous Hotel Run By the Best Team In New York City
text:
Plenty of people have written about the beautiful lobby and lounges and well appointed rooms, spacious (for New York) rooms. And y’all can check out the many pictures. This place is as nice as it looks. 
I will focus instead on the team of people behind the counter and at the door and maintaining the facility. As a group, they are next level: warm and friendly, knowledgeable, outgoing, and personable. As individuals, each one made me feel like a friend. . I know they have a lot of guests but they treated me as if I were somehow special and took care of me as if I were the only one. And I bet they do that for everyone.  Walk in with some bills in your pocket because each and every person working will go the extra mile, and so casually that it doesn’t come off as doing their job so much as helping out a friend. But it is their job and so you will want to tip. 
The place is also convenient to Broadway and midtown without feeling like you’re right in the middle of the throng. And ok the next block is one of the best bakeries and hole-in-the-wall coffee shops around.

title: F$&!&N Awesome!
text: Such great help from Darnell and awesome club recommendations Jose! See you again asap! Clean, great rooftop party lounge with awesome views and music. Room was spacious, great linens. All amenities, great breakfast downstairs with real coffee and fresh croissants.

title: favorite stay in NYC
text: front desk staff was welcoming, helpful, and very fast to check us in.  rooms were clean and much larger than everywhere else i’ve stayed in nyc.  Foday was really nice and helped us out so much! would definitely stay again.

title: Great hotel, Foday is awesome!
text: We were staying in New York for a weekend and found this hotel last minute. We got so lucky! This hotel is truly a luxurious experience. The front desk workers were extremely nice, accommodating, and funny. Shout out to Foday at the front desk for being awesome and helping us out. He even showed us to our room and gave us a small tour! Everything is extremely clean, sanitary, and modern. The views are great and it's so close to everything! Easily my favorite hotel I've stayed in in NYC thus far.

title: Jose Colon is the best!!!!
text: Jose gave us the ultimate experience during our time at ink 48. His customer service skills are like none I have ever seen; genuinely caring for the people that come through the doors of ink 48, loving his job & the industry he is in. We were completely unaware that the rooftop bar was not apart of the hotel & that was a huge part of the reason that we came to the hotel— the pictures were outrageous online. In response, he politely stored our bags for us & gave us a tour of the penthouse!!! An amazing experience, he blessed us so big! THANK YOU JOSE! We will be back to say hello & stay!!!!

title: MAGNIFIQUE VUE
text:
NOUS SOMMES ALLER EN TOURISME DANS CETTE HÔTEL POUR LA VUE,

title: Beautiful views and great stuff.
text: When we arrived and walked into our room, we were not too happy with it. I went to the front desk and Ivan was very sweet and helpful. He really made our trip a memorable one. The views from our room were breathtaking! Thank you Ivan for making my husband's bday weekend a success!

title: NYC Adventure
text: My friends and I recently stayed at ink 48, it was a wonderful place to stay, and the staff was amazing. Darnell was helpful, the view from the rooftop lounge was beautiful, and the rooms were clean every day.

title: Sûrement le plus beau roof top de New York
text: Il faut aller boire un verre au roof top, bar cosy et une vue exceptionnelle, de nuit c’est super. Un moment à savourer..  Ne pas oublier son passeport et comme tous les bars à New-York , interdit au moins de 21 ans meme accompagné par des adultes.

title: Valentines Day treat
text:
An amazing Valentines Day weekend made all that much more enjoyable because of the great stuff.

Special mention to Darnell and Jose for their great attitudes and taking care of the little things that make a huge difference.

title: Incredible views!!
text:
We stayed in the Hudson Suite for a staycation and it was just wonderful!! Great views both during the day and at night. Our suite was very clean and comfortable. The front desk staff provided amazing service. Sergio and Ivan made check in easy and efficient!! Loved them!
Rooftop bar was also a huge plus. We’ll definitely come back

title: Great stay!
text: My Boyfriend and I Stood here for my Birthday. The room was a very nice studio with the tub by the bed. The view of midtown was a plus. My only negative is that the Mini Bar was a bit expensive. Room was clean and the staff were very accommodating. Especially Daniel, who checked us in. He was so nice and told us he was the manager if we need anything to just call and when he heard it was my Birthday, he upgraded our room to the studio. That was amazing. Also The press lounge was awesome.  We would definitely come back again.

The room was KING PREMIER CITY-VIEW which could have a river or city view. I requested a city view high up with Lynn (manager) who was  very nice and explained the differences between the rooms, so I knew what room to book! She did an awesome job helping me!!! Upon arriving it was on the 15th floor with a city view amazing!!!!

title: Bom hotel, mas expectativas estragaram
text:
Bom, para fazer a avaliação do hotel, primeiramente é preciso destacar a alta expectativa que estávamos considerando as avaliações dos hóspedes que lemos antes de escolher o hotel. Não preciso nem dizer que a expectativa era altíssima, certo? 

De fato é um bom hotel: cama MUITO confortável, chuveiro bom, quarto muito espaçoso (ficamos na suíte Rio Hudson - tinha sala com TV e sofá, 2 armários, banheira e um quarto espaçoso), bom atendimento dos funcionários. 

Alguns pontos que nos pegaram de surpresa: não tem metrô perto, se você está se preparando para andar de transporte público a melhor opção é ônibus, que para a umas 3 quadras do hoteç (dependendo da linha).

Não há serviço de quarto e não fizeram reposição do frigobar.

O mais frustante foi a vista para rio: não tinha vista. Nosso andar era o 4º e dava de frente para um estacionamento cheio de vans, o que tirou TOTALMENTE  a privacidade, uma vez que as cortinas tinham que permanecer fechadas o tempo todo, de nada adiantou o upgrade :(. Se o andar for baixo, acho que a vista até mais bonita seria para a cidade. 

Gostamos da estadia, mas não avaliaria com nota máxima.

title: Comfortable and Relaxing
text: In a time when Customer Service is forgotten about, Faday and Daniel are 2 gentleman that are great examples of what Customer Service looks like. Thank you both for your excellence and patience. Ink48 has gotten it right with these to gentleman.

title: Avoid this Place
text:
Avoid this place , this is probably the worst hotel experience. 
I do not understand how some guests give it 5 stars !!!
Staff are rude and not interested, hotel is old and dirty , phots on web site do not represent the actual facility now.
this photos are old and not current .
Avoid this dump, much better options in NY

title: Wonderful Hotel
text: We’ve stayed at Ink48 three times and will be returning. It’s hip and beautiful but also warm and comfortable. Impeccably clean, quiet rooms, good location to get to anywhere in Manhattan, but most of all a terrific staff who make you feel welcome and happy to be there.

title: Ivan the GREAT!
text: This is our first time staying at the INK 48 hotel, which was recommended to us by family friends. We met Ivan at the front desk at check in. He went above and beyond to make sure we were happy and comfortable with our room. We travel a lot for work and pleasure and the kind of customer service displayed by Ivan speaks volumes. Thank you Ivan!!!

title: Very pleased with Ink 48.
text: I had occasion to stay at Ink 48, in conjunction with my attending a family wedding. All of the staff, from the door person to the front desk associate and the manager, seemed very pleasant and genuinely concerned with making my stay a pleasant one. My room was very clean and comfortable. I would highly recommend.

title: Deserves Lots of Ink
text: Everything about our stay exceeded expectations. The staff was extremely helpful. As a former printer in New York City, I was attracted to the printing artifacts in the lobby and the books on the bookshelf. And they added one of my books to the collection.

title: INK 48 STAY
text:
Had an amazing stay at this beautiful hotel.  The staff were extremely professional and very accommodating.   Our view from the hotel was absolutely gorgeous.   The roof top bar has breathtaking views of the city and is elegantly cozy, offering light fare and cocktails.  Sergio  is part of the front desk staff and made a wonderful recommendation for a local restaurant called Fusion , which is 2 blocks away.  The food was a Peruvian Mexican and one if the best meals we have had in a long time.   The margaritas were also excellent.  We highly recommend this hotel and we will be back for sure.
Jen B

title: Best Views In The City
text: Best service and views in the city! Amazing time for both work and leisure. The restaurants on property are great, but you also have access to some of the best restaurants in Hell's Kitchen just one block away. Will definitely be back!

title: Best service team ever
text:
This was the best hotel experience I ever had in NYC. After check in, I had some questions about my room and Foday at front desk was so knowledgable and professional about addressing them and helping me out. His kindness and thoughtfulness went a long way. I thought it was rare to experience that sort of service in NYC, but it exists at this hotel, and I felt like my stay in the city started out super positive, welcoming, and comfortable. 

My room on the 10th floor had amazing views of the city.

The housekeeping staff was kind as well. They helped me get a hot water machine for making tea, and smiled and greeted every time I passed by.

Great experience staying here, and excellent location with restaurants and easy access to metro. Would do it again.

title: UNBELIEVABLE.  Beware.
text: I cannot even fathom where to begin with this experience.  FRAUD sums it up, long story short.  We booked two rooms with Priceline.  We received the confirmation numbers.  Upon arrival, a very RUDE Sergio informed us we only had one room.  When I began to let him know we did indeed have two - he said I was mistaken and was extremely judgemental as though this hotel was my first experience.  Highly mistaken.  When I brought the confirmation numbers up, he disappeared and returned.  His attitude was better - but definitely short of welcoming.  We had to give our credit card for incidentals and he said they would handle it.  Well - we got charged for the second room by the hotel AND Priceline.  It has been two months.  Emails, credit card statements, phone calls with Priceline and the FRONT DESK that lets their phone ring and ring.  While our stay was pleasant, this absurd lack of doing what's right lets me sing no praises.  As a frequent visitor in the city, this place will not have a second glance.  The hours spent trying to rectify this is unbelievable, and the runaround/attitude we have gotten from Sergio Sandoval, Andrew Brady, Andy Naibako, Daniel, and Carlynn Ramos - among others - is one for the books.  We were told by Priceline that Carlynn posted the refund on Jan. 13th, and that it was indeed an "error on their end"...they are entirely untrustworthy, rude, and have no idea of customer service. Do better Ink48.

title: Poor Customer Experience.
text:
With all of the choices in NYC I would not stay here. The only reason I’ve giving 2 stars is because the location was great for us.

First, I called when I booked to make sure they had a roll away beds/cots as we brought our niece w us. They said they did. I paid more for a bigger room to accommodate that. They DO NOT have roll away beds and would not accommodate a different room with 2 beds.

Secondly, the front desk staff were unfriendly. It really seemed like they didn’t want us there from the moment we arrived.

Thirdly, the rooms were extremely basic and there wasn’t even an option to get a coffee in the morning.

Lastly the air conditioning in our room was broken. They attempted to fix it but it never got fixed.

Oh wait, I forgot to add that they charge $40 as an amenity fee. For what we never found out.

I travel internationally very frequently and this hotel is one of the worst values. It seems “scammy”.

title: Not values as the price
text: The room was good. But others were under expecetaion considering its price. As you can see in other reviews, staffs were not kind. Not good location. Needed to walk or take bus to get the hotel from other sightseeing spots. It was bad as i traveled NYC in winter. The last one is that the room was noisy. Window didn't block noise, so car sounds including embulance siren interrupted my sleep

title: Not what it used to be.
text: There is still info on the TV saying they offer coffee like they used too in the lobby. They no longer offer water or coffee complimentary to guests in the lobby. We also read children were allowed on the rooftop till PM8. We were therefor devestaded (not exaggerating) when we came at PM 6:20 on Monday only to learn  security said minors were only allowed for first hour and that 8 PM was an exception for the new year holiday. We wanted to show our now 14 y.o. and 4 y.o. The rooftop where we got married from an evening view. But there was no reasoning wirh the doorman. We were leaving the day after and could not return. Although friendly doorman and receptionist we feel this place has lost its charm and warm touch. Slamming of the doors at night kept waking us up. The price is definiteöy not worth it. The place is not what it used to be.

title: Hidden Gem in Manhattan
text: Comfortable beds, spacious rooms, clean hotel, great service. I really liked the location as it was within walking distance to many attractions yet tucked away nicely so you can avoid the everyday hustle-bustle of Central Manhattan. I like a nice cup of coffee to start my day and was very disappointed with the drip coffee at the Print restaurant downstairs. I would suggest requesting a Keurig machine to your room or walking 5 mins to the Jolly Goat! Overall, a positive experience!

title: Sergio
text:
Forget what the actual problem was, or call it a misunderstanding. Sergio was able to communicate, handle, and respectively take care of me. He is an asset to the organization. 

I’ve worked in the hospitality industry for a few years and I recognize an MVP when I see one. Regardless of my situation, it simply doesnt matter. He swiftly took control of it, and handled ir appropriately. He went above and beyone and truly cares about guests stay.

There are plenty of great hotels to choose from in NYC, but because of Sergio I will make it a point to come backcto ink. He is seriously GM material! 

Thanks for making my stay!

title: Not the kimpton anymore
text: You need to request a coffee maker in your room. Kimpton had complimentary coffee downstairs. Not anymore. Feel like the restaurant has gone downhill. Doors are very heavy on the street. Need a doorman there at all times

title: Absolutely lovely
text:
Ink48 is super boujee, and I absolutely loved it. 

The room itself was very modern, clean, and spacious. I was also lucky to have a pretty good view from my room too. The bathroom had a wonderfully large tub to soak in after a long day of walking around the city, and the walk in shower has a massive shower head that immerses your entire body in hot water, and it’s so relaxing. 

They have a killer rooftop bar with amazing views of the city, and a blissfully creative drink menu.

Friendly staff, well kept, and just took our weekend trip to the city to the next level. Can’t recommend it enough. 

I’ll be back for sure.

title: Great stay!
text: If you're headed to NYC, please give Ink 48 a try. Our room was surprisingly spacious and even included a soaking tub! The view from our room was nice, and the rooftop bar and view was stunning! Friendly/helpful staff! And close enough to walk to the major tourist attractions! 5 stars!

title: Not bad, but not worth it
text:
The room was not ready upon arrival at 3:00p.  

The view (we paid extra for a Premium King room on an upper floor) was terrific.  Otherwise, the room was clean but felt a bit tired and cheap - very clearly the product of a hasty, discount renovation.  Overall the experience was fine, but not worth what we paid.

title: This is what royalty feels like when you're being Pampered
text:
Last night I stayed at the world Famous Ink 48 Hotel in Hells Kitchen on 48th and 11th Avenue. From the moment I pulled up to hotel I was greeted with a warm and pleasant  welcome to the Ink 48 and would you like to check in via through their Kiosk service if you pre-registered or if you like you could go to  concierge service  and check In.  After being check in by Ms. Cierra who was such a professional at her job got me checked in a jiff with ease.  I stayed in one of their Jr. Suites and  Omg! I felt like royalty for the day and just think I get to experience it all again tonight! 

My room was so comfortable and my view of the Hudson was superb!  When it was time to pamper myself, I stepped into this amazing Spa Shower  I felt like singing Papa Got a brand New Bag by James Brown while being hit with shower jets at all angles coming at you from every which way! Then I stepped over to the his and hers sinks and grabbed a shave with the magnifying mirror and Omg my face felt like a baby smooth face.  Then it was time to order dinner and I ordered Uber Eats because the hotel was rented out for a Christmas event last night but tonight I'm dinning in tonight after my Christmas party tonight! I cant wait to get back to my  room and not drive home until tomorrow.

Sincerly,

David Rose From the Poconos!

title: Hochpreisig aber gut
text: Wir haben drei Nächte dort geschlafen. Das Zimmer war geräumig, ich fand es gemütlich. Die Preise in NY super hoch. Die Resortfee von 45€ zuzüglich finde ich sehr Happich. Frühstück gab es auch nicht und das für 300€ +

title: Extra charges are ridiculous
text: I have stayed here for 10 plus years but they are now charging a $40 resort fee per day. It’s definitely not a resort! No pool and tiny fitness center full of broken equipment. Great location for theatre but time to find a new place.

title: Christmas Vacation
text: Hotel is so cute! Our room was in the 14th floor & the views were amazing. Was very happy with the service especially for the rate. Staff were all very helpful - Darell checked us in & out & was super helpful!! Would recommend for anyone stay in the city. Will be returning!

title: What a rip off
text:
We were at the hotel when Conde Nast rating as #3 Hotel in NYC came through in November.
It is a travesty!
We wanted to have breakfast on the Friday morning and went to the café area. After some negotiation we were able to get coffee in a cup. That is proper size porcelain cup, not paper rubbish. The same people were there the next day so it wasn’t a problem.
Later some women who appeared to be in charge refused point blank to provide anything but paper cups despite the area serving food to customers on plates with cutlery. We were told it was a grab and go facility!! Clearly not with people sitting and table service!
When we left we got a huge bill which I queried having prepaid accommodation and was told it was a USD 40 per day “Facility fee” .
What facility ??? I was told the internet, the gym and the bicycles. All we used was the internet. Who in their right mind would ride a bicycle in New York!
It was an expensive rip off that we were not told about when we arrived and didn’t appear when the Hotel was booked. I was aware of these fees being charged in NYC and would not have booked such an obvious rip off.
Incidentally the facility field in the  similar hotel in Nth Hollywood was USD 1.25 per day!

title: Nice location shame about the staff and nightclub nextdoor
text: Great location and room size but the staff are pretty unfriendly (other than the doorman). The first room was not clean and the charge for water in the room is criminal. There is a nightclub next door which creates a lot of noise at 3am in the morning  not just the nightclub goers. The taxi drivers were all chatting! There are some good restaurants nearby ciprazzi for pizza and westway diner for breakfast. Thai at obao was also a good choice.

title: Awesome Service!
text:
Ink 48 is a beautiful hotel with great rooms! 

And the staff is even better!!! So welcoming, helpful and kind! Jose Colon went above and beyond for me and brightened my day with his kindness! 

Thank you ink 48!!!

title: Not the best value for money…
text:
Arrived at hotel and waited 15 minutes to be checked in…. also faced with a ‘resort tax’ of $230 for 5 nights.  The receptionist stated it was partly a city tax, but mostly a resort tax!!!  Room offered was on the 3rd floor, a ‘quiet room’, yeah right…. next to the lifts!!!!

USB chargers not working and room not very clean,  finger prints on drinking glasses, dust on picture frames, films on demand being charged at $22! A complete rip off.

title: Ink 48
text: Darrell made our stay at ink 48 a delight! We had some issues with reservation and he was able to help solve our problems in a kind way. The hotel is great! My favorite part is the rooftop bar! Beautiful view

title: Son’s 17th Birthday NYC trip
text:
We stayed at Ink 48 for a family trip. When we arrived Sergio greeted us and informed us that he had upgraded our 1 room with 2 double beds to 2 rooms with kind size beds. We were thrilled and it made our stay and NYC trip the best birthday for my son and a very special get away for my wife and I.

I highly recommended Ink 48 to anyone that wants a very enjoyable time and experience in Hell’s Kitchen! 

Thanks again Sergio!!

title: Great place great price great view
text: My friends and work collaborators came for a trade show and we were so pleasantly surprised with not only a mishap in not booking enough nights and hoping for the best the staff took care of us and we were provided the opportunity to upgrade for the entire trip to allow us more room and great views of the Hudson!

title: Thank you Darnell
text: Darnell was an amazing. He was friendly, easy to talk to and made the check in process straightforward. The Restaurant inside the hotel was delicious. Next time I'm gonna definitely be coming back here!

title: Girls weekend getaway
text: I stayed at the hotel for 2 days, parking was crazy as expected in NYC so the hotel had a offsite parking garage they recommended and was told they would stamp my valet ticket for a 'discounted' price. After 36 hours I walked (no car service to take me) the 7-10 blocks to the garage I parked my car at, only to find out there was no discounted rate as the garage said they are not affiliated with the hotel. Either way I had to pay for my car to get out of the garage. The staff at the front desk barley made eye contact upon check in or check out, the bellmen however we friendly and engaging. They were the true stars of the front end of the hotel. The rooftop bar was a great feature, however again the staff was unengaging and it took 25 mins to get someone's attention to get a drink, please note I left the one bartender after 20 mins to wait at the other end for 5 more mins before getting a hello. The rooms were great, clean, nice, however no cleaning services in between nights. No one came and made the beds or took out the trash, just seems like for the amount of money you're paying taking out the trash daily would be nice. Also it would be nice to have a coffee maker in the room for an early morning cup of coffee but that was lacking as well.

title: Upscale comfort in NYC
text: We stayed for a weekend while attending a conference, and were pleasantly surprised by the comfort of this hotel. The room was among the most spacious we have encountered in Manhattan. The bathroom had a double sink, large countertop, spacious shower and separate soaking tub, and a separate niche with a lighted vanity in the “hallway” to the sleeping area. Modern finishes, plenty of plugs to charge devices, comfy pillows. Spectacular rooftop bar with great views of the city, helpful front desk staff, very easy walk to Times Square. I’d definitely stay there again.

title: Best rooftop bar in NYC - Excellent stay in Hells Kitchen
text: Amazing stay and huge rooms. Blown away by how nice the rooftop bar is. Great drinks. All employees were nice and provided top notch service. Two long blocks from the metro but easy to get to. Will stay here again!

title: Nice Hotel in Hell’s Kitchen
text: Enjoyed staying here for a weekend with friends. Definitely could have been more upfront about the dress codes for their rooftop bar but otherwise great place. Rooms are great size for NYC did not feel cramped at all. Also very clean and could smell it upon arrival too. Would stay here again!

title: Lovely Stay
text: The room was spacious and clean. The hotel has a beautiful lobby and two fantastic bars. A special thank you to Darnell at the front desk for his exceptional service and friendly demeanor! I will definitely be staying here again.

title: Above the fold at Ink 48
text: Extra! Extra! Read all about it in my review: Darnell elevated our experience at Ink 48 to first class within the first moments of walking in the door. Amazing, accommodating, astonishing, A+, awesome!

title: Exceeded my expectations
text:
This hotel is great. The friendly staff makes the stay even better. The view from the hotel room is one of the highlights of my entire stay in NYC. The room is amazing, big, clean and fully equipped. We stayed on Saturday and experienced no nuisance from outside noises. 
Special thanks to everyone who helped me for the surprise for my fiancé. Ink48 has a place in my heart and I will deffinitly book again when Im back in New York again.

title: Horrible experience
text: Horrible experience. The king-size room on the fourth floor that I had smells like something had died in there and they had tried anything and everything to mask the smell it was horrible. The two queen size bed room on the eighth floor had ripped sheets on both beds the shower was stained and not clean the carpet was not vacuumed or clean. It was very disappointing especially since I’ve stayed at this hotel before. The staff was not helpful and sometimes even snotty and rude especially in the restaurant

title: Consistently rude and incompetent front desk staff ruin an otherwise great hotel.
text:
Once again, the front desk staff at ink48 are the weakest link to an otherwise great hotel.  

With the exception of Lynn, it seems ink48 consistently puts anyone they can behind the front desk, from security to personnel untrained in the basic aspects of hospitality.  

I had prepaid reservations, that specifically state on your confirmation email that the room has been prepaid at the time of reservation.  This is obviously done (and counted on) so that the guest can check in to the room without needing to pay for it, as it's how we accommodate VIP's and staff.  Imagine the frustration to have a VIP guest arrive and be told they could not check in because the room wasn't paid for, because unbeknownst to us, ink48 is crazily deciding behind the scenes not to charge the room ahead of time like you say you do.  Then the guest is told they can't check in without payment or without me showing up to take care of it.  A VIP guest that has travelled far and needs their room.  On top of this disappointing issue, the front desks staff is rude about it and insists there is no way to help the guest.  (1) ink48 needs to understand what a prepaid reservation means.  

If you don't actually charge it like you say you do, at least understand that we already agreed during checkout for the room to be charged and don't leave a VIP guest standing there rudely telling them you can't help them (2) have the common sense to figure out calling me or processing the reservation as advertised.  We had a negative experience in June with a similar issue when computer systems were down and rude front desk personnel.   

Management at ink48 needs to realize that the front desk staff is the first point of contact guests have with the hotel and stop placing any stiff unfriendly body they can put behind the desk and realize they need people trained in friendliness.  

The front desk experience at ink48 continues to ruin an otherwise great property.

title: Nice looking....SO loud
text: I really wanted to like this hotel but the street noise (even on the 9th floor) was unbearable.  It only stopped between 5-6am.  It was Halloween weekend so maybe its better another time but there is a big bar across the street with huge lines and noisy patrons.  The honking and sirens in a room on the corner of 11th and 48th was terrible.  They moved me the second night to the 11th Ave side which was better but I really didn't sleep

title: Don't go there for the Rooftop Bar & Dining Experience you won't be allowed in!
text:
We chose INK 48 & booked two rooms for my family of 6 of us. The main reason for booking was the restaurant & the rooftop bar for my wife and I. NOPE!
Both were totally booked for private events on both Wednesday & Thursday and totally inaccessible, we thought about going up on the Thursday but the roof was only opening to the public at 10pm and when we went downstairs we were told to get to the back of the queue!
When I asked about this at FRONT DESK I was told both the Bar and the Internal Restaurant are run by a separate company - totally separate to the Hotel...
I asked why do the emails I received from you guys NEVER MAKE THIS CLEAR?

THIS IS THE MISLEADING / FALSE WORDING OF  EMAIL
We're looking forward to welcoming you to Ink 48 Hotel, located in the creative center of New York City, Hell's Kitchen. As our guest, you'll have easy access to the neighborhood's best restaurant, PRINT., as well as our rooftop hotspot, The Press Lounge. Ink 48 Hotel is also near the new shopping and culture mecca Hudson Yards.
**** NO YOU WON'T!!!!!!!!!!

Our team is dedicated to making your time with us special — and your well-being is our top priority. Read about our Above & Beyond cleaning program, which ensures a worry-free stay, and learn about our hotel's updates here. 
**** YOU DIDN'T....
I'LL BE MAKING SURE TO SHARE THIS EXPERIENCE WITH ANYONE THAT ASKS ME

title: Absolutely terrible
text:
This hotel is totally run down needs a seriously good renovation. Bedrooms are small with torn mattress protectors, dirty chair and very small bathroom. We couldn’t use the bar as private events on for 3 nights we stayed, when we eventually got to see it for 20 minutes they charged 24 dollars for a small drink in a plastic glass. 

Majority of the staff are rude and seem like they just don’t care. Dirty glasses in corridor beside our room when we arrived and still there 3 days later when we were leaving.

Do not waste your money and stay here it’s below 2 star in my opinion.

title: Shabby hotel
text:
Stayed here for 3 nights , roof top bar was closed for private function on 2 nights. 
The photos on web site are old and do not represent how this hotel is presented today. 
It is shabby and in bad need  of refurbishment. Rooms have poor facilities , no shelves or storage  in bathroom, very uncomfortable beds with dirty mattress.
No room service, reception phones are not answered, no service available from rude staff. 
I do not understand how it is rated so well
Avoid it , much better options in NY.

title: Beware. Not What it Used to Be.
text: Such a bummer! We were Ink 48 loyalists when Kimpton owned the hotel. It was always well maintained with incredible staff - my favorite place to stay while in NYC. However, the hotel has now been sold and the Kimpton standards of excellence no longer apply. Everything in the hotel room was worn and  overall, the hotel had the feeling of being run down in comparison to what it once was. However, that's not the worst of it - the worst is the deafening sound and vibration of a rave going on at a rooftop nearby. The noise starts around 9PM and goes on for hours - heavy base, DJs shouting into a mic to drown out the crowd and the crowd itself - cheering and screaming for hours on end. Even with noise cancelling headphones we could not sleep both nights of our stay. While we LOVE the convenience of the hotel we would never stay at Ink 48 again and can understand why Kimpton no longer has it in their portfolio. If you're in NYC to party all night - this would work. If not, consider staying someplace else.

title: Avoid avoid avoid and save your money
text:
The hotel is super ran down from its elevators to the roof top bar and rooms are so ran down.

This hotel has so much potential but feels like no one cares, rooms are just a bed, TV, a dirty chair and super overpriced mini bar, they charge $8 for a small bottle of water 😳

No coffee machine, no way of making tea or coffee, no complimentary water, NOTHING

the charging stations don't work which was super annoying.

The rooms are so cold. The air con was really old and when it starts it sounded like jet engine and no way you can sleep with that noise and when it stops the room gets stone cold. We had really uncomfortable sleeps.

The roof top bar charges $21 for a small drink served in plastic cups 🤷🏻‍♀️ I just don't understand, we were sitting there and thinking they must be deliberately running this hotel down to the ground as there's no way anyone with a bit of brain would run a business like this.

With the location they have they could have done so much better.

Staff are unfriendly, feels like they don't even want to be here.

We are regretting that we've wasted our money here.

title: Great Location & Very Accommodating Staff
text: The INK 48 hotel is located within walking distance to Time's Square, Hudson Yards, Theatre District and many other attractions.  It also is very clean and every staff member we interacted with was friendly and super accommodating.  Access to the Press Lounge was a sweet plus.  The views at night are gorgeous.  Note  there was no coffee maker in the room but we called and asked for one and they happily provided one for us with all the fixings. Also- our room was up high but facing the street so you could hear some NYC traffic during busy hours of the day and night. The bellman also arranged a car for our early morning flight back home which was super convenient.

title: The WORST hotel experience EVER!
text:
An absolute nightmare. The noise at night, EVERY night, coming from a nightclub next door was DEAFENING...would literally vibrate the walls. Many nights it went on till 4:30 AM!!! We stayed here for a week and never got any sleep  despite using earplugs and putting pillows over our heads! Guess they've never heard of double paned windows! 

Why didn't I leave you ask? My company was paying for the room (thank God) or I would have been out of there in a New York minute. 

On top of the noise factor, the staff was always too busy to help and pretty surly when you asked them a question. For example: I asked to see my bill one day to make sure the charges  were being put on my company's card and not my own, and the person at the desk said, "I don't have time for that now. Just look at it when you check out" 

Another time I had an important letter that had to go out. I asked the gentleman at the front desk if he could mail it for me and he looked at me like I had 3 eyes. "Uhhh...no. Can't you just take it to a mailbox or something?" Been staying at hotels all my life and that's the first time  I ever got a response like that. 

It's unfortunate, because the room itself was pretty nice and had an amazing view.. The location was good as well. The potential to be a good hotel is there, but......

title: Great time in NYC
text: Fantastic experience! Great room and views - super close to the venue where we had a conference. Large bathroom with nice shower and tub and huge windows. We had awesome service from the bellman Jose Colon. He was kind and generous and made great restaurant recommendations. Overall a wonderful two day stay.

title: So so
text: Not bad. Not great.  Pricey for the room.  Food very good. Rust in water when trying to take a bath.  Not the best value for.the money.  Would choose.a.different hotel for a pre.cruise stay.  A lot of street noise and noise.from club across the street.

title: Wouldn’t Stay Here Again
text: We booked this hotel for a one night stay, prior to taking a cruise out of NYC.  We were glad it was only one night.  Aside from its location near the cruise terminal it doesn’t really have anything going for it.  Rooms are tired and feel unclean because of all of the staining on the carpet, old fittings and fixtures etc.  i\It was very expensive for the quality of the rooms and right next to a rooftop cantina bar which we could hear as if it was in our room.

title: Located in Hell's Kitchen because it IS HELL.
text:
If you are looking for a loud, unkept, hotel with subpar service and food then YOU FOUND THE RIGHT PLACE.   Our first room smelled like RAW SEWAGE and after calling multiple times to the front desk and then having to go down to it a few times, the unhelpful staff sent up someone to "disinfect" the room, but the hotel engineer finally came up and he took one whiff, looked at our shower and said, "you gotta get out of this room".   Thankfully the unhelpful desk clerk found us a tiny room next to the elevator (the "thankfully" used is sarcastic).  Again, another room that has seen much much better days.  Mind you this room switch took place at 10:30pm after we had a very long day and no one offered to help.

What is also great is that the hotel is next to a club the pounds music all night long usually until about 4:00am.

And the restaurant staff is just as helpful as the uncaring hotel staff.   Can I get my eggs not "runny" as it states they are prepared on the menu?  Answer, "NO".    My girlfriend is vegetarian, can you not put the meat on the breakfast sandwich?  Answer, "NO".  Can we get a bagel?  Answer, "We are switching to our lunch menu, so NO"  But you have a bagel sandwich on the lunch menu can we get one of those bagels?  Answer, "NO".

Between the raw sewage smell in our room and the difficulty and reluctance to move us, the noise at all hours  and the unfriendly and uncaring staff this place IS HELL.

title: Customer beware
text:
Customers please beware of hidden fees that the hotel is not upfront about. 

I had stayed at the hotel several months ago. Initially the hotel room I was assigned was dirty when I walked in with an unkempt bed. Thankfully the hotel upgraded me. 

I check out and the front desk says nothing but when I check my credit card statement, I have been charged almost $150. Despite multiple calls the hotel refuses to respond. They finally send me a bill which demonstrates the fees I have paid with Priceline but are getting charged again. Finally I am charged with a minibar charge even though we didn’t touch anything from the minibar.

title: Nice hotel in walking distance to many family friendly sights
text:
We chose this hotel because we wanted to discover hell's kitchen while beating jet lag. It did not disappoint and could definitely recommend. If you have kids, don't expect to enjoy the rooftop, it's a bar and therefore only for 21+. 
Staff was nice and the room big enough for 4 people.

title: Great location and friendly staff
text: The location is ideal to reach the Port. Also great location to venture out and dine in Hell's Kitchen. The staff are super friendly and helpful. The food is terrific and a large selection of drinks are available.

title: Stand out hotel of our vacation.
text:
Great location!!
We stayed in the Deluxe Suite overlooking the Hudson - incredible space, decor, views, light and sunsets!
The rooftop Press Room bar is a must to visit.
Friendly, professional staff.
Ink 48 location is easily accessible to Hudson Yards, Times Square, Theater district, The Highline, Central Park. Hells Kitchen area has a great range of eateries and bars. 2 blocks away is the Subway.
We traveled from New Zealand and stayed in several places in Manhattan plus Boston, Provincetown and Newport. Ink 48 hotel was the standout hotel of our vacation. I will definitely recommend.

title: Pathetic service staff
text: room is good and clean but service is worst. You will be charged 8 USD for small 500ml water which is part of snacks bar. once you drink it (even for any house keeping service), you ave to go reception for water and they will tell u to buy from restaurant.

title: Above and beyond service ❤️
text:
On arrival doorman assisted with bags opened door and we walked through immediately greeted by the front desk. We were taken up to our room by Kareem who gave us so much information about the hotel adjoining restaurant and also the bar on the roof. He also let us know that he would be happy to contact uber for us. He also gave us a list of his favorite restaurants in the area. Later when we went to dinner we stopped at the front desk and asked if it was possible to go to a higher floor. Lynn was so gracious and she spent several minutes looking to see how she could accommodate our request. There were a few rooms coming available in the morning, so keep everything packed up when you leave to the city and we will move you  to a different room. After a full day in the city we were tired and ready for a quick change of clothes and go to dinner. We checked in with Lynn. She gave us new room keys on the 10th floor on the Hudson river side with a view of the Intrepid, cruise ships that came and went, a navy ship and 2 tug boats also coming and going. Absolutely exceeding our expectations!  I called her right away and thanked her. We are celebrating 47 years being together. Lynn was truly excited for us. 
Over the week at the Ink 48 we had several conversations with Lynn  and her staff. They would always ask us about our day and ask if we needed anything. 
Already talking to my 3 daughters if they might like to go to New York for a girls trip. Of course looking to stay here again!
Thank you,
Christine  Canby OR

title: Whoever runs this hotel should try calling it
text: Two days straight I tried to reach the front desk to ask if the two rooms I booked could be next door to one another since we were one family.  I could not reach one human being at the front desk for two full days.  Reservation team said I'd need the front desk to do this.  So poorly run.  Hotel itself is good.  No complaints about the hotel.  But whoever is running this space needs to actually call and pretend their a guest to see how poorly this is being run.  It could be a great hotel with the right staff.

title: HIDDEN "Guest Amenity Fee" of $40 per day!
text:
Not disclosed on reservation - we were told at checkout "there's nothing you can do, you have to pay it".   We asked for managers but "sorry, no-one is here right now".   THIS WAS IN ADDITION TO $400++ room rate!

I wrote Nick Ivezaj, GM of the hotel, asking for refund for obvious reasons but CRICKETS!

Hotel was groovy, but first room had no A/C and both bars (one rooftop) closed for private events - one of the key reasons we chose it.

There are lots of great properties in NYC and Hell's Kitchen.  Don't patronize this place!

title: Good property, just short of a great stay!
text:
This is a well located hotel - close to the riverfront, close to the action, and with good eating and shopping areas within a short walking distance. The rooms are well set and spacious, but would be nice to get some hot water/ coffee set ups in there as well. For the room rental that they charge, one would expect some water/ soda to be thrown in as well. 
Basic services are in place, though most in-room purchases are quite steep. I was surprised to see an 'intimacy kit' on the menu as well.

title: Racist print restaurant
text: Print restaurant is racist. My room was never cleaned, I had to call them and the very bare minimum was done. Horrible horrible horrible. Print restaurant was the worst I have ever experienced. Print restaurant was just racist and horrible

title: Wonderful Hotel!
text: We chose Ink48 as the main hotel in our wedding block and we are beyond happy with this choice! The front door staff, event planning staff and the rest of the Ink48 team were amazing! Sierra was the sales representative I spent the most time working with and she did so much to ensure that both me and my guests had a nice stay in the hotel. Overall the hotel is very well kept and has a modern look. The rooms are also large compared to other New York hotel rooms and the views are amazing! The Press Lounge, attached to the hotel is an absolute MUST! Our wedding guests spent most of their time on the rooftop of The Press Lounge and it was a major hit. The Ink48 staff allowed us to use their rooftop space for some wedding pictures as well and the photos that turned out from this are to die for!!! Thank you Ink48 for making my wedding weekend one to remember.

title: Room was awesome, but service was terrible.
text: The room is great, clean and has amazing views. Room service and trying to get a hold of the front desk, room service or bell boys is impossible. They don’t answer the phones. Location is in a good area, couple blocks down to get to food and stores.

title: Dirty and dates rooms, hardly a 3 start hotel
text: From my arrival to my departure, I could not feel more regret for had chosen this hotel. I went to NYC to attend the US Open and wanted to stay in Hell’s Kitchen, hence why I booked this hotel. The information given online is very misleading… for instance, they do not even offer room service although they charge almost $400 for a room. The rooms are dirty and dated, with a bad smell. The TV is also old, the beds are extremely uncomfortable and the bathroom / shower are terrible. This is barely a 3 start hotel, very overpriced. I would not recommend it.

title: Would not recommend-gave room away
text: My boyfriend and I booked this stay for our 4 year anniversary almost 2 months in advance. The “recommended” parking garage staff were quite nasty for what I consider an extension of the hotel when they said they didn’t have parking. Additionally when we checked into the hotel at 3:45, only 45 minutes after our allowed check in time were we informed our room was given away. The attendant then seemed to rush us and we were told we would not be charged for the price difference in the rooms but I was never told what that number would be or provided with information stating so. When we got up to the room, all I will say is I would not have bought a room at that hotel if I knew what room we were getting and that they were giving ours away. WOULD NOT RECOMMEND!

title: Excellent hotel in a great location.
text: This is a great hotel in a fantastic location. I walked easily to Central Park, and back down 5th Ave past the Empire State Building. Staff are friendly, and the room was great. I would stay again for sure.

title: RANDOM NICE HOTEL IN OFF THE BEATEN PATH NEIGHBOURHOOD
text:
Ink48 is a nice hotel on 11th Ave and 48th St; the neighborhood is residential / commercial (car sales).  It is a walk to the subway and difficult to grab a yellow cab in this area.  We walked everywhere; the closest subway is 44 and 8 or Times Square (about a ten to fifteen minute walk depending on the path you take. 

Price of the room is relatively reasonable for NYC.  Bed is okay; room is clean and large especially for NY.  

POSTIVES:
1. Room size & value 
2. Cleanliness 
3. Bed size 

NEGATIVES:
1. There is an all night club right across the street and if you are on the 48th St side, you will hear screaming, music and noise ALL night until 5am.
2. Staff is neither helpful nor unhelpful (just there) to swipe your card.
3. I was leaving for LGA at 4:30am and told I could not get a yellow cab in that neighborhood at that time which ended up being untrue.  I paid $92.46 USD for their private cab to LGA. Yellow cab is about $50 USD. 
4. LOCATION is not convenient - I prefer SOHO as it is a more easily accessible area and quieter despite this being a residential area for the most part with car dealerships. 

Overall, I am in NYC every 6 weeks or so and this is not the worst place at which I have stayed but also not the best.  It is neutral for me - neither here nor there but gets KUDOS for room size. The SUITE is an exceptionally laid out room however, the mattresses and pillows could use upgrading.

title: In the end, all was good
text:
So I was starting this review just with the accolades to Lynn, the desk manager during our check-in....then I read the latest review from I379WIchloeh. Eerily similar scenario befell us. As we checked in - I walked up to the desk and said "Let the fun begin", and then it did. I booked through Booking.com two months before arrival. Two weeks out, I needed to shorten my stay by 1 night. Booking.com said I had to contact the property and, you guessed it, the property said I had to contact Booking.com. B.com then proceeded to try to contact the hotel directly and after several attempts (I was informed through a text chain), could not get through or get a response from the hotel. I also tried and no joy. The day before, B.com was still trying and as we were traveling the next day to the hotel, we were told "no worries, everything will be sorted out". We arrived and (you're good at this guessing game), no reservation, no track of communication from B.com. They continued to tell us it was B.com that was at fault, but from the previous review, I now suspect that may not be true. The man who was helping us HAS to be the one from the aforementioned review. I actually said nothing as he was being snippy and arrogant to me, but when he did it to the next two people (repeating the same sentence, verbatim, several times to the person, etc.), I called him out and said that if on the Friday of Labor Day weekend, he was already having this attitude, he maybe should not be in this profession, he proceeded to childishly defend himself - - again wrong response/approach/attitude.  

NOW - the reason for my high review is because of Lynn, who saved the day and the made the rest of our stay in NYC enjoyable. She was gracious, apologetic, understanding, so helpful with the utmost professionalism. She upgraded our stay and comped the amenity feee, which since we had already spent an hour trying to check-in and were leaving the next day, was very appreciated! The room was lovely, the beds and pillows SO comfortable, and we enjoyed our stay, regardless of the rocky start! My advice - only check in when Lynn is working. ; ) If this hotel had been a $150/night room rate - I would forgive all, but at $400/night, be better.

title: Honestly amazed at how many people have given 5*...wish I could give zero!!!
text:
Arriving at the hotel, we had a good first impression. The lobby area was modern and clean and looked great. When checking in, we were told that they didn't have our booking...which is where the fun began! We had booked this as the last stop on a honeymoon trip through a few destinations. We had not had a single problem before arriving here but were told that the company we booked through have obviously just taken our money and not booked the hotel. I actually had a personal contact number for our travel rep who was amazing and answered my SOS message even though it was midnight back at home...she had emailed over some final confirmations to the hotel the month before we arrived but apparently at that point the hotel knew that we were not on their system but didn't reply to our travel rep saying this so she assumed all was okay! 

The man on the desk was actually incredibly rude and not at all sympathetic to the fact that we had been awake for 36 hours...he offered no solution just 'we don't have your booking so I can't help you' numerous times I might add...there was then a lady who took over who was more polite at least! She reserved us a room upgrade and said that once they have the booking confirmation from the company then we could go up. The company we booked through phoned the hotel to sort it directly but were put on 'hold' whilst they checked in other guests...unfortunately they had actually hung up and then the company couldn't get through again. 

When asked when we booked (Nov 21) the lady said 'ohhh that makes sense, we can't access the booking because we didn't work here then'...and told us that bookings go through individual email addresses for certain booking companies which seems utterly ridiculous to me! So there was no central booking system?! There were people who had booked last minute (that morning) who were being checked in whilst we sat there...no prizes for being organised!
