We did eventually get into our room though and it had a great view. The bathroom floor though was covered in hairs...to be honest by this point we were so tired and fed up that we just wore flip flops inside and made do...sadly the fun didn't end there.

We requested a late check out the following day as we were not flying until 10;30pm 2 days later and were told that we could have a complimentary late check out at 2pm but any later would incur a charge - fair enough! Upon checking out, the man said that we owed money for the late checkout...we told him that someone else had put it on their system and said we could have it complimentary. He proceeded to quiz us on 'what was his name', 'what did he look like' 'what time was this that you were apparently told'. Eventually he put it through as complimentary but clearly didn't feel happy about it. We were told that the money taken for incidentals would be returned straight away as we didn't owe anything else.

We booked a taxi through the hotel to get to the airport as the ubers were all coming up as quite expensive anyway. €130 flat rate we were told but ended up as €140 including tax...fair enough I guess but seemed an awful lot of money for a taxi! I just wanted to get out of there though!!!

Upon returning home, I checked my bank account and noticed that the money had not been returned to.my account yet. It is now 13 days later and still nothing...I emailed the hotel the other day (3 times before getting a reply). The sales manager was polite enough and told me he would forward my email onto the front desk...I waited a couple of days before chasing up. I then received the following reply 'good evening Ms Davies. Unfortunately we have no reservations under your name.' I have no other words...I have to wait 31 days before my bank can claim the money back from the hotel but honestly wasn't even surprised by this reply. Short, rude and incorrect information given.

The hotel itself is in a great location but the staff are, generally, rude and incredibly incompetent! Would not stay here again if you paid me (and that wouldn't be likely anyway as I'm still waiting for my money nevermind some extra!) 

The travel company that we booked through have put through a formal complaint but we aren't holding our breath for a response...wouldn't normally like to write a review like this but this experience put an unfortunate negative ending on our honeymoon and we wouldn't want anyone else to experience the same!

title: Expensive, not worth the money. Others in the area are comparable value.
text: I booked this because it was an Amex deal and usually I trust their judgement on properties. Personally, I didn't feel like this was a great hotel for what I paid, even considering the deal. The rooms were okay, but similar to a Courtyard Marriott. The kitchen is very inflexible in offering alternatives, so watch out for that. Next time I'll find a cheaper hotel that offers a comparable stay.

title:
A wonderful first trip to New York! 
(10th till 14th August 2022)
text:
After reading some of the trip advisor reviews before I left, I was quite worried as they weren't very positive.
However apart from trying to contact the hotel before we left the UK (to upgrade our room as my daughter was now staying with us) I could not fault the hotel at all.
On arrival we were welcomed on the door and at reception. Check in was quick and efficient,  and the upgrade sorted, and the receptionist explained the extra charges...and you could view them on the account settings on your hotel room tv.

The room was immaculate and the aircon on for us to cool off from the summer heat.
We had a family room with 2 queen sized beds, and the room was spacious with plenty of storage, and it had a large clean bathroom with walk in shower, toilet and sink and big mirror.

The beds were very comfortable and there were extra pillows in the wardrobe if we needed them.
The shower worked well and there were plenty of towels, which were changed daily.

There were no tea or coffee making facilities in the room, but it was offered in the lobby area every morning from 7-9am ( I think). We didn't use this facility as we bought a travel kettle with us to use.

We did not use the roof top bar as we were busy exploring the city in the day and evening, and as my daughter is under 21, could only go up between 4 and 5pm. However it seemed very popular.

We stayed for 4 nights and had a wonderful stay in New York.  We visited the Intrepid museum which was just round the corner from the hotel, and we walked to central park which took about 30 minutes, and the High Line, 5th avenue, Broadway. Everything was within easy reach and there were plenty of taxis to use or we had a 48 hour Topview bus tour ticket to get around the city and to do the boat trip to the Statue of Liberty. 

Having worked in hotels after doing my degree in hospitality management,  I know how much hard work is involved in working in this sector, so I was keen to do my review and I want to say thank you to all the staff at the INK 48 hotel for a fantastic stay.

title: Great Stay
text: I was worried by some of the other reviews but everything with this hotel was great. I booked through the Amex Hotel Collection and the hotel made it very easy to use the perks. We arrived early so the doorman checked our bags until the room was ready and suggested a great breakfast place. Staff was friendly and the on site restaurant had good food. Was able to walk to a lot of our plans which was nice.  Would definitely stay there again.

title: The Hotel with Chic and Personality
text:
The hotel went beyond all my expectations!  From the minute I pulled up to the minute I left the entire staff was helpful and personable!

I love the “look” of the property!  The guest rooms are all impeccable!

I will definitely return to this hotel again and again!

title: Poor customer service
text: We booked this hotel for our daughter during her tour of the states.  On arrival she was asked to pay a $300 safety deposit.  Beware as this seems to be a scam.  Despite much contact with the hotel and promises - the money still hasn’t been refunded.

title: Great location!
text: This hotel is located in Hell’s kitchen which means you will encounter bombs on the street, nothing a little gentrification can’t fix. :-) within walking distance to all the shows which is a good thing. lots of eateries which I thoroughly enjoyed. :-)

title: Spacious rooms!
text: My sisters and I had a wonderful stay at Ink48. The ambiance is chill and gives off a upscale vibe. Check in and check out we’re nice and quick as we were pressed for time. Beds were comfortable and rooms were so spacious with beautiful big windows. We will definitely stay again.

title: Posh hotel with lots of guest conveniences
text:
Large room, comfortable, lots of nice toiletries, nice to have a refrigerator and room safe. 
Staff welcoming was the best part; very attentive when needed.  Didn't get a chance to use rooftop but I have in the past and the views are stupendous.  Easy walking to Javits for business and midtown for theatre district.

title: Billing not transparent/poor customer service
text:
As a lifetime Marriott and Hilton Titanium and Diamond member I have spent over 2000 nights in hotels and thought I would try something different since my dealership is a couple of blocks from the hotel. The hotel stay overall was OK though the after service is terrible!!  
I stayed 5 nights as I do 4 times a year in the city. After departing I arrived at the airport and reviewed my bill. There was a $40.00 per night "guest amenity fee" billed on the invoice. When booking and checking in this "Fee" was not mentioned nor have I seen this at any hotel I have stayed at in the city.
I immediately contacted the hotel and was put on hold and bounced around to a reservationist that couldn't help and sent me back to what she thought was the front desk, nope back to reservations, left name and number to forward to hotel to call me back, never got a call. Filled out contact us form on the ink 48 website and waited still no response over a week now.. Tried calling once again and was put on hold again and in a loop.  I have given up....beware.

title: Bel hotel avec roof top relativement bien situé  a Manhattan
text:
au coin de la 11 eme et 48 eme, le quartier est calme mais il y a suffisament de commerces de proximité (par exemple si vous n'avez pas recu votre valise ... merci AF / CDG).
Bien desservi, c'est un endroit central pour visiter NY (evidement la 5eme est plus centrale mais beaucoup plus oppressante).
Il s'agit d'un bel hotel avec de belles grandes chambres (a l'americaine). Bien entretenu mais pas neuf.
Nous n'avons pas testé  le pdj mais le resraurant est tres cher pour une qualité  correcte avec un joli bar a cocktails.

title: Poor
text: We had a terrible experience with the doorman to the rooftop elevator. He was extremely rude and it ruined our trip. Guests do not get priority access to the rooftop and families are completely denied access - be aware of that when booking.

title: C’è di meglio
text: Non è posizionato bene, sta vicino ad una discoteca che praticamente dai rumori non si riesce a dormire, alla reception non sta nessuno che parla italiano o spagnolo, insomma per quello che costa non va molto meglio altri hotel più vicino a Times square

title: very nice place to stay
text: i am visiting NY for the first time with my family i enjoying the view specially from the roof top lounge and the restaurant food was very delicious i will like to come again definitely. NY is my favorite place to visit again

title: Not a four star hotel
text:
This is a hotel that has been on it’s peek. Current owners have missed our what you need to run a four star hotel.
-Good service 
-Quiet rooms
-State of art AC
-Well maintained 
-Comfort in the rooms (Coffee, The etc.)
-Breakfast 
This hotel does not deliver on any of the above. 

Also notice that if you travel as a family the rooftop bar is 21 years only (does not belong to the hotel).

I would not book this hotel again or recommend it.

title: A really solid hotel
text:
I really enjoyed my stay at Ink 48.  The staff was friendly and helpful, room service was great at keeping our room clean, sheets fresh, and toiletries/towels stocked.  Our room also had a bathtub, which was fantastic and I had no issues getting the water nice and hot.

The hotel is only a block away from a crosstown bus stop, so it's easy to travel further into the city and into the subway, and there are plenty of nice shops, convenience stores, and restaurants within close walking distance so you don't need to go far for food and snacks.

My only nitpick about this hotel is the TVs in the guestrooms.  You can't use any external devices that plug into the TVs, like a Roku stick, as the TVs don't let you change the input to HDMI, you can only use them to watch regular TV.  This wasnt a huge deal to me, but for others that could be a big downside.

Besides that, a really nice and friendly hotel, I would definitely recommend it to anyone visiting the city on vacation.

title: Mediocre
text:
The best thing about our stay was the view and location to the Hudson yards.
The weird concept of the bathroom left a lot to be desired. The actual walk in shower was 1/4 the size of the bathroom. I didn’t like the size overall. Why have an oversized bath tub and a small sized walk in shower? It would seem to have been the opposite. Most people don’t take bath soaks anymore.

title: Very good
text: It's in the city but away from the hustle and bustle.  That's how I like it. Staff was friendly and the area seemed safe.  Restaurants, grocery store, drug store all within walking distance.  Very easy check in process.

title: Too expensive and staff is not very useful
text:
I stayed with my family here for 3 nights, and when we checked in everything went fine. We booked here because of the nice rooftop, which then appears not to be a part of the hotel(?). First if all they have a dresscode, so you are only allowed to wear formal wear. Woman can show toes, but men arent allowed. And if you have kids, you can only go to the rooftop between 4pm-5pm, and the parents are not allowed to drink anything. Not Even a soda .
Staff gave us conflicting information - at the elevator going up - we were informed we could have soft drinks - but when we got up there, they said they could not serve us anything. 

The aircondition wake you up at night, and in spite of al the flashy appearance they forgot to give us any toiletpapir… 

When we left on the 3rd day, we asked to switch creditcards (instead of paying with visa we paid with mastercard) and the staff said that they sure could change it. 2 days after when we checked the accounts we were charged double. Mastercard & visa, and when we called to tell them about this, they got us waiting without giving us an answer, so we contacted our bank to help with the problem instead. The ammounts that were charged weren’t even the same.

I dont reccomend this hotel.

title: Great location. Don't bank on getting into the rooftop bar. They don't make it easy.
text:
Great location for exploring New York. Close to loads of good restaurants. Close to midtown and the High Line for exploring downtown.

Was really looking forward to the rooftop bar with its views - heavily touted by the hotel. Tried to get into it every night of our 4 night stay. Turns out (a) it's a separate company to the hotel so they have no control of the door policies (b) they only let kids in from 4 to 5pm and the adults can't drink alcohol at that time (c) paying hotel guests come second (d) changing dress code requirements (e) private parties take priority.
Ink48 hotel is nice but don't bank on getting a rooftop drink. We couldn't. Disappointing. Go to Cantina rooftop opposite for some fun!

title: Awfully rude unmannered staff
text:
I really don’t know where to begin with this review, two days after returning from our stay at this so called hotel. We are still enraged by the total lack of professionalism shown by the staff. My wife and I have travelled extensively around the globe, and never I repeat NEVER  have we encountered such ignorant and bad mannered staff. On our arrival at 14.53 we checked in, and were informed by a very belligerent reception staff member that our room would not be ready until 15:00. After waiting till 15:30 in the foyer we returned to the reception and requested our room, only to be told that it was unavailable. This was from another belligerent reception staff member as the previous had disappeared with out informing the following shift staff. So once again we had to go through the checking in process. Finally we have entrance to our room at around 16:00.
Then the room! 
Electrical sockets hanging out of their fixings, a safe which was not safe as some of the rubber push buttons were missing, a so called closet which only had a hanging space of about 3 feet in height so my wife was unable to hang her dresses.
I would have complained to the reception but as previously stated, they are so ignorant and bad mannered it felt that it would be ignored. 
BEAWARE  a very horrible place to stay, Virgin Atlantic should take this place off their list of hotels.

title: Lovely Hotel, unfriendly staff
text:
The hotel itself is lovely and clean with great sized bedrooms. Do not be fooled into thinking it hosts a rooftop pool, it does not. 

On arrival, no queue at reception and our booking was confirmed almost immediately with the receptionist saying I needed to pay  $500 (slightly more but I can’t remember the exact amount). 

On querying the amount, I was told it was for resort tax and ‘incidentals.’ I have no issues with the concept but this exuberant cost was not made clear at the time of booking; we actually had two rooms booked and when this was discovered, we had another $500+ charge laid in front of us - the incidental monies will be refunded in approx 7 working days, quick enough to take $1,000 though! 

For the remainder of our stay, the reception staff failed to even lift their heads to greet us or anyone else in the morning or throughout the day, they were sharp and lacking any customer service when asked a question and generally vastly reduced the vibe of the hotel in general. 

We also booked their car service to JFK at a fixed, all inclusive price of $105. The only problem here is the hotel clearly failed to tell the driver who tried to charge $125, excluding a tip and who informed me the hotel staff were ‘lying’ about the cost of the transfer. 

I negotiated with the driver and have contacted the hotel for an explanation and refund, no response 12hrs later (this is the second email I’ve sent that’s gone unanswered). 

Very disappointed with the staff, their attitudes and the lie about the transfer costs which is a shame as the hotel could have been great if the staff bothered to care about their customer service.

title: Stay away from this hotel
text:
1 ) my room total was $171. The hotel took two amounts from my card upon check-in without informing me,  $317 and $271, sum up to $588. I noticed soon and asked the staff, she said “that’s how it works”. Therefore, hotel guests need to budget more than 3 times of your actual  total to stay at this place. If that causes overdraft on your account, your bank will charge you as well. 
2 ) my major reason to stay here was “one of the city’s most attractive bar” as they advertised. However, as I tried to get in, a staff from the bar rejected me due to dressing code. I had regular summer outfit on but they required formal wear. I went back to the hotel and brought up the concern to another gentleman staff, he said “the bar operates separately, not under our hotel.” In other word, the hotel used another business to mislead guests, once guests arrived, hotel doesn’t care. At least put a big and obvious reminder on the website regarding the dressing code?
3 ) it’s not qualified as a 4.5 star hotel. No slipper, no water, coffee or tea. No coffeemaker or condiment kit. The worst part was sleeping quality. The AC suddenly blew out air with noise, it lasted about 10mins and stopped. After a while,it’s acting up again. It’s like a new born baby wakes you up every 2 hours. Further, there was no soundproof. I heard people talking on the hallway and in the rooms next to me, they were not loud, but I could hear. Also traffic noises came up to the 9th floor until 3am, I couldn’t imagine how it was on lower floors. 
4 ) Housekeeping entered my room around 9am while I had “Privacy” light on. And I could hear everything as she started cleaning other rooms. 

At the end, I shared my experience with front desk as I was checking out. He barely had any reaction, all I could tell was he got it and that’s it. He just said he would forward it to the management and someone would follow up with me in an hour. When I’m typing this review, it’s the next day. No call, no voice or text message, nothing happened. None of the employees, either the front desk or the housekeeper, no one apologized to me for the inconveniences. It’s very unprofessional. Friendly reminder, if you have a situation, ask for a manager right away, don’t just check out and leave. When you’re calm and polite, they only want to get rid of you, OR DON’T STAY.

title: Beautiful Hotel, with magical views if you are high enough
text: Very nice hotel overall. We had a problem when we checked in when they told us there were other fees.  Most were removed by the Manager.  The "Hudson Suites" face the river with tall windows, but you need to be on a high floor to get it all.  The "The Press Lounge" balcony has gorgeous views in almost any direction.  We did not try the "Print" dining room as we could not figure out the menu's Fancy Foreign "Word Salad" - with no description to help.  So we ate at the Landmark Tavern down the street (Very Good).  We walked to Westway Diner on 9th Street for Breakfast.  We were prepared for high prices, just not bizarre sounding food.  We were next to the USS Enterprise Museum & the Cruise Port.  We enjoyed both of those and also the Classic Harbor Cruise Line's Architechts's Tour around the entirety of Manhattan.  Staff was friendly and very helpful.  Service would be excellent if it wasn't for the checkin and not using the dining.

title: Great clean hotel
text: Try to avoid lower floor rooms due to traffic noise, I had a truck parked with running engine under my window for several hours and I couldn't sleep. Hotel offered me another room as they had no control over who is parked on the road.

title: Stay away from this Hotel!!
text:
Upon arrival on Sunday evening, the hotel told us that they had given the room to a group because it was the better deal for them (they wanted to accommodate a whole group on short notice). They stated they had called, which was not true because I had no missing calls  from the hotel Ink48 during the flight. They gave us 4 alternative hotels for which they would pay for the cost. However, we did not like these (all hotels that had a reputation but were very much aging) because they were not in the style of the Ink48 hotel (modern and fresh). Also, they did not cover any additional costs for cab or extra expenses for another hotel of our choice. We found the hotel's behavior to be extremely anti-social and unprofessional. 

Guests arriving from overseas for a week getting a cancellation from the hotel  at 20h in the evening after a 10 hour flight just because they can earn more on the hotel room with another group - shame on you Hotel Ink48.  What a shameful behavior. And so rude. We had additional costs of over 300.-, which we have to pay ourselves. NEVER NEVER NEVER again the Ink48 Hotel! I have never experienced anything more unprofessional (...and I travel a lot...). People in NYC told us that this is a very atypical behavior for a hotel, normally they would at most cancel a room for 1 night, but not a booked room for 7 nights! Shame on you Hotel Ink48!

title: Double-Booked our Room and Forgot to Rebook us at Sheraton
text:
They double booked the room and had to rebook us at Sheraton, which they forgot! Multiple people at the front desk told us this reservation is done until we made it to Sheraton, where the front desk people had no idea that we have a reservation there!
We called Ink48 but ended up talking to an operator at a different location who refused to give us a confirmation number or directly connect us to the front desk.
We had to uber back to Ink48 only realizing that they never made the reservation at Sheraton and just did it there after we showed up. 
We lost half a day of our vacation because of these people! They were extremely rude and not helpful. They would give incorrect and conflicting information throughout our stay, and caused us so much headache. I don't recommend this place to my enemy!

title: Unprofessional
text: I booked two Hudson suites ahead of time and prepaid those rooms received confirmation for both suites drive 5 hours to the hotel and guess what front desk telling me they have only one since they over sold it ??? What ??  And they degraded me to other room. Bed sheets were dirty bathroom were dirty and room was full of smell called front desk and they sent maintenance  ppl to make the room and clean it literally they made the bed and clean the bathroom after we checked in.

title: Overbooked and horrible staff
text:
This hotel happily took our money weeks ago (nonrefundable booking), and upon check in said oops, we don't have room for the last 2 days of your trip. They transferred us for the last 2 days of our trip to some other hotel. If having us check out and check in on a day in the middle of our trip (effectively losing half of that day) is not bad enough, we had to deal with the most incompetent staff here, who just make empty promises. We were promised on our check in that they'll arrange everything so we just show up to the other hotel and they'd take us in. Big mistake on our part to take them at their word.

We showed up to the other hotel who didn't know we exist. We went back and forth (Ubers each way on our own dime), because they're not responsive on the phone, only to find out they hadn't made the reservation at the new hotel yet. Not a single person ever apologized to us at this hotel, as if it's their right to do whatever they want; on the other hand, when we tried to warn another guest at the reception (who was also being routed to some other hotel) about our experience, the manager got mad at us for talking to other guests.

Terrible experience all around. Stay away!

title: Great hotel let down by the details
text:
We stayed here for five nights on a 50th birthday trip to NYC. The hotel is a lovely building and rooms sizes are good. Comfortable beds, lively rooftop bar, great views from some rooms.

They just need to get the details right. The front desk shouldn't tell guests the rooftop opens at 4pm if in fact there's a private party and you can't go in at all. The excuse? Its a different company, we don't know if they have an event. Well why not ask them? They are literally in your building and come through the lobby to get into the elevator.  The hotel web site promotes the bar as its own. A short note - the bar is closed for a private function tonight - would enable guests to plan accordingly. 

Same with housekeeping. It was a heatwave but they didn't replace the water in our room. We called housekeeping and after a LOT of unanswered calls they told us they didn't replace water but there's a 24 hour market 5 blocks away. We were literally trying to buy their $8 small bottles of water and they wouldn't serve us.

This was very much the feel of the place. The guys who work the door, store luggage, call cars were great. But there were few smiles on the front desk or in the coffee shop. 

I anticipated a response from Alan Cruz, GM, to a review might say "If you tell us about this at the time we can rectify it" so I asked to speak with him briefly. Apparently he was busy in meetings the whole five days and would have no time for guests. Sums up the experience really.

title: Great deal with a view.
text: One mile walk to everywhere you need to go, excellent restaurant. Right near air and space museum. Nice room size for upgraded rooms Good views out front or back of the building. All staff super helpful.

title: Great Hotel
text: Beautiful hotel, the location is amazing. The staff are amazing. I would definitely book this hotel again. I love how everyone was helpful and kind. The location is right in the heart of midtown. Beautifu

title: Cool hotel and awesome rooftop bar
text: The room was a little small but had all the accommodations I needed other than a coffee maker. Everyone I dealt with was extremely friendly and helpful at all times and the rooftop bar was incredible.

title: Worked well for a family reunion world wide
text: The staff were generally great if a bit overworked at busy times. The rooms were good, the linen and towels very good and we all had a good time. It does get a bit traffic noisy street side. Personally, I would try and extend the breakfast offers, as we wound up discovering the nearby delis for eggs and sausages, but may that's our English breakfast thing......

title: Business Traveller
text: Did exactly what it said. The room was clean and quiet. There were plenty of elevators. Breakfast was basic but service was quick. Unfortunately, I did not get to visit the roof top bar which looked very nice.

title: Trendy, affordable hotel with excellent rooftop bar
text: Ink48 is nicely located and is perfect for both business travelers and holiday. Relative large rooms according NY standards, great restaurant and rooftop bar. Friendly, helpful staff. Nothing negative.

title: Da evitare
text:
Direi proprio di no. Considerato che il Rooftop, specchietto per le allodole, è una realtà indipendente, consiglio di venire qui solo per un aperitivo ed evitare di soggiornare in questo hotel. 
L’hotel si definisce 4 star ma non lo è assolutamente, non puoi essere un 4star e non avere delle amenities basilari come un bollitore, delle ciabattine o prodotti decenti x il bagno e tecnologie funzionanti. 
Una mattina alle sei sono sceso a chiedere una tazza di acqua calda per sciogliere un Tachifludec e non sono stati in grado di soddisfare questa richiesta, dicendo che il bar era chiuso e dirottandomi verso la palestra che aveva il dispenser, che tra l’altro non funzionava. 
La palestra con macchinari fuori servizio, dopo averlo fatto notare ci si aspettava che rimediassero, ma per tutta la settimana che siamo stati lì nulla è cambiato. 
Ho prenotato con mesi di anticipo una camera king premier con vista sulla città e ci hanno dato una camera non premier con vista parcheggio, ho fatto notare la cosa è mi hanno detto che nel giro di qualche giorno ci avrebbero cambiato camera ma non è successo. 
Il giorno del nostro matrimonio abbiamo chiesto se fosse possibile fare qualche foto sul Rooftop ma ovviamente ci hanno detto di no perché apriva al pubblico alle 5pm (il personale era già lì). 
Insonorizzazione inesistente, nonostante fossimo al 10 piano fino alle tre di notte si sentiva la musica provenire dal Rooftop. 
Ciò che comunque ha lasciato l’amaro in bocca è la scortesia e la poca professionalità del personale. Considerando che alloggiavamo qui per il nostro matrimonio non c’è stato alcun accenno di cortesia, solo indifferenza senza neppure un anonimo “congratulation”. 
Least but not last la posizione è davvero infelice, chi scrive che con una piccola passeggiata sei a time square deve rivedere il concetto di piccolo, la zona di HK è davvero scarna senza alcun interesse. 
Concludendo, un posto carino (come tanti altri) per un sunset happy hour ma di certo non per soggiornare.

title: Wonderful stay at the Ink 48
text: We opted for the Terrace Room suite which overlooks the Hudson Bay.  We were cruising out of NYC and discovered this gem of a hotel.  We were able to watch our NCL cruise ship come in to dock.  The windows are floor to ceiling and adds quite a bit of a feeling of space.  It's not a large room, but the terrace space more than makes up for it.  The staff was very helpful and friendly.

title: Not what it used to be
text: I had stayed at Ink 48 before, years ago. It's a lovely spot though the pandemic has brought some changes. I was on the 3rd floor, so no beautiful view but I didn't have any noise issues. The staff was very nice. The room was clean but a bit run down. Scratched table top, no chairs with the table, the makeup mirror does not hold position (just needs a screw tightened, but still annoying), and the safe was broken. I SHOULD have called the front desk about it. I thought I got it working, but then came back to find it unlocked. Overall a nice hotel that maybe needs to pay a little more attention to the basics.

title: No longer a Kimpton property
text: Lovely lovely hotel. Great location near the west side highway and Hell’s Kitchen. No coffee makers in the room. Print restaurant was one of my favorites before Covid. Did not eat there on this visit.

title: Great view and superb hotel
text: We stayed here at recommendation of family living nearby. This is a great choice of hotel for proximity to the river and midtown/Times Square. We loved looking out our window over the Hudson and the Intrepid. The room was huge. The soaking tub was a dream. The restaurant Print is first class. The soundproofing of the building is good so you can sleep despite the NYC noise. The room rate was very fair given how huge the suite was.

title: Not what it appears on the ads!!!!
text:
The roof top view on the marketing advert certainly grabs you. It is why we booked this hotel - but it’s totally separate. A different business entirely. 
It’s only open from 5pm so thoughts of enjoying the roof view in the sun are out. In the evening you have to book along with the public  and pay 50 dollars towards your order to even get a chance of getting in. NOT what it appears in the adverts!!!! 
Forget relaxing in your room if you are facing uptown as there is a very loud rooftop cantina blaring most days and nights (till late)! 
Double glazing or TV up full blast makes no difference. We were on the 11th floor - lovely room but we couldn’t enjoy it for the horrendous noise. 
Reception acknowledged it and said they were trying to fix it. But not hard enough obviously!!! 
Also - after paying a lot of money for our room - there are ‘resort fees’ of 45 dollars a night … for what??? This is no resort! The spa room is closed, a tiny gym??? We had all these charges removed when we challenged them and obviously as compensation for the noise!!! 
Plus it costs 20 dollars to watch a film on the TV!! And don’t get me started on the mini bar prices. They had us laughing out loud as they were astronomical. 
Such a shame. We liked Hell’s Kitchen and our room was lovely. One reception guy was helpful, the other not. The doormen are utterly charming.

title: LOUD LOUD LOUD
text: There is an extremely loud bar across the street that blares REALLY LOUD music along with a DJ yelling right into your room until 12:45am!!  If you want a quiet nights sleep DO NOT STAY HERE!!  Times Square is much quieter.  NO help from front desk trying to get a quieter room.  I was staying for work and had to wake up at 6am and was not happy.

title: Great hotel! Make sure you don’t leave anything behind.
text:
Clean, upscale, comfortable hotel with a nice restaurant.  Used Amex and got a great upgrade.  

Rooms that face the side street are pretty noisy because of the club down there, but that’s NY. Just ask for a quieter room if you really need it. 

- 1 star for their use of the abysmal lost & found service “ileftmystuff.com.” Can’t get anyone at the hotel to speak to you or anything re: lost & found and that outsourced company is a joke.  You will never get your stuff back, because no one at that company will respond to you and the hotel will ignore any follow up emails you try to send.  It’s not really the hotel’s fault, per se, except that they should handle this internally and not outsource it, given that they are a 4 star hotel and seem to otherwise care about customer service.

title: Horrible Experience
text: Horrible experience. The hotel miscommunicated pricing and fees and how they apply with my amex credits. I contacted the hotel attempting to get this issue resolved but customer service was plain rude and basically said there was nothing they could do . I stayed there and left feeling scammed. I do not recommend.

title: Best Views
text: Views are unmatched and service was great! A gem on the West end providing a great boutique experience. The roof top is a bonus as well as the restaurant on the main level. I appreciate the low key neighborhood still providing access to the NYC chaos.

title: Nice enough but way too loud. Don't go if not clubbing...
text: The hotel is nice enough. Location in Hells kitchen same. Lobby staff friendly. Coffeeshop OK, but too expensive and there are no alternatives in the direct neighborhood. Room good size for NY, rain shower nice, but difficult to operate. Amenities all solid. Elevators wonky - key card needs to be maneuvered multiple times each time. Wifi needs to be activated multiple times as well, but comfortable bed is what counts. TV in room is not big. Negatives. Bottles of alcohol prominently for sale in the room is tacky and the 'club' on the 16th floor - the 'rooftop' terrace - is so loud that sleeping on the 17th floor is impossible until the club closes. Can't even hear yourself speak. That alone is a reason never to come back!

title: Not a 4-star hotel
text:
Location is within walking distance to Central Park, Times Square, Hudson Yards, and multiple subway lines while still being in a quieter part of Manhattan - which was great. Also compared to other NYC hotels, the rooms were larger and not cramped.

However, do not expect four-start service. Our room was not cleaned for two days, even after we were told it was going to be a priority to be cleaned after the first day it wasn’t cleaned. This wouldn’t have been an issue if was just my wife and I and if it were marketed as a 2-star hotel, but it was said to be a 4-star hotel and we had brought our two daughters (including one 5 month old daughter). Needless to say, since the room wasn’t cleaned it ended up getting messy by the third day. The hotel had said they would be comping some of our stay but they have not yet followed up on their word.

In summary, the facility is nice and the location is great for exploring Manhattan, but the service is sub par for a “luxury” hotel

title: One of the best hotels in the city!
text: Ink 48 is an upscale hotel that isn't stuffy or formal. It is warm, friendly, welcoming and absolutely comfortable. The staff not only meets patrons needs, but is known to anticipate them. The biggest draws for me are the huge luxurious soaking tubs in some of the rooms, and the absolutely gorgeous rooftop lounge with its exquisite views.

title: April in NYC!
text: Location is fantastic and near all things Broadway! The staff are super friendly and the rooms are modest but nice! The coffee shop, restaurant and roof are such a cool part of this off the beaten track hotel. We would totally stay here again!

title: Hidden charges
text: Just come back from a 4 night stay. Room.and view was lovely. Wasnt told about a $500 holding fee when we arrived. Also got charged $206 fees which we knew nothing about, think it could be wifi, amenities etc. We only used wifi. The staff gave us the wifi code but didnt mention any cost. Wasnt aware of an amenitie charge either. Our first time in new york, spoilt by the hidden charges.

title: Nice but expensive (hidden fees)
text: The room was very nice and clean. Rooftop bar class and the hotel had excellent views, from our room and the bar. It’s also in a decent location, not a long walk from Times Square and the Hudson River. However it’s very expensive. They charge a $500 holding fee, and they also charge you for WiFi, without saying! They gave us a code for the wifi, but there was no mention of the charge for it. There’s also no hot drink facilities in the room, if you want a coffee or tea you have to go downstairs to the bar and buy one, for about $7!

title: Rude front desk woman
text: Front desk woman Ella with grey hair was extremely rude and blatantly racist, insinuating that I’ve never been in a hotel before because of my skin color. I hope she has been fired. It’s a disgrace to have a racist woman representing a NYC hotel. My stay was ok otherwise but her dehumanizing treatment completely ruined my experience and made me uncomfortable during my stay.

title: Overall Satisfied
text:
To address some of the comments we saw here before we stayed:
Mixed reviews on customer service:  Our experience was very good.  We had many questions and one small issue with the tub, but all were addressed immediately and to our satisfaction.  Every staff member we came in contact with was pleasant and helpful.
No coffee pot: True and a disappointment - I like tea before bed - not sure why they can't include this.
Smell of "weed"? We did not experience this @ the hotel, that being said if you haven't been to NYC in a while, the entire city smells like weed.  It's awful.
Loud? Also we were lucky here too, despite a false fire alarm and some usual "city noises" we did not have any rowdy guests keeping us up, or hear the music others mentioned.  No complaints here, probably more dependent on the neighbors you happen to get rather than the hotel.
Distance from subway - yup, but again, don't you figure that out before you book?
Distance to Intrepid - can't get any closer.
Didn't try either restaurant, and yes, that you can't even see the rooftop without paying (a lot) was super disappointing.  It's definitely a hot spot at night.  
Worth it?  We paid more for a mid-priced room, and to me it's a lot of money, but I don't think it's out of line with all of the other NYC hotels I've stayed at (many).  NYC is expensive and a nice room is even more expensive.  That's just a fact.
BOTTOM LINE:  I think the best way to explain this place is we got exactly what we were promised, so just be sure you look at what you are booking.  The room was nice and the staff was excellent.  I wouldn't rave about it as some have, but we certainly left having no complaints either and were satisfied with our stay.

title: Terrific Hotel
text: Loved this hotel. Hip, fun, beautiful amenities, good restaurant, great views from my room and especially from the Press lounge. Really well run and  every single staff member was super helpful and friendly. If you’re visiting NYC, stay here.

title: The smell of Weed filled the hallways
text: This was a nice hotel, but I have 2 major complaints. For multiple nights, the smell of weed reeked and got into our room, and I was especially upset since the friend I was staying with is pregnant! Also, they say on their website they have complimentary bikes, but they told me all of them were supposedly in the shop getting worked on and did not offer me anything else. Lastly, if you are planning to try to take the subway at all, stay at a different hotel unless you want to walk 20+ mins to the subway station everytime you leave your room. I would say that the rooftop was amazing, but you don’t even need to be staying at the hotel to go to it. The people who worked there were very nice, just not helpful when things were going wrong.

title: Not helpful
text:
I called before making my reservation with Amex Hotel Collection and was going to book 2
Rooms for my family of 4 for 4 nights. I asked Claudia at the hotel  if they have connecting rooms and if I can reserve those If I make a reservation.  She said no.  And kept advising me to “shop around”. I was a bit confused.  But anyway-if I cannot request adjoining rooms when I book 2 room for 2 adults and 2 kids then it’s just not the chance for me worth taking

title: Overpriced / Basic
text:
I can’t believe this property is part of Hotel Collection. Too basic, meaning very overpriced for what it offers. The hotel has minimal amenities and the room basic accessories. The rooftop bar is not affiliated with the hotel, which is weird and makes you kinda uncomfortable. The cafe in the lobby also offers minimal options. 
Bottom line, too overpriced and not in a good location!

title: One of the best value hotels in Manhattan
text: This hotel had the most friendly staff. They were very accommodating. We booked with the Amex program and got an upgrade, which the staff did for us before we even arrived. The hotel may seem far from "points of interest," but it is pretty easy to get to Times Square by a short walk. There are also a lot of Citibikes around the area. 10/10 recommend.

title: Great hotel, great service!
text: What a wonderful boutique hotel with excellent accommodations! The room, the view and hotel amenities were delightful, especially during a snowy weekend. Upon returning home I realized  I left my cell phone behind. Ralph Johnson Jr, in Ink 48’s security administration, offered exceptional help in safety- and quickly- returning my phone. Kudos all around for a fabulous stay and customer service!

title: Fantastic Service
text: I've stayed here 4 times over the past few years, and every time have had a great experience. Ink has a good location, good food and drink, and nice rooms. But the best thing has been the service. As an example: on our last stay, I left some valuables in the safe, and realized it only while on the way out of town. My frantic call to the hotel was answered by the security manager, Ralph Johnson, who assuaged my fears and quickly retrieved and accounted for my valuables. In the same day, he got them into a Fedex package and off to me, and he checked in along the way. That sort of service makes all the difference in creating loyal customers.

title: amazing hotel, 120% love this place
text: people are very friendly and professional. room is clean, good size and wonderful view. The food is amazing. good location, you can find many great restaurants around too, walking distance from Times Square. roof top bar is one of the kind. we wanted to have a room with bath tubs, hopefully next time...

title: Great location.
text:
Enjoyed my stay. The hotel is situated within walking distance from Javits Center.
Cool rooftop bar and very nice restaurant/bar (Print) right next to it.
Bed was comfortable. I will definitely consider it again next time I visit New York.

title: Property needs a major facelift
text: The property had bad carpets, worn out beds/elevators, poor quality eating options.  It is well located within walking distance to Times Square and good places to step out and eat. Overall i would not pick next time.

title: WOWED on the Westside
text:
After 40 years of frequenting Manhattan, this was my first stay on the Westside and I will be back again soon.  From the early check-in accommodations and meeting “Boots” at the front desk, to the clean, quiet, stylish and spacious room, we were wowed.
The only minor hiccup was a small glitch with the thermostat, which was instantly remedied by a member of the engineering department named, “Jeffrey.”  His service and friendly demeanor was the highlight of our afternoon.
We also recommend a visit to the Press Lounge for delicious libations and unparalleled cityscape views.

title: Spacious rooms, great view of the Hudson and city view
text: Ink 48 is a real find...spacious rooms by NYC standards, tasteful and trendy decor, very clean and well maintained, all at a reasonable price. The restaurant and lounge has good service and an elegant, intimate feel.  Loved being near the Hudson, with terrific room views from the upper floors.  And the rooftop view of the city is AMAZING, perhaps one of the best in Manhattan. I'll definitely stay here again.

title: Spectacular views and location
text: We were kindly upgraded from a junior suite to a Hudson suite which had gorgeous waterfront views and a huge bathroom. DK at the front desk was an excellent host during our stay. While Sunday brunch was not available at The Print restaurant, we were directed to an excellent brunch restaurant Mom’s kitchen a couple of blocks away. Highly recommend this hotel.

title: Awful service, never again.
text:
We stayed here because our travel agent decided this was a suitable alternative to Hilton Metropolitan. This wasn’t by choice. 

They charge you resort fees, it’s certainly not a resort. 

The bath plug leaked so you could really only have a bath with running water. Staff ignored requests to get this fixed. 

The front door it so heavy it’s difficult to get in with luggage. There is a member of staff who will open the door, but they only open one of them. 

The location isn’t that good. A good 15 minutes to the nearest tube. 

We said we didn’t need a full room clean, took fresh towels  yet received a call from reception saying why did you reject room service. Shouldn’t have to justify cleaning our room ourselves, saves water!

The safe stopped working. Took 3 calls to get some one out to fix it. 

Our travel agent agreed to pay the resort fees. Checked out advising nothing to pay yet have charged $500 in resort fees. 
Hotel have ignored all messages and request for guidance. 

Will never be using this hotel again.

title: Great Centrally Located Hotel
text: Excellent value for money. Close to Time’s Square and its madness, without being too close. Quiet neighborhood with great restaurants, an amazing bakery less than a 2 minute walk away and close to theatre. Didn’t take a taxi or public trans the entire weekend. Easy walk to Central Park, Broadway, 5th Ave, etc. Rooms were very clean, had a great view and the staff was super friendly.

title: Très bon hôtel avec un personnel qui laisse à désirer
text:
L’hôtel était très bien situé (proche de Times Square et Central Park), propre et très beau. La chambre était spacieuse et la literie très bonne. Malheureusement le gros point négatif de cet établissement est son personnel peu chaleureux et hautain.
Recommandation : dans la mesure du possible, demandez à avoir une chambre qui ne donne pas sur la rue. Elle est très bruyante et l’isolation phonique est très mauvaise.

title: unclear Amenity Fee, loud, terrible neighborhood and not as fancy as photos do promise: way too expensive for that
text:
- unclear and unnecessary Amenity Fee keeps the price down and are only mentioned  "by the way" in the faq on the website extracting a dropdown
- very loud
- the neighborhood is terrible (car dealers and shabby/empty buildings) and far from the subway
- not as fancy as photos do promise
- not as clean as you I would expect
- the people were nice though

>>> way too expensive for that and somehow a rip off... by management/owner!

title: Excellent 4 day stay in a wonderful location
text: We booked this hotel because we haven't explored this part of NYC and the proximity to both Hells Kitchen and the pier was appealing. I booked this hotel as part of Amex Platinum perks and it turned out be a grea t move. We checked in earlier than the check-in time and were promptly upgraded to Junior suite - roomy and quiet. Didn't have a great view. I casually inquired about the rooms on higher floors and was told we can move rooms tomorrow to Premier King studio. We liked that room a lot better. Wifi was decent. We didn't go to the rooftop bar. although its very popular. Elevators 4 or more – never had to wait more than 30 seconds. Water pressure in the shower was good. Gwyan (Director of Hospitality) was super hospitable and great. Hotel was clean, staff was good, felt safe, walking distance to a lot of restaurants – diff price points. Hells Kitchen has tons of choices. Room was spacious - layout was a bit strange but we didn't mind it. Good quality toiletries.

title: Spacious, views but not quite up to standard
text:
Distinctly average and overpriced.

While we were lucky enough to have some incredible views of the city, the rest kind of fell flat. 

We had the most incredible city views on the 11th floor, it was spectacular and what I could have dreamed of for our 8 night stay.

The location was good, it’s quieter than other parts of town (IMO) but close enough to bars in Hell’s Kitchen and perfect distance to Hudson River greenway walking / running track. It’s also nice and central enough to walk to major sites, without being in tourist hell.

The bar on the roof is a separate entity, don’t believe that it’s part of the hotel. It just shares a lift shaft. It’s got incredible views, but is super popular so reserve a table, unless you are happy to stand at the bar. 

The room wasn’t cleaned for two days in a row, so we had no clean linen, towels or anything, really not good for an expensive stay. It was rectified when speaking to reception, but not quickly. And after 2 very long days, less than ideal to come back to this.

We also noticed glasses in the hallway not cleared up.

We did raise this to the GM, and it went ignored. The responses to negative or constructive feedback here is clearly lip service for trip advisor visitors. 

WiFi was charged yet rarely worked.

The room was spacious, but was not particularly clean, it felt dusty and the chair was dirty, the bathroom not super modern and parts of the hotel needed upkeep to make it actually a 4 star. Which this is not. 

Staff were largely polite.

Great location, spacious but I’d chose other places when we are back next year.

title: Okay but not great
text: The hotel is clean and the staff very friendly and helpful. But the rooms are small and they do not provide you with a coffee maker, refrigerator, or even a chair. Housekeeping has to be requested. The windows are very thin so we heard every noise from the street all night, including a woman who was sleeping on the sidewalk. Glass doors on the bathroom and no fan can make things unpleasant, odor-wise. I’ll find somewhere else to stay next time I visit the city.

title: You become instantly more hip when you walk in the door
text: we had an 8th floor river view and MAN was it cool. an entire wall of windows to be surrounded by the city but feel like you are in a sanctuary - barely a peep of a city sound could be heard. the bathroom was incredible, the shower especially cool (my boyfriend is still talking about it...3 days later). the staff was friendly, they had answers to all the questions and recommendations where to eat, the neighborhood was quiet but not (because hello NYC), bustling with restaurants and many non-touristy things and easily walkable to Rockefeller, Broadway, Times Square, Grand Central, etc. and it was (although still pricey) one of the most reasonably priced hotels in the area.

title: Amazing hotel
text: There’s nothing I could fault about this hotel. We were on the 14th floor (complimentary upgrade). The room size was unreal, very clean, tidy and modern. The view was outstanding. I loved the location of this hotel, in a more residential area rather than midtown but I loved that and loved being in Hells Kitchen, plus everywhere is walking distance. The staff were super friendly.  I would definitely seat here again.

title: Hotel stay
text:
Donna at the front desk is amazing! Thank you for a very comfortable visit these past couple months!
We have stayed at many different hotels in NYC but we will always book at INK48
The entire staff was outstanding!

title: Fair Hotel, Poor Service
text:
Booked for a few days in NYC and got a decent price for what looked like a good, boutique hotel, with rooftop bar and river views. 
Room had no view, but was huge by NYC standards, with huge bathroom with shower, and a bath tub. 
Bed was large and comfy. 
BUT…..no bottled water in the fridge & no coffee facilities in the room. 
A coffee machine was provided when we asked, tho. 
Only 1 robe, but another provided when we asked. 
They failed to make up our room on day 2, but as we didn’t get back until 10pm, it was too late after I complained. 
They made up the room the next day, removed both robes and turned the heating up to full. Petty and embarrassing by hotel staff. 
The rooftop bar is only accessible if you book in advance, and the downstairs bar seems to shut by around 10:30. Very poor if you want a drink when you get back from a night out.
Based on service, probably wouldn’t stay there again.

title: The worst service I have experienced in any hotel
text:
I’d like to start this review by saying I run my own travel business and spend a lot of time travelling in hotels so
I don’t take writing a review like the lightly but I have never experienced service like I experienced here and especially in a New York hotel who’s service tends to be second to none.

We arrived after 11 hours of travelling no one opened a door for us or offered to help with bags ,a service that I normally would expect as standard in New York. Our room was a city view suite though the only view was straight in to the flats opposite. The suite it’s self was beautiful and is the only reason I won’t give the hotel a 1* rating as they rooms themselves are lovely despite the lack of city view but a hotel is a bout more than just that. 

The room had no refreshments at all in the mini fridge , no water, no soft drinks nothing which after a long flight when you are dehydrated and thirsty and haven’t been offered a welcome drink is far from ideal. I went down to the reception to ask if this was a mistake or where in the hotel we could get a drink from and was told nowhere for the next 2 hours there is no vending machine after the bar is closed there is nowhere on the premises to get a drink which is obviously very inconvenient. The staff did unhelpfully suggest I drink out of the tap. We decided we would get ready and head up to the rooftop bar but were unfortunately told that wasn’t an option as it’s fully booked and reservations are required (information the would have been helpful at the time of booking) we asked if reception could book us in for some point on our stay and were told no we were told “the 2 bursinesses aren’t connected in anyway so you would need to go online and do it yourself” which seemed crazy as if they aren’t in anyway connected why are all the hotels photos of the rooftop bar? I went to go online to book but ofcourse WiFi isn’t complimentary is a $20 per day charge which in a high end hotel I just didn’t expect. We were left feeling so disappointed the next day we were out all day and returned to the room to find their had been no turn down service and no fresh towels provided.  At this point I decided to raise my issues with the hotel only to find that the phone in the room was broken. So I sent an email which was never acknowledged by the hotel all we received in the way of knowing they had got it was fresh towels in the room the following day but still no turn down service.

I’ve stayed in a hotels under a range of budgets and never had these issues which is shocking as it’s not a budget hotel. I won’t be recommending to any customers. It could be a lovely hotel if the service matched the rooms and the room descriptions were correct tight now the hotel feels very much like a budget hotel masquerading as something more high end

title: Avoid this Hotel
text: Very disappointing. Tiny room poorly equipped. View from room was a parking lot full of Verizon vans. Card readers for elevators and room doors were clunky and only worked about 50% of the time. Staff rarely wore masks. Rooftop Bar is separately owned and not part of the hotel. Terrible location - located among NYC car dealerships. Hotel Lobby bar had last call for drinks at 10:45 pm both Friday and Saturday nights - entirely too early as we had been out to shows and bar was closed by the time we returned. Lots of people waiting to go to a separately owned upstairs bar hanging around the lobby - almost none of them wearing masks. Will not return to this place, except to eat in its excellent farm-to-table restaurant.

title: Scam hotel images! They do not own the rooftop terrace!
text: They are using images of the roof top restaurant and bar to promote the hotel which is why we booked it. But it is a lie as it is not actually part of the hotel. It is a separate business that you have to pay a minimum deposit of $50 just to go up and have a look. You are literally forced to spend $50.00 minimum. Seriously not impressed! False advertising! When I complained to the staff about this they ignored my complaint. Then when I was in my room having taken a shower I noticed that there was not water in the room. When I called "Guest Services" to ask where the water was they told me I had to come and get it myself from the restaurant next door as they do not supply water at the hotel!! Seriously why type of dodgy hotel is this. STAY AWAY DO NOT STAY HERE! If you want the view come and book into the overpriced bar and restaurant separately!

title: Exceptional!
text: Outstanding hospitality, & the amenities are top notch. Beautiful hotel in a beautiful setting. The hotel is located in a perfect spot close to everything! This is definitely where you want to stay!!!

title: Fabulous stay at Ink 48
text: I visited NYC and stayed at Ink 48 in Hell's Kitchen.  What a great hotel - my room had a wonderful view of the skyline, and it was also comfortable, quiet, and clean.   There's a coffee bar right in the lobby that also serves breakfast sandwiches and pastries, and it was so nice to not have to go out to look for my morning cup of Joe.  Print, their restaurant, is also lovely with a great menu and attentive service.  The portions were very generous and my salad and entree were both delicious.  There's also a rooftop bar with one of the most amazing views of the city.  I would definitely return to this hotel as I loved the character - nothing cookie-cutter about it and way better than the feel of a chain hotel.  The area is quiet and away from the real hustle & bustle of NYC, and it's a quick trip if you find yourself needing to go back towards the Midtown area.

title: Don't Stay Here Unless You Plan on Being up All Night
text:
The website photos of the hotel look amazing; a beautiful view of the river and cruise ship terminal. The truth is that our rooms (we changed rooms) overlooked a nightclub with loud music blaring until 2AM. When we requested a room change upon checking into our room, the manager and front desk clerk looked at the available rooms for several minutes before the manager pointed to the screen and said to move us to "that" room. The front desk clerk said, "really?" I should have known at the moment that this wasn't going to be good. They obviously had several rooms to choose from given the amount of time they contemplated the room change. However, when we got upstairs our new room was three rooms down from our original room. When we, again, requested a room change, we were met with rudeness and told that there weren't any available rooms. When we requested some sort of compensation for the inconvenience, the manager said that since we weren't the only people to complain, she couldn't give us any added benefits because then she'd have to give the same to everyone who complained.

Fortunately we were only staying there one night before leaving on a cruise. It was a shame, though. It was my sister's first time in NYC and I wanted the first night of our vacation to be fun. It was anything but.

I would say that unless you'll be partying at the club across the street, don't stay here. There are many beautiful hotels in NYC with staff that actually care about the satisfaction of their patrons. This is not one of them.

title: Amazing Hotel!!!
text: This hotel was recommended to me by relatives who live in New York. It is very convenient to everything in town. Lovely, lovely, first class hotel. You know that as soon as you walk in. Our room was very large, super clean, and had a nice bathroom. The General Manager Nick Ivezaj was super accommodating and very friendly. This is THE hotel for your stay in New York!!

title: Love this hotel and can't wait to go back!
text: What a great choice from the list provided by the wedding couple who's wedding we attended September 26th. The General Manager Nick Ivezaj personally took care of us and was very helpful and we got to personally meet him when we were in the hotel one morning. The room was nice size with two queen beds which is harder to find in New York Boutique hotels. The staff was super friendly and very helpful with all our questions and had a lot of good suggestions for whatever we needed. I will plan to stay there when I return to New York it was a  wonderful experience.

title: Buen hotel. Buenas habitaciones. Gran servicio.
text:
Luego de varios meses en New York, decidimos probar este hotel, un poco “alejado” de la zona más turística, y con muy buenos comentarios en tripadvisor. 

Desde nuestra llegada todo estuvo muy bien. Reservamos 3 días para probar, y terminamos quedándonos 15. 

Todos en el front desk fueron siempre muy amables, especialmente en el turno de noche. 

Al llegar, viendo que teníamos mucho equipaje y aue la habitación no era tan grande, nos dieron upgrade sin costo a habitaciones se esquina, que eran muy grandes para lo normal de la ciudad. De todas formas, las habitaciones originales eran más grandes de lo normal, considerando que es New York. 

El servicio de housekeeping era muy bueno. La habitación siempre impecable. No ponían problemas para hacerlo, como si lo hacen otros hoteles por el covid. 

Pese a tener un rooftop y estar rodeado de bares, nunca tuvimos problemas de ruido ni mucho menos. 

Realmente agradable y con un gran servicio. Lo único un poco negativo es el el precio considerando la ubicación. Para nosotros era perfecta, pero quizás otros turistas lo descarten por ella. 

Recomendado 100%.

title: Nice and worthwhile hotel experience with few small shortcomings
text:
My wife and I stayed at the Ink48 hotel for our wedding anniversary, and thought it was a nice experience. There's a lot to like along with a few small-but-noteworthy shortcomings. I've broken out our thoughts into multiple categories below.

What drove us to book it? We wanted a romantic and classy room that was nicer-than-the-norm. We also enjoy a boutique sensation, which this hotel does somewhat evoke despite being part of the larger Kimpton chain. There's also an **awesome** rooftop bar called "The Press Lounge" (and they do encourage advanced reservations); the cost to get in is $50/person with dues being fully applied toward whatever food and drinks ordered through the bar.

Location: we wanted something moderately close to Broadway for a show, but didn't want an overly touristy area since we visit NYC often. Beware of two things. 1. the closest Subway stop is about a 15 min walk away (W 50th Street & Broadway). We consciously knew this and were OK with a combination of walking and using Uber/Lyft. 2. The neighborhood can feel a bit seedy if you're new to NYC. We go to NYC often and weren't bothered by this at all.

Room: We originally debated getting a suite but chose the "King Premier" room since we were spending most of our stay away from the hotel. The King Premier is 50% larger than their regular King room. The layout felt spacious and it was neat that the toilet was separate from the shower; each has its own door so someone can do their business while another person takes a shower. The King Premier room also has a door-less bathtub situated in the middle of the room (away from the toilet and shower). Subjectively, my wife said the bathtub placement felt odd but judge for yourself since you can see it in a lot of photos.

Ambiance: As other reviewers have said, the first thing you notice are the tall ceilings with tall windows. We had a city view that was really cool during both day and night. There was also a comfy sofa and lounge area adjacent to the windows helping you soak in the view. Things felt bright and chipper. If anything, the room's artwork felt a tad barren; there was one big white wall with no artwork whatsoever.

Cleanliness: the room was pretty clean. No real complaints. We did notice a likely-permanent wine carpet stain but it was not obvious. Everything else was clean and tidy. Their "Clean Air" in-room card prohibits indoor smoking. Smokers will be charged a $350 penalty if they're caught smoking inside.

Upkeep: despite being renovated in 2016, I noticed minor details that momentarily snapped me out of vacation mode. 1. The shower stall's floor tiles were fading and needed new grout. 2. There were multiple shower knobs but one did absolutely nothing (and was loose to the touch). On the plus side, the showerhead and wand were very nice with good temperatures and water pressure. 3. The GFCI electrical outlet above the two vanity sinks was halfway pushed into the wall.

Staff: everyone was friendly and we had no complaints. Other reviews mentioned that the staff came across as curt or unaccommodating. We didn't get that feeling whatsoever (and this is after interacting several times with multiple front desk staff, including the luggage guy, at check-in and check-out). 

Food & Room Service: N/A. I don't think this was available when we stayed? There was a prompt on the TV that said to order room service through the TV digitally. When we went to that part of the TV's app, the room service section was blank. We weren't craving their food so we didn't actively call front desk or seek out food at "The Print Lounge" (their ground floor restaurant). The room's mini-bar was also (we assume) empty.

Electronics: Wi-Fi was free with our room although we didn't feel a need to use it (we have unlimited data plans for our phones and cell reception was good the entire time). The TV itself was a basic (maybe 42"?) flat screen 1080p TV - nothing special. The cable TV feed was clear enough and had plenty of channels to choose from. The remote control and TV apps were responsive enough aside from the aforementioned Room Service snafu. We never order Pay-Per-View content but the available selection felt pretty good including Still-In-Theater movie rentals. For anyone curious, there was no adult content to order - lol. One oddity was that music channels cost money which I've never seen elsewhere. Also, there was no option to hook-up-your-Netflix-account - a feature I've seen at other hotels. Last but not least, the digital thermometer worked correctly and the HVAC unit in the room cools the room down pretty quickly.

COVID-19: they reviewed our vaccination cards at check-in. The hotel didn't feel overcrowded so no concerns about social distancing in public areas like the lobby. Everything felt clean and most of the staff throughout the hotel wore masks.

Other: Signs to the hotel are not that obvious; one of our Uber drivers completely missed it when he was trying to drop us off. There's also a big construction project across the street, as well as general street noise. As others have said, it can be audible (even at higher floors) if noise is something that easily bothers you. Not a big deal to us but may be to some. Also, check out the Intrepid Sea Air & Space Museum that's a few short blocks away - it's very impressive.

Overall: We felt it was worth the money for a nicer-than-normal room without going overboard. The few shortcomings mentioned throughout this review prevent me from giving it 5 stars. Booking one of Ink48's larger suites is a tempting and appealing idea, but those same shortcomings are making us think twice.

title: Weekend Getaway
text: I this hotel last minute on a whim. I checked on Friday and Annie was fabulous - she welcomed me and my husband and booked a fantastic restaurant in Hell’s Kitchen to for dinner.  The junior suite we booked was clean and spacious and Jose the doorman greeted us as we came back and forth into the hotel.  I def will be back!

title: My Go To Hotel!
text: I’ve been to Ink 48 about 10 times in last 4 years - this is my go to hotel honestly.  Rooms are always clean and well maintained, front desk staff always remember and welcome me by name.  Manager always welcome me back when he sees me.  It’s on the west side of Manhattan away from all the hoopla of time square.  And I highly recommend jogging the Hudson River Park route - beautiful views of the river!

title: Convenient Hell's Kitchen Location
text: My fiance and I made a quick one-night trip to the city to see a show, and stayed at INK 48 because it was a favorite hotel my fiance had stayed in 5-years ago. We stayed in a Hudson River Suite and were pleased with the generous size of the room, the comfort of the bed, and the "WOW" factor of the sweeping views from the floor to ceiling windows. I should mention in fairness, the "view" of this side of New York isn't terribly interesting or beautiful, and you're in a bit of a fishbowl to the neighboring building - but the wall of windows makes an already large room feel even more expansive. There were discomforts in our stay, but I understand that everyone is suffering from COVID-19 fall-out. Staff, if available at all, isn't the cream of the crop, and we're all getting by as best as possible with supply chains, money, and restrictions on everything tightening by the minute. I don't pretend to know what it takes to run a hotel the size of INK 48 even in the best of times, but would agree with others who have commented that the hospitality level doesn't meet the expectation of 4-stars, I'm sure many hotels are experiencing at this time.

title: I keep coming back to Ink 48!
text: This is my second visit to Ink 48 in recent months and it’s my go to hotel! The staff are super friendly and always remember me. Anie and Ella are always there to greet me when I come in the evenings. The rooms are clean and spacious and the location is very close to my business needs at Hudson Yards.

title: AMAZING!
text: Ink 48 hotel is the best hotel in New York. I loved the staff. But special thanks for the Security Agent, Ralph Johnson Jr. he’s helped me so much and with beautiful smiling. Thank you Mr. Ralph and him team. Warm regards. We will come back soon!

title: Hit and Miss
text:
I've stayed at this location twice, and it seems like there are various sizes of rooms that fit into the same category because twice I've stayed in what I believe was King Premier, and one room was much, much nicer than the other.

I traveled pre-pandemic for work and enjoyed a really nice, spacious room with a sitting area that included seating by the window, a small dining table, bed, and a bathroom area. Traveling for a getaway with my husband, I booked the same hotel and room type and somehow ended up in a less pretty room half the size, with no seating area, and a small dining table with a single chair. It was also a LOT louder than the previous room, but that's probably because we were much closer to the window given the room size.

Room service etc. was suspended due to the pandemic, which is completely understandable, and I feel for this industry that has been hit by difficulties, so that is an informational statement only, and not a judgment. I assume that any mini bar items were also impacted, as these were not included in the room, though there is a small fridge.

My other callouts are just that the room seemed to be set up for one person. One chair, one robe, one of everything. We were informed by one of the men holding the doors in the lobby that we had an umbrella in our room, but unfortunately, ours was missing, as an example. 

I will say that housekeeping was fully operational, as we had actually not requested it, but came back to our room fully cleaned and reset.

So, I guess my experience was mixed. One trip was fantastic, and I declared that I would never stay anywhere in NY. The second was a bit disappointing, but I'm hoping it was just a sign of covid related times.

title: Perfect
text:
Arrived at the hotel 1/2 hr before check in time & was warmly greeted by both the receptionist & doorman,
   The check in process was quick & easy …..
  My wife & I proceeded to our room ( Hudson Suite)
 And as soon as we opened the door we were blown away 
By the incredible views from the large wall to wall windows 
    The room was immaculate & beautifully decorated,
  The bathroom had an incredible sunken tub & the shower had an array of luxurious shower heads ,,,
    After dinner we headed up to the Press Lounge for some late night drinks ,,, 
   When we arrived back in our room we were very tired from a busy day , & immediately sunk into the very comfy 
King size bed ,,,, 
  This Hotel is perfectly located in the heart of Manhattan 
And we would not hesitate to recommend it to our friends 
And will definitely be our new “favorite Hotel “ when visiting the city ,,,,
    Great job all around Ink Hotel !

title: Outstanding Service
text:
I would have to say that Nick the general manager is a Hands-On active and knows what goes on in his hotel and it shows. The hotel runs smooth everyone that I dealt with had smiles on their faces everybody was polite the service was outstanding from everybody that I ran into or encountered why I stay stayed it was beautiful centrally located easy to access close to everything, including the pier. It was peaceful well organized clean and a pleasant stay overall even for business I plan on staying here every time I come each month, the staff guaranteed a nice return. The reason for the return is because how well this hotel ran thanks to Nick and his staff for everything our stay was exceptional thank you. See you soon.

Thank you to Ink 48 for a very pleasant,clean and peaceful time .

Mr. & Mrs Brian Huffman 
California, USA

title: Clean hotel nothing else positive
text:
Came to NYC for two nights for a birthday party. Booked ink 48 via Amex , which turned out to be a mistake as I paid way more via Amex than what they were offering the rooms on other sites. 
Got 100 dollar credit to use for food and beverage however the hotel makes it impossible to spend. 
You cant charge food in the restaurant to your room! Which is insane to me ! 
They also charge an amenity fee for nothing plus you have to pay for WiFi. 
Couldn’t get up to the roof top bar tried three times but was full of non guests! 
Room wasn’t made up once . I hit the make up room
Button and called down to the front desk twice. In the end I took towels of a cart I found in the hallway , however house keeping banged on my door at 9am on check out day ! 

Front desk guy I was dealing with had a bad attitude and blamed covid for their lack of any thing. 

It’s a shame as this hotel is next to my office so would have been so handy for business trips.  Will never go thru the door again and don’t recommend anyone else to bother either

title: Amazing Attention
text: My daughter and I arrived after being at the hospital. She broke her leg and Nick in reception, Musa and Jesse in the entrance and Mar in the Restaurant, went out of their way to make our stay exceptional. They helped so much. What a great team and what great staff. Thank you.

title: Great value at NYC
text:
The hotel is nice, clean, but most importantly it has awesome big rooms at a reasonable price, unlike the rest of NYC.
Anthony at the front desk, is the most outstanding member in a crew of people that will really go out of their way to make you feel at home.
Location is good, though it is a 15 min walk to metro stations.

title: Incredible Service and a Super-Cool Property
text: The Ink48 was an incredibly fun and wonderful surprise in so many ways.  From the outstanding bar, to the very well-appointed rooms, to their great supply of bikes available for guests, this hotel is a gem.  But by far the best thing about the Ink48 is the amazing attention of their concierge staff (and Anthony Bosco in particular!)  Anthony intervened at a moment of stress for us, when we were trying to return a product to a NYC location but getting no cooperation from the vendor.  Anthony stepped in, took full responsibility for the return on our behalf and invited us to "just relax."  This is the kind of fabulous attention we all USED to expect at hotels, but can still find at this wonderful property.  Don't hesitate to stay at the Ink48, and hope you're lucky enough to have Anthony or any of his colleagues attending to your needs.

title: Wedding Anniversary
text: Where do I begin?  My friends were celebrating their 10 year wedding anniversary and I wanted to surprise them with something special for when they arrived. After all, I was their Minister.  I was thinking of having a bottle of wine or champagne sent up to the room. I called the hotel and spoke to Anthony in concierge and told him what I was thinking. Anthony came up with an even better idea. He had me send him a couple of pictures of the happy couple, he printed them out, put them in frames, set them up in their room with rose pedals scattered around them. Talk about going above and beyond!! Thanks so much, Anthony!

title: Quick B Trip
text: Great swanky spot near Hell's Kitchen.  3 rooftop bars within a block including @Ink48.  Quick walk to Broadway Shows and Hudson Bike Paths... Very nice, large rooms with plenty of space to work (if need be).  Set up office here for a week- good internet speeds.  Great coffee slash  food in lobby (although wasn't full service due to covid just yet).  Workout room has everything u need and spa looks lovely although i didnt indulge myself this trip.  Great helpful and friendly staff and service!

title: Anthony saved our first impression!
text:
