We got here at 7am. There’s no one waiting for you and opening the door or helping you with the lugage. The receptionist has a terrible attitude... 
She said “as you know check in is at 3 pm and it’s 7, so you’ll have to wait until maybe 2”.... (which is ok, but not the way to receive a guest) 

Besides that, no breakfast was offered... she said we could walk two blocks and found something to eat.... and also, would you like to drink water???? Go get it 2 blocks away from the hotel...

She didn’t give us the wifi pass while we waited for our room until 3 pm... we almost paid 14 dollars to get it from the lobby.  

She said Concierge arrived at 7:30... she wasn’t even able to notice us when he arrived.

Anthony has been the best!!!  Is 9:20 and we are already in our room, with free wifi and the Dinning menu available at the hotel. 

We’re very disappointed with the famous and well promoted Ink48 rooftop, since it is not part of the property. You have to make a reservation and pay a deposit to go.... the view is basically the main reason we had high expectations with the hotel. 

Not very happy, but Anthony has definitely saved our first impression... We’ll be staying for 6 days and really hope it will be better.

title: Memorial Day Weekend @ Ink 48
text:
We figured we would take a last minute trip to New York City over the long Memorial Day weekend. Since we have a $200 credit through American Express, we decided to book through their portal. When searching for hotels, we stumbled upon Ink 48 and by all accounts, it seemed like the perfect little spot to stay while we were in town - rates were reasonable, they are part of the American Express Hotel Collection (upgrade if available and $100 on-site hotel credit), and decently close to everything we were looking to visit when in town.

Ink 48 has a few different room types. We went through each room carefully and decided to book the King Premium room based on the description and pictures provided by the marketing team on Ink 48's website and the American Express site. 

Since we took a red eye, we were hoping & praying for a potential early check-in so we could take a quick nap before venturing out. By the time our plan landed, the hotel had already sent us a notification that our room was ready! It looked as though things were going our way!

When we arrived at the hotel, we asked the front desk if there was any potential for any upgrade. Sadly, we were told that there was, but we would be charged for it. This was a bit of a shock, but decided to let it be until later since we were tired and not looking for any argument. Outside of that, the front desk staff member was super nice.

We proceeded to our room and found that the room we had been given was nothing like what was described or pictured on Ink 48's website or American Express' travel portal. We took a quick nap and then proceeded on with our day since we had activities that were at specific times.

When we returned to the hotel, we asked the new front desk lady about the room and she wasn't super pleasant to interact with. She let us know that the room shown on the website has only a few rooms that look like that and they are reserved for VIP guests who stay with the hotel frequently. She told us that she would move us, but they were 100% full for the night.

We went back up to the room and while looking up review to see if others had experienced the same type of issue noted that the hotel still had plenty of rooms open still for our days of stay. During this same time, we had also noticed that the headboard was covered with what we can only assume was something from someone having a super happy evening of fun with someone else. 

Since the front desk didn't seem to be able to help or even really explain why things were not as advertised, we decided to reach out to the General Manager (Nick) who we noticed replies to most reviews in a quick and timely manner. Nick was 100% on the ball and willing to help explain the situation and offered to upgrade us at no cost to the Junior Suite (which is the next room type up it appears). Nick even agreed the descriptions and pictures were not really accurate for that room type. We moved into the new room the next day and it was night/day different than the room we originally were assigned.

The beds and pillows were super comfortable. Make sure you pick up some cups from the front desk as the hotel has removed everything from the rooms. The bathroom products smelled great (might even buy some for home), and the spa like shower was wonderful to stand in when getting ready for the morning.

We did take advantage of the $100 credit by using the Print restaurant in the lobby. We shared an egg sandwich which was pretty tasty. You don't need to order via the website, you can walk in and order at the counter and they will deliver it to you.

Lastly, if you are planning to use the subway, this hotel is a bit of a walk (about 10 minutes or so) to the closest terminal. Otherwise, you can easily hail a cab right outside if needed.

Overall, while the room situation was a bit of a failure, Nick and Anthony did an excellent service recovery on a holiday weekend. We enjoyed staying at Ink 48 and would recommend you trying it out.

title: Exceptional choice for travel and business
text: In recent and distant past I have lodged at the Ink 48 on many an occasion.  I am in Nyc often, as my business dictates especially during this crisis.  I can't recall but one of the suites facing the Hudson was excellent, it may have been a junior?  The rooms were neat and immaculate.  The Front Desk staff were warm and very accommodating.  Genuinely some of the friendliest employee's I've encountered.  Wifi was always spot on.  This fine establishment is my go to whenever I'm on business or leisure.

title: Meh
text: Reasonably priced and access to a good market.  VERY loud location.  Rooms were passable.  Location is remote - there’s VERY little in the immediate area - mostly garages & lumber yards.  Definitely NOT good for families - that one was on me, should have researched more.  Keys frequently did not work.  Customer service was uneven - sometimes helpful, sometimes snarly and ambivalent.  Important to note that the lovely adjacent rooftop bar is NOT a hotel amenity- it is a separate entity that requires reservations and a has 1.5hr max time limit and $50pp fee. Restaurant was not open at time of stay.  Bottom line is if u have biz in the immediate area and bring ear plugs, u will be fine.  Otherwise, it’s pretty much Siberia.

title: Love this Hotel!
text:
Super clean rooms, over the top staff and awesome rootop!!   I reserved a Hudson Suite and it was amazing!   I met the manager as well during my visit - i cannot remember his name but he was just an absolue pleasure to deal with.

Can't wait until i come again!

title: Best Hotel in NYC!!
text: Came to Ink 48 on a last minute decision - and it was the best decision ever!  Fabulous rooms, great restaurant and Hudson Yards is a 10 minute walk away.  Oh and the staff are truly the best - the people working the front desk are some of the most friendly people I ever encountered.  I really do recommend this hotel!

title: General Manager Nick
text: Nick is the General Manager at Ink 48. I am so incredibly thankful for meeting him. I shared that it was my birthday and he modified my stay an extra day for the most affordable rate I’ve seen. The King studio with a city view room exceeded my expectations. I honestly did not want to leave. The customer service and hospitality of Nick exceptional. It made my stay there worthwhile. Nick and I conversed about life and what is important to us. It was refreshing that we shared a lot of the same values as one another. Nick is compassionate and kind. Ink 48 has been my best hotel experience let alone customer service experience. Also, Nick made my birthday even more special by allowing my significant other and I to get a view of the city during sunset hours. I was appreciative of this because it’s one of my favorite things to do. Nick accommodated me a couple of times. Please mention that Tamaine & Taleena sent you. I promise you won’t regret it!

title: Couple's Retreat - Grows and Glows
text:
I booked this hotel to have a romantic getaway experience on the West Side of Manhattan. I knew that due to COVID-19 many things could be limited, but I don't feel that affeHere's the gist:

Glows (The Good)
+ Good location with access to the west-side of manhattan and midtown

+ Modern furnishings and a quiet stay 

+ Great customer service with the restaurant staff

+ City Views: I booked a city view room which was great at night but in the day time you could see a building under much construction. 

The Grows 
(-) Repairs: Upon entering our room we noticed that the TV was unplugged, bathtub stopper was unscrewed (preventing sealing) and the bathtub faucet handle was broken which led to the counter top flooding over on the floor. The maintenance staff were accommodating but this  ended up spoiling a portion of our romantic getaway.

(-) Amenities: We were told that due to COVID-19 there were no bathrobes or in-room bar provided. Also, at night when we wanted a beverage, we were directed to walk down the street to a 24 hour deli as sodas/waters were not provided after 8:00pm. 

(-) Rooftop Access: The staff informed me to speak with the rooftop restaurant owner, to access the beautiful view of the city skyline. When I arrived I found out that they were closed, preventing that from being an option to celebrate my time at the hotel.

  
All in all, I have mixed reviews. The hotel has a lot of potential that they should capitalize on.

title: Perfect wedding venue
text:
We rented the luxury penthouse for an elopement and this is the best place you can possible get married. The penthouse has a huge terrace with a stunning NYC skyline. We worked with Andreas and he was very professional and helpful. All the guests enjoyed the stay at the hotel and the ceremony went smoothly. 
This hotel is so picture perfect and we did lots of styled pictures at the hotel. There is also a wonderful restaurant downstairs, so our couple had their reception there. 
Overall wonderful experience, great staff, and outstanding service.

title: Great Recovery
text: Originally booked 2 rooms/3 nights at TRYP Hotel/Times Square (via Hotwire). TRYP cancelled our reservation THE DAY OF CHECKIN, and offered a sub par replacement. Hotwire helped us to rebook at INK 48. Totally satisfied with INK 48. Some services were a bit limited due to Covid, but rooms were fine and location was walking distance to restaurants and bodegas. Overall very satisfied with INK 48, would stay here again and recommend to others.

title: Dishonest and unprofessional
text:
Dishonest and unprofessional. 

This change in management has been incredibly unprofessional.   I booked suites (December 2019) for my Memorial Day weekend wedding in 2020 and had wedding blocks set up for the wedding guests (January 2020). 

I made it clear that I had 2 dogs that are in my wedding and staying with me in my suite. They are part of my wedding party. I partly chose Ink48 because of the pet policy (no pet fees, no pet deposits, no size/breed restrictions). I had to postpone my wedding to 2021.  When I had to make the date change in April due to Covid-19, Andreas gave me an addendum to change the dates but neglected to mention the change in pet policy and management.

I noticed the change in the pet policy and emailed the sales director, Andreas, on October 1.  With this new pet policy, not only would I only be able to only have one dog but I also would have to pay $100 extra for something I thought was included in my reservation.  I asked for my wedding block guests and my own reservation to be exempt from this policy because I made the reservations while the hotel did not charge pet fees and did not have a size restriction.  I consider it being "grandfathered".

He did not respond for 2 weeks.
It was not until I complained to the concierge desk and asked for his superior that he responded to me.
He made an excuse about his reduced work schedule due to Covid as his reason for not responding.  I work on a reduced work schedule too. If it took me two weeks to answer an email, I would have been fired.  That was a terrible excuse. This hotel is a client relationship based business, is it not?

He did not exempt my reservation or wedding blocks from the rule change. His response was to tell me that the rate was $100 per pet for the entire stay. And that he would reduce my fee to $30 per day. Whether he meant $30 per day or per pet per day is unclear.

Worse case scenario, I would have had to pay more than $100 for something that was supposed to be free and included in my reservation with your hotel. Best case scenario, I pay $60 for something that was supposed to be included. He made it seem like he was doing me a favor.

Can you imagine the nightmare this would have been for me to check into the hotel for my wedding if I had not spotted this change? I would have been charged another $120 and not been able to bring my large dog into the hotel (who is the ring bearer in my wedding).  This is incredibly unprofessional and dishonest.

I feel like this hotel is a complete joke for trying to pull wool over people's eyes. I have secured another pet friendly NYC hotel and rebooked everything there.

title: Great Visit - All things considered!
text: I used to visit Ink 48 frequently when I traveled to NYC from Connecticut extensively.  I came back this week to visit a client and the hotel still impresses me - even in this current covid climate the staff were super friendly and seemed to genuinely care.  The rooms are very spacious (I booked a Premier Room) and the rooftop lounge is always a nice way to the end the night.  I hope to come back soon!

title: 2nd stay better than ever!
text: 2nd time at Ink 48!  I visited this hotel pre-covid and had such a wonderful time.   I came back last week for a mini-getaway with my husband and Nick/GM greeted me at the desk and was an absolute pleasure to deal with.  Try Print Restaurant and their grab and go option – the food is really well prepared.   The rooms are very large and spacious and clean!  I will always recommended this hotel!

title: Excellent service and experience at INK 48
text:
I have stayed at Ink 48 several times over the summer / fall of 2020.  

Every single stay has been excellent and the service perfect.

The Grab and Go counter in the lobby is the best way to start a morning. 

The rooftop outdoor lounge was the perfect way to cap off a busy day.

title: Disappointing
text:
The main issue was being woken up at 4am by the TV or conversation from a neighboring room, which was so clear we could almost make out what they were saying. With reduced Covid capacity, you would think they could space guests out more. Walls also seem to be paper thin.

The website also advertised that due to Covid, minibar items had been removed and would be available upon request. When we asked, we were told nothing was available.

title: Like hotel, bit away from the action
text: The good- chic boutique hotel,very clean , rooms are good size for nyc.  The main negative is it is not really near any tourist spots or great food.  Hells Kitxhen is a fine neighborhood but I wish we were more in the action.  However I got a great deal at $100 a night so I can’t complain

title: Amazing Wedding Venue NYC!
text:
As a Wedding and Event Planner, I have worked at hundreds of venues in the tri-state area. Ink 48 is by far the most underrated venue in the city! 

Our venue flooded a week before the wedding and Andreas completely saved the day! Andreas offered us the penthouse and terrace at the most affordable price! The views are absolutely breathtaking! It epitomizes what a NYC rooftop should look like! 
The week leading up to the event, Andreas (the Sales Director) was in constant communication with me to ensure we had everything we needed and all questions could be answered. Nick Ivezaj, GM and team accommodated our every need. 5 stars for hospitality! On the day of, our marble sweetheart table tops had a mishap and couldn't get to us - Joe the hotel engineer helped me come up with a creative solution to build a glass tabletop for the Bride and Groom. Talk about a superstar troubleshooter! 

The entire team made our day smooth and unforgettable. When it comes to the top venues I trust for my clients in the city, Ink 48 definitely lands in the top 5! I cannot wait to throw my next event here!

title: のんびり
text: 地下鉄から少し歩きますが、周りにレストランやショップがあるので、気になりません。部屋はバスタブがあって、のんびりできました。屋上のバーは、見晴らしが良く、楽しめました。サービスも良いタイミングでした。壁は少し薄いようで、周りの音が聞こえます。入口のドアが重いので、ドアマンがいないタイミングは辛いかもですね。

title: Wonderful stay!
text:
We finished off our trip to New York State with a night at the Kimpton Ink48 and I will admit to preferring it over the Intercontinental Times Square where we stayed a few days prior. The hotel is away from the hustle and bustle of Times Square but has very easy access to the Hudson River Park footpath. It overlooks the Intrepid Sea and Air museum. With a room on a high floor overlooking the river, you can have great views of the displayed aircraft.

Check in was very friendly and efficient. We booked a Hudson Suite. Although not cheap it was very spacious with a separate bedroom and living area. The latter had a sofa bed but the two are open plan - there is no divider between them. With floor to ceiling windows the view across the river is panoramic.

The suite also had a spacious bathroom with a separate shower and bathtub, and complimentary Atelier Bloem amenities. The hotel also has a great rooftop area with a bar. In the middle of summer this was packed with both residents and visitors. There are great views over the city from the top.

Another highlight is the hotel’s restaurant, PRINT. The food was exceptional and service friendly and attentive. The staff were also very knowledgeable. 

Although not the most central hotel on Manhattan, I loved the location. It was a lot calmer than areas around Times Square and I loved the access to the Hudson River Park footpath which you can follow pretty much all the way down to Battery Park; a walk I thoroughly enjoyed!

I would highly recommend the Kimpton Ink48 and will gladly return.

title: Long weekend in New York_January 2020
text: We recently visited New York in January 2020 for a 5 night stay and what an amazing trip it was.  We considered lots of hotels before booking the Ink48  in Hell's Kitchen area of Manhattan.  The hotel was in a great location if you want to be just on the outskirts on the hustle and bustle of Times Square, which is only a 20 minute walk away. The hotel is modern, clean and tidy.  The staff are great and the general manager was extremely helpful and accommodating with our anniversay weekend, providing a few treats in the room and allowing us a late check out.  We highly recommend the Ink48 hotel.

title: Very nice hotel
text: Clean and spacious rooms for a reasonable price. Great location.  Very nice and helpful staff. We left something in the room and they responded immediately to my inquiry and sent me the item right away. Cool bar on top of the hotel with gorgeous views on Manhattan.

title: Room huge, sleek, and new & a bargain too!
text: We were astounded by the size and quality of our massive and sleek, modern room — which featured sky-high ceilings and a sweeping city view — given the modest price we paid. The room was huge and decorated mostly in black and white with a cool, artsy vibe. Everything, from the furniture to the bedding, seemed pristine and new. The king-size bed was ultra-comfy too. PLUS we were allowed to bring along our dog, free of charge! The Hell’s Kitchen neighborhood was surprisingly lively late on a Sat. night. We will definitely stay here again... and again.

title: Hudson Suites are still very nice, but beware construction
text:
I've stayed a few times in a Hudson Suite at Ink48, albeit not since winter 2017.

Was excited to return in January 2020.  The Hudson Suites are as lovely as ever, with floor to ceiling windows and views of the Hudson, capacious closet space (a seeming rarity in New York, even with suites), a huge bathroom and an attractive layout.

However, if you are sensitive to noise, you might want to check on the status of construction as during my visit there was excavation going on between the hotel and the river, including on Saturdays.  The drilling jolted me awake at 7:00 a.m. each morning (particularly awful the first morning when I had arrived well after 2:00 a.m.) and the drilling started at 8:00 a.m. on Saturdays. Sunday was mercifully an off day for construction.

Other than the construction, the stay was fine. The hotel charges the same ridiculous "resort fee" that every other hotel in New York now charges, but at least at Ink48 I got something useful for the fee -- a $10 daily credit for room service or the hotel restaurant (albeit not for the mini-bar).  However, I just checked the hotel's website and I do not see anything about the food credit, so maybe they took that away, which would be a shame, because it does make you feel less resentful about the resort fee.

I do quite like staying in Hell's Kitchen, especially now that Hudson Yards is open, which is a few blocks south of the hotel.  I wasn't that impressed with Sullivan Street Bakery, which is down the street from the hotel, but some people like it.

title: Häftigt hotell
text: Vi bodde på detta flotta och trendiga hotell nära Times Square men också alldeles vid Hudson river. En supertrendig reception och mysig lounge. Rummen var fräscha, gymmet bra och standarden hög överlag.

title: Valentine's Weekend Getaway!
text: From the moment we arrived, we were treated by friendly and courteous staff. Our check-in was super quick and EJ was awesome during our entire stay making sure to always ask if we needed anything each time he saw us. We had a room on the 14th floor which had views of not only the city skyline but also the river as well. The room itself was clean, stylishly decorated and the bed was very comfortable. The hotel also has daily wine reception which we looked forward to each day after returning from exploring the city.

title: Tremendous experience staying at Ink 48!!
text: Top class facility with an amazing staff.  The gentleman at the Front Desk named EJ is a rockstar and did an amazing job welcoming us!  Also, the complimentary bicycles in the lobby for use around town is a very nice touch.

title: Fabulous Hotel near Hudson Yards
text: I’ve come to Ink48 3 times so far this year - I find the hotel to be incredibly clean and the staff delightful - always willing to please.  I typically book a junior suite as I my stays are usually 4+ nights and the room is huge - lots of living space and big bathrooms.  Highly recommend.  P.S try nearby Sullivan Street Bakery - their croissants are to die for!

title: Ink48 Rocks!
text:
Super chic and modern hotel! Most importantly clean, service and staff are super helpful and caring. Walking distance to literally everything! Food is amazing. 
Rooftop has great drinks too! 
Awesome stay!

title: Best Hotel on the West Side!
text: “Great hotel - Staff really in-tune with guests needs and really take the time to cater to all your needs.  I emailed the GM in advance for some special requests and he graciously replied within minutes!  Rooms are huge and well appointed.  Restaurant in lobby is fabulous as well - highly recommend!”

title: Disappointed.
text: Just staying for one night to visit family. Staff average and pushy in the downstairs bar when they wanted the check paid and tip. Asked a porter in the hallway for some extra water. Tipped him $10.00 and received nothing. One of the most embarrassing must be holes in the bedsheets. Never saw that before.

title: Kimpton Ink 48
text: I am a ihg gold member so expect more from Kimpton than what i received staying at this hotel recently. Check in: the 2 guys at the desk were so nonchalant I had to ask them could i check in. Most helpful person was the door man to get us checked in. Next, requested an upgrade before arriving.  Nothing was mentioned about my request until I asked. was told by the guy at the desk 'guess you did not get it". Finally was placed in a higher floor room, 14th floor which i normally request to get a view of the city.  what i was not warned about was a club on the 17th floor on saturday nights where the music was thumping at 2am in the morning rattling our room. was not warned about this at check in and given an opportunity to get another room. Night manager was not very helpful; was asked why we were not warned about this at check-in she indicated things were in "transition" as this wioll not be a kimpton property much longer thus the slip in not telling us about the nightclub noise. weak excuse. To their credit we were comped the Saturday stay, and was told we would get additional ihg points (not received yet). Just think we should have been warned at check in about the nightclub when we arrived and given the opportunity for a different room especially as an ihg member.  Will not be back when we come to nyc in a few weeks.

title: Nice hotel , poor service orientation of staff
text:
Nice hotel, modern rooms but incredible construction noise. Staff neither imterested nor helpful, except for breakfast crew.
Windows are not soundproof at all, does not honor privileges for lhg unless booled directly. 
Housekeepimg did not clean room on a Saturday.

title: Disappointing
text: We arrived on a Sunday around 2:50 pm (check in was at 3pm). We were hoping to drop our bag in our room because we had a 3:30 appointment in Times Square. We were told that our room wasn’t ready yet and instead of being offered an upgrade, we were offered a downgrade (with no price reduction except for a waived “activity fee”). For obvious reasons we chose too wait for our room since we had paid extra for a “city view”. When our room was finally ready, we were disappointed to find that the city view that we had paid for was a view of a construction zone. Not only that, but we were now paying full activity fee and the rooftop bar was closed for a private party. The room itself was comfortable and clean. The bed was great. But I will note that with construction comes loud noise... starting at 6am. So overall, if given the chance to redo our stay, I would have chosen a different hotel.

title: Stylish Hotel near Hells Kitchen NY
text: Stayed here for a business meeting, good location with easy walks to Hells Kitchen and Time Square. Comfortable and stylish but construction work on 2 sides means some external noise early in the morning. Great rooftop bar with excellent views, however one of our party had a much larger credit card charge than he signed for which was rather alarming while the restaurant team were looking into why this happened, it’s not what you want to hear!!

title: Lovely Hotel
text:
This hotel is located in hells kitchen 
We love walking and found location very good 5 to 10 min walk in the highline 15 to 20 to time square. Hotel has a beautiful roof top terrace .Rooms are spacious modern and very comfortable. Staff is amazing. Restaurant makes great Espresso coffees 
Only negative is the staff at the roof top terrace ..Service is a bit sketchy it's like they are making you a favor by serving you. I M guessing its outsourced for 2 reasons .1 the service does not match the rest of the hotel and 2 I wasn't able to charge tour drinks to our room account.  Nevertheless worth going to see the view up there

title: Amazing hotel
text: I thought this review would be helpful for anyone looking to stay at the Kimpton ink48. I picked the hotel because when I booked the reviews were great in July. After booking the reviews kept stating all these difficult faults about the staff, windows,nightclub, noise etc. But when we got here we were greeted by the lovely reception team and even though our room wasn’t quite ready, we just sat in the nice bar and had a cup for tea and patiently waited. We went back to the reception an hour later to be told as it was my partners 30th we had been upgraded to a city view room with a large bath and walk in shower, we were not disappointed. The room was extremely clean and spacious and the beds beyond comfortable. We were on the 15th floor and heard a little noise in the morning from the builders across the road, but nothing drastic and at night some horns from the cars but we are in NYC after all. Overall the hotel and staff were fantastic and I would certainly recommend. I would suggest like we did and ask for a high floor in the quietest part of the hotel 😌

title: オシャレホテル
text: 空間がとても広くつくってあって快適でした。屋上のルーフトップバーからビル群の夜景がキレイです。ホテル入口の扉が重いのと、地下鉄から少し遠いのが難点。

title: good hotel
text:
the hotel is located near time square on the pier, staff service is standard.
Rooms are still good as they were renovated not so long time ago, well equipped (clean iron, board, toiletries...) you can enjoy a good view if selecting such room category.
the rooftop bar can be

title: Too far from public transportation. Not for people who can't walk distances and don't want taxis be their prime expense
text:
The hotel is new and looks great.
There are a few things with it. We stayed 3 nights. At the end of the second day we asked the receptionist if this was hotel without room cleaning. We had garbage piling up and no one came to clean the room. We were told it will be fixed immediately. The next day we had to request again....
The hotel is pricey. I think that with the same price or minus you can find something closer to center. Maybe down town. If walking is an issue, do not choose this hotel. You will need to relay on taxis with fares only going up with tips and such.

title: Excellent stay, handy location.
text:
We stayed at this hotel over the Christmas period. Not only were the staff super friendly and helpful, the accomodation itself was great. What we found handy was the location, whilst it was tricky to jump on the subway; it was a short walk to Times Square, Central Park, Chelsea and Hudson Yards. 
We had an excellent stay here and would definitely come back.

title: I felt the employee at check out was dishonest about "facility fees"
text: Check in went smoothly. I asked for a quieter room and was told they would do their best, but that is would be difficult because of the location of the hotel. The room was reasonably quiet at night, but soundproofing between rooms sucks and it didn't help that the maid service slammed room doors as they were entering and leaving them.  During the daytime, noise was particularly loud—either from construction or a nearby lumber yard.  The room was modern and well-designed.  I had a view facing south and east. I could see the Intrepid.  My main concern happened at checkout.  I was informed of a “facility fee”.   I believe this was $30 per day, plus taxes.  I pointed out that this was not mentioned in my Priceline booking (such bookings put this amount as “payable at hotel” and that if I had known about the fee I would have taken it into account in my choice of hotel).  When I showed the desk employee my Priceline bill (which did not mention that any additional fees were payable at the hotel), the employee said that every hotel in NYC and nationwide has such fees.  I pointed out that this statement was not true and that I was aware of that as I travel a lot.  I also pointed out that I wouldn't have booked the hotel if I knew it had a facility fee and that it was unfair of the hotel to only inform me of this after my stay.  The employee then removed the amount from my bill.  I am extremely unhappy with this interaction. I should not be deceived by hotels about the fees payable and for the employee to indicate that such fees occurred in all hotels is a blatant lie that attempts to normalize this deceptive conduct by his own hotel.

title: Spacious room and stunning rooftop with small hiccups
text: This hotel is a newer hotel with a stunning rooftop view. The room is spacious. However, there were little hiccups during my stay. This is the only hotel who requested they speak to my dad because I booked under his membership. There's no coffee machine in the rooms, so the place to get water is the gym. This particular location and time of my stay rendered this particular spot noisy with construction, and I'm quite tolerating with noises.

title: Too loud to sleep
text: Nice hotel but does not deliver a place to sleep - very loud cars, trucks and construction all through the night.  Just be careful.  Managment very unhelpful; difficult to get anyone’s attention.  Too much $$$ for that kind of service.

title: Lovely hotel
text:
We stayed here from the 8-12th December for a Christmas break. We stayed in room 1214. Although facing the nightclub and the construction, we didn't hear any noise (and i am a light sleeper). The hotel is modern and the rooms are a very generous size. The bathroom was large with a lovely walk in shower. We found the staff to be very friendly, including the cleaners, doorman etc... 

The hotel is around a 10 minute walk to times square, it was a little out the way but we didn't feel we had to travel far to get to many places. The hotel is also located conveniently out of the traffic, so was quick travelling to most places. We didn't struggle much to hail down a taxi either. 

The only downside i thought was that even tho it was the Christmas period, there wasn't much festive spirit (not even a christmas tree) in the hotel, it would have been nice to have felt abit more Christmassy. 

We didn't try the rooftop bar as we was so bust but the one night we was going to, it was closed til 12am so i wouldn't really count on this if this is what you choose the hotel for. 

Price of the minibar is extortionate and room service, i would just avoid these all together. There is a small mini market across the road to get supplies from. 

I would recommend.

title: Disappointed
text: Not the first time in NY but the first time in this hotel. Unimpressed from the start. Yes the building work and noise is annoying but they can’t be held accountable for that. However, they can be accountable for their service provision. The lobby in the morning caters for hot drinks but when I asked the lady at reception if I could just have a water she told me they didn’t serve water until 9am but I could buy a bottle from my mini bar. Her attitude made me feel so very unwelcome. I have never stayed in a hotel anywhere on my travels where water has been denied to you. If they can’t get the basics right then this really is not a hotel I would recommend to anyone

title: ABSOLUTE JOKE... DO NOT BOOK... WEBSITE IS NOt 100% TRUE OM FACTS!!!!
text:
This hotel prides itself on its rooftop views, but out of the 5 nights we were here, we were only allowed to use the rooftop on the 1 night, as they had private events.

There is construction to the front of the hotel and a Mexican bar at the side of the hotel, which stays open very late with very loud music which you can hear up on the 14th floor and will kepp you awake until 4am!

Free wine for an hour in the evening is about the only perk... Don't waste your money. You can definley get better value closer to times square.

title: Loud Loud Loud
text: Beautiful hotel with nice people managing it but the loud music from a club next door till 4 am and the street noise will prevent us from ever going back. We were on the 7th floor so we were shocked that the noise was so loud. We wanted to leave in the middle of the night but had to wait to pick someone up in the morning so we only slept and hour or two. What a shame because it’s near my daughter’s apartment and would have been perfect for future visits.

title: Perdersi nei dettagli
text: Ottima posizione, perche’ vicino a tutto con una piccola passeggiata, ma lontano dal caos. Abbiamo alloggiato nella suite Hudson 14^ piano, quindi la camera era ovviamente grande, ma i dettagli, anche se piccoli, fanno la differenza. Abbiamo chiesto di avere una macchina per il caffe’, che ci hanno fornito, con una sola tazza (eravamo in due), ma regolarmente abbiamo dovuto richiedere le capsule.... Prodotti per il bagno insufficienti per due persone e anche in questo caso, abbiamo dovuto chiedere.... Il personale in reception, piuttosto sostenuto e poco propenso a soddisfare le richieste del cliente. Abbiamo chiesto di telefonare per prenotare un ristorante, che risultava pieno con la prenotazione on line: abbiamo dovuto insistere e abbiamo cenato nel ristorante voluto. Siamo gia’ stati a NYC, alloggiando in altri hotel, questo e’ in fondo alla nostra lista.

title: Hells kitchen
text:
Me my 2 daughters and a family friend stayed her on a short trip. The hotel was quite nice for saying where located. it was clean and staff very friendly,and the doorman are lovely and couldn't do enough to help if asked. The room on the 5th floor was a great room, 2 x queen beds lovely walk in shower bathroom. Big wall mounted TV, but no tea or coffee making facilities(but apparently its not a thing in Hotels in NYC!!!, But great mini bar if wanted to use.
we didn't get a great view  as on the side street with the club opposite which at kicking out time is very noisy, cars people shouting And the NOISE oh my god. not only is there noise from the local UPS truck loading warehouse, there is the normal traffic, with the horns every 2 mins. 

The double glazing is shocking didn't keep any noise or draft out.  with no central heating as such, there is a heating vent which you have to turn heating on until gets hot, and is quiet noisy.  

iI was an issue but we tried to cope  and didn't complain to move (was told it was full anyway)as didn't want to spoil the trip.

In the mornings they do provide Coffee and tea but you have to get dressed and go down to the lobby  help yourself and take back up to the room and only available for a few hrs and not  very hot when poured.  
Free water always available.

he plus side, there is a lovely bar and restaurant which reasonably priced, and the roof top bar, which the views are amazing.

There are plenty places around to eat or drink if choose to go eat out.

title: Feels like coming home!
text:
I have visited the Kimpton Ink many times over the last year due to my brothers illness. Everyone at the hotel is so kind and accommodating!  I especially love the nightly wine hour and meeting the different staff every evening. 
The location is perfect being within walking distance to the Hudson River & Times Square. 
The rooftop bar has the best view!

title: When is a City View not a City View - When you book one below 11th floor at this hotel!
text:
Booked a city view room, direct with hotel so no excuse of miscommunication from booking agent/company. Picture of our lovely city view provided with my review and not what we expected for $434/night for 5 nights... This hotel shouldn't be allowed to advertise city view for anything below the 11th floor otherwise you are paying for a view of a building site. When we highlighted to reception, the guy got extremely flustered(we kept pointing out we knew it wasn't his fault and we were staying calm whilst trying to get our point across). Initially offered 15,000 points with IHG then said all he could discount was $100 and it wasn't his fault they were building across the road. Next morning i tried with reception again as felt he hadn't provided the normally excellent US customer service we've got used to when visiting the USA each time and was in fact quite rude to my wife. The girl this time just kept pointing out the building opposite had gone up quick and they couldn't adjust their website to highlight no city view as that takes too long to do... i then asked for the manager, unfortunately not Nick as highlighted on other reviews but someone called Gwuyen(sp?) who also didn't really seem bothered also and said it wasn't his fault and again company can't adjust things for months. He didn't reply when i questioned why they didn't even email me to say view was restricted from what was being advertised and he just shrugged his shoulders. He claimed floors below (up to 6th) are a little cheaper due to lack of view and offered another $50 but that's all he can do. Place was busy so i guess they can afford to not be bothered. Not once was the word sorry used to accept our disappointment. It was as though it was our fault for even complaining. Definitely a case of mis-selling & advertising something that isn't going to be delivered! 
Not normally a ranter but if booking with this hotel and expecting a view then demand to be as high as possible or the only view you will get is of workmen from 6.30am! 
Being positive, the room was nice and kept clean through our stay.
As with others the heating was like an industrial air blower so couldn't have on at night.

title: Great customer service
text:
We are a family of 4 visiting during holiday season. The hotel is clean, comfortable and located in Hells Kitchen, just a 10 minute walk to Times Square and loads of food choices close by in restaurant row. 
We did have some noise issues from a neighbouring property (not the hotels fault and clearly doing their best to tackle this) but when we brought this up with Nick, the GM, he was super responsive and couldn’t do enough to ensure we were not bothered for the rest of the stay. Customer service counts for everything, thank you Nick for brilliant and genuine great service.

The beds are super comfortable, the rooms are spacious and the property is kept very clean. Would 100% stay here again in a heartbeat.

title: Construction, night club, screaming at 3 am
text: We stayed here because we had no choice. Business trip.  The hotel is on 11th ave (Hell’s Kitchen) and in a very industrial part of the city. Construction right in front of the hotel. Not the best area. The other issue is the nightclub. You are basically getting hit with noise during the day or at night depending on what side of the hotel you are on. The only “quiet” room they had was next to the elevator. Gee, last time I checked elevator rooms are noisy too. We had 8 screaming adults partying in the room next to us to top it all off. Not millennials. Adults. We had to call security. The location alone would keep me from staying here again. But the other issues made the whole stay miserable.

title: $300 a night room with no heating in December
text: I quite like this hotel. The room is spacious, bed comfortable, people nice. The problem is the heating; in that it is really noisy (on cool or heat) - not a soothing white noise hum, this is intrusive booming annoyance  (whether on low, med or high) and worse for us, room 1517 at $300 a night, it delivered all that noise but no heat at all, which isn’t ideal in December. Maintenance guy visited, was very nice and did his best, which unfortunately was to confirm broken and supply an old fan heater and a promise to try and fix the problem with a new part. Given it was now 11.30pm the idea of major surgery on the heating system in our room while my wife was in bed didn’t feel like the experience we were hoping for.

title: Outstanding few outstanding location outstanding style
text: I had a business meeting in Hudson yards which is a very close location and also multiple events around the Times Square area and Broadway. Location was ideal. Also the views from the top of our outstanding, the staff were very late I’ll be confident. There were no problems with the room checking in or checking out. Highly recommend it.

title: Underwhelmed and wouldn’t recommend
text: Visited here this past weekend.  The hotel is pretty and clean.  But, the service was sub mediocre at best.  Our room was not cleaned once over a two night stay.  We could not sleep on Saturday evening because the club across the street was playing crazy loud music all night.  When I called (waiting until 2a), I was told there was nothing they can do and the music should stop by 5a.  5a!!!  Add to that when I tried to leave the next morning, I called for my car.  20 mins later when I came downstairs and checked out, the woman at the desk said she didn’t take the call - must have been a colleague.  I asked to check on status and she noted that the request had not been put in the system.  Ugh!  Pretty hotel but can’t recommend based on service and no attempt at service recovery at any point in the stay.

title: Off the beaten path
text: Really nice sized rooms for New York City. Off the beaten path gives you a big bang for your buck here. Bigger rooms with nice big windows, good service, and really not far from Times Square or Theaters.

title: Lovely hotel
text: We had this trip booked for over 12 months and upon reading the most recent reviews I was really concerned with the noise. My husband emailed the hotel manager with the concerns and we got a prompt response was was placed onto a higher floor. This put my mind at rest. We got to the hotel and was greeted by Penelope who was lovely and answered all our queries and greeted me a happy birthday. We got to our room to find champagne, chocolates and fresh fruit. The view was amazing from the 11th floor. My husband was woke up with noise from a club but I slept through it, this was only on the Saturday night. I’ve stayed on park avenue before and there was plenty of noise to be heard, I think wherever you stay in NYC you are going the hear traffic, beeping horns etc. We had a beautiful room. We didn’t eat at the hotel but had a drink on the roof top bar. It’s pricey but so are all the bars in NYC. Couldn’t have asked for better service. I liked being away from the centre and there are loads of restaurants and bars on 8/9&10 avenue. We had an amazing view but there is a building going up in front of the hotel and if this goes any higher then that view will be spoilt. I didn’t hear anyone in any other rooms

title: Nice long weekend a bit of the rush
text:
We where for a long weekend and booked based on price and review. The hotel was great and rooms where good. There is roof bar that is very nice in the evening. Could not charge the room though. View great and also from the room.

Service was friendly and personal. If you want be the abaoult midel of things maybe a bit off. We prefered to have a more peaceful area and walk to time sq. We will come back

title: Great Hotel but really bad experience with noise
text: Great hotel, clean, nice staff, good amenities.  BUT.......I was booked on the 48 street side of the hotel.  Finished up watching an in the theater movie(Tarantinos new one) and fell asleep at 10:00.  At 10:30 was woken up to some serious latin flavored BASS.  I looked out the window and realized that the Rooftop Cantina had started La Fiesta De La Noche.  The noise was unbelievable.  I called the desk and asked "I can't be the first one to complain about this"  They said "Nope.  You are not the first and you are not going to be the last".  So why the heck do they not correct this issue??!! I mean this a hotel right?  you are supposed to SLEEP there?  Anyway two hours and a room change to the other side of the hotel later I was able to resume sleeping.  This was a major turnoff to an otherwise great property.  Its a shame and kind of a head scratcher.  This is a major issue that needs to be fixed.

title: Weekend getaway
text: This is a beautiful hotel with well appointed rooms. Location was perfect to walk to Time Square, get to the Highline, or walk the Hudson down to Soho. Nice bonus to have turn down service too.  The roof top bar view was incredible. We would definitely stay here again.

title: Avoid
text:
At the hotel now.  Walls are extremely thin.  Crying baby next door seemed like it was in our room.  Street noise very loud.  Major construction just across the street.  Bright lights all night, even with shades.  Early morning construction noise.
Just came downstairs to have a nice breakfast and was told the restaurant is no longer operating for breakfast.  Was here just over a year ago and it’s a great space, and had a relaxing breakfast.  Now you have to stand in line and wait to order at the counter, from an extremely limited menu.  Then the only seating is in a cramped, dark “lounge” area.  Very disappointing.  At the very least open your restaurant for breakfast.

title: Looks great People that work there very nice
text: The place is very clean very comfortable but not my taste. Bathroom has showers no tub glass doors for bathroom even though you can't see in you could see image. No coffee in room, refridge is full of their drinks for you to buy, so no fridge or microwave. Beds are comfortable but very noisy outside and you can hear it inside. You can get other places to stay for better prices that are just as good or better close by.

title: Very noisy due to building work opposite. Avoid a lower floor room.
text:
Be very careful if you are looking at this hotel during November and December. Stayed here for 4 nights recently and ended up with a second floor room, the noise from the building site opposite was horrendous, they stated hammering steel work at 5am. We could even hear people talking on the street below. 
The hotel was nice enough but everything was extra and over priced. 
The staff were quite abrupt and pretty unhelpful. 

 I know a lot of people come back to this hotel, but we won't be one of them.

title: Make sure you get a room on a high floor!
text:
Stayed here for three nights recently. Arrived late and very jet lagged on first night so didn’t fuss over room allocation. Given room on 2nd floor overlooking 11th Ave and the building site opposite. Noisy. Would have called reception but phone didn’t work. Would have emailed but WiFi took an age to activate. Following morning had to prepay $25 for a cup of coffee and a bowl of cereal that took 20 minutes to arrive

Room was nice enough. Staff pleasant. 

Underwhelmed overall given $550 per night price tag

title: Torture
text: My recent stay at Ink48 was one of the most tortuous experiences I have ever had in a hotel. Be warned, there is a Cantina/drag queen club across the street that starts playing loud music around midnight and does not stop until around 4 am, at which time the crowd spills out onto the street and screams for another 30 minutes. Despite the prior responses from the hotel’s manager on TA, my stay was NOT on a Saturday night! The walls are paper thin, the windows are single pane, and there was clearly an installation error made when the windows were put in. We heard everything on blast including people talking in the hallway, toilets flushing, doors closing, traffic, and the music from the club. I took a video and you can clearly hear the music thumping and someone on a microphone declaring a "winner" loudly at 2:30 am. There was no information provided at check-in to indicate that noise might be an issue despite numerous complaints on this board. In fact, the hotel touts itself as being located in a quiet part of town (one of the reasons I chose the location), which is false advertising. I stayed at another hotel in Times Square several months ago, didn’t hear a thing in my room, and had no problem at all sleeping. This was my first and last time staying here!!!

title: Knocked it out of the Park!!!
text: Great stay, wonderful hotel staff and the view from our room of Manhattan was incredible(1401).  The staff brought anything we ask for to our room within minutes.  I would definitely stay here again and again and again.

title: Amenity fee: a hateful  deception
text:
This hotel is ok, perhaps a bit bland, especially in comparison to the earlier  Kimptons (DC, Marlowe) , which had more flair.

However, I am really pissed off by the amenity fee they charged.  There is no reason for that, they offer the basics. As a rule, I don’t do business with people who use deceptive practices. Kimpton, never again.

title: Hip Boutique Hotel
text: Stayed here with my wife this past weekend and had a blast.  I got upgraded to a large King room with a private terrace - which was pretty awesome!  I found the hotel to be very clean and staff to be extremely hospitable.  Also - I read other reviews about noise and didn’t find that to be an issue at all.  I mean it’s New York City so street traffic and cars zooming by in the night is pretty normal.  Also - check out Hudson River Park if you are a jogger - it’s 1 block from the hotel and is a pretty cool area to get in a morning run!

title: This hotel needs attention
text:
I was disappointed by my recent stay at Ink 48. I have stayed at this property a couple times in the past few years and feel that the level of care of the property and the level of service has really gone down. While we were sitting in the lobby a guy came in from the street and sat down, he clearly looked high and out of place...he was a bit disheveled and was nodding off while a couple other guests around looked uncomfortable and commented on the situation. Neither the front desk or the doorman took note. This was disturbing. The hotel interior is looking tired. 
 We saw empty wine glasses that were left behind in the lobby long after the wine reception ended. Also, feel that the security is not being kept up to par. Elevator use does not require key log in to get to your floor so anyone can roam about the hotel. This is not in line with other NYC hotels at this level. I will not be staying at this property again any time soon.

title: Should’ve just stayed home
text:
Booked a one night stay at this hotel due to the location, the ratings, and for a mini staycation for my girlfriend. So many missed marks at this hotel, that if it wasn’t for the heavy traffic and the hour it took us to find parking, we would’ve just turned around and went home. Hotel front desk was consistently rude and dismissive. Upon check-in, the front desk agent did not greet us or look up once the entire time until he took my ID and credit card and fed it into the chip reader. Not until I had asked him what exactly what he was charging me for, that he finally looked up and ran through a spiel about a safety deposit and fee for hotel facilities which included WiFi, $10 credit for in room dining and on site restaurant, and printing up to a certain amount of pages. He went on quickly about getting to their rooftop bar and the hours of their bar and restaurant, without even stopping to take a breath. We could barely get a question in. We requested a higher floor and paid for a studio with a view but was given one on the 9th floor. The room was nice and clean with a decent view, despite the dirty windows and construction across the street which woke us up bright and early. They had an in-room minibar complete with drinks and snacks. I took a bag of gummy bears which totaled up to 9$, which I figured could be handled with the dining credit. Spoiler; it does not. No water or ice machines on the floor, so you’re better off buying it from the convenience stores on the corner. The morning after, we realized we forgot toothbrushes. Made a call to front desk, and didn’t get them until 20mins later. Causing us to almost miss check-out time. When we finally made it to front desk, the first agent I approached only responded with a no eye-contact (seems to be an ongoing theme here) and brisk, “I’m setting up.” The desk agent at the end of the front desk called over and said I can assist you. Asked me for our room number even though I had already passed her the room key. She quickly printed out and handed me a receipt, without any explanations of the charges or any question of the quality of our stay. I was honestly so fed up and did not have the energy to argue. At this point I just wanted to get the hell out of Dodge.

It was this weekend that I proposed to my fiancé, and the whole hotel experience left a horrible stain on our entire weekend. If this was just a regular inn, I would have expected this level of service, but since we were paying 300$+ for one night I was expecting quite a bit more. Honestly, your money would be much better off spent at a more professional establishment, like a McDonalds drive-thru for instance.

title: One of the worst nights ever
text: If you actively hate sleep, then this is the perfect place for you. If, however, you book a hotel in the reasonable expectation of getting a few hours shut-eye please RUN AWAY now and book ANYWHERE else. We booked in for three nights over a weekend in October. On the first night, a rooftop nightclub opposite started pumping out loud, thumping music at about 11pm. It was so loud it woke me up. I then put in earplugs and wore noise cancelling headphones over the earplugs and I could still hear it. The hotel rooms are not double-glazed and there is no sound-proofing whatsoever. I called reception to be told there was no way they could move us to a different room as they were fully booked and was casually informed that the nightclub would be playing their music until 4am. So clearly, the hotel knows this is an issue and has done for some time. Sure enough, the music continued at a decibel-shattering level until 4am, making sleep impossible. Then there was the added noise of people leaving - shouts and car horns and engines - for another hour. I can honestly say it was the worst night I have ever spent in any hotel. This is the first trip advisor review I’ve ever written but I have to do it to tell you PLEASE do not book this place. Also the bed linen and towels didn’t feel clean - in fact they smelled not of laundry detergent but of burned fabric. We are checking out today, cancelling our next two nights, and moving elsewhere to avoid our trip being ruined. Shockingly bad.

title: Great Kimpton Hotel!
text: Spent the weekend at this Hotel, really had a good time. It is on the west side of Manhattan and much quieter then staying in Time's Square.  Also my wife and I went to Hudson Yards which is only a 15 minute walk from the Hotel.  We had dinner at a really cool restaurant called Wild Ink, which I recommend.  All in all a great visit and I will definitely return.

title: Superb Hotel on Manhattan’s Westside!
text: Stayed here for 3 nights on business.  Like previous reviewers have mentioned - the rooms are huge based on NYC standards.  Much larger then the previous hotel in midtown I used to stay at.  Clean well-maintained hotel with all the modern amenities - super friendly staff that seem to truly care about you and great restaurant/roof-top lounge for after work cocktails.  I love the Kimpton brand and this was a home run visit!  Highly Recommend!

title: Never Again
text:
My wife, friends, and I stayed at the Kimpton Ink48 on a Saturday night in early September, the night before our cruise. Great location as it's just a couple blocks from the cruise terminal. Our 9th floor room was directly across the street from some rooftop cantina nightclub. The noise from the DJ was overwhelming, with house music shaking the walls of our hotel rooms all night and morning. They say this is the city that doesn't sleep, but I wanted to. This nonsense went on until 3:30 a.m., at which time all of the drunk, coked up cantina patrons decided to beep their car horns in the street below and make a lot of other noise. 

The Kimpton's rooftop bar area was an awesome space with incredible views. Unfortunately, it wasn't designed for hotel patrons but more geared towards younger affluent nightclubers who didn't mind paying $15 for a domestic beer. 

As for the staff, the receptionist I spoke to about the noise couldn't care less. Understand she couldn't do much but show some empathy, and maybe throw in a breakfast for our troubles. The website I used to book the hotel was a trusted one as I used it in the past. The hotel is pricey but for what the website claimed was a 4.5 star hotel, I didn't mind. This was a three star hotel, nothing more, at best. Rooms were clean and some of the staff, particularly one of the doormen/security gentlemen, were friendly and helpful. 

The inability to get ANY sleep is enough to ensure that I'll never spend time at this hotel again.

title: Excellent boutique hotel
text:
I have just spent five days on business in Manhattan.

I booked the hotel as part of a package offered by Virgin Atlantic.

When visiting New York, I’ve always tended to stay in the bigger / chain hotels round Time Square, most of which look as if they were last decorated in the 1960’s and have staff who are hard-bitten and lack any real warmth.

The Kimpton Ink48 was a refreshing change.

On arrival – even late on a Sunday evening the staff are genuinely pleased to see you and you can feel the warmth of the welcome.

The hotel is very stylishly decorated and has a modern and trendy feel.
I had a King room and it had plenty of space and was very well furnished and spotlessly clean.

I certainly would return but it seems more suited to the leisure rather than business.
There isn’t a desk in the room and although they brought me an upright chair it was difficult to work, especially as the lights are not configured to the glass table.

If you like your coffee in the morning – make sure you ask for a coffee machine to be delivered to your room, otherwise you have to go downstairs for guest free coffee between 6.30 and 9AM.

Also note, and I can understand the reasons why, they have signs on tables in the bar – no use of laptops over 30 minutes.

I’m probably a seasoned traveler and it says a lot that I was prepared to put up with these points as the overall ambience, furnishing and staff attitude is top-drawer.

A hotel that I’d like to return to one day.

title: Too Notch Hotel
text: Read the other reviews and they are all spot on!  Impeccably clean rooms, really attentive staff and awesome restaurant.   I booked a Hudson Suite and it was very spacious and had a massive bathroom with a soaking tub!  Also - I noticed several of the hotel's management team in the lobby throughout my stay interacting with guests which was nice to see.   This place is such a hidden gem on the west side of Manhattan!

title: ロビーのレモン水&キュウリ水が美味しい1/4
text: ロビーはゆったりソファ配置で落ち着く空間でした。トイレは洗練された雰囲気の男女兼用４つあり。一つは車椅子対応。

title: Great Location
text:
We had a view of the river which allowed us to catch our cruise ship arriving.  

The hotel location is great for circle line, Intrepid, cruise ship and arriving by ferry from Weehawken NJ.

The room we had was a corner with separate living room/sofa bed for our daugther.   

The rooftop bar looks amazing...but over 21...so we only had a brief visit.

One annoying thing is that the help staff used the same elevators.  So we were fighting for space with them 6 out of 8 trips.  Just not a normal thing in a better hotel.

Also, free coffee and tea....but you cant take it in the hotel breakfast spot....sort of petty.

Overall if i ignore the price....would stay again!

title: Great boutique hotel
text:
Large high ceiling rooms very comfortable and well equipped. Staff couldn’t be more helpful they were able to print an e ticket for me no fuss no charge. Able to advise on local knowledge etc nothing was too much trouble, we were made to feel extremely welcome.
Small restaurant is excellent particularly breakfast and free tea and coffee available in the morning if you’re in a hurry.
It is a little on the noisy side but .... you’re in midtown Manhattan- what do you expect??
It’s staff that make a hotel successful or otherwise and they have it right here!
Overall I would strongly recommend a stay here you will not be disappointed

title: A bit noisy!
text: We had a lovely room at the Kimpton for one night pre-cruise. However, we were on the 'club' side of the hotel and were awake until the club closed at maybe 3am?? It was really noisy. It was the total NYC experience though!! Loved the restaurant and the breakfast cafe.

title: Spacious rooms, nice views
text: Very nice hotel. They give you drink coupons upon your arrival for use in their bar. There’s a rooftop deck that has fantastic views. Staff is very nice and friendly. Close to Hudson Yards. They have bicycles available for guest use.

title: New and Fresh
text: Ahh. New smell in NYC is hard to get. Try this west side hotel in the Kimpton group and relax in modern comfort. Close to Broadway and the High Line but far enough out of the mania of Times Square. The rooms are of decent size and nicely appointed.

title: Fabulous Hotel
text: This really is a fabulous hotel.  Their rooms are huge compared to the boutique hotels I used to stay at in times square.  Big bathrooms and super comfortable beds.  They also have a very nice farm to table restaurant in the lobby and all the staff I encountered seemed to really enjoy their jobs and were incredibly pleasant to interact with.  Highly Recommend.

title: My anniversary
text: It  Was a great trip and the staff and GM were amazing they treated us like family End of the Room and facilities were top notch one of the best trips I have ever taken because the hotel was fantastic  Will stay at this hotel on our next trip to New York

title: So disappointing!!!!!
text: We came to New York for my birthday. I even told the front desk staff that it was my birthday the following day. They could not care! The man at the front desk did not even acknowledge it. When we checked our I told the front desk how disappointed I was that they did not try to make our stay special at all and didn’t even receive an apology! Never staying here again and will discourage others too.

title: It's My Birthday!!!!
text: I must say after trying to make plans for my bday I decided to go to NYC. Let me tell you Ink48 staff was exceptional and definitely exceeding my expectations. They were very friendly and very accommodating to my needs.They also put a special bday amenity in my room which was amazing. I will definitely stay here everytime I visit NY.

title: ROOM !!!!
text:
What a room big spacious and great view hotel is lovely 10 min walk to times square one downside bar really expensive but other than that brilliant would stay here again.
Did not here any noise from construction site across road

title: Absolutely AMAZING!!!
text: I come to New York City for work meetings and this is the only hotel I stay at! Absolutely AMAZING!! The staff is attentive and very friendly! I highly recommend and always look forward to coming back to this hotel!

title: Out-of-the-way but I like it, for the most part
text:
This was our second visit to this hotel, but the first visit was around four years ago so it has been some time.  This Kimpton is waaaay on the west side of Manhattan, and for those readers not familiar with the island, know that there isn't an awful lot that is comfortably walkable from this location (other than Gotham West Market, the cruise terminal, or a bunch of car dealerships).  However, since it's so close to the Hudson River, you do get the benefit of some lovely views.  Nevertheless, quick cab rides will get you to all kinds of stuff.

We prefer boutique hotels these days, and this is a nice one.  The building is a former printing factory, and the newly renovated rooms are comfortably industrial chic.  You'll notice a number of nods to the building's history as well as to its location near the piers of the Hudson.  Now that Kimpton is part of IHG, my hubby's IHG Ambassador membership resulted in us getting a large, airy Junior Suite.  This meant that we had huge windows, a king bed, a vanity area, a sitting and dining area, and a bathroom that you could do cartwheels in.  There were lots of good things about this suite.  For example, the fridge wasn't one of those where when you move an item they charge you, so I was able to get some of our own bottles of water, sports drinks, etc. in there.  The bed was comfortable, the HVAC worked well, the lighting was nice, and the colors were calming (whites and tans with pops of navy and black).  

There were a few issues -- when we first arrived, inches from our room's door in the hallway was somebody's used wine glass with a napkin stuck in it.  Also, when we pulled back the sheets on the bed, the fitted sheet had some stains on it, even though it clearly had been laundered.  Of course we called down to the front desk and these things were rectified while we were out at dinner.    Details matter to me, though, and I would have expected these oversights not to have happened.  Speaking of details, while another thing I like about Kimptons and this place is that they have big glass containers of water with cucumbers, oranges, etc. in them so that you can sit in the lobby and have a little refreshing moment.  We went to do this and found that both of the urns had barely any water in them (we managed to squeak out two small glasses).  The front desk staff were maybe five feet away and we had to go and tell them about this.  The containers were clear glass and all it would take is a glance over there once in a while to make sure they are filled by someone.  To me, a hotel is truly excellent when amenities they offer are always available when they should be, without asking.  Again, it's the details.

The staff we encountered were pretty much all really nice to talk with.

While not the hotel's fault, fyi, when we were there we were woken up very early by some very loud construction jackhammers at a property adjacent to the hotel.  So if this is important to you and you are looking to book in the near future, you may want to inquire about the construction going on nearby.

The rooftop lounge and the restaurant lounge (both I reviewed separately) are worthwhile visits.

title: Shhhh. Don’t tell anyone about my fave.
text:
This hotel is my favorite in NYC and I choose to stay here everything I visit.  The service, the atmosphere, the rooms, and the location are all excellent.  It’s extremely consistent and I’ve been happy every single time I’ve stayed. Im a runner so I love the Hudson path to run on each morning.  It’s so close to Mid Town yet just off the beaten path on 11th to be much quieter and less congested.  
The one thing that I didn’t love this time was the expensive breakfast as everything is a la carte. The bill added up quick. 
With that said, I’m still rating five stars and will come back to stay at Ink48 again.

title: 快適♫
text:
旅行でこのホテルに3泊しました。
賑やかなタイムズスクエアからは離れているので、とても落ち着いて宿泊できました。
周りは、工事現場や車のディーラー、少し歩くと倉庫があったりと、夜は静かでNY慣れしてる方向きのホテルかと思いますが、少し歩くとレストランやコンビニがあり、あまり不自由はしなかったです。イントレピッド海上博物館は歩いてすぐです。部屋も広く、窓からの眺めも良かったです。レストランや屋上のループトップバーには今回時間がなく行けませんでしたが、次回滞在中はぜひ行ってみたいと思います。

title: Am Ende war es ein toller Urlaub !
text:
Mega Lage mitten in Manhattan. 
Daher alles sehr gut erreichbar was man sehen und unternehmen will.

Wir hatten ein Zimmer mit zwei Betten gebucht doch als wir ankamen hatten wir nur ein Doppelbett und nichtmal ein Sofa. Das Hotelpersonal gab uns dann ein Zimmer mit Ausziehsofa. Dieses war Anfangs ganz ok doch es lag direkt neben einer Diskothek und die ganze Nacht war ein Höllenlärm !

Am nächsten Morgen forderten wir ein anderes Zimmer und bekamen dann ein Upgrade in die Junior Suite die sehr zu empfehlen ist !

Die Rooftopbar ist wunderschön mit Kindern darf man sie aber leider nur Mittags besuchen. Oft waren aber auch externe Events auf der Bar und sie war ganz geschlossen. Deshalb kamen wir leider nicht dazu sie zu besuchen!

Hatten dann aber die Möglichkeit eine „private“ Führung mit dem Manager der Roof Top Bar (Orlando Carafa ) zu machen. Er ist mega nett !!!!

Die Lage war Top, mit den Fahrrädern des Hotels war man innerhalb von zehn Minuten überall.

Das Essen des Hotels haben wir nicht genutzt.

title: Amazing Hotel!!!
text: This hotel is amazing! What makes it amazing is the team of people that work there. The team at the front desk are the nicest people I have ever met. Always smiling and no task to small for them to go above and beyond. Mr. Ivezaj and his team always greeted me with a smile and made sure I knew where I was headed before I left the doorway! They gave me landmarks to look for and were so pleasant, always with a kind word and a smile when I returned. The hotel itself was fantastic, and I’ve stayed in enough to know, this one has the best staff I’ve ever met in my life and the hotel was so beautiful! The rooms were very clean, the bed was so comfortable, and the view is fantastic! Thanks for making my trip to the city one I won’t forget!! Amazing team! Great place!!!

title: Great Place
text: Family and I stayed here before a cruise.  We had a river view suite like room which was just fantastic.  Nick and crew hooked us up.  We had heard about the construction and Nick came through for sure.  We walked from the hotel to the cruise port which is just a block away.  Place is very nice and not too far a walk to the great food on 9th and 46th.  Really great options.  Just stayed another night in NYC and tried to stay here again yet booked.  Too bad.  Stay here for sure.

title: Absolutely Amazing
text: My friend and I stayed for two nights for a Broadway show and a concert. Of all NYC hotels I've stayed at, this room was the biggest and best. An amazing waterfall shower and huge soaker tub along with a great open room, separate vanity area, couch and table. You just don't get that with just any NYC hotel. We requested a mini fridge with no issues. Lastly the Kimpton amenities on top of that was the icing on the cake. Can't speak highly enough about it.

title: A wonderful Hotel with one exception
text:
My family spent three nights at this Hotel to celebrate my daughter's birthday.  Here are my lengthy, if not particularly brilliant, observations:
1.  The staff was unfailingly polite, from check-in to departure.  The front desk sent us a free bottle of champagne for the celebration, it quickly repaired a stubborn sliding door in the shower, and best of all, the Hotel gave us three adjoining rooms without question or the usual lame excuses.  
2.  The Hotel location, 11th Avenue between 48th and 49th Streets is excellent;  it is one block from the Hudson River Park and just minutes from the Intrepid Museum.  My daughter, now a savvy NYC dweller, however, felt it was not convenient to the subway system.  
3.  Our room was very nice: clean, reasonably spacious, and well appointed.
4.  The rooftop bar is simply incredible with wonderful views of the Hudson River and the New York skyline.  The service is excellent and the people-watching superb.  Please note that the bar is only accessible from the lobby, and you must show ID to the doorman.  (The bar is apparently a separate entity from the Hotel.)
5.  I rise early, and the coffee in the lobby is good and plentiful.  We also enjoyed the water in the lobby in the afternoons.  (I  greedily filled my bottle several times.)
6.  We had dinner in the Hotel restaurant on our final night.  The menu is a touch expensive and fancy for my pedestrian tastes, but we had a nice meal.  The host was very nice and pleasant.
7.  I have only one negative aspect to report.  Our rooms faced North and were directly across from a rooftop bar, the oddly named Cantina Cantina.  It closed on Friday and Saturday night at about 3:30 am.  At one time, I might have joined the young revelers as they headed into the night laughing and having fun, but now, as I approach my dotage, I find sleep more inviting than late night shenanigans.  The Hotel obviously cannot control its neighbors, but you should certainly request a room on a different side of the building.

title: Great room with awesome rooftop bar
text: Good location, clean rooms, clean shower , fast elevator, overall no problems at all.  It was close to the pier and lots to see nearby. would stay here again. The rooftop bar has the best views in the area..

title: Exquisite Stay
text:
Other than the street noise, my stay at the Kimpton Ink 48 was delightful. Great reception staff at arrival( 07/26 at around 3:40 p.m) and upon departing ( 07/27 around 10:25 a.m)
The room was well appointed , large and very comfortable. There was a very nice high-def television as well. The bed was nice and firm( a godsend to those who have bad backs). The lighting was fantastic and there were plenty of accessible outlets.I judge hotels based on their cleanliness ( especially the bathroom)and this was a 10 out of 10 hands down.  I would definitely return to this property again. Thanks to all for a great stay.

title: Perfect for a Dog Trip
text: We were there two nights...very pet friendly and lovely people. Excellent service. There's a dog park within walking distance. The room was comfortable and we got one with a Hudson River view. Excellent food at the cafe!

title: Going downhill
text:
I have always enjoyed staying at Kimpton hotels and Ink has been ago to for ease of travel to it and amenities given. It seems that the corporate structure is just going for $$$ in anyway it can, i.e. $96 for 3 drinks, a "nominal charge" for late checkout, complete mixup on the reservations, my room requests were not given, south side , upper floors , two rooms together, when I called the front desk 4 days in advance to see if rates had changed, (lowered), the individual laughed at me, I asked for a manager and was promptly hung up on. 
 Anyway, lots of other NYC hotels to choose from, unless they get their act together, spend your money wisely and elsewhere.

title: I was there for the terrible construction - still a great Kimpton hotel
text: I stayed three nights at the Ink48 this week. On the third night, they kindly moved me to a smaller room at the back of the hotel away from the loud construction. Of course, it is not their fault that a building is going in across the street. The jackhammers start at 7 AM...and on the first day, I was up at 6, so it was OK, but the second day I didn't have to be up early so it was a little frustrating. Kudos to the hotel for moving me during a busy time. The staff is very friendly and helpful, which is why I am a Kimpton fan. I find the staff at the Press restaurant to be a little less "Kimpton like" in that I don't think the customer service is at the same level of the Kimpton staff. The rooms are comfortable and this time I used the services of the spa, which I really liked and would go back to.

title: Excellent Hotel & Extremely Pet Friendly
text: I was extremely surprised by how big the rooms at this hotel were and the service. They are extremely pet friendly. I found the hotel to be very clean and the rooms as well.  I will definitely stay at this hotel again. I am def a fan on the Kimpton line now.

title: Would definitely return!
text: Let me start off by saying that I booked this hotel as a friend was staying here for the same event we were attending in the area. I was quite hesitant due to the reviews and I always read the Tripadvisor reviews. As the day came closer to our event and I continued to read the reviews, I was worried. I also know that some reviews come from people who are just never satisfied. With that being said... We were greeted at the entrance by Jose'. A true gentleman who answered many of my questions. Upon check-in I was informed that our room was not ready even though I had requested early check-in. Which I also know is never a guarantee. The young lady offered to text me when the room became available. Had not heard from her by 2:45 so we headed back from the Gotham Marketplace where we went for a bite to eat. Room became available as we were standing at counter waiting. I would also like to say that she (I neglected to get her name) was very pleasant. Our room the "Hudson Suite" was excellent.
