We did not have bathrobes (included in room). But after a phone call, the bathrobles arrived promptly. We were able to utilize both Print and the Press Lounge, I highly reccomend both of them! Be aware that the Press Lounge is often closed for private events, so check ahead of time. Upon check-out the following morning we were once again greeted by same young lady. She asked how our stay was. My reply, the property is lovely, room and staff were great all around. BUT...it is true, the noise that began early in the morning due to construction is HORRIBLE! Reviews and comments from management had stated that it was soon to be over. It is not near done so be aware of the noise. Other than that, fabulous property! And honestly, the hotel/management has no control over construction in the area. I look forward to returning in the future

title: Excellent hotel stay for our anniversary, and great customer service!
text:
This hotel is by far the nicest hotel stay we had in New York. It’s newly renovated, very clean and modern, yet charming. It has a boutique vibe and a personal touch you don’t get in the big hotels.

Truly happy we had chosen to stay at Kimpton Ink48 for our 1-year wedding annivarsary. Our flight got cancelled and we ended up getting there two days later than planned, but they changed our reservation and was very accommodating and serviceminded! They also surprised us a sparkling wine and strawberries. 

The room service food from Print restaurant was very good, and we feel that we have found a new retreat in New York. Far enough away from the main tourist drag, but close to all the restaurant in Hells Kitchen and an easy walk to Times Square. The location is also excellent if you arrive at Newark airport, and want an easy commute to the hotel.

title: 2 nights in July
text: We stayed 2 nights in July....Very clean hotel;  good coffee, tea and condiments choices in lobby; room was very quiet except for a little road noise late at night, compfortable beds/pillows, should have at least 1 sitting chair in guestrooms ....excellent rooftop sunset views ......hotel restaurant menu looked good and reasonable priced...but did not get opportunity to try it out this time...

title: Could have been better...POOR customer service
text:
This weekend I stayed at this property for my birthday trip to NY. I booked two rooms through Hotels Tonight. I can say that I had a nice stay and enjoyed the hotel. However, the interaction I had with one of the front desk agents made the stay not good at all and it made me very uncomfortable. The front desk agent named Moustafa was very rude to me and friends during our entire trip. 

From the time we checked in, he was very rude and unprofessional. I arrived to the hotel around 10:30-10:45, I was able to check into one of the rooms and had to wait for the other room to become available. I asked if I could have the room soon as it was ready. The young lady that originally checked me in said that she can do what she could, then the gentleman interjected saying that check is at 3, he continue to insert himself in the conversation I was having with the young lady. The room I was checked into was 1001. Moustafa told myself and my friend who was checking into the second room that the room we were going to get was 1002, we asked if we can rooms next to each other. While we waited for the second room, I was in my room 1001. I called down to check on the status of the second room at this time it was 1:30. I called down to ask the status of the room and asked for new pillows for the room. He proceeded to lie to me over the phone and argue with me about the room, We were told repeatedly that 1002 was our second room, he proceeds to tell me that is not my room and the room I was getting was 1007. At 3:00 I proceeded down stairs and he gave us the keys to the room 1007, and I requested that I have pillows, it was not done when I first asked for them.

He was very malicious, when it came to making us wait until 3pm to check into the rooms. As someone who works in this industry, this is very unacceptable and unprofessional.

My guest and myself felt very uncomfortable after this first encounter. 

When we checked out, we asked for our bags to be held. When we returned to collect our bags, we had asked another young lady if anyone turned in sunglasses, one of my friends left them in the lobby. When we asked about the glasses, before even attempting to look, he once again interjected and said there were not any here. His delivery was sooo rude, all we asked were there any glasses left behind and look. He then began to argue with us again saying he was there all day. 

Overall the stay could have been better, I just feel that me and my guest were discriminated against from the beginning. I spent my money here for my birthday to be treated and talked to so nasty by one of your staff members.

ALSO, at check out I was charged an additional $53.00 "service fee". I was not informed about this charge and it is not posted anywhere on the website. This needs to be posted on your website and needs to be mentioned to guest at check in, if this is a such thing. After having $200 held on my card and then charged an additional fee was just the icing on the cake. 

I usually do not write reviews but I was very upset about my experience.

title: Another great Kimpton property
text: For anyone who read my last review of the La Quinta Central Park, this is the hotel I booked after my wife refused to stay at that disgusting place. I needed guaranteed quality, so I chose Kimpton. Property and staff were amazing, as I anticipated. Only drawback was the construction site across the street (non-issue on weekends). But, it’s out of their control, so I can live with it. A little off the beaten path for NYC tourist activities, but a good value for the amenities. Pics are the view from out corner room. Lovely, indeed.

title: Overnight Stay in Manhattan
text: I traveled to New York City again for a quick 1-night stay in Manhattan on the west side in Hell's Kitchen. I was lucky enough to get a great price for Kimpton Ink48 Hotel. The room again was spotless and the bed was very comfortable. When I checked out I was able to have Kimpton Ink48 hold my luggage while I was at a meeting for a few hours. The hotel staff is always very friendly and courteous. I did not use the Valet Parking that Kimpton offered.  I used ICON parking just 2 blocks away. They also have very good coffee. Kimpton Ink48 is the first place I check when I need a clean hotel in Manhattan.

title: Great location, clean, decent price, but VERY NOISY
text: I agree with every review on here: BRING YOUR EAR PLUGS! And a sound machine. Excellent location in the meat packing district, but there's tons of construction early in the morning, plus a huge night club next to the hotel that doesn't stop thumping music until 4:00am. Rooms are also a bit small, but as with all Kimpton hotels, very nice accommodations.

title: Honeymoon
text: We stayed here for 5 nights. Staff were all friendly and helpful. Hotel was clean and room was large and comfortable. We only heard the building works nearby once or twice and never caused us any issue as we wanted to be out and about early. The only downside is the music from the bar in the hotel/nearby bars loud and can be heard from room and on the worst occasion it did go on until 4am!!

title: Bring ear plugs!!
text:
Beautiful rooms but SO LOUD with all the nightclubs around!!  Staff knew it was a problem so should have offered ear plugs and noise machines at check-in...just “own it”.  
No sleep for us until clubs shut down at 2:00 am.  We were on the 12th floor and it was like noise was right next door!
Air conditioner was hot first night ....came to “fix”.  Super cold the next night and wouldn’t turn off (58 degrees!)
Seems like a comp breakfast would have been a nice touch by management for all the troubles?

Needs a bigger shelf to put shampoos etc in shower.  
Rain shower head.

Beautiful views of harbor and city.  Nice modern clean furnishings.

title: Nice Place, Clean Rooms, Handy for a Cruise
text: This motel is nice, the staff is very attentive, and the location is perfect to catch a cruise ship from New York City.  The room we were in overlooked the river and was a block away from the port.  This is the second time we have stayed here and both times were equally impressive.  This will be our motel of choice for any future trips to NYC.  There is construction on a building on the river side, but we did not hear anything from the site while we were in the room (evening and over night).

title: 21st birthday
text:
Very clean and modern hotel in the hell’s kitchen district, within walking distance of Hudson. Lots of building work around therefore quite noisy, however not in hotel much so didn’t really affect us. 
Breakfast tasty if not a little expensive. Free wine available from 5 - 6 pm and coffee/tea available in morning. 
Pleasant staff.

title: This time-EXCELLENT!  Total Kimpton Love
text:
I had another chance to spend a night at the Kimpton Ink48 a few weeks ago. I stayed there about a year ago and was really not impressed at all.  Between lackadaisical attitudes from the staff and a room with a leaky A/C unit, to a very late AM coffee break, I was really not happy.

This stay however, total turnaround!  I arrived early again and had to wait for my room.  I opted into the last minute e-Upgrade and wound up with a FANTASTIC suite overlooking the river, the Intrepid and various cruise ships that were in NYC the weekend I was there.

Aside from that, let me say that the doorman, Jose, was super friendly and helpful as were Kelsey at the desk, the Front Desk Manager whose name escapes me but he did respond to my texts quickly, and my server in the restaurant when I stopped in for a snack.

Everyone was really genuinely friendly and helpful.  My drinks were excellent, the room was spotless and comfortable (albeit a little noisy but it's a city, what do you expect!)  Coffee hour was on time, wine hour was a bit late (however, I was rewarded with some bonus points for patiently waiting, and adding a bit of humor too I guess).

It's amazing how much things can improve when you let the company know what they missed out on during prior stays.  Yes the hotel is pretty pricey but I snagged a really good rate by checking the Kimpton/IHG site obsessively, daily!   

The hotel is close to a couple corner stores or bodegas/delis and I actually grabbed a sandwich for dinner at Sunrise Market and it was pretty yummy.  

Ink 48 is walkable to the piers though it poured rain so that's not a walk that I'd take with luggage. It's about a $10 cab ride from Penn Station and I suppose that you could walk up to Times Square.  All in all, I had an excellent stay and I am happy that Kimpton Ink48 redeemed themselves so well!

title: Worst night in a hotel ever
text: Literally worst night in a hotel ever.  I checked in at 9pm to get a good night of sleep after the floors in my apt had been worked on.  I booked the reservation the American Express Platinum Services, which should have come with loads of perks and upgrades- none.  I was greeted by a rude man at the front desk who seemed to be bothered that he had to help me, insisting that I'd make the reservation only moments before I'd walked in the door.  That wasn't true, I'd made it at noon, but for some reason at 9pm the reservation still wasn't ready.  He offered me no information on the hotel, nothing. Just my room number. I was surprised to see the hotel has no Wifi, unless you pay $16 for it, more terrible service. My room was fine, absolutely nothing special, and tiny. I was not given an upgrade, nor was I offered one in this completely empty hotel.  Fine.  I went to sleep.  But what they failed to mention, was that the jackhammering across the street will wake you up at 7am.  They offered me earplugs when I called to complain.  They said I paid for a king room and that's what I got.  So no to this hotel, no to this service, no to this location and no to this staff.  One star all around.  I cannot believe how infuriating this is that NO ONE thought to tell their arriving guests that HALF the hotel rooms face this said construction!  HELLO!  Put me in a different room to begin with and we wouldn't have this problem!  OR at least forewarn me! Worst worst service ever.  I'm appalled.  I woke up at 7am, threw a fit and checked out at 7:10am. It isn't worth it. Not even for free.  I always put my clients in this hotel when they arrive to NYC. Never again.

title: Still love it!
text: This was my third time staying at Ink48 and all the things I’ve loved about it before were just as good: the lobby and appointments are stylish; the staff are friendly and accommodating (I needed some additional lighting in my room and was a bit puzzled as to how to operate the TV, and staff were helpful and solicitous). The room was spacious - especially by New York standards - and the bathroom large, with good counter space, double sinks, and a deep separate soaking tub. My room was on a high floor with a “city view” - so the noise from the construction right across the street was definitely quite loud. With my schedule this wasn’t a big issue for me, though I’m sure it might have been for others. I knew about the noise because I read reviews beforehand!

title: Business - beware of construction
text: The one bedroom suite overlooking the Hudson is a great room. The rooftop bar is also great if it's not too crowded. Location is a bit off the beaten path and far from trains. The front desk staff at this hotel are TERRIBLE. They need training in how to deal with good customers who are travel savvy with multiple rooms. Seriously horrible experience. Also, the construction on the city view rooms is insane. The hotel obviously has no control over what is being built around them, but it's a deal breaker. And I'm more than fine with the general street noise of New York City. Hopefully management will read this and get a handle on the customer experience.

title: Seriously the construction noise
text: I checked in the hotel in the evening. Staff very welcoming lobby very clean and modern. My room was on the 3rd floor over the front entrance. My room was extremely spacious and the bathroom was very large with great counter space. My colleague had a much smaller room I am told and did not care for the size. The next morning I was awakened by awful banging and construction noise directly across the street. This made my stay very uncomfortable and has swayed me never to stay here again. The construction starts a little before seven and it almost feels like it is in your room.  I did mention it to the front desk and all they said is that they were sorry. I guess I am one and done at this hotel and that’s a shame.

title: Construction Ruining A Good Thing
text: The construction is really hard to endure. I like the hotel and amenities but won't be staying here again until that banging noise stops. I used a free bike to ride on the Hudson River Greenway to Battery Park and back which was super nice after a long flight.

title: Stay clear
text: Room air-conditioner didn't function, property didn't explain the amenities available,such as coffee downstairs, complimentary drinks at 6.00pm. Discovered all this on our last day. Made to feel distinctly second class because we didn't book direct, as a result we were allocated rooms on the noisy lower levels. Approached management a number of times to address the broken air-conditioner to be told 'they were busy with guests'. I used to work for IHG and this particular property is quite frankly unworthy of having the IHG brand. Location not anywhere near a subway. Just stay away!

title: LOVED IT!
text: It was such an amazing stay. Marilyn at the front helped me promptly and from the initial introduction, highly pleasant. I would def. love staying here again. the room was so wonderful and the room service on point. The Restaurant PRINT 75 connected to the Hotel was wonderful, the food delicious, the service great s well and the ladies at the bar very amicable and professional. I have zero complaints, only the noise of construction taking place across the street, which of course Ink48 can't do a thing about.

title: BEWARE: 2019 bookings prepare for terrible noise
text:
The hotel is fine. The rooms are spacious and the restaurant surprisingly good. 
HOWEVER. Nowhere on the web site or in the booking process or in our conversations with the hotel leading up to our stay did they mention the construction happening directly across from the hotel. I know, there's almost always some construction happening in NYC, we've experienced it before. But this was absurd. Giant jackhammers (seriously, the size of bulldozers) start at 7am and do not relent until 5:30pm. I wore Bose in-ear noise-canceling headphones with white noise turned up as high as was safe and still couldn't sleep. It was impossible to have a conversation without raising your voice. It's that bad. That there is no warning or discount given is absurd. Between this and our mediocre stay at the Eventi last year, I'm starting to think Kimpton just isn't a good bet for travel in NYC.

title: Dog Friendly First Rate Hotel
text: Clean, roomy hotel with excellent restaurant and rooftop bar/lounge with spectacular views. Dog friendly and they actually mean it - as in they LIKE dogs. I loved our stay and appreciated everyone from valet to housekeeping. They made our stay for Columbia graduation comfortable and we didn’t have to worry about the dogs. It is an upscale hotel for those without dogs, but when you travel with dogs you generally have to settle for the places that accept them. This is the opposite in that it is a spectacular hotel that welcomes and appreciates dogs and their people. They have a concierge dog walking service if you have long events and can’t get back to attend your dog. We didn’t need to use it but having the option was quite nice. They have dog beds they will bring to your room if you wish, and a food and water bowl is in the foyer to greet pups. Located in Hell’s Kitchen it is a quick walk, Uber or public transportation ride to anywhere you would want to go. It is a terrific option for those in town for Westminster or travelers with pets. It is clean and not dingy. Definitely a pawsitive experience.

title: Wonderful hotel in a perfect location
text: We picked this hotel because it was near the dock our ship was leaving from.  It is really a hip spot, very contemporary.  The hotel staff was great and the hotel room was fabulous.  The bath is enormous with separate shower and tub.  It also had a double sick and plenty of counter space.  The bed was very comfortable.  They have complimentary wine in the evening for an hour and wonderful coffee and tea in the morning.  There is a fitness center and a restaurant.

title: Loved it!
text: Stayed one night for a quick visit to NYC. Lovely hotel, with fantastic views from our corner room, comfortanle bed and convenient location. Staff was helpful and pleasant. Yes, there was construction noise in the morning but it's a big city and beyond control of the hotel. We'd definitely love to stay here again!

title: Our Go To NYC hotel
text:
We live in the NYC area, but sometimes we need to stay in town.  This is our place.  We have stayed four or five times in the past year.  This is a warm and hospitable hotel!  

Special shout out to Elijah at the front desk who always welcomes us by name.  The customer service is wonderful here.

It is pet friendly (our bernadoodle knows her way around, and the staff loves her).  You can walk or take short UBER /cab to any of the Manhattan sites. Well worth it to get one of the suites or mini-suites if available.  We have only stayed on the West side, and the views are good from high floors there.  Don't miss a nighttime cocktail in the roof top bar, the Press Room.

Highly recommend.

title: Great stay, accessible location
text:
I sought out a location in a New York that was close to the centre of Manhattan but found price vs convenience to be quite sporadic. In the end I settled on the Kimpton. While not a cost effective hotel it served my need very well. It’s beautiful and a rather standard quality hotel. It’s not over the top elegant buts it’s very comfortable. The downstairs bar and lounge is great albeit rather pricey. We had a delicious farm to table meal and spent a few evenings in the relaxed lounge. It’s location granted us walking access to most of the locations in mid and central Manhattan. Times Square is very close by  to give you a sense of proximity to tourist areas.

The rooms were clean and elegant. A modernist vibe with cleanliness and accessibility. Overall the experience we great for a 5 day stay. I’d certainly stay at the Kimpton line of resorts again. Having visited other locations specifically in the Caymans, I can say they are a great brand to stay with.

title: Gorgeous Property with Great Amenities
text: I spent 4 nights here with my daughter and we loved the location and amenities of this hotel.  The rate is not cheap ($300+ per night plus all the taxes), but the value is evident in the quality of the towels, bath robes, bedding etc.  The area immediately surrounding the hotel is home to many low-rise businesses and so you get a great view of the waterfront and the city. It was easy to get to many attractions nearby by walking. There are plenty of great restaurants and museums nearby as well. I know some reviews have commented on noise, but we found that by putting the fan in the room on "medium" that the white noise generated masked the street noises. The meals we ate in the restaurant and drinks we had at the roof-top bar were pricey, but we were prepared for that.  The staff who I interacted with were helpful and friendly. I liked that they had complimentary coffee/tea and papers out first thing in the morning. I didn't partake of the afternoon "happy hour" with complimentary wine, but there were people always crowded in that area so it was enjoyed by them. I thought the way that breakfast is served in the restaurant (order at counter) was confusing and one morning there wasn't enough seating. I would definitely recommend this hotel and would consider staying at it again.

title: Lovely room but noisy and not welcoming staff
text:
We stayed here for 5 nights as part of a trip for my partner’s 50th birthday. On arrival the staff were not particularly welcoming. Our room was on the 5th floor - a studio king with city view. The room was fantastic with a bath overlooking the city views. However, the noise from the construction site from 7am to 5pm was relentless. The rock breaker did not stop. They don’t start till 9am on a Saturday though!!
I can’t see how it will be completed in 4 weeks as suggested on a previous review as we were there at the end of April and the foundations were still being dug. What’s more when it is finished it will block the view from many of the rooms.
The restaurant was nice with some friendly staff but incredibly over priced with far too many people falling over themselves to dust imaginary crumbs off the table!
The Press Lounge cocktail bar has some nice views but the drinks are extortionate.
We know that New York is expensive but this was ridiculous.
We were also there doing the tourist thing but everyone else seemed to be there for business meetings or the cocktail lounge.
Recommend the go air link shuttle to get to the airport - fixed rate and much cheaper than a taxi.

title: Gorgeous Boutique Hotel
text:
I stayed in this hotel during a work trip. It’s pricey, but I had to remind myself that everything in NY is pricey! Lol

The front desk staff was great and even let me check in at 11 am since I arrived to town early. The decor throughout the hotel is well thought out and even the rooms have a NYC feel to them. Beside the bathroom sink being a little small I was very happy! 

Also there was construction going on outside, but nothing my tv couldn’t drown out. I’m assuming that there was curfew in the construction b/c the noise would stop at 11pm and begin around 7am each day. 

Next time I’m in town I hope to take advantage of the hotel amenities and wine for happy hour. 

Overall this is a great hotel that I highly recommend!

title: Horrible noise and a bad atmosphere wrecked out stay
text:
I proposed to my wife almost 5 years ago at Ink48 and we returned on a Friday to spend a weekend resting and indulging at what used to be our favorite hotel.  I know much can happen in 5 years but this place is barely a shadow of what it used to be.  We were greeted coldly by a woman who wasn't even dressed like she worked at the hotel who begrudgingly gave us a high floor when we told her we got engaged at the hotel.  What she neglected to tell us was that it was right above the Press Lounge and that music would play until late at night.  We returned from dinner and immediately requested to be moved which took the better part of an hour to happen.  The new room was on a lower floor but was bigger and still had a nice view.  We were happy.  Until 7am the following morning when a horrible clanging and pounding started.  It was impossible to sleep once it started so I got up to look and right across the street the entire city block was a giant hole in the ground where they are constructing an office tower.  Several large machines were beating into the bed rock and others were lifting rock and moving it.  I placed my hand on the window and found it was a single pane of thin glass; completely worthless with no sound proofing.  I could have put my fist through it easily, that's how flimsy it was.  What kind of a hotel in Manhattan would not have sound proof windows??  I immediately called the desk and told them this was unacceptable and asked to speak to a manager.  Maybe there were dozens of other complaints but it took an hour and a half before a woman who said she was the hotel manager offered to move us to a suite that night.  That's the type of room we had stayed in before so I accepted and the hotel moved our things while we were out that day and when we got back the room looked wonderful.  We took a nap, went to see a show and have dinner and got back hoping to enjoy the room and a good night's sleep.  Until 10pm when a nightclub across the side street started playing music so loud we thought we were IN the club.  I called the desk and the agent told me they were aware of the problem but  the hotel was sold out and there were no rooms to move us to.  I asked to speak to a manager and when we spoke she offered to give us the night for free.  The problem was I didn't want a free night, I wanted to SLEEP.  We turned on the TV, the room fan, and tried to fall asleep which didn't really help much.  Then at 4am I thought there was a riot on the street.  As the nightclub let out we heard screaming, fights breaking out, and car horns blaring.  We were victims of the same poor windows in this suite, and the noise just kept going.  At this point I told my wife that I just wanted to go home so we packed up at 5am and left the hotel and we went to Grand Central to wait 2 hours for our train.  It was honestly much less noisy at the train station.  

When a hotel cannot provide it's primary function which is to allow for a good nights sleep then that hotel should not be in business.  Ink48 seems to have taken a big fall in it's service standards and the noise is unacceptable and impossible to deal with.  The staff seemed not able to deal with the situation and we certainly did not experience any of the fun, joyous service that created such beautiful memories years ago.  All the managers and agents seemed tired, bored, and almost completely unconcerned.  I think that this hotel needs to close large areas of their rooms until the noise problems are fixed and they also need to make it very clear when people book what is going on because after this I will never stay there again.

title: Hidden fees ?
text:
I think that anyone who comes here should see my review.

Unfortunately my review isn't about the quality of the hotel, the location or the staff.

After I left the hotel, and without my permission, the hotel used my credit card to increase their profits.

I was charge an additional "amenity fee".

I was never told about this, and I was told that everything was paid on my check in.

I'm complaining with IHG and trying to block my visa.

title: Fantastic Experience !
text:
Had the perfect stay in these hotel . All was absolutely Perfect ! 
Amazing view ! All team is great ! The print bar has a fantastic food !
Marlyn of the front reception was absolutely incredible .
Def gonna come back soon !

title: NOISE NOISE NOISE
text: We rented two rooms on the 5th and 6th floors for 4 days to see the sights in NY.  But as I write this review I’m absolutely shattered from staying here!!! There is so much noise from every direction!  Be it from deliveries on the street level at ALL hours of the night to construction ALL around the hotel.  And the clientele is a real special breed here as well. Just think parties in rooms next to you to long rude phone conversations in the hallway.  SO DONT PLAN ON SLEEPING HERE!  And I expect some glamed up response from Kimpron... Don’t be fooled like we were.  Go elsewhere... Sofitel for example.  They care about hospitality and that you SLEEP!  This place is is one big bar trapped in an 80’s party mentality.

title: My fourth review, and over 30 stays....amazing staff, suite and loyalty...
text: Another great stay at the Ink48.  Thank you to Nick and his team for the attention to detail and special requests, and all of my friends - too many to mention - who make this hotel my true home away from home.  I gave up my NYC apartment after 25+ years to simplify my life and be treated great after a few stays in this property while my place was being used by a friend undergoing medical treatment in NYC.  I travel to NYC every month or so to meet with my work team in Manhattan, and love everything about this property.  The team is great and treats me like family, the restaurant and bar on the lobby level are delicious with great management and service, and the rooms are spacious - many with soaking tubs and sweeping views of the Hudson River or cityscape.  I appreciate the door staff and security, the front desk and management, the housekeeping team and all of the good people at this property.  Thanks Ink48!

title: Loud!
text: I know all the previous reviews have mentioned the noise, but I feel like it needs to be mentioned again. The construction is one thing, but the regular outside traffic noise and the nightclub noise make it hard to relax. I would definitely stay somewhere closer to the action, this hotel is off the beaten path and not near a subway.

title: bring earplugs
text: great location, good vibes, friendly staff, clean spacious rooms. noisy though, even for manhattan. also there is a massive construction site where the “city view” was supposed to be, and they start working EARLY. but bring proper earplugs and you’ll be fine.

title: 3 nuits à New-York au Ink48
text: Avis plutôt positif. Belle chambre spacieuse (chambre Premier) au 5ème étage. Et bien déjà au 5ème, vous avez une très chouette vue avec les lumières de Time Square au coin des buildings. Salle de bain agréable avec lavabos et baignoire ouverts sur la chambre, douche et WC fermés. Penderie avec safe, fer à repasser, peignoirs, tout y est. Bar très fourni. Chambre franchement calme, aucun bruit ne vient des chambres voisines. Quelques travaux dans la rue mais pas le week end. Petit déj sympa et produits frais. Resto très joli, on a eu un serveur pas très patient et mon canard était très rosé mais rien à redire d'autre. Femme de ménage très discrète et chambre parfaite. Rooftop vraiment incroyable, j'ai rarement eu autant de plaisir en terrasse. On reviendra.

title: Extremely noisy, maintenance/mgmt issues. Clean.
text:
This Kimpton is clean and well appointed. 

However, we did not have any luck with having the front desk/management repair the air conditioning in our room. It was very warm during the whole stay even though we reported the issue on the first evening (out of 3 night stay). They never followed up or offered to move us. 

This is not usual Kimpton service.

We had also read reviews about the construction noise and asked our travel concierge to call ahead and help us get our two rooms AWAY from that side of the building. Our rooms ended up being directly over the construction (view and constant jack-hammering)!! What in the world?

The rooftop is very nice. 
Bath soaps and supplies are good quality. Housekeeping is excellent and very friendly.

Location is not convenient to Metro or landmarks, but Ubers and taxis are easy to access. 

Print restaurant located in lobby has great coffee and food. 

There is no coffee in the rooms and regular size water is $9! Mini water is $6. Bring your own bottles— filtered water on 2nd floor /gym area. 

Lobby coffee available in morning in the lobby and happy hour in lounge (wine was undrinkable!) 

Sign up for Kimpton rewards for free WiFi. 

Last, but not least, the hotel charges an additional “amenity fee” per night, that was not clearly mentioned ahead of time! ($25 PER NIGHT PER ROOM.)

title: Usually love Kimpton’s but this was a huge disappointment!
text: We have stayed at this property before and it was a pleasant stay, but this go around the experience was truly subpar.  Towels had stains on them, the overall decor was tired, and perhaps the biggest issue, an incredibly loud nightclub playing heavy bass until after 2am.  Even with a white noise machine at max volume, it was unbearable.  We could deal with the daytime construction noise from the neighboring property, but the nightclub noise was unacceptable.  When presented to the front desk at check out the response was “I was not here last night, I don’t know what that was, hmm?”  Really. No one else would have complained?  This kind of customer experience is wholly unacceptable at this level of hotel.  We will stay at other Kimpton’s in the future, but never again at this property. Disappointing.

title: Acceptable, but could be better
text:
I had heard so many awesome things about Kimpton Hotels - particularly for excelling in offering quality customer service and giving nice perks to their guests. 

I think Ink 48 does well in some areas, but doesn't really hit all the points for me to be completely satisfied with my experience. 

On check-in day, my room was burning hot - about 90 degrees. I tried cooling down the room, but it was impossible. 

I went down to the counter and asked if I could be moved. The front desk said they would have engineering check out the issue and would then move me if they couldn't fix the error. They said they had no other rooms available. Mind you, this was around midnight and I had just gotten off a flight - I wanted to crash. 

I left the hotel, got soaked in the rain and came back to learn - they were going to move me to the room next to the one I was assigned. So there were other open rooms... 

At other hotels, I would usually just be moved. This is an incredibly poor customer experience. 

The room itself was large by NY standards and comfortable. The bed was nice and there were blackout shades available. No additional couch, desk or dining table, but there was a small coffee table. My room had no tub, but there was a very energizing rain shower. Wifi speeds were pretty decent. Minibar was interesting - tons of local products, but still very expensive! No additional mini-fridge or cooler in room. 

For being a hotel targeted to millennials, the lack of availability to link up your streaming services (Netflix, Hulu) to the TV is pretty lame. Otherwise, your only options are live TV channels. 

There is free coffee in the morning and free wine in the evening - but no free breakfast or any other perks, although the resort fee includes a $10 credit for in-room or restaurant dining. 

Here are some other notes about the area: This hotel is in Hells Kitchen and is not the most "touristy" area in NYC. That can be a good thing because it's a bit more chill than staying in Times Square for example, but you do have to walk a bit if you want to get a drug store or a nice sit-down restaurant. There is a 24 hr. deli about a block away and a Halal cart that sets up shop at night. There are also some nightclubs and strip clubs adjacent to the hotel, if you are planning to bring family. 

At the end of the day, I don't know if I would recommend or come back to Ink48. The room was comfortable, but nothing spectacular.

title: Very noisy construction next door with no noise reduction help
text: The hotel itself is nice and well designed. I've stayed before and it was great. However now there is construction going on next door and it woke me up early in the morning. Other hotels that know there is lots of construction going on nearby think ahead and provide ear plugs and a note to anticipate it. I was sorely disappointed a hotel at this caliber didn't anticipate the needs of its guests.

title: Very Nice would stay again!
text:
Beautiful, clean, modern hotel. Staff very welcoming and friendly. Room was very clean and up to date. Lots of windows which is always a nice plus when staying in NYC. Forewarning there is construction across the street, started working around 7am. It was fine for me since I was up anyways for work but for those on vacation might want to suggest a room on the other side of the building. 
For work, our office is near Times Square which I dread staying at hotels around there. This hotel is a short walk from that area in a much quieter and less touristy spot.  I would definitely stay again and would recommend it to others.

title: Not as advertised
text: Experienced lots of issues.  The room was less than 200 square feet versus the advertised 275 square feet.  The room was supposed to have a desk but didn't, which made it impossible to work in the room.  The TV was smaller than the 42 inches advertised on the Kimpton web site as well--probably 36 inches.  I arrived early and requested check in, and many people got their rooms before me.  Worst of all, my room wasn't even available at the check in time.  I always make a special request fro a room away from the elevator, and this was not accommodated.

title: Such a Perfect Place
text:
Its our second or third time at this wonderful hotel. The staff is so amazing...helpful and nice! And our room with a view is over the top! What a great way to spend a special day or  any day!

I highly recommend this hotel amd look forward toour next visit.

title: Goodbye good nights sleep
text:
We had selected the Ink48 for a week's stay in New York. Due to our Platinum level IHG membership, we got upgraded to a Hudson river view suite. 

First arriving in the room, we felt we had hit the jackpot with our choice - the room was spacious with huge windows displaying a great view of the Hudson. Unfortunately, the great first impression was not lasting. 

We were exhausted from our journey (9 hour flight) and were looking forward to a good nights sleep in our beautiful room. Unfortunately, the hotel is directly next to a rooftop restaurant AND a night club venue. For the first half of the evening we got to enjoy the latina music blasting from the rooftop restaurant, and then the night club was keeping us up until 3AM. The music was incredibly loud, and another testiment to the hotels lousy sound proofing is that after the club closed, we could literally hear people having conversations at street level - 9 floors below our room. Luckily the night club was not open any other night (only Sat-Sun) but the rooftop restaurant made sure that our evenings were filled with unwanted disturbance through 4PM-11PM almost every single day. 

Beyond the obvious issues with the noise level, the room was also not cleaned up to the standard you'd expect from a hotel of this level. The shower door was really dirty, as well as the bathroom counter showed toothpaste stains from the previous occupants when we checked in. The bathroom also had other problems, for one the tub would not hold water so we could not use it. The shower set up was the worst I've ever experienced; no hand-held shower at all (not in the shower nor the tub) and the jets on the wall were completely at the wrong height for a short person like myself. It was impossible to have a shower without getting your hair wet, since the highest of the body jets was literally spraying me in the face, and there was only the overhead jets as the other option. Not ideal when you just want to refresh a bit before going to dinner without ruining your hair in the middle of the day. I really can't understand how they've decided that this is a good set-up.

Another thing we found problematic is that the hotel does not offer breakfast. The restaurant downstairs does have an ala carte breakfast - but it's really expensive. You don't even get proper table service for the price (order at the counter and served to table), and since they only allow you to be seated in the bar area at breakfast, the tables are really not suited for eating. Our table was so tiny that just to fit two coffee cups and plates was almost impossible. We ended up eating at different places every single morning - but we do really prefer to start our morning nice and slow at a hotel breakfast, so we definitively missed having that. 

Overall, I don't think the hotel is worth the money we spent, especially because it was not the safe haven we would have needed after the days spent in the bustling city. Most of the staff was great though, my only complaint would be with the sometimes less than friendly gentlemen manning the door - who most often did not even greet us when passing. Unfortunately overall the hotel was a disappointment to us both.

title: Terrific visit to NYC
text: 3 friends and I recently visited NYC from Washington, DC.  We stayed at Kimpton Ink48 and were very pleased with our accommodations.  From the warm greeting at the front desk, to the clean and spacious rooms, comfortable beds, complimentary wine at 5pm in the lively lobby, and wonderful morning coffee service also in the lobby -- everything was perfect.  The concierge was very helpful in assisting us in finding the best place to watch the Final Four, the bellhop stored our bags safely for us, and the doorman was very helpful in assisting with cabs/Ubers.  The rooftop lounge is not to be missed (but be warned, the line forms early on clear days) with terrific views and attentive staff.  Ink48 is conveniently located just a few blocks of Gotham West Market, a great place to grab street food or craft beer.  Couldn't have been more pleased with our choice of hotel.

title: An Ink-redible experience!
text: My friend and I decided to visit NYC to celebrate our 60th birthdays and chose this hotel for our stay. We were not disappointed - It was fantastic! We enjoyed being in Hell’s Kitchen, a buzzy, bustling neighbourhood with a whole range of bars and restaurants just a short walk away. Our room had a jaw-dropping view of the Hudson River and the Intrepid Museum and it was extremely comfortable. The staff were friendly and helpful and I highly recommend a trip to the Press Lounge (right on site) for a dazzling view of the city skyline.

title: Great location
text: This hotel is in the Hell’s Kitchen part of Manhattan next to the Hudson River and only a few minutes walk from Times Square. The rooms are really nice and rooftop bar has great views of the Manhattan skyline.

title: So disappointed - can't recommend
text: As we sit in our room over the lounge listening to the pounding of music, I can't say I can recommend this hotel.  During the day - nice view but instead of music, there was construction noise all day long.  Room service is overpriced as well.  Staff was pleasant - the only plus.  I'll never stay here again.  If you like Kimptons - try the Eventi - great views .

title: Nice hotel but guests should be warned of 7 a.m. construction noises
text: Nice hotel, with large comfortable, well-designed rooms. But guests should be pre-warned that one-half (or more?) of the rooms face a large construction site, with loud noise beginning each day at 7 a.m. And it looks like the construction is only just beginning. Elevators are glitch-prone and shared with laundry and housekeeping. Also, why the strange, unfriendly policies of the restaurant at breakfast? The hotel makes a big point of free coffee in the lobby in the morning -- but don't you dare try to take it into the restaurant. And if you order coffee in the restaurant, you are allowed one refill -- only -- before you are charged again. I can't think of a restaurant in any major hotel that has that policy.

title: Really nice business stay
text:
As a tourist the hotel might be a bit “far away” from the hot spots, depending where you want to go. Also metro is not really close but if you prefer some quietness and a real nice and classy stay: that’s your choice! Comparably big rooms and nice style and amendments. The beds are comfy and I loved that you could open the windows 👌🏻
Bathroom is super big and beautiful and nicely equipment. 
Restaurant and food is great, yet relatively expensive. 
Staff and overall service of the hotel is really friendly and nice. I’d come back any time ;)

title: Great location and fabulous roof top bar
text: We had a room overlooking the construction mentioned in previous reviews but we were lucky enough to have arranged such a busy schedule whilst in NYC that we were up and out before it started at 7am.  The bathroom door is style over substance as it is glass; illuminating the room if the bathroom is used at night and providing an audible playlist for anyone in the bedroom 😉.  However, the location is great with easy walking to some superb bars and restaurants and also some of the main NYC attractions.  The staff were all very helpful and friendly.  And the roof top bar has one of the best views of Manhattan

title: Just Right
text: I've stayed here 3 times now.  Ink48 is my favorite hotel in New York.  The combination of location, value, and cool factor can't be beat.  I enjoy how professional the staff is.  I like how they text to ask how things are going and if you need anything, it's very convenient vs a call. The rooftop bar is impressive, I had a great time up there even though it was cold.

title: Frequent guest for business travel
text: I had 18 stays at this hotel last year.  It is my first choice any time I am in NYC, which is often.  Great location in Hell's Kitchen.  AMAZING staff.  From my 2nd stay they recognized me and always welcome me back.  While I could easily name at least 10 regular staff members that have gone above and beyond I would like to mention Anthony and America.  Both front desk associates, both exceedingly helpful.  Especially during my 10 day extended visit last month when I underwent major surgery at a NYC hospital and needed a local place to recover.  The rooms are the most comfortable I have come across in NYC and the bar/restaurant top notch--I would recommend it to locals (and have had them join me there for meals).  I lived in Hell's Kitchen for over 10 years and Ink48 is now my home away from home each time I am back for work.

title: Rooftop- Those Summer Nights
text:
This is the place to be on NYC summer nights! 

I've been to Ink48 possibly over a dozen times an I dont even live in NYC anymore. 

Its a lovely hotel with an amazing rooftop. I

THey've got great drinks, a bit pricey- but its NYC, so thats expected.

title: Terraza bar
text: Hermoso lugar vista increíble de la ciudad un poco atolondrada la atención de la moza pretendiendo cobrar el trago cuando no se termino y no sabía si repetiríamos . Las vistas impresionantes precios elevados pero vale el lugar y las vistas

title: Wonderful Staff and Lovely Hotel
text: Stayed for 6 nights in February while in town for convention at Javits Center. Location quick walk to Javits. Hotel is lovely and room was oversized and very well equipped. Staff were incredible. Wonderful door men, helpful front desk employees, top notch housekeeping staff, every single person I interacted with while I was visiting greeted me with a smile. Everyone was helpful and professional. I wish I could list the names of all the people I met at Ink 48 because they were all awesome! The bed was heavenly, every night was the best night's sleep. Only car dealerships nearby, so you need to walk up from 11th to 10th to find places to eat, grocery stores, etc. There is a great Amish Market nearby where you can stock up on anything you'd need. I loved everything about the Kimpton Ink 48 (it even has a wonderful scent when you walk in). Elevators were quick, rooms and hotel are kept spotlessly clean, security in lobby at night always made me feel safe, super helpful staff, good options at the restaurant (excellent food, great room service), bell hop always available to help with a cab when necessary. So happy I chose this hotel (a change from where I normally stay on business when I travel to NYC). Highly recommend and I will be back. Well done to the management team!

title: Exceptional Service Always!
text:
This was our second visit to this fabulous hotel.   Excellent location, close to fantastic restaurants and walkable to time square and theatre district.   
We are always greeted by name and thanked for being rewards members.   Once we were in our room we received a text again welcoming us and telling us to pls let them know if there is anything we need from guest relations.    We were hoping that our room had a different view, although the skyline view beautiful.   We were hoping to see the river this time.   I only asked if possible we can move to the other side.   Immediate response that the bellman will be up to help us move our things and was at the door with new key. Excellent and immediate attention to our request.   Rooms are clean and beds are so comfortable.  Every member of this team is friendly, knowlegable and very professional.    Breakfast grab and go is very good or you can dine there as well.   We have been to many Kimpton properties and as usual, never a disappointment and always very pleased.  

I would like to personally thank Akil, Jesus and Gwyan if you read the reviews.   You all were so kind on our request and made it happen within minutes.

title: Beautiful lobby, unclean room...again
text:
My first Kimpton experience was in their Huntington Beach location in 2015, and I was blown away by the beauty and uniqueness of the hotel. Later, I was similarly impressed when I stayed at the Hotel Monaco in Chicago. However, both times that I've stayed at Ink48 have been a let-down. 

My husband and I just gave this hotel another chance last month, after being disappointed with the cleanliness on our first visit. This time, my husband surprised me by getting us an upgraded bath-spa suite. Unfortunately, the room was not clean, and thus uncomfortable.

The tub - the special feature of the room - had a large stain. The floor also had multiple stains. Hair was all over the floors and in the bed. A panel hung from the ceiling. The magazines in the room had food stains and scribbles on them. 

We let the front desk know on our second day, not wanting to get anyone in trouble, but wanting the hotel to be aware. They had the room turned over, but not to much effect. Less hair this time, same food-stained magazines, I believe the ceiling panel was still loose, and obviously the stains on the tub and floor could not be addressed.

We never heard any follow-up from the hotel. I was surprised we were not offered a different room (they could have been full). I was surprised that they offered a stained bath in a bath suite, it was gross. 

This was similar to our first Ink48 experience. At that time, I emailed them after our visit, but the conversation went nowhere. We were willing to give it another try this time because of my past great experiences at other Kimpton locations (pre-buyout, perhaps this is a factor). From now on, we will not be staying at Ink48, and probably not other Kimpton properties. It's a shame, my first two Kimpton visits we so good.

title: Staycation Heaven!
text:
After a disappointing and annoying interaction with Intercontinental Barclay’s, I wrote to Nick  Ivezaj to help save our much anticipated time away - last minute. Wow, did he and his staff deliver! Upgraded to a Studio King (had a huge soaking tub -yay!) with spectacular city views, welcome amenities both days, and the best service we have had in NYC in ages!  This of course, is in addition to the regular Kimpton amenities of complementary coffee in the morning and wine in the afternoon, plus IHG membership perks of raid the minibar credit and spa services credit.  Everyone on staff was so friendly and welcoming, but Ralph gets a special mention for his stories and his smile. We loved the atmosphere and views from the rooftop bar and their restaurant offered exquisite food. 

Thank you so much, Nick - this was exactly what we needed and we left refreshed and resolved to always stay at Kimpton!

title: Horrible neighbors ruin this property.  Sleep difficult.
text:
We were given a room on the 5th floor, facing 48th street.  We checked in Saturday afternoon when the block was quiet.  The hotel staff was professional and the accommodations were comfortable with two queen size beds for a family of four.  The bathroom was large with an over-sized shower that has a frosted window that faces the bedroom. When the bathroom is occupied the the light illuminates the sleeping area which can disturb someone sleeping in the other room. 
Across the street is a Club that is open until 4 AM.  We returned to our room from dinner and it sounded like we were in the club across the street.  The staff of the club set up a queue area down the block and all night over the music we heard people talking, yelling, screaming, car horns...it was horrible.  It was the worst night in any hotel property I have ever stayed. This noise went on past 4 AM, we could not drown out, it was unbearable.  We were only staying one night, had we booked multiple nights we would have checked out and changed hotels.  
If you are planing a late night out on the town, this is the location for you.  If you are looking for a good night sleep, I do not recommend this hotel.

title: Amazing
text: Although this hotel is about 15 minutes from Times Square we were extremely impressed by the welcome and the amazing view from our room. The decor is beautiful and the room really comfortable and quite large. We had a corner room with everything we needed including a roof top bar that looked out onto the city and the Hudson. The only negative was the walk to the hotel from Times Square we had a few issues on the walk to and from the hotel including a fight in the street rubbish lining the pavements and someone shouting abuse at us after accidentally bumping into them. Not sure Hells Kitchen is that desirable  but it wouldn't stop us staying there again just grab a taxi.

title: Not What I Expect from Kimpton Properties
text:
I recently spent four days at Kimpton Ink while in NYC on business.  I am a platinum IHG member because I love Kimpton and will stay at their properties any chance I get. I was excited to experience this hotel in Hell's Kitchen.  Unfortunately, I faced some extremely undesirable circumstances -- some they could have controlled and others they could not have.
I arrived at the property to face over 30 dogs in the lobby.  Yes, I discovered, the Westminister Dog Show was in town.  I love dogs.  However, I could not get a seat for the wine hour because dogs were on the furniture, a drooling rotweiler was next to the only open seat and several boisterous dogs were barely under control.  Not their fault as a dog friendly property, but suggesting that dogs be kept in the room for the one hour a day there was a hosted wine reception could have mitigated the chaos, including several "accidents" on the lobby floor I encountered.  
Next, I got an "upgraded" room looking directly out over major construction.  Only after the 7AM start of hydraulic drilling the next day was there any discussion with me about the construction.  The person behind the desk, rather than engaging, pointed to a printed sign on the desk offering earplugs.  I was not offered a room away from the construction nor was there an ounce of acknowledgment or empathy.
On my third day, at 4AM a barking dog persisted until 6AM.  I fell asleep just long enough to be awoken again by 7AM hydraulics.  I went to the front desk to complain and was met by a shrug and told, "The dogs will be gone tomorrow."
Cleanliness wise, the hair I found on my shower floor the first day was there until I finally removed it myself on the third day. 
From a practical standpoint, although not about Kimpton per se, there was one day I was there in very inclement weather involving slush and sleet and hazardous walking conditions. If you have not had a chance to bring your own water and snacks, you will pay mightily for the mostly-junk mini-bar because there is no gift shop or nearby bodega for such things. 
In my (at least) tens of trips to Kimpton over the years, and particularly as a platinum customer, I have never felt that my business mattered so little.  I hope this was because of the chaos of the dog show, but I also wish I had been warned of that and the construction.  I could have made a different, and better choice.

title: Wonderful place to stay for a romantic evening!
text:
My girlfriend and I booked the Kimpton Ink 48 in the West Side / Clinton / Hell's Kitchen area for our anniversary, and it is easily one of the most rewarding hotel experiences I've ever had. The service was exceptional, with care both with the booking staff (thanks to Ms. DJ / Mr. AR) and the front desk. 

The room was luxuriously appointed, the bed extremely comfortable, and the views wonderful. We had a River view which is very clear and crisp, the rooms with the city view can be assumed to be very nice as well, as the view from the modern and clean rooftop lounge was breathtaking.

The hotel's location is nice in that it is a little removed from the bustle of Times Square while still having all the comforts and advantages of a Manhattan location, with views, services, and easy walks to food / drinks / fun.

I will absolutely stay there again, and am grateful to the staff for helping make my anniversary a wonderful experience. A truly exceptional experience.

title: Awesome
text: This hotel is awesome!!! Great location!! The staff is exceptional!!  Even with the construction going on around the hotel ,they could not do enough to accommodate guests. They offered ear plugs, noise machine anything to make their guests comfortable. I would recommend this hotel ! I will be returning very soon!!!

title: Top service Superb Views
text:
Off the Times Square chaos but close enough to walk into it if you like.  Grand views of cityside or riverside are a gift for the higher floors.   Friendly staff eveyrwhere and always a kind doorman greeting you welcome or wishing you fun when out and about.  Taxis easy to find on 11th.
This hotel is trying to gasp for a trendy look but really translates into modern clean. Being mid age fits in just right here, but younger or more seasoned can appreciate the stay too.
Try to get to the lounge at the top for fantastic views.

title: Great hotel, wonderful service
text:
We have stayed here at least 8 times and the experience is always excellent. Just returned from a 1 night stay and again, a great experience. Stephen at the front desk is friendly and attentive. His restaurant recommendations are spot on. Trust his advice. He recommended Casellula, a charming wine and cheese bar with a solid wine list and delicious post-theatre bites. 
Our room was a Hudson River Suite with an impressive view of the Hudson. It was initially chilly in the room, in large part due to the many windows and the "polar vortex", but the hvac unit in the bedroom was not functioning. The unit in the sitting room was working well. We called for service and the engineer came up within 15 minutes. He assured us that the main unit could handle the entire suite. We requested blankets (which also cam up promptly) but it turned out he was correct. The main unit heated the entire suite. 
The neighborhood around the hotel has a more subdued appearance, seeming industrial at times. But that appearance belies lots of little gems like Sullivan Street Bakery (a half block away) and Veritas Studio Wines, with an impressive array of small producer wines. Lots to discover in the neighborhood. And the Ink48 service tops it off.

title: The noise!
text: Kimptons are very nice hotels but I would stay away from this one. The construction noise from across the street is unbelievable!  Every morning starting at 7:00 am. It’s like someone is in your room banging a drum. All day long!  Disappointed that management gives no notice of this. Ruined our stay.

title: Underwhelmed
text: Nice hotel downtown NY.  Rooms were decent sized, and we did have a good view.  They are trying really hard to be trendy.  Staff was mostly helpful.  I wish they offered a shuttle service.  We were able to walk to most our destinations, or hailed a cab, but the shuttle would have been a nice option.  They have a VERY EXPENSIVE roof top bar and lounge.  Views are incredible though

title: Construction
text:
If you plan on sleeping after 7 am, get another hotel. It's very loud, pretty much like being outside. We got earplugs from the receptionist, but were useless. They didn't seem to care much about the noise. I know it's not their fault, but they could warn about it and make the stay more comfortable, not act like nothing is happening. And it's not one block away, it's right in front of the hotel.
We also had a horrible smell from the shower one day, called about it , luckily didn't happen the next day,  they didn't follow up on that.
Otherwise the room was nice and pretty clean.

title: Always a perfect stay!
text: I have stayed at this hotel multiple times. Rooms are amazing the rooftop lounge called the Press Lounge has amazing views, drinks and ambiance. The staff is friendly and it’s a perfect place to stay for fun and for business. There isn’t anything exciting around the neighborhood but very easy to grab a cab and hit anyone of the amazing neighborhood of nyc. I always take a morning run to Central Park so I love staying in this area.

title: Construction everywhere!
text:
The least the mgt can do is to advise the weary traveler that the hotel is surrounded by noisy construction. It is not as though they are not going to find out. Also, this place is in “no man’s land.” The neighborhood is chock full of car dealers and auto repair. To make the stay even more uncomfortable the restaurant is way too eclectic and foo foo. Better suited for grazing than dining. So, if you are
An insomniac who is on a diet of veggies and inedibles than this is your place. I am neither.

title: Amazing visit to NYC
text: The hotel exceeded all of my hopes. I had been to New York before but decided to stay at a hotel this time. Was very nervous about staying in a New York hotel because of some of the stories I had heard about them. A friend recommended the Kimpton Ink48 and I decided to try it. From checking in to checking out the staff were wonderful and very helpful. The rooms actually looked like the pictures online which is not always the case. Our room had a full view of the city and a partial view of the river amazing. The hotel was close enough to everything without  being in the hustle and bustle. I am already trying to decide when I will return.

title: Perfect stay just a few blocks from Times Square
text:
I would highly recommend this hotel if your looking at a trip to New York. It’s just a few blocks outside of Times Square, based in Hell’s Kitchen (!Tip! Hell’s Kitchen is best for food! Don’t go to Times Square for food). The blessing of this hotel just being slightly outside it’s it’s not as noisy as we all know, New York is the city that never sleeps! The views in our room were spectacular, this is very difficult to find in New York. 

Room - was finished to a high spec, lovely, comfortable, modern and CLEAN! And the views I cannot stress enough, we had a view of the city and Hudson River ! The only disappointment was the price for the mini bar in the room, 9 dollars for water ? This is totally unreasonable....

Staff - very lovely, accommodating where possible and helpful we have no complaints. Thanks also to the gents at the main doors who were there everyday to open them for us ! 

Lobby - great place to chill out & Lounge, they also had happy hour everyday a glass of complimentary wine, I guess this made up for the 9 dollar water although it doesn’t make sense to charge 9 dollars for a bottle of water but give a glass of free wine ??? 

Bar - ambient & relaxing, it was always really busy, full of atmosphere, we did eat here but if your looking for an exquisite, high class meal I would say this is the place 

Roof top - gutted but unfortunately we didn’t get to experience it most nights we were out exploring the city, it looks amazing though ! 

Would happily stay again, thanks for a great stay *****

title: Excellent.  We had a great stay in a Hudson Suite, and the hotel staff was great! If Hell’s Kitchen is your destination
text:
Hotel- Kimpton Ink48 (NYC)
Date: 01jan2019- 02jan2019
Overall: 	Excellent.  We had a great stay in a Hudson Suite, and the hotel staff was great! If Hell’s Kitchen is your destination area, this hotel should be a top choice!
Accommodations- Excellent. We were assigned a Hudson Suite on the 14th floor.  It was well appointed and offered a spectacular view of the Hudson River. The bathroom had both a bathtub and a walk in shower, and the rain shower had side spraying water massage option, an unexpected surprise.  Coffee makers can be requested for the room.
Loyalty Program Recognition- Excellent. As an Inner Circle member, I was thanked for my loyalty, and my room was upgraded. The usual ‘Raid-the-Bar’ allowance of $15 was given, as was the $30 in room spa credit.  We also received an amenity of pretzels, mixed nuts, bbq chips, and two sodas.  Our newspaper was delivered, as set up in my profile. The Complimentary Chefs Taste benefit was not applicable to this property, like other NYC Kimpton properties.
Staff- Excellent.  Akil, who checked us in, was professional, personable, and knowledgeable. He was able to help us find the food type we were looking for when we went out, which saved us an extended walk in the cold. He deserves special kudos for his customer service. Although I came in contact with only a few other employees during my stay, he presented the hotel well.  The wine hour attendant was also very pleasant.
Housekeeping & Maintenance- Excellent.  The room was immaculate, and the bathroom couldn’t have been any cleaner. Shampoo, conditioner, lotion, soap, facial tissues, and toilet paper were in adequate supply for single day stays. The carpet, windows, walls, window coverings, and decorations were in great shape.
Pool/Gym: Not evaluated
Breakfast/Meal Options-.While we did not have a meal at the restaurant, the options presented were tempting, although not inexpensive.  The Presse Lounge upstairs was very nice.  The skyline views were very appealing, as were the drinks. Two drinks cost us $37, which was notable. 
Laundry- Not evaluated. The prices were appropriate for the venue.
Computer/Printer/WiFi- Excellent. WiFi was strong throughout the hotel. Streaming video was a breeze.
Property Appearance- Very Good
Exterior- The property was branded effectively, and the entrance and lobby was very well cared for. A bar that neighbors the hotel is a serious detractor.
Interior- Excellent. Stylish and well maintained is a clear standard for this hotel.

title: Hell’s Kitchen printing company with great views!
text: Former Hell’s Kitchen printing company is great place to stay. The rooms are sleek, modern and large by NYC standards. Many have views of the surrounding skyline even on lower levels. The best part is the incredible views of the surrounding Skyline. The Roof top bar, “Print” has sweeping views in all directions and has become a popular spot for having pricey cocktails. You can sit indoors or lounge outside in comfortable surroundings and take in the city. I was expecting “old factory loft funky” This place is nothing of the sort. No ghosts of printers past, just the modern feel of a new upscale hotel. This hotel is pet friendly. You will see relatively well-behaved dogs in the lobby at times. Super friendly helpful staff!

title: Enjoyable 5 night stay
text: The hotel is well located if you want midtown in walking distance but without the craziness. The roof top bar and the views are excellent. The bathroom we had and the city view from the room were also great. Fits the Kimpton brand.

title: Get the right room and its a great hotel...
text: We stayed for four nights leaving 1 December. We had two children (12 and 10) with us so had requested nearby rooms on a higher floor. Of course on arrival we were told we had one room on the 2nd and one on the 5th! (Why is it so hard for hotels to allocate rooms on a sensible basis?). On the first night it became clear that noise from a nightclub across the road on West 48th Street side was a real problem - the club is at roof level (about 5th floor of the hotel) and obviously loud music can be heard but also at closing time the noise at street level is really loud and included that night police in attendance etc! we asked to be moved and the 2nd floor room was changed to 9th floor same side - this was much better and a better view too! They could not change the other room as we had asked for twin beds and none were available...The next night same problems so I asked to change room and got a City View Studio King. This was on the 11th Avenue and 10th floor - finally quiet! The rooms are good and well designed for the price. If we had been in these rooms at the start it would have been a very good stay. The double glazing is not good enough. The staff are great, rooftop bar cool and the restaurant really good (tho not cheap). My advice - make sure you are on an upper floor and 10th floor upwards - the City view rooms are all higher and pretty cool.

title: Skønt hotel lidt udenfor turistområde
text: Et fint og moderne indrettet hotel med gode faciliteter. Vi havde et Premium værelse, desværre med udsigt til en stor og larmende byggeplads, men også ud til byen og skyline. Der er et mindre fitnessrum og en lækker skybar.

title: Home away from Home
text: Ink48 is a midtown oasis that provides luxury, comfort and space, while still having easy access to all tourist attractions by walking, subway or car. I ended up staying at Ink48 for almost three weeks during some reconstruction of my apartment and it was an incredible home away from home. The morning coffee and complimentary wine happy hour are fabulous. The staff are all incredibly nice and helpful, and having access to the downstairs restaurant and upstairs bar was great, especially because of how bad the weather was during my stay. There also is nothing like having a soaking tub overlooking the Midtown skyline. I specifically want to thank Stephen Field, the concierge who greeted me on my first day in. Not only did he provide incredible service, but he was extremely friendly, quick in response when I needed to extend my stay (multiple times!) and a pleasure to say hello to every day after work! I know 11th avenue might seem a bit far from the action for people just visiting New York, but I promise you the extra 2 minutes of walking will be worth this remarkable hotel.

title: Very disappointing.  Definitely not a 4.5 star hotel
text: If this hotel were rated properly, I would not have been as disappointed.  To me this is a 2-3 star hotel at best, not a 4.5 star.  We were given a room on the second floor that was under the bar/restaurant.  This would have been fine if you plan to stay up until the bar closes, but if you want to get some sleep before 3 a.m. it was a very poor room. We heard people talking, the blender turning on and off etc.  The next morning we asked to be moved and they told us to pack up, head out for the day and they would move our things between 1:00 and 3:00.  We came back to the room around 3:00 our things were still there.  We had to change clothes so we had to open up our suitcases again, then repack.  We left and returned after 8:00 p.m.  Our bags were still there.  We asked and they said our room was ready so we happily moved our own things.  The room itself was basic.  Once again, not a 4.5 star room.  Very very small, no hooks to hang wet towels,( we hung ours over the lamp), no desk, no chair, extremely small vanity, no place to put our suitcases.  You could put your suitcase next to the bed and not be able to get out of the bed on that side or choose to keep it on the floor by the door so you can't open the door all the way.  We would have put it on the luggage stand, but that would have blocked the only mirror outside of the bathroom.  Once again, this hotel was fine for a 2-3 star, but definitely not a 4.5 star hotel.  The best word I can use to describe this hotel is basic.  If you are looking for nothing special and a very cramped very poorly planned out room design that is loud, then stay at Ink48.  Otherwise, for the price find another hotel.  The roof top bar is very cool, but that's the only good thing I can say about this place.  I would never stay here again and I do not recommend this hotel to anyone looking for something above a 2-3 star hotel.  Extremely disappointed.

title: Beautiful rooms but terrible noice from street.
text:
The rooms is great but the windows are not soundproof. From the 6th floor I heard more from the street than I wanted. Lucky me I had Ear protection with me. For $450 per night I had hope it was better. I stayed four nights at Marriott Chelsea and it's more crowded but it is quiet and a lot cheaper.
The quality at rooms isn't however the same.

title: Wonderful Hotel within Easy Walking Distance to Broadway & Times Square
text: We've never been disappointed staying at a Kimpton property and Ink48 was no exception.  A wonderful hotel in the Hells Kitchen district within easy walking distance to Broadway and Times Square.  The hotel staff was courteous and extremely friendly.  The hotel graciously sent a bottle of champagne to our room when they learned that we were in town celebrating our 25th Wedding Anniversary.  We'll definitely stay here again the next time we're in town!

title: Great hotel all around
text:
My wife and I spent the night in the city to visit the Christmas attractions and enjoy dinner etc...  We stayed at Ink 48 and were very happy with the choice.  The design of the hotel is top notch.  The service is excellent.  Every staff member we encountered could not have been more helpful and professional.  The restaurant and roof top bar add to the attraction. 

The room was large, well appointed and updated, as was the bathroom.  The location is great as well.

Only caveat is that our room faced the street and even on the 10th floor was fairly loud.  The dance club music from nearby was clear until around midnight.  The street traffic, trucks, sirens and garbage pickup in the morning was also fairly loud.  It didn’t ruin the stay by any means but be aware.

title: Xmas Fun in NYC
text: My old home town is a one of a kind and Holiday season is a magical time. Our stay at Ink 48 was wonderful in every way. The hotel is in a perfect location for access to the theater district yet close enough to the Hudson River for beautiful nightly sunset views. The staff is welcoming and knowledgeable. And then there is the secret weapon, concierge Stephen Field. A man with the plan to maximize your access to great seats, great sights, and succulent eats. A consummate professional and a terrific guy. A shout out to America at the front desk as her smiling greeting can make your day. Congratulations GM Nick....you should be proud of your team. Thanks!

title: Amazing and luxury
text: The Kimpton Ink48 saved us from our awful visit to NYC with our first night stay at the Hudson hotel that was nothing less than pitiful. When we walked in, we were greeted by a lovely staff, a concierge available by text, and early check in and a clean and spotless hotel. Such a contrast! The room was gigantic and bathrooms were both modern and clean. They have a cute rooftop bar available with gorgeous views of NYC. Free coffee and wine happy hour were a plus. This is my second stay at a Kimpton and couldn’t be happier plus they are dog friendly! A wonderful stay that made us feel comfortable and located in an area just near to the city but a little away from traffic too!

title: Amazing NYC Stay
text: Amazing hotel! The staff was very friendly. The room was surprisingly big for NYC and CLEAN! The restaurant was great. We had dinner and breakfast and both times on point. We had drinks at the lounge great views and drinks.

title: New York favorite
text: My go-to hotel every time I visit New York. I was delighted to see services and facilities in top form on my recent stay in December 2018. Staff are always warm and welcoming. Rooms are fabulous. Best in room dining breakfast anywhere. And the Hudson River location may change your mind about midtown Manhattan always being a crazy, stressful place. Very much looking forward to my next visit.

title: A gem of a hotel in NYC...
text: Ink48 is the hotel I return to again and again and again when I visit New York because it ticks all the boxes. The rooms well-appointed and impeccably clean, the beds are very comfortable, the staff goes out of their way to help you and the food is outstanding; I LOVE the restaurant. I'm made to feel welcomed back each time I return, so there's no reason to say elsewhere. I love this place.

title: An experience to return to.....
text: An excellent westside location....it's the one hotel you'll experience a warm, inviting and personal welcome.  A staff of graciousness and incredible attention to cleanliness... It's the excellence of hospitality....

title: phenomenal time
text:
i stayed here with my girlfriend before a concert at msg. i called concierge who is the best person at any hotel. stephen field. he provided me with the best recommendations ever. he gave a full breakdown of where to go and what times. also as a spire member i was able to get and upgrade to a hudson suite! 
i will always stay at ink48 when in nyc

title: One of the best Kimpton’s
text: I continue to be impressed by this hotel. The staff has been nothing short of supreme for the last several years of my visits. The general manager is great and has helped me to build relationships with other properties. For me it’s only Kimpton and everybody else after. This is an outstanding property in a great location in the worlds best city!

title: New go-to hotel?
text:
I love Kimpton properties; I stay Kimptons all over the country when I travel. I dig the modern, cool vibe of the brand. After a recent stay at Hotel Eventi, another Kimpton in NYC, I wanted to try a different one. Happened to catch a crazy sale being offered at certain Kimpton properties, including Ink48.
