Especially for the rate I paid (on a Saturday night) I can't get over the value of this place. Regular king room was HUGE (for NYC standards). Vaulted ceilings?! Very bright, very well appointed (not a frequenter of hotel room mini bars but if you are, you won't be disappointed). Impressed with the list of items on the "did you forget these?" list displayed in the bathroom. Ha.

Took advantage of the valet parking -- at $65 plus tax for my SUV I'm sure I could have found a lower rate somewhere else, but you are NOT going to beat the convenience of literally pulling up to the hotel right off the West Side Highway. No stress whatsoever. They say to give them 45 minutes when you need your car at checkout; it took nowhere near that long. All I had to do was inform the front desk that I was ready for my car, and a few minutes later, it was waiting for me outside the hotel doors. 

Bellmen and front desk employees were exceptional. So warm and welcoming. In general, just fantastic hospitality at this property. Love the infused water in the lobby. There was also complimentary coffee and happy hour; we did not partake this time but will on a future visit. 

Did not make it to the restaurant or the rooftop bar on this visit. Really appreciated the fact that they kept hotel guest access and rooftop bar access separate at night (roped off elevator access); felt more secure that way.

One thing I can't get over: there was turn down service. I can't remember the last time I stayed at a hotel in NYC and received turn down service! It was such a pleasant surprise to come "home" to after a long day and night out. #littlethings

I missed the Kimpton "raid the minibar" perk (I usually go for the snacks!) -- this time it was $30 off a spa service. Nice, but who has time on a quick trip to the city for a spa treatment? ;-) Nervous about how the the Kimpton rewards program is evolving since its takeover. We shall see. So far, still a devoted Kimpton-goer.

If you're looking for a stylish, service-oriented hotel away from the typical NYC crazy (which is only about 15-minute walk away), this is the hotel for you.

title: Euro sensibilities, NYC style, wonderful American welcome.
text:
Kimpton is a name we have come to trust for flair, that sense of a European sensibility for comfort and unique room design, and a good NY bar.  You have it all here, and more.  Our first encounter with Stephen Field illustrates the Kimpton draw; a front desk and concierge manager who knows the local places to see and to eat, because he lives in the neighborhood, and his suggestions never let us down.  A small room selection glitch could have been major for us, but without hesitation, he took it in stride, eased concerns and just "got it done" without fuss or drama. Being a busy Christmas season, and fully booked, we didn't old out much hope, but were so grateful when it worked out for us.  I watched him consistently serve many guests; he was kind, patient, and above all, a careful listener to what people really wanted or needed, regardless of the request.  Not to miss the others, the entire staff, from help with the car, the room attendants (who  made it lovely to stay) and the onsite restaurant Print servers all did their part in welcoming us into a GREAT NYC stay. And did I mention the lovely wine hour at 5 pm?  (My only suggestion would be to have SOMETHING to nibble....even if just one thing).  I have stayed many times in NYC for work and play, but haven't found many places that achieve the easy atmosphere of understated luxury, at a great price, This is one of those.

Sadly we only saw the rooftop bar, and did not partake of the cocktails but you will NOT REGRET the view if you go there.  Another hidden perk!

Yes, as others mentioned, there is some noise on 11th Ave, with a lot of construction; but they seem to have soundproofed the lobby, which made it a lot cozier than I thought it would be.  And if you stay in NYC these days you know it is the City of Cranes, and you will likely encounter construction anywhere.  Nothing about this put us off, or made it less enjoyable.   

So, get ready to romp in the city, and come home to a warm, inviting place to rest and relax, in the lobby, in your room, in the bar. Thanks Kimpton!  We'll be back!

title: Front desk makes the boutique hotel extra special
text: When I step into the Ink I feel like I am coming home.  We go every year over Thanksgiving.  The staff is excellent but I have a favorite and it is Stephen Fields.  He is MR NYC.  This year we brought our adult son and he helped us plan some great adventures in the city and fabulous restaurants.  We discovered parts of the city we had never seen, always more to see in NYC.  Anthony, America and Jose are also excellent.  I would never stay anywhere else.

title: Thank you and Special Thanks
text:
Good morning, 

We have returned to the UK following our short stay with you to celebrate Thanksgiving for the first time.

Overall we had an excellent trip taking in the Macy’s Parade, visiting places we’ve previously not seen in NYC and, of course, grabbing a bargain or two to take back home!

The Kimpton Ink48 was recommended to us by our UK travel advisor at Dial-a-Flight and we were looking forward to our stay even though there were some recent negative Trip Advisor reviews regarding the nearby bar/nightclub and reception staff. We deliberately tried to forget these and take a positive attitude, even when we realised on arrival our 6th floor room overlooked the bar. Our check-in on Wednesday 21st after an extremely day was smooth and made us feel very welcome at the hotel. 

Following an evening watching the excellent Jersey Boys show, we returned to our room (608)and realised it was quite noisy but accepted this as being in a City. Also, it wasn’t any different to the volume of sirens and car hooters sounding, 

Having managed to get to sleep around 11pm we were abruptly awoken by the sound of screaming, shouting, fighting and some really colourful language! It was so loud that it sounded like it was only just outside the room, not 6 floors down. We tried to pass this off as a one-off, but some 30 minutes later was just getting louder and was followed by the sound of numerous sirens as police and paramedics arrived. Frankly after a full days travel, enough was enough.

I went to the reception area and spoke with the night receptionist, Mostofe (apologies if incorrect) and explained the issue. We cannot praise his proactive and positive response enough, even considering in moving our room if we would be more disturbed by the elevators. He was a real STAR! Having agreed to move rooms we went back, packed and Mostafe then sent up the bellman with the keycards to the new room (802). We understand the room was an upgrade and was at no extra charge; the bathtub was most welcome after standing and watching the coldest parade ever. Even after making these arrangements and moving at 2am in the morning, Mostafe was inviting us the speak with him if we had any issues and made us aware when he would be working. 

In that interaction, Mostafe displayed an immense level of customer service which reflects in a massive positive light for your company. If we’re honest, before 2am on that morning we would be unlikely to stay, or provide recommendations, to stay in future. However, whilst not wanting to be on that side of the building for future visits, we are talking about a future stay and recommending to family to go stay with you. 

In every other respect we thoroughly enjoyed our stay with you.

If you have an ‘employee of the month’, Mostafe would be our nomination for his handling and understanding of our situation. Thank you again to him and the Kimpton for our stay. We love NYC and shall be back!!

Many thanks

title: The Kimpton magic is in effect here, even in the aural shadow of the noisy club next door
text:
There’s nothing worse than when a good hotel gets stricken by something beyond its control and then remains forever tainted by that unfair association. Such is the case with the otherwise-charming Ink 48 – one of three Kimpton properties in New York City. After stellar stays at the Muse and the Eventi, this was our first time trying out their Hell’s Kitchen location, and in spite of some reviews decrying the noise level (something that has never really bothered me) we wanted to see how this compared. 
With magnificent views (depending on your room) of either the city or the river, the Ink 48, with its printing press theme and elegantly abstract book photos, leaves its mark on each guest. The room was bright and airy, the bed a little bit of heaven, and an extensive cocktail and snack collection as on hand for anyone who wanted such amenities. 
Things sorely beyond the control of management include a very noisy club across the street, which reached decibels that easily rose to our rooms (912 and 914) which kept my husband awake until after 3 AM. Our parents were next door, and were also kept awake through the night, so it wasn’t a case of light sleepers. Kimpton mollified the sleepless night with a slight discount, but anyone looking for a sound slumber may want to check into other room options to find something quieter. 
Despite this one major drawback, the Kimpton magic was in full effect, from the care the employees took to ask at every opportunity whether there was anything else we needed, to their signature wine hour from 5 to 6 PM. Setting this location apart from others is the popular Press Lounge on the 16th floor, where sweeping views of the city may be found when it’s open to the public (there was a private event on the second night we were there, so if the lounge is important to you, be sure to check ahead – and even then it might be booked as they said there were a large number of events held in the space).

title: Belle vue !
text: C’est vrai que les boissons ne sont pas données (comme souvent à New-York!) mais la vue est vraiment super et le bar n’est pas surpeuplé, ce qui fait du bien. Très belle découverte, grâce à des recommandations trouvées sur le net et nous n’avons pas regretté d’y aller, que du contraire !

title: Basically perfect
text: I stay in Kimpton often.  This is a nice one.  Very cool/trendy location.  I had a wonderful room with a nice view.  Reasonably quiet for ny.  The staff was fast and very helpful.  Price is about what you’d expect.

title: Very Nice property
text:
For anyone in midtown west, cruise ships and the massive Hudson Yard build - great location.  Very nice sleeping room and design.  Great bathrooms with some shower and soaking tub and other rooms just shower. The building formerly housed a printing press.  Sturdy and great spaces carved out for the rooms.    
Get specific on room location if you don't like traffic noise.  Front faces 11th Avenue...busy until late night.  
There is also construction next to building....check before you check-in
Fantastic terrace bar - The Press Lounge.  Very good restaurant and 24 hour room-service.

title: NYC Trip
text:
I visited Kimpton Ink48 recently with my sister for a 4 night stay at the end of October. 

After a long journey, the staff at Reception were very welcoming and check in itself was easy. 

Our room wasn’t quite ready but after travelling for nearly 20 hours, what was an additional 39 minutes?

We were given a two queen bed room on the 12th floor with a view that took my breath away. It was even more spectacular at night!

The room was incredibly large and clean with an abundance of fresh towels and toiletries. 

The staff we encountered were very friendly and we experienced a high level of service. 

The nightclub across from our hotel had initially caused me some concern however reception offered a white noise machine and ear plugs.  Neither were required as the noise was minimal and not out of keeping with being in the city that never sleeps!

The hotel is about a twenty minutes walk from Times Square however there are plenty of places to eat and drink nearer to the hotel once the novelty of Times has worn off. 

We didn’t eat at the hotel as we wanted to explore and neither did we use the minibar. $9 for water seemed a little excessive!

We did however take advantage of the free tea and coffee on the morning and the free wine hour between 5-6pm. 

The rooftop terrace is also a must but yes it does get booked for private functions.  If you get a chance to go to the 16th floor, you will understand why it is so popular. 

All in all, a great stay. Well done Kimpton, Ink48 is awesome!

title: Get INKed in NYC!
text:
Nice room, super clean and very professional staff.  Amazing roof top bar, gorgeous views.  During my business trip I became very ill and the staff was kind and professional beyond expectation of any hotel I have stayed in anywhere in the world.  Then my sister went into the hospital and I had to leave quickly.  Opal was outstanding in her consideration of my situation and was very professional and kind every time we spoke.  She made a point to connect me with Ralph (head of security) to send my belonging that I had forgotten in the room to my home. Ralph was professional and prompt.   days later I called  to get my bill sent via email and she ask me about my sister and was so pleasant and thoughtful.  Great from the get go and when it really counted, the staff was amazing. OPAL your fantastic, THANK YOU!
DB

title: Perfect last minute trip to NYC
text: The staff at Ink48 was phenomenal - helpful without being in your business. From the doormen to the front desk staff to housekeeping and the PRINT staff - they were the epitome of customer service stars.  The room was beautiful and comfortable, and though it was by the elevator, it was nice and quiet. They even let me check in early with no hassles after arriving on the red-eye.  It is worth the price to stay at Ink48 - I cannot recommend it highly enough! <3

title: Great Stay at Kimpton Ink48
text:
Great location, great rooms and very helpful staff - highly recommend!
Short distance from Times Square, Central Park and easy access to subway.
Enjoyed the complimentary bikes to ride around Central Park.

title: Perfect pre cruise hotel
text:
My husband and I stayed for one night before our recent cruise. This hotel is located one block away from cruise ship terminal and we walked there in the morning even with all our luggage! 
We had a suite overlooking the cruise ships, and it was fun to watch them come and go. The room was large and very modern and clean. The hotel had a evening complementary wine hour and we had a glass before our dinner. 
The staff was friendly and check in and out was fast. Our room wasn't ready when we arrived, but they took our luggage until it was.
For breakfast we got coffee and breakfast sandwiches from the lobby bar, and then off to the ship.

title: There are far better Kimpton’s out there
text:
Stayed at Ink 48 last week and I have to tell you all in all a very disappointing experience. I don’t know if it’s the new corporate influence but it’s just not the same Kimpton we have learned to love. The staff is not nearly as friendly and outgoing as we have come to enjoy, actually a bit standoffish. The hotel is very nice, rooms are very spacious for a NY hotel, but you also
Pay for it. The part that was most disturbing about the stay was the amount of ambient noise   There is a construction site next to the hotel and they start at 6am and I don’t mean gently. The noise was terrible and very annoying. Given that Ink 48 is off the beaten path you would think otherwise, NOPE think again.

Oh and getting to the roof top bar, forget that. Rented just about every night for some corporate event.  Stayed at this hotel many times and have yet to see this rooftop.

If your going to stay here get a noise discount, hahaha. Good luck with that, no but seriously give it a roll!

title: Second Time Not a Charm
text:
Was excited to return to the Ink48 with my wife after a very satisfying business trip earlier this year.  I opted for an upgrade to a City View Studio King (which are supposed to be floors 6-15), and requested a higher floor.  My room was on the 5th floor, which isn't even supposed to be an option.  Upon arriving in my room, there was a plate of treats and a bottle of wine to welcome someone entirely different.  Our room had  great view of the demolition of the building directly across from us, which you couldn't miss because the noise started promptly at 8:00 each morning.  (Not the hotel's fault, but no advance warning, and rubbed the fact that my request for a higher floor went nowhere.)  Was looking forward to the rooftop bar upon arrival, but it was closed for a private party.  Despite leaving the "privacy" sign up the next day, housekeeping came in and did their thing anyway.  Waited 20 minutes for complimentary coffee station the in lobby to be refilled before just giving up. Food service was slow both in the restaurant for breakfast, and at the walk-up breakfast bar the next day.
I can't reconcile the great first stay that I had with the very disappointing (and much more expensive) second (and last) stay. It's great to be out of the midtown hustle, but not worth the disappointment in almost every other facet.

title: Great hotel for convention centre/female travellers
text: I stayed for my second time whilst attending a trade show. The check in was great and I like the fact that they asked what room I wanted to be in as a woman travelling on my own. The room is clean, bright and comfortable and plenty of space. The food in the restaurant is really good though not cheap. Staff very friendly throughout and using uber I got everywhere I needed to be quickly. Would definitely recommend.

title: Excellent stay
text: We had a great stay at the Kimpton and in particular enjoyed the camaraderie & chats with Josè Colon who was a pleasure to deal with and really helped start our day with advice of where to go! Thank you

title: WOW
text: WOW is all we have to say. The hotel is beautiful and the staff could not have been any nicer. We arrived and the doorman was quick to assist with our bags, at check in we were offered an upgraded room and the room was terrific. We enjoyed the rooftop lounge....with incredible skyline views and enjoyed an outstanding room service breakfast. We cannot wait to visit this property again.

title: It was fine but . . . .
text:
The room was decent sized (by NYC standards) and the location was very good for our purposes BUT there were inconsistencies in the service and some other inconveniences that, for the price paid, won't make me hurry back:

The good:
- staff were very friendly - housekeeping, maintenance, front desk - everyone had a smile ready
- location - it's a pleasant 15-20 minute walk to the theatre district/Broadway
- room size - as I said, NYC is notorious for it's walk-in closet sized rooms - we could have actually swung the legendary cat in this room

The not-so-good:
- had 2 rooms booked, only 1 was ready when we got there (though it was well after check-in time) we checked into the 1 room and provided a cell number for them to call when the 2nd room was ready - after waiting an hour (which was now 1.5 hours passed check-in time), we went down to the desk only to find that the room was, in fact, ready, but no one had called
- room service took an hour (cheese plate and a couple of beers)
- the bathroom door is glass - if you're sharing a room be prepared to hear any noise your roommate makes in the bathroom because the glass provides no sound break
- room fan has 2 speeds - high and higher (no matter what you switch the thermostat to) I switched it to "low" just to get some air circulating and it was blasting down on my daughter's bed so we had to turn it off
- noise - lots of it: street noise - especially when the bar upstairs and across the street closed and everyone spilled out onto the sidewalk below us;  the boats/cruise ships blasts
- staffing - I must have left that hotel 4-5 times in a 3 day period looking for a cab - not once was there someone at the door to help;  not sure where the doormen/women were - maybe they were down a couple of people this weekend  but from the late room readiness (short housekeeping staff?) to the long room service wait (short in-room service staff?) it seems they may have been missing some bodies

Overall, I've paid the same price and had better experiences elsewhere in Midtown.

title: Spacious rooms!
text: The rooms are spacious by regular standards, let alone by NYC standards! It is modern and my room was overlooking the street, not on the river side, but has a nice skyline of New York. The bathroom is spacious as well and overall the too. Very well equipped for a comfortable stay. The breakfast is menu-based and is OK but overpriced for many delicious options around town. The gym was good as well. As far as the location goes, it is nett a walking distance from main touristic or shopping areas, but you get the spacious room on return. You will find bicycles at the lobby that you can lend to move around the city, also a nice add-on.

title: Fabulous Birthday Break
text: This hotel is lovely, from the decor to the service to the room comfort. They couldn’t do enough for us and even had a birthday bottle of wine and chocolates waiting for me on arrival, which was a lovely touch. Wine hour is a great idea and there is fresh coffee waiting in the morning. It was easy to walk to places, with the nearest metro within 10-15 mins walk, it was easy to get around. Loads of great eating places nearby. The views on both the city skyline side and the Hudson River side of the hotel are really spectacular and a drink on the roof bar is a must. Our meal at Print was fabulous, with excellent food. This is so nearly a perfect place to stay but there is one “BUT” and that is the noise. The air conditioning is pretty noisy, although very effective, so just be aware if you’re a light sleeper. There is construction going on opposite so we asked to be moved to the other side of the hotel as it started before 8am and went on until 730pm ish. You’re in NYC so street noise is inevitable but I couldn’t help feeling that a bit of investment in improving sound proofing would turn this into a real 5 star! Other than this, it was a brilliant place to stay and we really enjoyed our few days there.

title: Okay if you don’t want to sleep
text:
We paid almost $1000 for two rooms for one night, Sept. 29, 2018.  Made the reservation via their web site.  Nice enough hotel, but both rooms were inundated with band noise and revelers from a Cantina next door, and their own rooftop bar.  Until 4:30 a.m.! People lined up in the lobby to get into the elevator going to the roof.  We could not sleep!

Also, we overheard a man inquiring at the desk about a room for the night, and he was quoted $172 per night.!?#&  We, of course, feel ripped off with our advance reservation price.

Between being gouged and not getting any sleep, we won’t be back.

title: Ink48 is a true 5 Star Property with SERVICE its TOP priority
text:
AI have stated in many reviews before that I am myself a concierge at a major hotel in NYC.  I have spent 15 years in hospitality and can be a bit of a pain when staying at a hotel in or outside of NYC.  I know what to expect and am always truly excited wne a hotel can meet up to my very high standards.  

 This year I have had some personal reasons that have forced me to stay at hotels in my own city. After going to numerous properties I have truly found my HOME HOTEL.  Kimpton's Ink 48 is by far my favorite property in all of NYC.  The staff, the rooms, the style and the vibe make for a PET FRIENDLY and casual upscale stay.  

With so many superstar employees (Go HR!) it is hard to name a few standouts.  Elijah was the 1st superstar that I met more than 6 months ago when checking into this property.  The day I checked in I had a very traumatic life experience and he went above and beyond to make sure that my stay was perfect.  Besides the amazing upgrade the entire front desk staff asked me daily if I was feeling better and even offered personal help.  It is very tough to be vunerable to people you don't know and as a NYer we find it to be almost tragic to have to need compassion on any level.  The staff here did it in a way where it never felt like pity but they truly cared about my health and well being. 

As life returned to normal I still continued to find a night away at ink48 to be a refresher every busy NYer needs.  I own and run a non-profit theater company for the Make-A-Wish Foundation along with my full time concierge job and am a caretaker for 2 parents in Upstate NY.  A night away in my own city is truly the only vacation I get sometimes.  

After that 1st night my new "family" at Ink48 continues to impress me.  From overnight to evening shifts the staff is honest, respectful,, formal and professional every step of the way.  Naomi in reservations follows up on stays and even texts me to follow up  and confirm reservations.  Gwyan the Front Office Manager is a genuis.  He allows his staff to be successful and gives them the  freedom to grow these relationships and in turn make more business for the property.  

Kimpton should be proud of Ink48. They have created a GEM and I hope it never changes.  

Did I mention the rooms are amazing and spacious and they have a rooftop that's views are the best I have ever seen.  

Bellstand, Room Service, Housekeeping, Security.  All Five Star.  A few properties in the area should take some lessons from the managers and HR at Ink48.  

If you have a choice of where to stay take a chance on this boutique hotel and I promise you will not regret it.

title: Great in some aspects, terrible in others
text:
I have stayed at this hotel twice over the last couple of months - once for three nights and the second time for a period of 11 nights. Some aspects of the hotel are faultless but there is definite room for improvement in other areas.

Upon arrival at this hotel you will be welcomed by very friendly doormen - always happy to help and always very cheerful. Unfortunately, the same cannot be said of the reception staff, who are rather unhelpful and extremely disorganised (more on this later!)

Both rooms I stayed in were clean and modern. If you're here on business some of the rooms aren't great for working in (very tiny tables, and the 'business center' in the hotel seemed to consist of a sofa and a few stools around a table). Additionally some of the rooms face a rather loud bar, with music going on until 3am or so at weekends. As I was so exhausted I was able to sleep through the noise, but I know some others in the hotel really struggled with this.

On my first trip to Ink48 I misplaced a denim jacket. I left this on the rooftop and, despite reporting it to lost property just a couple of hours later, it was not find. I have to take some responsibility here for being careless, but the hotel didn't seem all that willing to assist and I wasn't able to get up to the roof myself because it was closed and then there was a private party (these seem to happen frequently - so don't just expect to be able to visit the rooftop bar whenever you want!)

On my second trip to Ink48 one of my colleagues gave the front desk some extremely important documents, which our boss was to collect at 5.30am the next morning (it was around 11pm when said documents were handed over). Over the course of the next few hours the front desk managed to lose said documents and, in fact, never seemed to find them. These were clearly labelled with 'FAO: Name of person, Room number'. This was hugely inconvenient and stressful for all involved as it meant a number of us re-printing the documents at 5.30am. The hotel didn't ever issue any sort of apology or compensation for the inconvenience caused.

The hotel asks for a guarantee of 100 USD per nights stayed I believe. I put somebody else guarantee on my room (as they did not have the funds immediately available) but specifically asked for this persons room bill to be put on their own card, not mine. Upon checking out the hotel informed my colleague that the bill had been settled. It was only after I got home that I realised a total of 120 GBP or so had been added to my card. This was extremely frustrating and, even more so, as when we challenged the bill it appeared that Ink48 had added on an extra 50 GBP accidentally (we're still not quite sure how!)

Overall, the hotel is a pleasant place and touches like the wine hour are great. However, the overall service is fairly poor and there is definite room for improvement.

title: Impactante
text: Estuvimos unos dias en este hotel las habitaciones confortables, el restaurante muy bueno , para nosotros no economico , en el piso 16 del hotel esta el rooftop , hermoso lugar muy bien ambientado , hay una barra y  con una terraza maravillosa  por la vista increible de la ciudad y del rio hudson y el times square . Vale la pena  era de noche y se veia espectacular.- Es para volver

title: Excellent Option off the Hudson
text:
Just recently stayed 3 nights at the Kimpton for NYCC. Hudson Suite was very nice with fantastic views of the Hudson River.

Only negatives were the small fridge had a slight odor, shower cap was thrown out and not replaced, club across the street was rather loud but not too bad given our room location. 11th ave has lots of traffic due to Lincoln Tunnel so getting a cab is easier by going down to 9th ave. Safe had to be reset.

Print restaurant has a good selection for breakfast, lunch and dinner. Staff was very attentive.

We would stay here again.

title: A Fast Favorite
text:
Stayed at Ink48 for the first time last month and has quickly become one of my favorite hotels in NYC.

The room was bright, clean and large. The view was spectacular and the service was top notch!

The most memorable part of my stay was the special treat of wine and chocolates that I found waiting in my room for me, with a personal note welcoming me to the hotel. After a long and tough day at work, it was exactly what I needed to feel important.

I also appreciated the end of evening text, checking on me and making sure that I didn’t need anything.

Looking forward to my 2nd stay this month and many more to come!

title: Do not stay here
text:
Terrible hotel in the middle of nowhere. No subway for miles. You cannot sleep because of the blazing music in the bar across the road. The music doesn’t stop until 5am and the Kimpton just doesn’t care.. 
Special mention to Kelsey for the worst customer service I have ever experienced in my life. She was rude, abrupt and went out of her way to be unpleasant. The noise was so bad with two small children that we could not sleep at all. The Kimpton’s response was to offer to move us to a different room for 2 days only out of a 9 day stay. So many better hotels to stay in NYC!

title: Great location and fabulous views
text:
Stayed in the Kimpton Ink 48 hotel when in Manhattan recently and it did not disappoint! Yes it is slightly out of the centre and hustle/bustle of Times Square but it was great to be able to escape from there for a calmer evening. Also the hotel is in a great location for 9th Avenue which is restaurant central with some nice smaller, more local restaurants. 

Room was a good size, especially for central New York. Top tip would be to make sure you have a high floor room and ideally one looking out to the front of the building-the view from our room was amazing, both day and night. It almost made you not want to shut the blinds!

There has been some reviews on here mentioning noise from the nearby club. Only one night during our stay did we hear any noise from the club and even then it was only for a brief time, so not a huge issue. 

Wine happy hour is a nice added bonus between 5 and 6 every evening. As well as free tea and coffee each morning. Overall, a really good hotel-just make sure to get a high floor room to fully enjoy the view of the skyline.

title: Don't Skip The Press Room
text: Admittedly, a couple reviews on here had me nervous, but ink48 managed to eliminate those fears by providing the service I've come to know and love from Kimpton. Check-in was a breeze. Our concierge was very friendly, and, to my surprise, happily upgraded our room. The suite was beautiful and spacious; I really can't say enough good things about it. Do yourself a favor and make a pit stop at The Press Room (rooftop bar) for the insane views. Breakfast from Print was good, nothing too fancy, and the neighborhood boasted some great food spots as well. Valet was fast and check-out was painless - great experience.

title: Amazing Room, Space, & Views
text: My husband and I stayed here for three nights while in town for his birthday.  We loved the location.  It was a quick 15 minute walk from the E Train on 50th, which gave us the opportunity to scope out where we would eat and drink while in town.  We loved the neighborhood, and the view from the Press Lounge was insane.  Our room was really spacious; much bigger than we anticipated.  The morning coffee bar was great and the evening wine hour was a nice amenity as well.  There are also bikes for guests to use, and dogs stay free.  We will absolutely stay here again.

title: Top Hotel
text: Super Service, schönes Zimmer mit toller Aussicht in Richtung Hudson River und seitlich auch Times Square, Rooftop Bar empfehlenswert! Die letzte Nacht aufgrund der Fashion Week leider gleich mal doppelt so teuer.

title: Bring your appetite for apologies
text:
We love Kimpton properties, and routinely go out of our way to plan our stay with them when we travel.

This is why Kimpton Ink48 had us baffled from the minute we checked in:

The otherwise polite gentleman at the desk made no mention of our room type as he handed us our key, and seemed to make a point of avoiding any type of eye contact during the exchange.  We soon discovered why.  Our junior suite provided sweeping views of a fleet of Verizon service trucks and little else.

Another visit to the front to desk to ask if we could switch rooms was met with a curt "I'm very sorry.  I do apologize."

No matter, this is a big, beautiful city.  We'll make the best of it, right?

A wonderful birthday dinner and drinks with friends complete with a bouquet of flowers brought back to our suite to enjoy!  A quick call to the concierge to arrange for a vase to keep them was met with a curt reply that this hotel with a bar and restaurant had zero vases in stock along with "I'm very sorry.  I do apologize."  No solution offered, but a pattern was emerging here...

A quick trip up to the top floor to enjoy a drink and take in the view sounded great!  We we met by a gentleman at the ground floor, who could not look up from his phone long enough to tell us that the top floor was closed for the evening, but we did get the now familiar "I'm very sorry.  I do apologize."

By the time our stay had come to an end, we'd had our fill.  The young lady handling our departure asked how our stay was, to which I replied how lovely it had been.  I don't think either one of us could handle any more saccharine apologies.

This place is Kimpton in name only.  Some views might be great, others not so much.  The rooms are adequate, but your experience here clearly appears to be a roll of the dice.  As for us, we'll vote with our feet and enjoy Manhattan elsewhere next time, and would encourage you to do the same!

Please enjoy the pics of our view and our homemade vase fashioned on the spot from a plastic water bottle to spruce things up!  Cheers, Ink48!

title: Views for days!
text:
My boyfriend and fur baby stayed here for 3 nights right before Labor Day weekend and our stay exceeded all our expectations!  I don't know why so many others are giving such harsh reviews because that was not our experience whatsoever.  The first thing to note is so many people are complaining about the noise from the club.  If you are a smart traveler and do your research before spending hundreds if not thousands of dollars on a hotel then you would have read about the noise (which is out of the hotels control) and find another hotel that suits your needs!  Also for those who complained about the location of this hotel you would know that it is about a 15 min to 20 min walk to the subway (from other reviews and gooogle maps) so please stop complaining when you have the choice to book where you want yo stay! We booked this location knowing it was right on the river, away from all the craziness and perfect for Intrepid/Chelsea Piers boating activities and a 15 min taxi ride from the World Trade Observatory. 
Every employee who we encountered were so kind, friendly and attentive to all our needs.  Maybe all these people who give such awful reviews walk around with frowns on their faces all day and who wants to be nice to Scrooge? 
Thanks for the iced coffee every morning, free wine at 5, letting my dog stay for free, spacious rooms (compared to most NY hotels),  spectacular views, comfortable bed, refreshing bath amenities and most importantly the staff who made our stay so hospitable! 
Sumo misses everyone at Ink48!

title: Sad to have spent our anniversary here...
text:
We booked our stay to celebrate our anniversary with our baby. Here's my feedback:
 
1) Receptionist were lovely. He allowed us to check in earlier, and was super friendly with our baby. However, that evening the receptionist seem to have changed and were not as friendly - maybe in the evening, you need to give off the moody vibe lol 

2) I fully respect that we are given rooms that are available, but I called two weeks ahead of time to book a room thats not near the club noise. Our little baby kept waking up. I'm really disappointed that the receptionist did not think of this when checking us in seeing as it is an ongoing problem. 

3) The lobby is always full of people who do not actually stay at the hotel. Waiting to get up to the rooftop was frustrating, and trying to get through the crowds of people was hard, especially trying to get through a throng of young merry people with a stroller. 

4) Loved PRINT. The food was yummy and the service was great. 

5) HATED ROOM SERVICE. We spent $150 for room service as there were 3 of us. I'm not cheap, and was willing to spend that much as we were celebrating. But the food was terrible. It was salty, the chips were burnt and my bread came up soggy. They also did not give any water (which nearly all hotels do). And please do not get me started on our 'cheese plate'. It's embarrassing that they felt this was worthy to be served to people who had pay over $400 on a room and then a further $150 on dinner. Its places like this that make you feel angry - charging people a lot of money for terrible food.

6) There are NO kid friendly channels. Or any good channels for that matter.

7) We got disturbed twice by the maids. Once was at 11.30am (half an hour before check out) whilst I was in the shower. Please, just leave us alone unless we need something. The other time the doorbell woke our baby up. We DID put up the do not disturb. 

8) Bring you own body wash - this brand of wash takes away any bit of moisture may have! 

9) Appreciate the anniversary gift that was given to us - that was a nice touch. 

We had such high hopes here, and we are so sad that we spent a milestone at this hotel. I wish we could go back in time and pick somewhere else...

title: Agréable
text:
Bel hôtel, chambre propre à la déco moderne et literie agréable. La salle de bain est petite, le choix du minibar impressionnant, cafe à disposition dans le lobby. Chambres qui donnent sur la rue bruyantes ,belle vue malgré tout (privilégier les chambres à étage élevé pour limiter le bruit).
Le rooftop est superbe avec une vue à plus de 180 degrés sur Manhattan et l'Hudson. 
Le métro est à 15 mns à pieds tout comme Times square, compter 20 mns pour rejoindre central Park.

title: Club Noise
text:
This used to be one of my favorite NYC hotels.  It has a great rooftop bar (Print) and the view of the city is one of a kind.  The staff was always friendly and accommodating.  However, since the IHG takeover of the Kimpton brand, these hotels have gone downhill in general.  Unfortunately this particular hotel has suffered the same fate.   

Overall the staff is relatively rude and unhelpful.  On the north side of the hotel there is a club across the street which plays incredibly loud music until 4am.  The bass makes it impossible to sleep.  Other patrons I met in the lobby said they were also unable to sleep due to the loud music.  Front desk staff brushed it off as "not our problem".  I live in a city myself, and this noise was like none other I had experienced before.  

So - go for the view.  Don't stay for the hotel.  If you do, try to avoid a room facing North.

It's really too bad IHG ruined Kimpton.  It was such a good hotel chain before!

title: Mixed emotions: suggest you keep looking
text: Let's start with the positives.  This hotel has great décor and an exceptional restaurant and bar (Print).  They offer little extras to guests, such as a complimentary coffee bar in the morning, water with lemon in the lobby and complimentary pre-dinner wine hour.  It's very clean and we felt safe.  Now some of the negatives for you to consider. There is a rooftop bar but you will be lucky to get to use it.  The hotel runs private functions on the rooftop and the entire time we were there it was reserved for others. The rooftop bar seemed to attract a very young crowd, which also generated extra noise, people and sometimes messy drunks.  The hotel is very noisy due to constant sirens and traffic but that may be common in New York (don't know).  My biggest gripe would be the staff.  Unfortunately most seemed to need further training in what hospitality actually means and carried an attitude.  Very pretentious and gave off the vibe that they were doing you a favour by letting you stay in their hotel.  Two exceptions:  Elijah who went out of his way to help us score Broadway tickets and Melissa who was the only person I remember ever smiling.

title: IHG Spire Ambassador Stay Away
text: I think this will be my first and only experience at hotel kimpton. A recap of my experiences. I booked two rooms for a friday night in late august. We arrived at 3am due to a flight delay. Upon checking in, he treated us as if we were sketchy people, ironic because I spend 80+ nights a year with IHG. I asked him if there were any complimentary, he smiled at me and said no- although I checked on my phone and saw that there was availability. He also said, hey it looks like one of your rooms isn't pre-paid I need to run your credit card again- both rooms were prepaid so I asked him if the charge was for incidentals. He said no and kept making me feel like I was wrong. Upon checking into the room I noticed it was not only extremely small relative to NY standards but that the shower had a few hairs that weren't cleaned. It was kind of disgusting considering that is supposed to be a luxury hotel. Furthermore, the AC sounds like a tank and it was impossible to sleep at all- literally the loudest AC I think that I have ever experienced. The next morning when we were planning to check out my GF if they had any lint rollers/anti-static, in the bathroom there was this sheet that said it was one of the items that the front desk offered. So I called house keeping, they said they would get back to me shortly. An hour and half later they responded saying sorry we don't. So much for a listed amenity. Finally upon checking out there was no accountability for any of their wrongdoing, in fact the bellman accused me of loosing my luggage tag, when he had never given me one. I am not one to really write reviews but this experience was beyond terrible.

title: Jekyll and Hyde receptionist
text:
We arrived after a 3 hour train journey from Washington and an hour taxi ride through heavy traffic with my 79 year old mum in tow. We arrived and the receptionist (women with ring through her nose) was abrupt and rude as she said she couldn't find our reservation, that our room wasn't ready and we might be lucky to get a 4th floor room if at all. I really thought she would turn us away until my sister asked her to ring the travel company. Interestingly, I told her that I'd already had email correspondence with the hotel, when they couldn't find the reservation so I had already arranged for the travel  company to ring the hotel and sort it out together with a late check out and I had email proof. I am still bruised from the exchange as I don't think I've met a ruder person in my life.

We returned 3 hours later and it was like a different person was greeting us as she had found our reservation (surprisingly under my mum and my surname, previously given) and that we would have the 14th floor room.

The Print restaurant was awful (separately review). 

The hotel room was small but nice with great views over the river but the location was too far out of the centre so the majority of our time was spent in taxis (and the NY traffic was terrible). If again, I would have stayed at the Four Seasons. Note that the cocktail bar on the roof is separate from the hotel, so I recommend you stay central and only come out to visit the rooftop bar.

title: Excellent Room, Wonderful Views!
text: We stayed here a couple weeks ago and it was just excellent. The bed was comfortable, the staff were attentive and the valet parking was, in spite of the traffic, speedy and courteous. The vibe here is modern and comfortable. The views from the rooftop are hard to find elsewhere and the room was equally as good. Within walking distance to Duane Reed and just about any food you could want the location in Hells Kitchen is perfect for just about anything you want to do. We will definitely stay here again when we visit NYC next!

title: Service client exceptionnel
text:
Service client digne d'un quatre étoile.
Dès notre arrivée, le personnel d'accueil a été attentif, à l'écoute et avait déjà personnalisé notre venue.
A tous les postes, les employés sont aimables, souriants, prêts à vous fournir tout types de renseignements : doorman, concierge, femme de ménage, etc.
Nous avons pris une chambre premium de 37m2 avec une splendide vue sur Manhattan. Chambre très calme de notre côté. Salle de bains spacieuse, lit confortable, bref un sans faute. Faute de temps nous n'avons pas pu accéder au roof top, vraiment bondé le week end.
La station de métro est à 15 minutes de marche de l'établissement, station 50st pour récupérer la ligne C ou E. Ou la station 34st Hudson Yards pour récupérer la ligne 7 qui vous amènera directement à Time Square en 1 arrêt. Il faut prendre en compte ce délai pour vous rendre au métro, surtout si vous avez des enfants car la fatigue des allers-retours 2 fois par jour viendra vite. Privilégiez sinon un taxi toujours présent devant l'hôtel ou un Uber. Le tarif des taxis pour aller de l'aéroport à Manhattan est fixe : 52 $ + extras. 
Hôtel sympathique, expérience positive

title: Spectacular views!
text:
My wife and I stayed here for a couple of nights.  It’s a little off the beaten path but still an easy walk to Times Square.  

The hotel was nice, Kimpton is our favorite brand, but but some of the property was showing a little wear.  The room itself was deluxe- huge by NYC standards. 

We arrived on Friday night so the valet was a little preoccupied as they have a night club on site.  Eventually we got his attention and check in was smooth.  The night was a busy one so lots of street noise, honking horns(it is NYC), people being picked up and dropped off, and construction across the street.  We didn’t hear any noise from the rooftop bar itself or other guests.

The next morning we woke up to a good view.  We stayed on sixth floor and I would recommend staying a little higher up to get better view.  Staff was good to accommodate our request for refrigerator that we could put our snacks in.  The in room safe was very convenient. 

The only food or drinks we had were on the rooftop bar.  The vibe is great.  Romantic and energetic. Service was friendly and the views of the Hudson and City were amazing.  Many professional selfie takers up there and they were fun to watch!!  

There were many types of people staying here but seems like 20-30 somethings would have a perfect stay with the night life and a Bloody Mary the next day on the rooftop bar with a million dollar view. 

I would give Ink48 5 stars but one issue:  We wanted a hot shower after long day of travel but shower controls didn’t work correctly which rendered the shower useless. We used the tub that night but asked for maintenance worker to be sent following morning.  On our way out for the day the next morning, we checked on the issue and were told it was in hand.  Upon our return in the late afternoon we were told that the repair had been completed.  We got up to the room and it hadn’t been touched.  We called down and they said maintenance would be right there.   An hour later we called again and then the repair person was at our door.  He fixed the issue but we never got great pressure out of either the overhead shower or the handheld sprayer.  I don’t think you would have this issue in any other room though.

title: Great hotel except for outside noise
text: We just stayed at Ink 48 for the second time.  We like everything about the Hotel itself.  Rooms are clean and a good size. The out of the way location on the west side we find to be a plus. The Staff is friendly and helpful.  Evening wine hour is another plus.  I definitely would have given this Hotel 5 stars except for a huge noise problem.  Our room overlooked 48th Street and across the street is a club called Cantina Rooftop.  They have a removable roof and the noise from the music was nonstop until 3:30 AM on Saturday night making sleep impossible.  The Hotel was very responsive and told us they have spoken to the club and the Police but the problem continues.  Should you stay at the Ink 48, make sure your room does not overlook 48th.  Until this problem is solved, this Hotel cannot be a 5.  I know they are trying to deal with the problem but anyone who is considering this Hotel should beware.

title: Great Hotel!
text: I stayed there last month and forgot to write a review. We enjoyed our stay and I'd definitely recommend it! All of the staff was very professional, friendly, and helpful; they truly welcome dogs; the location is perfect; and the room, including the bathroom, is a good size and very clean. For some reason, our carpet was very wet in a 1x3' area, but I think it was because it was cleaned and didn't have time to dry. Other than that, everything was great!

title: Huge rooms with fantastic Manhattan views
text: The location of this hotel in an old newspaper print factory on the west side does feel somewhat out of the way to start with but the size of the rooms and the view back to Manhattan more than makes up for it. I also enjoyed the 30 minute walk back to midtown through the brownstone houses each morning grabbing a coffee and croissant. It’s also convenient for getting into the greenline. The open plan bath was also enormous. The roof top bar also has fabulous views and a lively atmosphere. A great choice if you don’t mind the location.

title: Ottimo albergo, in zona tranquilla e vicino a Times Square
text:
Ho appena soggiornato in questo albergo 1 settimana con mia figlia. Si tratta di un ottimo hotel, con costi meno elevati della zona di Times Square pur essendo distante da questa zona solo una decina di minuti a piedi (io avevo prenotato già a gennaio per agosto). Vicino al fiume Hudson, ha camere ampie e confortevoli, un bagno non eccessivamente grande ma con tutto quello che serve. 
Ma l'hotel è ottimo anche perché dispone di un ristorante quotato, il Print e un bar con terrazza veramente bello e molto frequentato anche da persone che non soggiornano in hotel.
Personale gentile e accogliente. Consiglio senz'altro questo hotel e quando sarò di nuovo a NY ci tornerò.

title: Fantastic restaurant and bar!
text: The bar at the top of this hotel - the Press Club is truly wow!  Amazing views and perfect location to take in the city.  Dinner at Print was fantastic, the food was delicious and the service was excellent

title: Kimpton Ink48 is great
text: Kimpton is a very well appointed hotel with a new feel.  Michelin Rated restaurant, amazing 17th floor roof terrace and bar, and fantastic service make this a wonderful place to stay when in NYC.  A bit of a walk from public transit was the only downside for me.  Free coffee in the morning and wine from 5 to 6 each night was a nice plus.

title: Fabulous!!
text: We were going on a cruise and wanted one day in NYC. This hotel was PERFECT!! Fabulous views of the city, an awesome rooftop bar and only 2 blocks from the port. We visited Times Square and went to Hamilton, both of which were about a 15-minute walk from this hotel. You will have to walk through some residential areas (apartment buildings) to get there, but we felt totally safe, even at night. The guy who checked us in even called up to our room when we got up there to make sure we loved the view.

title: Nice room with a view, but a bit far from mass transit
text: My wife and I enjoyed our weekend stay here. We had a nice size room with city view. The room was well laid out and quite comfy. The only issue was there was no desk space, so it would be difficult if you wanted to do some work at a desk. The staff were pleasant. The attached restaurant Print is outstanding and well worth eating at. Around the corner is the Sullivan Street Bakery where you can get some nice baked goods. The coffee and tea in the morning is a nice though twice when we went they were out of coffee. They also serve inexpensive but not offensive wine from 5 to 6. This was quite pleasant. The rooftop bar is famous and a busy place. Do go up there and enjoy the view but skip the overpriced (>$20) cocktails. On the negative side the walls are thin, and we could here TVs in adjacent rooms and whenever people walked in the hall.  The windows are not sound proofed, so you could hear quite a bit of street noise and noise from the rooftop deck. The location is a 10-15min walk away from the subway. One and 2 blocks over on 9th and 10th Ave there are all sorts of bars and restaurants so you can walk to things, but I think you would get tired of the long walk to the subway if you were a tourist there for more than a few days. All told, we would stay here again for a short stay.

title: Definitely didn't feel like a Kimpton
text: I stay in Kimptons all over the world and I have to say, this was not up to the Kimpton name. I was only in town for one day on a business trip and had to change rooms twice because of stains all over the room. I honestly would've changed room a third time if I didn't have to shower and change for my meeting. The hallways were not intuitive. the rooms seemed to be done very cheaply. The stains were on the bedding, the headboard( I don't even want to know) and the chair. Both the rooms they sent us to were handicapped rooms, so my ironing board was about a foot off the ground and everything in the room was extremely low, which was very inconvenient. Ill always be a Kimpton fan, but I won't stay at this one again.

title: I wanted to love it, but I didn't feel the usual Kimpton Love.  3.5 stars
text:
I am a HUGE fan of Kimpton hotels and I generally love them.  I wanted to love Ink48, I really did, but reality fell short of my expectations.  Honestly, I feel like I wasted a LOT of points to stay here.

The location, just a block or so from the Manhattan cruise piers was perfect for my needs.  I was in town to check out a new cruise ship and staying here was a great choice.

I arrived early and didn't expect my room to be ready so I checked my bags and set out to explore for a few hours.  Once I got back, I still waited another hour or more for my room.  Granted, I was upgraded to a nice junior suite with a river view so I was ok with the wait though the staff could have at least given the appearance of being proactive in getting my room ready.  To me, it looked like they were not making an effort to expedite the room and nothing like that was communicated to me, just that the room wasn't ready.

Once I got to the room, it was fine although maybe I expected the junior suite to wow me a little more.  The front of the sofa was ripped, and the tear is very noticeable. One of the overhead lamps seemed to have been turned off at the light bulb as I was not able to find any way to get it to turn on without first jiggling the bulb.  Then it was able to be controlled with the ALL ON/ALL OFF switch.

I was walking around the room barefoot and the carpet in front of the a/c unit was soaked.  That wasn't very pleasant to discover.  As a former housekeeping manager, I notice cleanliness or lack thereof.  My room was clean BUT the bathroom had a lot of dust in corners and some mold in the grout near the bathtub.  Not cool and NOT normal Kimpton standards.

The doors to enter the property are VERY heavy and NOT automatic.  The doormen were often nowhere to be found, or otherwise chatting and not paying attention. Either get more doormen to open these doors for guests, or change the main doors so that they open on their own.  

I wanted to visit the rooftop bar and was able to once it opened but, as a guest, to have to go all the way to the lobby, through the rope line, past 3 burly security people at 4 PM made me want to NOT bother.  I'm glad I made the cut.  Sheesh, I really felt out of place going up to the Press Lounge at 4 PM on a cloudy Sunday afternoon to look around.

Overall I was not really pleased with the staff.  When, after retrieving my luggage after the ship tour, I asked if they had any bottled water, the desk clerk said no, just the cups and water dispensers.  So as I was loading my luggage, I said that I was going to run to the dirty water hot dog cart for some water.  The doorman said, "wait, I'll get you some!"  Obviously, the hotel DOES have bottled water and the desk clerk could have given me one, heck I'd have paid for it too!

I was really NOT happy that the AM coffee service was 45 minutes late.  The solution was for the desk clerk to tell me to go out to some coffee shop.  I didn't want to go out, but I did and $3.50 later I had a coffee.  Really??  It's COFFEE!! It's Kimpton's 'thing' as is wine hour, which they managed to get going only 1 minute late.  Why they were unable to get the coffee ready at 6:30 AM is beyond me.  It's not rocket science.  The hotel is staffed all night.  Make some coffee!

The hotel is rather dark inside and would benefit from brightening the place up.  All of the couches in the lobby have floppy cushions and they've tried to keep them attached by adding velcro.  Well, this doesn't work, nor does having the lobby housekeeper only fluff 2 of 4 cushions on each couch.  That's just being lazy and by the way, it's not nice to get stuck to the velcro.  Back to square one.

I did have a cocktail at the bar, and even though the "bartender" was actually one of the servers, she managed to follow the recipe I had on my phone for a cocktail and it was excellent.  However, if you're going to have a bar open, pay a bartender!  

So, while the Ink48 is a nice hotel in a great location near the pier (and not too far from the train station), I was really not wowed and certainly didn't feel the Kimpton Love. I spent a lot of points to stay here and in hindsight, I should have either paid for the room, or stayed at the Marriott Marquis.

title: Lovely views, excellent staff
text:
Located on 48th and the extreme west side, this hotel is best for people who already know NYC. 

Both the rooftop bar and the lobby level were excellent (and pricey). We had a lovely  uptown view from our room. 

My first stay in a Kimpton. I will definitely be back.

title: Very good hotel but with some issues as a business traveller
text:
This review written from the POV of a business traveller.

This hotel was recently refurbished and the quality of the room is very good. Except, that they've taken out a real desk and proper chair you can work at which I always need to do on a business trip. You have a round stool and round table, like a coffee table instead.

The location is so-so, (except if you want to visit the Intrepid aircraft carrier which is around the corner!). It's not close to the subway, which is fine as we have Uber, but it is the wrong end of town for the airports.

Staff are professional. Coffee / tea in the morning is OK. Evening wine is a poor affair with cheap wine, limited choice, and an area the size of a cupboard to sit in. Slight exaggeration but not much. Wifi and gym are good. AC works well and is quiet.

The top floor has a very large, impressive bar/ restaurant where all the beautiful people of NYC gather at night. It's great, impressive skyline view, but beware can make the lobby area very busy and there is noise you can hear from your room.

Tip, if you want exercise not in the gym, you can walk to the High Line from the hotel and the High Line is a great walk, especially early morning when it is not busy (and cooler in summer).

Overall I recommend this hotel. Quality of room and staff is very good. I think it's a great leisure / vacation hotel for singles / friends or a couple (not family with kids) and would happily return for that. I won't stay here for future business trips.

title: Great hotel, not a great location
text: I am a loyal Kimpton customer and booked this hotel with points and cash. The hotel itself is lovely. Our room was sleek, modern and spotless. The Press Lounge is great for a rooftop view of the city. Drinks are expensive, but that is to be expected. The location of the hotel is not convenient, if you are looking for that. The nearest subway is at least a 10-15 minute walk, but we knew this when we booked. The only complaint I had was that there is a rooftop bar across the street that is open very late and is very loud. Street noise is also loud due to lots of nearby construction. The Intrepid is a block away and that was perhaps the only nearby attraction we enjoyed. We did experience a lack in housekeeping our second night there, as we noticed housekeeping didn't restock our bathroom appropriately. I did call down to guest services, but our request for a bathmat was never fulfilled.All in all, an enjoyable weekend. Just not my favorite location in the city.

title: 旺中帶靜而且舒適的酒店
text:
酒店房間舒適，而且乾淨。雖然不是太近地下鐵站，但是步行也不是太遠，步行至時代廣場只需十幾分鐘。

以舒適度及地點而言，房價算是合理。

title: Loved this hotel
text:
-Our suite was so comfortable and had an amazing view.  -Every morning they offer free coffee and tea, it’s a nice set up too. 
-Every evening they offer a free glass of wine.
-The doormen are so friendly and extrememly helpful (some of them are quite attractive too which made coming and going nice)
-The reception is friendly and prompt. 
-Dog friendly (we had two dogs with us including a yellow lab)

I would return here in a heartbeat. It’s located in a convenient spot but is far enough away from some of the tourist spots that you aren’t bombarded with people or kids running around. Our stay was Friday- Sunday.

title: Not really the Kimpton experience we've been used to
text:
I should preface my comments here by saying, after submitting a post stay survey, the Manager of the hotel has already reached out to me addressing my stay here.

I am a fan of Kimpton hotels.  It's my first choice when planning any destination where these hotels are located.  I chose Ink48 because of its price relative to the other Kimptons in Manhattan.

This is really the first time I have ever stayed at a Kimpton where I felt they had become "corporate" since becoming part of IHG.

I had some initial reservations about booking here due to its location from Times Square, where I knew we were going to be spending most of our time on this trip.  It is a short walk from Times Square, a little less than 20 minutes.  But when it's in the high 80's and low 90's, that walk isn't very pleasant.  Especially if you're dressed a little better than t-shirt and shorts.  But, if you're there for a cruise, I would imagine it's very convenient.

The room was fine.  Not much of view and very very very white.

I have communicated to the management the condition of lobby with empty drinks strewn about and the water pitchers constantly being empty.

The wine hour, a defining Kimpton perk, really didn't seem to be a big deal at this hotel.  with no one there to pour when it began, much less have a smiling face there to do it.

Morning coffee, another Kimpton staple, which you have to go down to the lobby to get, was constantly empty.  It's location also meant that front desk staff had to constantly be informed that the coffee was out.  So there was a wait while someone came and refilled the coffee pots.

To me, there just didn't seem to be the friendly smiling faces with that personal touch that I've come to really appreciate about staying in a Kimpton.

Lot's of folks have had good experiences here so I'm not suggesting this hotel is one you shouldn't consider; however, for my family's stay, they whiffed on our stay.

I have stayed at Hotel Eventi (another Kimpton) and while this one might actually be a little closer to Times Square (if you're there to see shows like we were),my experience there was much better than here.

Not to mention the rooftop bar at Ink48 seemed to have a quirky dress code.  We were actually intimidated about wanting to go up there. And I still don't understand why hotels with that feature don't do more to make it something guests at the hotel can have easier access too.  Not to mention, it's a great place for the wine hour!  My .02 anyway.

Thank you to the Manager for writing me personally when I originally provided my feedback and I truly appreciate the comments made to me.  I hope they have addressed my concerns.

title: Perfect for a pre-cruise (NCL Escape)
text:
Perfect location if you are going on a cruise. We literally walked down the street to the cruise terminal and were checking in within 5 minutes of leaving the hotel

Nice large rooms and nice showers 

Stephen at reception was really great and helped us out with some local recommendations. It’s not located in the prettiest of areas but we always felt safe and it’s not that far from Times Square

Nice to have a free wine hour also

The views from the rooftop bar are amazing. Even though the drink prices are ridiculously expensive ( even for NYC ). The only issue we had was with the guy who was managing the lift up to the rooftop bar. Very rude in his demeanour and approach. He needs to go on a customer service course for sure!

Would recommend

title: Girls Two Day Visit to NYC
text: My friends and I arrived in NYC Monday, we checked into our room.  We went down for wine hour both nights of our nights we stayed at the hotel.   All of the staff we encountered while we stayed there was very nice and professional.  Even when we came back to the hotel soaking wet from a surprise thunderstorm.  They were helping someone at the front desk find a pair of shoes.  I would stay there again if I go back to the city for a visit.

title: Big rooms, great service
text: I always stay at Kimpton hotels when I can because of their excellent customer service and this one was no exception. The rooms are clean, modern and are pretty big for NYC standards. If you join the loyalty program (which is free) you get free internet and a $15 minibar credit. Like other Kimpton locations they welcome pets and provide bikes! This location is far from the subway.

title: Amazing rooms with a view
text:
Being on 11th Avenue and W 48th Street, Kimpton Ink48 is situated slightly outside of what I would consider central Manhattan which sometimes made it difficult to get back to after a day of sight-seeing. Additionally there aren't many subway stops around meaning Ubers and yellow cabs are your best bet for getting to and from the hotel. 

However the hotel itself is beautiful. The rooms are spacious and beautifully designed. The hotel staff are very friendly and accommodating, and it has a rooftop bar which provides amazing views of Manhattan. 

Something which was a little bit tricky is that there isn't a hotel restaurant. There was a restaurant inside the hotel which serves breakfast, lunch and dinner, however this is not owned by the hotel and as such you cannot charge anything to your room. You always have to pay there. 

There is also a nightclub opposite the hotel, so depending on where your room is you might hear some noise from the club.

title: Great Hotel, Great Views
text: Had a wonderful stay at the Kimpton Ink48!  The room was unbelievable in size considering the typical NYC hotel rooms.  Was on the 8th floor with a terrific view of the city on one side and the Hudson on the other.  Not crazy about the area but didn't encounter any issues, not a bad walk to Times Square, restaurants, Broadway shows, etc. The staff was terrific, friendly, welcoming and helpful!  Highly recommend!

title: Great stay in Hell’s Kitcgen
text: Great staff, near Hell’s Kitchen restaurants,  theater district. Took bus to Port Authority and walked to hotel (easy to avoid crowds in Times Square by going up 9th, then west on 42nd, then straight up 11th to hotel). Clean room. Definitely would stay again.

title: Loved this hotel
text: So many great things at this hotel. We spent 9 days at this fine property. First and foremost the professionalism of the staff; Each and every person we encountered was great. The hotel is near both Hells Kitchen, Broadway, Times Square and the Hudson River.  Loved the location. We did visit the rooftop bar one night. The views are amazing and As a hotel guest you have priority access which is a great perk.  If you are considering a stay, you will not be disappointed.

title: Great hotel and wonderful service!
text:
We stayed here for three nights and were extremely impressed.  The staff was always kind and courteous, from the doormen to the clerk to the housekeepers.

The rooms were very clean and spacious.  I did not experience the noise issue that the other reviewers have mentioned other than an occasional ambulance or police car.  Our room was on the 15th floor at the front of the building.  

The city view from our room was spectacular!

title: Chambre + vue = magie !
text: Nous avons eu la chance d’avoir d’une belle offre pour un Cityview King Studio et nous n’avons pas été déçus. La chambre (avec baignoire) était magnifique et vue du 15e étage est à couper le souffle. Tout le personnel a été charmant et même le petit déjeuner était délicieux. Aucune fausse note !

title: BE WARNED OF THE NOISE
text:
Great service, great views! Short walk to time Square. However BE WARNED about the noise. Especially if you are facing North. The rooftop club opposite plays VERY loud music until 4-5AM on Friday and Saturday nights as well as late into the evening on midweek nights.

Also the general City Noise such as sirens can be heard so clearly the Windows may as well not exist. Combined with the AC in the room, which is the noisiest you have ever heard in your life (tornado in the room).... You will not be in for a good night's sleep. It's just a good job the bed is really comfortable.

It's a nice hotel but the noise SERIOUSLY let's it down. Until I heard the repeated noise, this would have been 5 stars, edited to reflect that.

title: Lovely hotel. Great service
text: I stayed in a Hudson River view room and was delighted. I got the particular pillows I requested and was pleased with the efficient, courteous service. The lobby bar was pleasant and the General atmosphere quiet and relaxing. Top quality.

title: Love!
text: This is one of my favorite places to stay in NYC- it's close enough walking distance to restaurants/sights/etc. but out of the fray and craziness of midtown/times square. Rooms are well appointed and very comfortable. Amazing roof top bar with great views of city. Hospitality is top notch. I highly recommend if you don't mind not being in the center of the action.

title: Amazing!
text:
Visited this hotel with my husband as a 4 night break.
This was so important to us as it was the only time we’ve been away on our own, ever. As soon as we checked in the receptionist upgraded us to a room with a view of the Hudson and every morning we watched different ships dock. Roof top bar was excellent! Brilliant location as it was not too close to the hustle and bustle of Times Square yet close enough to walk to on the nice warm evenings. Thank you for making our first trip to New York one to remember!

title: Perfect stay!
text: This room was AWESOME!! In a city where most rooms are the size of a small closet, this room was huge with double ceilings and floor to ceiling windows that had a jaw dropping view! Location is great to walk or Uber most places and the staff is wonderful! Will definitely stay here again!

title: Husband birthday getaway weekend
text:
Ink 48 was such a nice hotel. Great view we had, clean and cozy room. Bed was nice comfortable and room was cool. Bathroom was spacious and clean love the shower head. I had asked for something to be brought in the room for my husband (3 beers and nuts) it was there when we got in the room with the little note I had written. They were on top of and that was great 

All in all we had a great time.

title: Almost perfect
text:
My 13 year old and I stayed here before a cruise. The hotel was extremely nice, well decorated, and the staff were very friendly. We had a room on the 9th floor and honestly it’s one of the nicest places I’ve ever stayed. We had amazing views from our room. The price that we got it for was very reasonable and it’s really the most convenient place to stay as it’s basically across the street from the cruise port. The bar on top of the hotel was fantastic and offered wonderful city views. 
    That being said here is one big problem which in no way is the fault of the hotel. Our room was facing the loud rooftop bar across the street. We didn’t hear any screaming or yelling that I’ve read in other reviews but the base from the sound system kept us up all night. I would definitely stay here again in the cold months when this may not be such an issue or if I was going to the city and planning to be out late myself. It really is a shame because the hotel itself is quite fantastic and beautiful.

title: Lovely experience, charming hotel & staff
text: We stayed one night at INK48 and were impressed with the room, views of city & Hudson River. The staff were all friendly, attentive & helpful. Would highly recommend if staying in the area. We also went to the roof top bar and restaurant, which was perfect because it rained & we didn’t have to leave the hotel at all.

title: Such potential — Too Bad About the NOISE!
text:
We stayed at the Ink48 during a weekend trip to visit friends and go to the theater.  When we arrived, the staff was extremely friendly and welcoming. The lobby vibe was cool and stylish. The view from the rooftop bar was stunning. Our room was well-appointed. Everything seemed perfect — and then night fell and we tried to go to sleep. 

Unfortunately, Ink48 is located very close to a dance club. And at night when the club comes alive, it kills any possibility for guests at Ink48 to fall asleep.

Most hotels in NY City have extra-thick windows which help keep out the city noise. Not Ink48, which has only single-glazed standard windows. We discussed this issue with one of the front desk staff, who told us that they have heard the same complaint about noise all too often. 

We enjoy staying at Kimpton hotels. They offer a higher level of service and style than many chain hotels. But Ink48 has us rethinking this loyalty.  If the owners can’t figure out how to enable their guests to sleep, maybe they should not be in the hotel business.

title: My favourite hotel
text: This is my favourite hotel in New York. The staff are friendly and efficient nothing is too much trouble. The rooms are spacious and spotlessly clean and a joy to sleep. I can't wait to my next visit.

title: Check your credit card and ask for a detailed receipt at check out
text:
This hotel is a bit off the way. It is new and nice overall. The bed are comfortable and the place is clean. The top floor bar has a great view.

If you need a bathtub, there are only available in premium room.

The hotel has bar on the top floor and a restaurant on the ground floor. These property are not linked to the hotel. The top floor bar can not be charged into your room. A ID and a credit are needed to order a drink. 

The hotel front desk share without your consent your personal phone number with the restaurant and unsolicited marketing message to promote the restaurant are sent to your mobile.

If you are an IHG member and using free night, check your credit card you use. The hotel mistakenly double bill the customers. They don't teach out to you to apologize, indicate the issue or correct the error. 

Request a full detailed expenditures bill upon leaving. If you just spent the amount of raiding the bar 15$ and you are told by the agent that is OK at check out, don't believe the agent. Ask for a detailed bill. It will be needed to dispute the additional charge they will ask you.

When calling the front desk and asking for the GM details, be ready for the staff not to provide you the information.

title: LOVED everything about and will stay again in a heartbeat.
text:
Fabulous hotel, easy check in by a lovely man (Elijah).  Easy for cab to pull up and bags to be rolled in etc.  There was someone there to open the door, no one really offered to help with my bags which surprised me a little - but wasn't a problem.

My room was AWESOME.  Worth every cent and was a joy to be in and enjoy.  The bathroom was huge with a separate bath and shower.  Loads of bench space for me to spread out makeup, jewellery etc.  Great hot water pressure too.  Great amenities as well!

The room itself was just gorgeous.  The views over the Hudson to Jersey were stunning.  Watching the ferries and looking out over the air museum a complete treat.  The room was huge with lots of cupboard space to put luggage away.  My only negative, which is not really a big deal at all, was that the minibar didn't have any chocolate without peanuts.  I love chocolate but am allergic to peanuts.  

From 5pm to 6pm there's Happy Hour with free wine or sangria - great wines and the sangria was delicious.  

The rooftop bar is FANTASTIC.  Cocktails are great, I had an easy dinner here one night of a few cocktails and a cheese platter, watching the sun go down and feeling the beautiful summer breeze.

I have been to New York several times (this is actually my second visit just this year) and I have now found a hotel that I will definitely return to.  The area is brilliant.  As it seems to be more up-and-coming still the space in Hell's Kitchen is used for a myriad of things.  One night whilst I walked home (and felt completely safe at all times) I passed the stables for the police horses (I think).  It was interesting have a look into this.  I just hope those poor horses are rotated and don't live their non-working time entirely in concrete stables :-(  On another night I passed a yellow cab depot where cabs not in use lined the streets and were being cleaned etc.
