Gotham Market is just up the road, it's similar to Gansevoort Market in the Meatpacking District.  There are loads of restaurants on 44th and a couple of other nearby streets.  I'm actually really looking forward to my next trip which will be a girls' trip in Spring 2019.

title: Kimpton never disappoints
text: Whether it’s the incredible staff, such as Kelsey at the front desk, or the attention to your needs as a guest, Kimpton hotels are worth every penny. I have stayed in multiple Kimptons and this one does not disappoint. The rooftop lounge was elegant, boasting with panoramic views and delicious cocktails. The room was clean, tastefully decorating with the usual Kimpton boutique flair. I always appreciate the warmth of the lobby and what I believe should be a mandatory happy hour for all guests but alas it is a complimentary happy hour of delicious wine everyday!  You will enjoy every minute of your stay.

title: Fantastic amenities but incredibly noisy
text: I am so conflicted writing this review because on one hand this hotel is fantastic with some great amenities and the biggest rooms we've ever had in New York. We had a corner room on the 8th floor and the views were fantastic, I sat on the window ledge with my morning coffee from the complimentary coffee station in the lobby and took in the incredible city views not granted when you stay right in the heart of midtown. However, the hotel is located right on 11th Avenue and the traffic noise right through the night was crazy! We have stayed on 5th and 7th Avenue before and heard nothing like that. Furthermore, there is an open air rooftop bar directly opposite the hotel and the music goes on to 2AM on the weekends. After that, be prepared for the party goers to scream, shout and laugh their way into the morning for at least another hour. We were still awake at 4AM on Sunday morning without having had a single wink of sleep. I think the sound proofing is incredibly low quality and it is solely this that would stop me returning to this hotel as otherwise, it has everything I need and want for a short NYC break.

title: Most Comfortable Beds!
text: The staff at this hotel make it well worth the stay. Our every request was attended to as quickly as you can imagine. It is within walking distance to the theatre district (15 min) and the harbor, to take a boat to several other key locations such as Statue of Liberty, 9/11 Memorial and other stops along the harbor (5 min to harbor). It is in an older building but updated nicely.

title: Very comfortable and clean but noisy
text:
We enjoyed this hotel and found it very clean and the bed comfortable.  The location was fine for accessing the theater and waterfront.  The people working there were all very pleasant. The only caveat is that at least in the summer it is extremely noisy on the right side of the hotel where the double queen rooms are located.  There is a rooftop bar in the building next door that is rocking at least on Friday, Saturday and Sunday when we were there. We experienced very loud music, as well as people screaming in a fun way.  This lasted past 2 AM.  We first had a room on the 4th floor and complained about the noise so they moved us to the 9th floor. This helped a little bit, but because we needed 2 beds they could not move us to other side of the hotel.  

I would stay here again, but probably not in the summer if I needed a 2 bed room.

title: Nice but noisy.
text: The rooms are small, but typical of NYC.  Nicely appointed, but how about a chair?  Guess not enough room.  Room was bright and white, but no blackout shade.  I guess they wanted style over sleep.  Speaking of which, lots of noise outside beyond typical NYC noise.  Perhaps from the club on the roof of the hotel?  People who enjoy their sleep might want to look elsewhere. Otherwise decent location, good price.

title: Reservations Should Come with this Warning
text:
We love the room and it’s spaciousness and the views even from our fourth floor northwest corner room are outstanding.  The bathroom is huge and the high ceilings are a plus. The bed is comfortable and the room has a cozy feel in spite of feeling large for a NYC regular non-suite hotel space. The coffee station in the morning is among the best I have ever experienced or tasted and the rooftop deck is just about the largest I have been to in NYC with spectacular views. I would recommend you come here ... 

however, allow me to give you some public warnings ahead of time to address the issues that have been well documented on Trip Advisor.  

Had I read the reviews here prior to booking the hotel, we would have either done things differently, or more likely, we would have stayed elsewhere.  

1. The most important thing you should know is that the hotel management is fully aware of the noise and clearly is not doing the following:

A. Notifying hotel guests about the absolute and essential need for earplugs and a sound machine to drown out the chanting, screaming, loud fighting, noisy car leaping/jumping, and clearly and unbelievably raucous intoxicated partiers who exit the nightclub from the 48th Street side.  I was informed by the night auditor that the management calls the nightclub hourly but I saw no one from the club outside to deal with the behavior. Having worked closing shifts from after hours nightclubs myself, what I see lacking here is a security presence for the revelers.  Being aware of the problem and doing nothing about their own safety in the streets makes everyone liable for their well being as well as the ability for anyone to sleep on the lower floors of those on the 48th side of the hotel. I should have done some phone video to show you just how bad the noise is and how unruly the partiers are.  No written review alone can truly prepare you for what you will encounter here. 

B. The only thing management is doing is to apologize after the fact and say they are doing something but they have not been able to accomplish anything since these issues were apparently published starting in 2016. I called tonight and there was nothing the auditor offered to me except to inform the night manager. I called the hotel prior to posting this review because I believe in communicating with a hotel before writing something negative on this site. It’s the same courtesy I would expect were the shoe on the other foot. 

2. Of lesser import, be aware that unless you are taller than us, we are short at 5’4” and 5’5”, you will not be able to reach the shower head to move it because it is super tall. Never have I ever encountered a shower head in my entire life that was placed so high that I could not manage to move the shower head without leaping. It was originally positioned to displace half of the water against the wall.  Who is going to call the front desk once you discover this when you are already wet and naked?  Not I. I chose to use what little athleticism I possess in my middle age to attempt to get water directly on my head. 

3. The management still has not any outside door people, which would be fine for me and for probably most guests who don’t care to have a door person were it not for the heaviest front doors I have ever encountered at a hotel.  They have known about this challenge for their guests for well over 18 months and have not installed lighter doors, or a push button door opening system. Tomorrow morning I will report back if I even see a sign in case someone does not have the ability to get into the hotel on their own. What would someone do if they had mobility issues aside from waiting for a well mannered hotel guest to assist them?

4. Although the Kimpton developers put some excellent features in the building which are quite nice, they have yet to address what I consider non standard windows on the lower floors.  Having lived on the second floor of a NYC condo on 6th Avenue near 23rd, I know what street noise sounds like. And I am comfortable with it. I have been a major city dweller since 1989.  Thing is, these windows at Kimpton Ink48 block nothing short of about 10 decibels and I am not exaggerating. There has been ample time for management to address the sound and it makes me wonder if they do not believe the expense will provide any return on their investment. I think it should improve their guests’ stays and ultimately their return visit rate. 

So there you have it. My warnings about the place coupled with the amazing features of the hotel. If you are fully able, taller than 5’10, comfortable with extremely loud noise, stay in any room at this hotel and not to worry, you will five-star this place in a jiffy. I have to agree with the other posters who notice or mention that they feel this hotel is geared toward the younger or the party set.  Read some of the other observations and you will understand what I mean.  We are 40 and 49 and neither of those. 

My recommendation is only to stay on a floor level above 12 and on the west side of the building facing the Hudson River. My fellow Kimpton Ink48 reviewers are probably right that the higher floors and the west side, mostly if not entirely, remove the biggest problem (the partiers’ noise) and the sole reason I was immensely motivated to write out our frustrations at 4:30 in the morning. 

So, yes. Do stay at this hotel but please heed our warnings. Thank you for reading my review.  I really didn’t enjoy writing this but felt that I had to.

title: Fantastic retreat from a busy city
text: Kimpton Ink is a hidden gem and so peaceful after a day in the city. Rooms are fresh, comfortable and well stocked. Janice our room attendant was fantastic.  Musah the door attendant couldn’t help enough, looking after our luggage and getting a taxi for us to JFK. Beware of the top floor bar very very expensive.  I highly recommend this hotel.

title: Great Service From Eli
text:
Elijah (Eli) checked me into a hotel. Hooked me up with an awesome room with a city view. He followed up with a warm text and even sent a complimentary bottle of rose to my room. Great service. Definitely would recommend someone to stay at this hotel again! 

-Alex

title: First stop on our Honeymoon, absolutely loved this hotel
text:
The perfect hotel for us. Modern, clean and in the perfect location to explore. So close to Times Square, about 15 mins from a metro station. Nice neighborhood with nearby deli's and some fab restaurants all within walking distance. The roof top bar is wonderful, especially as hotel guests get fast-track entry. Amazing, when we see there is a queue of 50 people outside. And the views from up at the bar were fantastic, just set back from the hustle and bustle, the 360 degree night views are the best. 

Hotel reception and staff all lovely. Coffee and water stations in the reception were a great addition. 

Struggle to fault this hotel and would recommend to all.

title: Great press for Kimpton48's Paper
text: Lean, modern and offering beautiful views from its many walls of soaring glass, Kimpton's Ink48 hotel offers a great midtown location just a stone's throw to the river and the cruise line piers. The rooftop lounge offers pricey cocktails that stop your breath at first glance-- from sticker shock-- but the accompanying night time vistas are spectacular. And breakfast or brunch at the hotel's Print restaurant dishes up fantastic and fresh fare, from scrumptious baked goods to some of the best poached egg fare you'll ever have. We all had a great time. Promotions found online made it a bargain by New York comparison, especially given the nice size and well-appointed details of the deluxe king we enjoyed.

title: Kimpton L🖤VE
text:
I've always been a fan of Kimpton hotels because of the wonderful service, the perks, and the staff.
This trip had it's fair share of hiccups, but I don't feel the need to harp on it because the staff handled them so well, I had zero room to complain. Truly appreciate the quality of the service here at Ink48. Everyone from the desk service to the maintenance guy (Sago?). He's great people and the happiest man alive. 😊
Oh, and the rooms are excellent. One of my best stays in NYC ever!!

title: I'd Go Back
text: Nice hotel with large rooms; clean; great location for Hell's Kitchen (and to get away from the masses of tourists elsewhere); good connection to E Subway; rooftop bar.  I would make a couple of tweaks, but overall it's a fine hotel.  Tweak One would be to provide more towels (without having to ask) and Tweak Two would be to somehow add an elevator solely for staff use.  Breakfast at the restaurant is excellent, if not cheap.  Cocktails on the rooftop are also excellent, if amazingly expensive (Tweak Three: pour the entire contents of the shaker into the glass, couldja please?).  Views of city and river from rooftop are fantastic.  Reasonably quiet bedrooms (little door-slamming noise).  Easy walk to theatre district; very easy to Daily Show venue.  Staff are generally polite and accommodating.  If glass-walled bathrooms bother you, then you should know that this hotel has glass-walled bathrooms (frosted glass, but still glass).  Free wine and coffee are both quite tasty.  A good experience.

title: Very Dog Friendly
text: We stayed here this past February for the Westminster dog show and absolutely loved this hotel. I've stayed at hotels around the world with my dog and this one is one of the most dog friendly. There was no pet fee, no limits on pets, door hanger alerts, poop bags, and additional pet amenities. Yet the hotel was still upscale and super clean. The staff was top notch. Can't beat this hotel

title: Don't expect to ever visit the rooftop
text: I had a beautiful corner room with an amazing view.  The room was immaculate and the housekeeping was on point. The location is great. Loved that you could go down to the bar in the morning and get a scone and a latte. Room service is insanely expensive. The rooftop is either booked or so cramped you don't want to be there. You can call down for a keurig for your room.  To sum it up - worth it.

title: Great Property in NYC
text:
In April, my family and I stayed at this property--three rooms in all.  I found it fit aptly within the Kimpton portfolio, which seems, to me, a difficult thing in NYC, where the unique and personal feel of the boutique brand can easily fall short.  To that point, and my only point of criticism during my stay was how at times the front desk staff did not respect the queue and entertained anyone who approached, despite the presence of people in a line.  I experienced this myself.

That criticism does not amount to much in my opinion given the numerous other strengths and positives of the property.  I found the staff friendly and inviting.  The property was maintained beautifully.  The accommodations too, I found surprisingly large, and with appointments I've grown accustomed to with this brand.

Although I reside in NYC, should I need local lodging again, I would definitely consider this property as anyone local or visiting should too.

title: Good location to port.  Can walk to Times Square
text: The benefits for us choosing this hotel were location to port (leaving on cruise next day) and also walking distance to Time Square so we could catch bus tours for our 24 hour visit to NYC.  Bellmen were great and quick with our luggage. Room was nice and modern, nice view of city and the Hudson.

title: Escapade weekend à NYC
text:
Bel hôtel situé à l'ouest de Time Square (Hell's Kitchen) offrant de belle chambres bien rénovées. Le service y est attentionné et courtois. Il est même possible de profiter de la terrasse sur le toit pour y prendre un verre tout en profitant d'une très belle vue sur la Hudson... et Time Square. Il est possible d'y loger à coût raisonnable si vous prenez le temps de chercher sur le WEB 😊

PS cet hôtel est "Pet Friendly"...

title: Spacious room and that view!!!
text:
Overall all a good hotel - the room was very spacious and light and the bed was superb - comfortable (nice and firm) with good quality linen. The air conditioning was exceptionally noisy - it seemed to rattle in our room and took some getting used to, although by the time we’d walked thousands of steps we didn’t mind too much as we were tired out! The bathroom is a little bit of a let down - quite clinical and basic and the shower needed some refurbishment. 

The hotel is in a great position for the many restaurants and bars of Hell’s Kitchen (all of which were brillant!!) and a little more low key and relaxed than the bustle of Times Square!

Oh and the view from the roof top bar.....WOW

title: Amazing View of Port of Manhattan
text: My daughter and I stayed here the night before a cruise out of NYC.  Arrived very early in the morning and they held our luggage.  I had some expensive jewelry that they locked in managers office with no issues.  I had a Hudson River Suite, and I requested the best room to see our cruise ship the Carnival Horizon come into port.  They delivered, and more.  The staff is very attentive.  I was completely surprised based on some  of the reviews.  I got up at 5:15 the morning of our cruise and was able to live stream the ship coming into port from our room.  I would definitely stay here again.

title: hotel review
text: This hotel is worth it.   the sheets were so soft and room was so big and clean.   Once we arrived I got immediate text asking me if needed anything.  of course we forgot some toilet trees so within 5 mins it arrived with smile.  amazing service.   We paid upgrade for city view.  well worth it we even had large soaking tub in room.  wow what great large room with high ceiling.  I am a bite claustrophobic and this room did cause any trouble.  view was spectacular esp at night.   in evening they free wine social from 5-6 p every night.  in am all coffee and tea you want drink fro free and best yet free wi fi and on 16 floor roof top view of city.  We saw best sunset ever and food hotel is 10.  Do worry when book this hotel you love it.  will only return to this hotel.  forgot to say location great and walk to intrepid and good area easy access to everything. anywhere we went was taxi ride only $8 away.

title: Great property in a slightly less busy neighborhood
text: Excellent rooms and attentive staff made our 9 day stay wonderful. Great location within easy reach of tourist destinations but quieter area. Nice little restaurants within 10 minutes walk. Larger King room with soaking tub was perfect for a longer stay.

title: Fantastic Service
text: Just returned from staying 4 nights at Kimpton Ink48 and could'nt fault it.  We had two rooms on the 12th floor with fantastic views of the city and the river.  As it was our daughters 16th and 18th birthdays while visiting we got back on our second night to find champagne buckets and glasses with a bottle of non-alco drink and a cake in each room for them, such a lovely touch.  Everybody who worked there was cheerful and helpful.  Would definately recommend and stay again.  Thank you!!

title: Very nive
text: Very pleased with the service, staff and accommodations. The room was clean, bed comfy, nice decor. The Rooftop bar is also nice. The location was perfect for us. Not too noisy, we were able to sleep without issue. We would revisit.

title: Attention to Detail
text: I've read a number of reviews rating this hotel less than perfect.  I fear that a few of them hinge on things that are "New York being New York" rather than the quality of the hotel itself.  Every hotel in the city suffers from street noise.  I should know, I've stayed at almost 50 of them over the last 7 years.  The hotel is also a converted warehouse...which invariably poses some challenges.  What distinguishes this hotel from all of those others are the little things.  The coffee in the lobby in the morning and water/wine in the evening.  Getting a text message from the front desk within a few minutes of getting to my room to make sure that everything is in order and asking if I need anything.  Continued follow up over my stay, whether in person or by text.   Requests for things like a toothbrush or extra towels took moments and were delivered with a smile rather than the feeling that it was an inconvenience.  Add this to the location in a great part of the city with restaurants for every taste, the west end of the theater district and the Intrepid museum, one can't help but feel very immersed in what makes New York City the destination it is.

title: If you can't get morning coffee service right
text: Overpriced. No AC last night of stay. Manager should have apologized. If you cannot get coffee service in AM...what can you get right? Would never stay again. Supposed to be the hip place. Kimpton no longer an option.

title: Room with a View
text: Wow.. what a beautiful hotel!! Our room was overlooking both the city and the Hudson River - it was absolutely spectacular. The staff at reception were beyond friendly and were more than happy to help us with questions from a broken zip to how to order takeaway to the hotel. Our only issue would be the doormen - they didn’t help us once, even when lugging round heavy suitcases they didn’t offer to open the doors. We did witness them open the doors once and this was when a “celebrity” came into the hotel and they were on hand straight away! The drinks on the rooftop were quite expensive but I wouldn’t really expect anything less in a New York. Aside from that, it was amazing and I would definitely visit again.

title: Excelente Rooftop
text: Buen ambiente. Buena deco. Excelente vista. Te ofrecen mantas tejidas para el frío. Vista al Hudson. Buenos tragos. Es un poco más cara pero vale la pena visitarla. Fue la que ma se nos gustó. Está más alejada pero lo vale.

title: Really wanted to love this hotel
text:
... but the street noise and very loud a/c will likely keep us away. Sad, as we normally really like the Kimpton Hotels. 
The breakfast bar part of the hotel has excellent coffee, juices and croissants, however. 
The rooftop deck is quite spectacular, but with genuinely crummy, indifferent service.

title: Honeymooners
text:
I am a travel agent and chose The Ink48 hotels because of it's location and style which fit my honeymooners requests perfectly. 

The contact I had with Akil, the concierge Coordinator was fantastic and I know he did everything he could to make my customers stay a memorable one and they sent me messages whilst there saying how beautiful it was.

Thank you Ink48 and especially Akil, I will certainly be recommending you to my future customers.

title: Hudson view? Raucous club noise!
text:
I have been a loyal Ink48 customer for awhile. But my most recent stay will be my last. I arrived at 8 pm, tired from a journey from Europe. The front desk attendant was surprised to find that the room I was slated to occupy had never been vacated. Odd that they only discovered this at 8 pm. He offered me a free upgrade to a suite, and a $150 credit, which I reluctantly accepted as it had a river view and I much preferred the city view. But alas no city view rooms, so I took what I could get.

The trouble was that the river view rooms are over a raucous outdoor nightclub. Saturday night the party went to 5:08 am (yes, I was counting the minutes of lost sleep). The night manager comped my room for one night.

The staff did what they could as bad things occurred -- free upgrade, house credit, comped room. The problem was really mismanagement -- room inventory control failed and there was some tolerance of a noisy neighbor known to disturb their guests. All in all making for an unpleasant stay. 
 
So thanks to the Ink48 staff for a good ride over the years. But so long to a mismanaged hotel. Sorry IHG, you've somehow lost the old Kimpton touch.

And to future customers, avoid the river views unless you like a night full of thumping music and loud DJs.

title: A series of unfortunate issues
text:
My husband and I spent two nights at the Ink48 last week. The lobby and room decor are beautiful. We both slept well, and found the chairs in our room comfortable too. We also appreciated the decor and had a very nice (if pricey) breakfast in Print, which is a lovely space.  

That said, we experienced several issues during our stay that left us both less than happy with the hotel and unlikely to return, particularly given the cost ($400-plus per night). We are normally fans of Kimpton hotels, but this one didn't deliver.

The doorman was only sporadically available, and when he was there, held the door open barely enough to squeeze a suitcase through, rather than making it easy for guests to enter. We held the door for others numerous times when he wasn't there. 

The maid service was really spotty — dirty drinking glasses were not removed, bathmat was not replaced, toilet cleaner was left in the toilet.

Heat from the enclosed minibar left the snacks and drinks atop the bar very warm to the touch — not a big deal for Oreos, but surely not good for the small bottles of alcohol, left to slow-roast for who knows how long. 

The roomy walk-in shower had only one small soap dish, which was not nearly big enough to hold soap, shampoo, conditioner, etc. With plenty of space, why not make it easier for people to put the items they need while showering within reach? Do the people who design hotel bathrooms ever attempt to use them? 

Finally, the doorman who had promised to have a ride waiting for us at 3 p.m. did not, and had apparently misunderstood the conversation. This delay mean my husband had to run a meeting via conference call en route to the airport, rather than in a lounge at the airport -- not ideal.

We mentioned the housekeeping and minibar issues when checking out, and the person at the desk removed the charges for a couple of minibar items, but didn't offer anything else and didn't really seem to care. 

All in all, we were both disappointed in this hotel, and in their response to our issues. We've had better stays at the Residence Inn just south of Central Park, also an easy walk to the theatre district, and will likely return there on our next visit. Unless you have a compelling reason to stay in Hell's Kitchen, I would steer clear.

title: Best NYC Walk-to Theater Hotel!
text: If you're looking for a hotel within a mile or so walk of NY's theaters but away from the Times Square hustle & bustle, you cannot do better than the Ink48.  The neighborhood is safe and charming and the walk to the theaters (we attended Beautiful at the Sondheim) was simple and easy.  The hotel itself is outstanding -- very large rooms for NY, excellent staff and service, and a nice lobby bar as well as a very sweet rooftop bar that's a great happy hour venue.  In short, stay here, you won't be disappointed!

title: Es-pec-ta-cu-lar!
text:
Esta ubicado en el piso 16 del hotel del mismo nombre. Antes de subir al ascensor se debe presentar identificación, pues prohibidos los menores de edad. 
El lugar es hermoso, ambientado y decorado con buen gusto. Al ingresar hay un salón con la barra y sillones, luego, a un costado derecho otro lugar semi-cerrado que permite el acceso a la terraza descubierta, con muebles de rattan, muy chill out, decoración minimalista, sobria y de buen gusto. Hay un espejo de agua (como mini piscina) y una hoguera para sentarse alrededor. La noche que fui con mi hija (adulta) hacía mucho frío. El bar ofrece mantas(divinas) de lana para el exterior y de peluche para el interior. Con respecto al idioma había un par de camareras que hablaban español sin inconvenientes. Las vistas son espectaculares: hacia un lado está la ciudad (a tan solo 4 cuadras largas y a la altura de times square) y del otro lado se observan el Hudson y New Jersey, y si coinciden con la puesta del sol, es un espectáculo total.
Hay que ir bien vestidos (no de etiqueta!) pero también he observado chicas en zapatillas.
Con respecto al precio, quizás sea elevado para nosotros (aprox u$s12 +tax una cerveza) pero es muy lindo y valió la pena, al menos como cierre de despedida de la ciudad.
Para personas con movilidad reducida es accesible.

title: Restaurant avec accès au rooftop
text: Cadre agréable (un peu bruyant pour avoir de bonnes conversations), vins surprenants, assiette dans l’air du temps, très bonne cuisine et sanitaires propres. En prime, accès prioritaire au bar lounge sur le toit avec vue panoramique. A faire !

title: Enchanted
text:
First time: crush! The reception and bar are gorgeous.
Service and staff super efficient and smily. Tool is a delight and a surprise when entering . Long room , very ample and super comfortable . The decor is perfect. Will definitively com back. 
Food from the restaurant was also delicious

title: Would have gotten 5 Stars but doormen were terrible
text: Klimpton Ink48. Hotel was excellent and the location very good, especially if taking or returning from a cruise. They have free coffee in the morning until 9:00am, which was not long enough, especially giving the price for the hotel. We enjoyed their happy hour and met some other guests. Personnel from housekeeping to front desk to the person pouring wine were excellent. EXCEPT for doorman, who always seemed to be fooling around, busy chatting with each other, not paying attention to anyone trying to come in to hotel or leave hotel. This poor old man struggled with the door, and I went over to help when I was waiting for my husband to check out, while these two doorman were into their own conversion. This was NOT an isolated situation….I watched several as I waited for my husband, and then remembered struggling with the door myself when we checked in the previous morning.  The doormen use their body to open only one of the doors vs using the door handle, so there was not that much room to pass through, especially with luggage. I saw so many people delayed and hindered by them.

title: Great Service with a smile!
text: I travel a lot to NYC, and love staying at the Ink 48 -- and that is because I am always greeted with a Smile by Stephen! He remembers me, welcomes me back, is super helpful and ensures my stay is going well in his personal follow-up. Enjoy my stay always and looking forward to my return!

title: Great Staff, major misconnect in management & promises made & not kept
text:
We were 4 friends that stayed here across from the cruise ship terminal to watch the fireworks for the Christening events after our world cruise.  When we originally booked we were assured by the hotel that the roof top patio would be open for the fireworks viewing at their beautiful rooftop bar.  

Upon check in, they stated that instead it would open up at 930pm instead.  Okay fine, thats not what we were told when web booked, but we will work around it even though thats cutting it close.

So we made our dinner plans accordingly elsewhere and then returned promptly as hotel suite guests at 9:30pm to go up to the rooftop to watch the fireworks show.   Upon arriving back - once again, they changed their mind again and said their 'outside' group extended another hour which caused us to miss the fireworks show and the primary reason for booking this hotel venue for the events!!!

We were told by the front desk manager that they are not in control of what happens on the rooftop, which makes no sense.   It really is very troubling they advertise something as an amenity of the hotel yet they can not honor their words or statements to hotel guests.  Extremely misleading. 

What did we do wrong we ask ourselves?  We provided our credit card, they swiped it - took our money and did not deliver the product we purchased.

Also disappointing was the functionality and layout of the suite bathrooms - very unusual, showers difficult to use/controls not user friendly and they need to be renovated.

title: Bel hôtel dans un quartier calme mais proche de tout
text:
Nous avions choisi une chambre "king-size premier" avec vue sur la ville. La chambre était très spacieuse, bien aménagée, avec en effet une très jolie vue. Oui, il y a du bruit, même en étage élevé mais c'est toujours le cas à New-York ! La localisation est idéale : le quartier est calme mais l'hôtel est bien situé, en face du Gotham Market et à quelques pas de la très animée 9ème avenue qui propose des dizaines et dizaines de restaurants. Time Square se rejoint facilement à pied également.
Mon seul regret : être venue pendant les fêtes et donc ne pas avoir pu profiter du rooftop, décrit comme incroyable, car il était privatisé presque tous les soirs. Une information à demander en amont !

title: excellent!
text:
staying in hudson suite and it's just excellent.
hotel is very attentive and meeting every need i have and request.
Thehudson suite is facing river and it's jut beautiful. please give it a try when you stay in NYC especially if meeting at Javits Center like me. it's on 11 ave a little further from center midtown area of mantattan but the sunset view by river side is unforgettable and makes it worth it. by the way did i mention they have a great rooftop bar?!! as a IHG member i also was given spa credit for in room spa. it's highly recommended and i will come back again when i come to NYC

title: Excellent stay
text:
My wife and my parents stayed for 1 night for a friend’s wedding that was held in the Press Lounge upstairs.

Check in/out was really easy and lobby staff were very welcoming. They even moved my parents room, without being prompted, when the noise from nightclub over the road was a little much for them.

Kimpton Hotel’s ‘Wine Happy Hour’ from 5-6p is always great as well.

title: Rooftop bar is everything
text: The rooftop bar is worth the somewhat inconvenient location if you don't happen to be staying here. Reflecting pool in one spot, fireplace in another, plants all around, it is a very nice setting. Small wine selection leaned toward the sweet side but paired nicely with the salumi plate we had.

title: Birthday weekend
text: Very nice hotel with an incredible staff! The beds and bedding very comfy. The bathroom was very large for NYC. Food was delicious. Views beautiful location close to everything. Elijah at front desk was so nice and helpful the entire staff made the hotel welcoming. My only complaint is I picked the hotel for the roof top bar because being summer thought it would be great to have Birthday drinks up there and enjoying the view. The hotel rented it for a private function on Friday night and the guests were not allowed to use it. Unfortunately the Hotel has no say in this bc the rooftop is owned by someone else so it can happen at anytime and there is no way of planning around it 😞 The GM felt bad but nothing he could do. I am not sure I would stay there again because I pick hotels with amenities and I was disappointed because their website really mislead me to think I had a great outdoor space to visit at night and take in the beautiful view.

title: A VERY cool Hotel
text:
Although I only stated one night, my experience will surely bring me back SOON!  I didn’t experience much outside of my room, because I strictly went there to get some much needed rest before a big morning this morning. But...it felt like an apartment. This suite was spacious, comfortable, and the process of checking in, valeting my car & checking out was so swift!
My favorite part of the room was the huge bathtub, the very comfy robes, and the vast variety of items in the bar! Their food was great too!

title: Lovely Stay in a good location
text:
Lovely hotel - very modern and has everything you would usually expect in this standard of hotel. The views from the bar upstairs are stunning, and those staying in the hotel have priority access, skipping the queue in the hotel lobby and going straight up. Be prepared for very pricey drinks upstairs though!

The wine hour was a nice addition and we enjoyed having that time at the end of a day's sightseeing to relax before we dressed for dinner. Free coffee and tea in the morning again a nice touch, but it was a shame that the quality of these drinks was so poor. 
We had both dinner and breakfast once in the hotel during our stay, both were lovely, lots of healthy options. 

Rooms are spacious with excellent views and an incredibly well-stocked mini bar with lots of snack options, soft drinks, 'pleasure pack', as well as liquor, and the location is very easy - 15min walk to Times Square, 10min walk to the Hudson River pier for water taxi/boat trips etc. Taxis were available readily outside the hotel entrance, which was handy when it was very wet.

The biggest let down for me was that one of the lifts was also used as a service lift to the kitchens. This meant that on several occasions we got in the lift (dressed for dinner/cocktails) and then found ourselves sharing the lift with the large industrial rubbish bin/trash can. It was smelly - of fish, and dirty. I understand that with one lift now serving the rooftop bar they are trying to maximise lift usage for customers, but it was not a pleasant experience and there must be a way to ensure that if a lift is being used for service it is out of operation for customers?

title: Did not disappoint
text: We always try to stay at a Kimpton when we travel due to their amenities and the friendly staff.  This one did not disappoint! When we checked in they originally placed us on the 3rd floor, with no view.  We contacted the front desk and without hesitation, they placed us in a similar room on the 15th floor. The city view was amazing!  All of the staff members here were very polite and helpful. Great hotel!

title: Enjoyable stay
text: We liked this very much. Room clean and spacious and serviced promptly each day. Good city views from 7 th floor. Small problem with blind resolved in 2 hours. Liked the style of the hotel and reception staff, bar staff and concierges very pleasant. Found bar prices pretty steep which put us off from lingering since there are plenty of alterantives in the area. Tiny complaint. Lift buttons really dark and hard to see when coming in off the street. Couldn't they be illuminated?

title: Centrico y moderno
text: Me gusto mucho este hotel! la vista es hermosa desde la habitacion  y tambien tiene una terraza con un louge... hace que no quieras salir del Hotel, el restaurante se ve bueno pero no lo comimos. Lo recomiendo por el precio y la ubicacion... lo unico malo es que hay caminar un poquito para llegar al metro.

title: Nice stay -- a bit of a scene
text:
We stayed here for one night in a studio king room.  The room itself was lovely.  The only negative was that the mini bar fridge did not keep things cold enough.  We notified the front desk and they deliver a separate fridge. 

The hotel itself is a bit of a "scene".  There is a popular rooftop bar that results in lines of people outside and a lot of young scantily clad people in the lobby.   There was also a wedding party in the hotel three night we stayed there, and they were very very loud in the lobby.  

Overall, it was a fine stay, but we would probably pick something a bit quieter and more chill next time we are in New York.

title: Short stay
text: Just in town to see a Broadway way show and wanted to be away from Times Square tourist mayhem but an easy walk to theatres. Excellent facilities with quality restaurant. There is also a fabulous rooftop all weather rooftop bar which we visited first night. Guest get priority access.Room was large with separate bath and king bed. Easy walk to lots of nearby restaurants and of course our show. Used Uber to get downtown to World Trade Centre and walked back .hotel offer complimentary wine tastings in afternoon free papers in morning and also coffee next to reception.  Lovely stay in a good hotel.

title: Heerlijke plek waar vandaan je New York kunt ontdekken.
text:
Dit hotel ligt vlakbij de oevers van de Hudson. Heb je er wat geld voor over dan kun je een kamer boeken met uitzicht op de Hudson. Die hadden wij en we vonden het de moeite waard. Het was een prachtige kamer met een heerlijke zithoek; in de middag even heerlijk uitrusten en genieten van het uitzicht, om dan vervolgens weer de deur uit te gaan. De bedden waren prima en boden ook dat heerlijke uitzicht.
Het is een modern hotel met de mogelijkheid om te ontbijten en/of dineren. Boven op het dak is de press lounge, een hippe bar met dakterras. Wij hebben er even gekeken en het uitzicht over Manhattan is prachtig. ‘s Middags om 17.00 uur wordt er beneden wijn geschonken, aangeboden door het hotel. De checkout time is riant 12.00 uur!
Vanaf het hotel is het 15 á 20 minuten lopen naar Time Square. Wanneer je via 6th street richting Time Square loopt kom je allerlei leuke restaurantjes tegen.

title: A Really Great Boutique Hotel!
text:
Went for a spur of the moment Broadway shows in NYC for the first time.  Overall its a beautiful hotel and between excellent amenities and location (walking distance from downtown time square and Broadway but far enough that your away from the lights and people) I'd recommend staying there.

Room - I had a king bed with a standard room. The room was large and spacious with high ceilings and very clean which is important to me. The aestetic is very modern and 'zen' throughout the hotel and that includes the room - they have really great calming spaces.  I find this can be difficult to find at a good price point in NYC Manhattan but Ink48 offers that.  The Bathroom was great as well with more amenities than one would need.  The only downer was the stand up shower size...its a bit small.

Restaurants / Food - I'm a huge fan of fresh food and what I realized was that while I was searching for great spots for delicious food in Manhattan, my hotel actually had some really great options.  Although  bit pricey, I had a few meals and they were delicious... I still remember my breakfast! So if it's pouring rain out and you don't want to leave the hotel, you can stay and eat in the restaurant. 

The Press Lounge is their rooftop Lounge and I have to say it provides some of the best ambiance and views of the city. Again pricey if you want to buy a drink (average 25$) but in the end its to be expected as you are staying at a basically 5 star hotel.  

Service - What I appreciated was that they do not charge a 'resort fee' witch many 4/4.5/5 stars in Manhattan do.  As there are so many places to eat and not to mention a great bakery down on 47th street, you wouldn't need a resort fee.  As well, they provide complimentary coffee & tea.

Ultimately, the staff make the stay memorable.  The men and women who are at the front desk ensure that you are having a wonderful stay...the service is 5 stars in my opinion and the staff and guests are diverse and it makes me feel at home... especially since when I usually go to 4.5/ 5 star resorts the guest don't really tend to look like me.

Overall A+

title: Another amazing Kimton stay
text: Had the most amazing stay last night! Robert and Akil and the rest of the staff took great care of us, and were more than accommodating to any questions or requests that we had. Will definitely recommend this hotel to anyone looking to have a great stay.

title: Gem of a Hotel
text: Great room; great view; personable and friendly staff!  We enjoyed a delicious breakfast, too.  Attended a private event at Print which was great fun.  Loved the large outdoor deck and seating areas.  Will visit again!

title: Great rooms, terrible service recovery
text:
Stayed for birthday weekend. Had a great jr. suite on 6th floor. 2 of three nights, our room smelled like marijuana from adjacent rooms. Also, if you stay on a weekend, avoid the 48th street side of the hotel at all costs. The noise from the night clubs is intolerable—we could make out the lyrics from songs at 2:00 am. Not the hotel’s fault, but something they could have warned us about given that the manager told us it’s an ongoing problem.
My biggest issue is the way management dealt with our complaint about marijuana smoke and noise. There was never an apology. Yes, we didn’t ask to change rooms at 2:00 am; no one in their right mind would. The problem I had was that management didn’t seem to care what they could do to apologize and recover; rather, the manager on duty at checkout only cared about negotiating compensation. This is a huge letdown as compensation should alway can me after asking, “How can I help?” This manager just wanted us to go away. We will always discourage family and friends from visiting this hotel in the future unless something changes.

title: Great hotel and exellent customer service
text: Booked a staycation here and was very pleased with the hotel, restaurant print and the staff. Hotel guests skip the line fro the beautiful rooftop. Elijah was especially accommodating during our stay. Will definitely come back.

title: Get away
text: This had been my husbands and I first time to this hotel. From the moment we arrived till we left it was an extremely pleasant stay!! They handled my many questions and request with professionalism and effectiveness. The room was well equipped, clean and spacious. Conveniently had a lounge and restaurant.... After checking out of our room the next day they even kept our car in valet and cared for our many items so that my husband and I could go see some sites for 3 hours in the afternoon.... I will most definitely be back!!

title: Maravilhoso!!!
text: Imperdível!!! Toda às vezes que vou a NY não deixo de ir a um happy hour neste rooftop incrível, além do atendimento impecável, ver a cidade no final da tarde iluminada não tem preço!!! Não deixem de ir, vale muito a pena!!!

title: Great Hotel Until The End
text: The hotel is great and as an IHG frequent user throughout Europe this was one of the reasons for choosing this hotel for our 5 night stay. Ink48 is in a great position in Hells Kitchen with a lovely restaurant and roof top bar which is not part of the hotel but you have use of these facilities. The room was great with a view over the Hudson and all the staff are helpful and friendly. However the lasting memory of what should have been a glowing review was having to get changed in the public toilet ready for a 6 hour flight. I asked if we could keep the room as we were leaving at 4pm and as the temperature was high 80s wanted a shower before leaving for the airport. I asked again at reception if there was a place for us to shower and offered to pay for this. The receptionist "Americas" was unhelpful and rude. She just said we can get changed in a toilet. I asked if we could change in the spa and was told abruptly No we don't allow that. Having spent a lot of money on this hotel and I was not expecting a shower room for free I was left disappointed at the response I got. It just shows how one poor action can taint an overall opinion.

title: Excellent hotel - lovely rooms
text:
We arrived in NYC to a lot of snow and general chaos, and were warmly welcomed. The desk staff were great, and the room was an excellent standard - clean and bright and unlike a lot of hotels in NYC we had a good amount of space. 

We ate in the restaurant for breakfast and one evening meal - for the latter you need to book as we’re unable to get a table another night. The food was great - my one reservation was the lack of flexibility when feeding my children. You had to have what was on the menu, which if you don’t offer a children’s menu we couldn’t tailor items to their needs. Otherwise the food was very good.

title: Top Hotel
text:
Das Hotel liegt super mitten in Midtown. Nur 10m zum Times Square. Gute Gegend mit netten Bars und Restaurants. 
Das Frühstück ist für amerikanische Verhältnisse richtig gut und bezahlbar. Wir würden jederzeit wieder hierher kommen. 

Zimmer top, super Aussicht, super concierge Service!

title: Christmas in NYC
text: I have stayed at the INK48 many times on business and I am never disappointed.  They always take good care of their Inner Circle members and this visit was no exception.  I was able to enjoy the holiday festivities while also working.  The hotel staff as usual was friendly and helpful, including Roger who helped locate a package that was sent ahead of time that got misplaced prior to my arrival.  He and the concierge were able to locate the package quickly that needed for a meeting.  As long as work keeps sending me to NYC, I will be stating at the INK48

title: Rooftop bar met mooiste uitzicht over skyline
text: Deze rooftop bar heeft een schitterend uitzicht over de skyline van NY. Onze dochter van 20 mocht er tot 18:00 uur in, dus hou rekening met de leeftijd van 21 jaar om naar boven te mogen en neem je ID mee! De drankjes zijn vreselijk duur maar wel volgens Amerikaanse begrippen. Ze zijn er (Amerikaans) vriendelijk en een uurtje op het dak is lang genoeg om de sfeer te proeven. Er staan lekker bankjes binnen met dekentjes en kussentjes en buiten zijn er sta tafels en wat bankjes. De loungemuziek is erg aangenaam.

title: Million dollar views
text: This may be my new favorite hotel in NYC. We enjoy Kimpton properties and we were attending an event near this property. We arrived late on Friday (actually early Saturday). In spite of the late arrival, we were greeted warmly. Check in was prompt and efficient. We went up to our room and we were shocked. It was large, especially by New York standards, high ceilings and incredible views of the city. We stayed through Sunday and really enjoyed the property. We had a very nice breakfast in the hotel restaurant and enjoyed the slightly less crowded neighborhood. (Pro-tip: there is a very nice grocery/market about 1 1/2 blocks south of the hotel on the east side of 11th street). Great place for provisions or a quick grab and go snack.). We look forward to staying here again.

title: Great place to stay
text: We very much enjoyed our stay at the Ink48. Three of us shared a junior suite. It was spacious and lovely, with a great view of the river. The bathroom was very large and very clean. The staff were friendly, accommodating and helpful. Great rooftop bar. The location is an easy walk to Times Square and the High Line. We look forward to returning.

title: Worst Night of Sleep
text: I just came back from spending a night at the Ink48 Hotel. The hotel has a very cool lobby and the room was beautiful. The room was very specious for a Manhattan hotel. The reason for the poor review was the noise that came from the club next store to the hotel, Stage 48. The music from the club was heard in my hotel room and the noise was outrageous the noise continued when the people from the club spilled into the street at 4AM. I complained to the girl at the front desk and she apologized but it would have been nice to be forewarned before checking into the room. It was the worse night sleep, ever! Beware and ask to stay on the side of the hotel away from the club. It was a very expensive room and I was hoping for a nicer experience.

title: Awsome très bien et pet friendly
text:
Bel hôtel au goût du jour, personnel sympathique avec une belle vue sur la rivière Hudon et une magnifique terrasse. Le stationnement est dispendieux $65 US par nuit. Le restaurant est très bon. Et votre chien est bienvenue. 

Very nice hôtel, employees are friendly. Nice view on the hudson river and à beautiful terasse. The parking is expensive $65 US per night. The restaurant is very good. Your pet is welcome.

title: Girls’ Overnight
text:
For our third annual girls’ overnight, I suggested to my girlfriend that we stay uptown and advocated for a Kimpton hotel, given my recent familiarity with this “boutiquey” hotel chain. It feels young, sophisticated and edgy, with complimentary happy hour and a very friendly pet policy (not that I had my pet with me but I am partial to hotels that are  welcoming to furry members). 

I selected INK48 in particular because of its proximity to the theater district yet a tad removed from all the hustle and bustle and easy access to the Lincoln tunnel and West Side Highway for our separate journeys into and out of the city.  

The lobby was modern and sleek, and our room was very spacious with high ceilings and tall windows and easily accommodated our two very comfortable queen size beds.  The bathroom was also a smart layout with opaque doors to allow for additional light yet give privacy. I could not have been happier. 

I have only given four instead of a five star rating because of the following two reasons. At no point during our stay did a door man (person) hold open a door for us, including when we each entered with our luggage,  when we returned to our hotel at midnight or when we checked out. Second, while I chose to park my car on my own in a garage on 10th Avenue (at a significant discount from valet), my friend used valet. Because she arrived around 4 pm, traffic starts to build up leading to the tunnel on 11th Avenue and she had difficult pulling her car over for valet to take her car.  She also learned that the hotel parks car in a garage on 8th Avenue — quite a distance away. Word to the wise, but call at least a half hour or 45 minutes before you need your car. 

Despite these two not so insignificant criticisms, I would still stay at this hotel again, with the hope that my comments will be taken into consideration. 

Finally, we had breakfast downstairs at Print before checking out and enjoyed a lovely and relaxing breakfast.

title: Great hotel
text: Stayed a night to take a cruise the next day...very comfortable room and close to the cruise terminal.  The rooftop lounge gave a great of the city.  The room was quiet and had a very comfy bed.  We ate a light breakfast before heading to the terminal...

title: So many positives, a few major issues
text:
I celebrated my birthday with a coast-to-coast trip spanning 7 different Kimpton hotels.  As an Inner Circle member, I’ve fallen in love with Kimpton’s trademark “ridiculously personal service” and beautiful properties.   The Ink48 has so many wonderful things going for it, however a few major issues still leave much to be desired.  

I had three separate stays at the Ink48 in February.  The first stay was a pure delight.  America, a friendly and professional front desk clerk, checked me in and happily answered all the questions I had about the property and the neighborhood.  I hope management reads this and commends her for the high quality customer service she offers.  Due to my Inner Circle status, I was given a gorgeous upgrade to the Hudson River suite as well as a stellar welcome amenity with all my favorites.  Everything about this first stay was perfect!  Spotlessly clean housekeeping and all staff members I interacted with were helpful and pleasant.  Check out was as smooth and pleasant as check-in.  

I then spent a few nights at the Hotel Eventi, another Kimpton property, which was a delight!  I returned to the Ink48 for a one night stay and that’s when things took a turn for the worse.  I checked in with America, who was very pleasant once again.  I was given an upgraded room (no suite but still beautiful!) and a welcome amenity.  

The problems started at approximately 7:15 AM the following morning when there was extremely loud renovation/construction noise and people talking.  I look through my door’s peephole and I see maintenance workers and a ladder!  I call down for earplugs and I’m told that they don’t have any.  I was up working till 4:00 AM and was looking forward to sleeping in.  Since it was only a one night stay booked on awards points, requesting a room change for essentially a couple of hours would be silly and wasteful.  In summary, getting a restful sleep when staying at any hotel is not too much to expect.  This was a complete waste of valuable points.  When checking out, I mentioned what happened and I was given a quick apology but nothing more.  

Just as I’m walking out the door, I get a call from my boss telling me that I need to stay in NYC another night.  I book another room at the Ink48 on my IHG app and this time the stay went somewhat better.  I was given an upgrade to a Studio Spa room and another seamless check-in.  When I entered my new room, there was an overwhelmingly strong smell of cleaning fluid.  The maid must’ve just finished servicing the room.  It was so strong that I had to open the window as wide as I could.  Because it was February, it was frigid outside so I had to crank the heater to help balance the temperature.  The only other issue with this room was that the sink was not thoroughly cleaned.  Nothing too major but not up to Kimpton standards! 

I sent an email to the hotel outlining the above but received no reply.  In the rare case that something goes wrong, I generally always like to address issues privately first.  Not getting any reply was a bit of a disappointment.

In summary, I stay at A LOT of Kimpton hotels so I’m quite aware with the brand’s standards.  My visits to the Ink48 in previous years were just as great as the first stay covered in this review.  The latter two experiences combined with the lack of email reply, however, made me a bit concerned.  I am fond of this hotel and it’s many lovely aspects and staff members.  I just hope that they can work out a few issues and be even better.

title: NYC's little secret GEM... Shhhh! It's literally the BEST hotel in NYC
text:
I stumbled upon this hotel one evening while enjoying a night in the city and immediately fell in love with it. I work in NYC, however live in the Westchester suburbs so when I needed to overnight in the city the following week I didn’t hesitate to book a room. My experience at the Ink48 Hotel was absolutely amazing. Every single thing blew me away. The service from the ENTIRE staff was beyond incredible. Upon check-in I was warmly greeted by Elijah who was so pleasant and welcoming. Check in was easy breezy – less than 5 mins. 

OK, the room. I was completely and utterly BLOWN away - by EVERYTHING! I can go on about the height of the ceilings and the beautiful color combos, the lighting, and that breath-taking, pristine view of NYC. But what made it that much more spectacular was the phone call I received from Elijah to ensure it met my expectations and THAT! That is something you cannot put a price. Later that evening I wanted to take pictures in the beautiful lobby and Mostafa at the front desk so graciously offered to take them and took as many photos as I wanted – that’s a big deal. I ended up having an extended conversation with him where he filled me in on the Kimpton properties in other cities. One of the most humble human beings I’ve ever met!

I really can’t wait to go back to my ‘home away from home’ as they’ve befittingly coined it. The staff and the ambiance made the experience magical. As a service provider myself, I am aware of what it takes to ensure clients/guests are rendered service that meets and surpasses expectations and I can say that I was thoroughly blown away with this experience.

title: Another wonderful stay at Ink48
text: I just love this hotel. The location is great, the rooms  are beautiful, sleek, and comfortable. Immaculate housekeeping, efficient and delicious in room dining, super friendly check in service. This stay was about as close to perfect as they come. I could make this my go to hotel in NYC easily.

title: A Welcome Break from the Crazy
text:
Spent two great nights at the property while traveling on business. Like all Kimptons, this property had a clean, cool vibe to it. It feels fresh and new, and as many other reviewers have mentioned, the staff is exceptionally pleasant. There was nothing to complain about and plenty to return for.  My big hits here were the fact that the rooms are a little larger than the typical NYC Utility Closet style rooms, and those rooms were very comfortable.  While Hell's Kitchen is about a 10-15 minute walk from Times Square, that's what I loved about it.  It has a slower, more relaxed pace (for NYC), and if you can walk for 5 minutes, you have numerous dining choices.

It's not a great business hotel - my room didn't have a desk, and breakfast doesn't start until 7:00 AM - not great if you have to get going early as I did.  Despite those two drawbacks, I'd return in a heartbeat.

Yes, drinks and food are expensive - especially at the rooftop bar. If you're going to New York and are trying to save money - just stay home. Nothing is cheap.

title: Wowed the family during a vacation to NY
text:
I often use Kimpton Hotels for business and am honestly usually running in and out with meetings, dinners and events already scheduled before I leave home. So when I recently spent time with my family visiting NY as a tourist, it was such a joy to realize how knowledgeable, helpful staff can enhance a stay. The Ink48 in the Hell's Kitchen neighborhood was a surprisingly good location for all we chose to do. A short walk or uber got us in the direction of plays, great restaurants, and the sights. However, it was the encyclopedic knowledge of the concierge Stephen Field that made the deep impression. On vacation, having the luxury to ask about restaurants, play choices or jazz club ideas, I was stunned by the wealth of Stephen's expertise. And he treated us as though we were VIPs. Additionally, America (Soccer mom) and Nick the general manager added to our feeling at home far away from home. We will be back very soon.

Rooms are gorgeous and quiet and lobby relaxing. A view of the river is peaceful and a respite from the bustle outside the hotel.

title: Loved this place!
text: From the incredibly helpful and personable front desk staff (Thanks SO much Stephen Field, Concierge extraordinare!), the friendly cleaners ... basically everybody went out of their way to be nice and welcoming.  The room was spacious and the beds very comfortable.  Loved the big shower, nice shampoos and comfy towels.  Welcomed with a bottle of wine and a personal note - which we didn’t manage to finish - as we also enjoyed the daily free wine hour (again, with personable and welcoming staff) - which provided opportunity for hotel guests to mingle - a very nice touch.  Also loved not having a coffee maker in my room (although we certainly could have had one) - as this encouraged people to get up and enjoy coffee (or great teas) in the lounge - where you could also read the paper.  Altogether, one of the most pleasant weeks I’ve ever spent in a hotel.  Oh - and forgot to mention - the incredible views from their amazing rooftop bar/lounge.

title: Close to...
text: This is a great hotel close to the Javits Center and really close to the Intrepid museum. It was only a $10 uber from Gran Central and walking distance to Times Square. We had a nice clean room on the 8th floor. And even though we were near the elevators we didn’t hear them. Road noise and sirens throughout the night did keep me up until I turned on my white noise app on my phone and used my travel speaker. Both things I’d recommend if you are a light sleeper. The bed and pillows were very comfortable and we had a great view!

title: Nuit d’enfer
text: Nous avons détesté cet hôtel!!! Nous avons payé 325$ CAD pour une nuit avec l’impression que notre choix serait extraordinaire. Il était tout sauf ça!!! A l’ouverture du club d’en face nous avions l’impression qu’il était dans la chambre, bruit infernale!!! Les fenêtres coulaient, beaucoup de poussière en arrière des lits Quand nous avons demandé de changer de chambre, ils nous ont offert une chambre à un lit eeeeeeee nous avions notre fils de presque 6 pieds avec nous ou allait il dormir!!! C’est certain qu’à ce prix avec une chambre dans ces conditions plus jamais. Nous aurions dû être remboursé!!!!

title: Wonderful Stay Again
text: We love Kimpton properties, and this may be the very best.  First the staff, welcoming and not stuffy; then the decor, distinct and stylish without being over the top; then the rooms, well laid out with good views, good bathrooms, good amenities; and finally some excellent drinking and dining options.

title: GREAT Stay in the Big Apple
text:
Had a wonderful three-day, two-night stay in early February 2018 in the New York City Kimpton Ink48 Hotel; it is the closest hotel to the Manhattan Cruise terminal that I was headed to. When my ship came in, it was visible from the hotel’s roof (Thank you, Mr. Manager for taking me up there early my last morning with you so I could get a shot of the ship before I embarked.) and, of course, the top floors of the hotel were visible from the top deck of the ship.
.
I had arrived a few days before my departure date to make sure I didn't miss the boat and to have an opportunity to see some of the Big Apple, especially the 911 Memorial and Museum, a world-class exhibit. Everyone should visit it.
.
This was my first time as a tourist here with time to see something. I am particularly grateful to Concierge America who checked me in early into a great room the day I arrived and who gave me excellent advice over the next two days on where to eat (The restaurant in the hotel was her good counsel--I had great dinners there twice), what to see in town and how to get there. Who knew taxis would be cheaper than Uber? Thank you, Miss America. She is a great hotelier in the grand tradition of that honorable and ancient profession.
.
Valet Jesus was also a great person to meet, not only taking charge of my car and returning it when I needed it back to drive the last mile to the dock, but also with giving good advice about the area as we repeatedly walked by his station at the front door. He also got us a great cab ride downtown in a flash.  His estimate of how long it would take to get to the Memorial was spot on. Thank you, Mr. Jesus.
.
Both nights I took advantage of free wine at the hotel happy hour. Thank you, Miss Generous-pour Sommelier. Unfortunately, this potable magic elixir is not portable: it could not be carried into the restaurant as the eatery is run separately from the hotel. I find this policy short-sighted. Why would Print risk alienating diners over a few sips of wine just as you are opening and your waitstaff is anxiously waiting for someone to serve in order to start earning their pay? Not to mention giving potential customers time to reconsider and possibly walk out the door altogether never to return.
.
This is only an issue when you are opening up for dinner and your dining room is empty as the wine flows freely in the hotel back lobby for a very limited time in the very early evening. A more forward-leaning policy might be to pour the errant wine into your distinctive glasses at the table. You’ll secure the diners that you may have lost and you will make your customers extremely happy as they will think that they are getting away with something. Not that anyone on your staff did anything like that for two clueless bumpkins from the distant burgs the first night they were there.
.
My room in the hotel was great; everything was perfect, with a spectacular view--I couldn't stop staring out the big window. Maid service was excellent. Friendliest room staff I’ve ever met, the morning team and the evening team on my floor. The room did lack a mini-fridge and a microwave, which I've come to expect in lesser hotels; but, since this was New York City, I took it as the local normal.
.
I had stayed in a Kimpton hotel near Boston a dozen or more years ago for a wedding. I remember well the wedding but not too much about the hotel. Which means everything went well. Great hotels, like Kimptons, should be unobtrusive and supportive of your purpose for staying in a bed away from home. This one did that in spades. Thank you, Kimpton, for near perfection.

I look very much forward to returning here next time I sail from Manhattan. It would be great to see you here, too, and, if we are lucky, America and Jesus will be there to greet us with a smile and take care of our every need. Wine at four in the lobby and dinner in Print at five, okay?

title: A very nice property with very friendly people
text: We stayed there while in town on business. We got a very good rate; as with all hotels in the city, rates very dramatically depending on what's going on. The people are very friendly. The hotel is pet-friendly, with no charge for the pet. They put us in a room out of the main traffic flow in case our dog barks (doesn't). the room was very spacious by NYC standards, well appointed and clean, with a nice bathroom and nice shower. There is a mini-bar, but no real refrigerator. They offer valet parking - for us it was $75/day, which is expensive, but self-parking lots in the area are $60-$65, so not that bad. Very attentive and friendly staff. The rooftop bar is spectacular, not cheap, but it has to be one of the best in the city. It seems like a really good value to us.

title: Where everyone knows your name. My go to hotel!
text:
No, I am not talking about that place. I am talking about Kimpton INK48. Words cannot express how much I love this hotel!  The staff is exceptional, especially Stephen at the Concierge desk.  I am greeted with a smile and a welcome back and yes, they always remember who I am and my name.  I thought it was because I was an Inner Circle member but I have seen everyone who visit treated with kindness and excellent customer service.

As a New Yorker and one who travels a lot, it is my go to for all of my staycations. It has a cool vibe, great food and a rooftop views to die for.  I don’t think I have ever had a bad room and believe me, I think I have stayed in them all!  My favorite is the Hudson Suites (make sure you request that). Perfect for couples or families with a separate bedroom and pull out couch and great views of the Hudson River.  River views not your thing, that’s OK, request a room with the views of Times Square. It amazes me every time I see that view.

Some may think that the hotel is too far being in Hell’s Kitchen. It is really not. I kind of like that it is not in the middle of everything. There is a bus right outside of the hotel that can take you downtown and along the way, you can take a crosstown bus and of course there are taxis readily available.

I have mixed feeling giving this review because I want to keep this gem to myself. But as they say, sharing is caring so on your next trip, make sure to  give INK48 a try!

title: Great Property, Great Staff
text: Stayed here several times and enjoyed here stay. Seemingly, out of the way of things, but is just blocks from subway, theaters and dining. Plus, when my son was there on his own, they took great care.

title: I always stay at Kimpton Ink48 Hotel when traveling to NYC for business
text: The hotel is in a great location with great views of the city - but that is not why I stay here. I stay here because the customer service is top-notch and I feel they always go above and beyond and when out of town on a business trip, they really do make you feel at home. While the entire staff is incredible, Stephen Field, the Concierge and Front Desk, is just amazing! He has gone above and beyond so many times for various things I've needed assistance with - he keeps you updated every step of the way, and is obvious that he truly cares and is invested in the satisfaction of every customer. Looking forward to my next stay there this upcoming week!

title: A week in Hell’s Kitchen
text: My wife and I love staying at Kimpton Hotels when in the US and this was the first since the acquisition by IHG, so we wanted to see if they still maintained their unique character. Ink48 did it well. We stayed here 8 nights. Great hotel, we paid for the ‘standby’ upgrade and got a corner room. For a hotel in Manhattan, this had large rooms and was very light and airy with large windows on two sides. Because it’s down on 11th Ave, it was away from other tall buildings, so wasn’t overlooked and this helped with the light. We had views over the Hudson and towards midtown/uptown. Location was great and close to 9th Ave, where In Hell’s Kitchen, there are plenty of restaurants. If you are not that Mobile, the walk to the nearest subway station on 50th and 8th, is a bit of a hike(approx 15 minutes with traffic lights) but 46th, 47th, 48th, etc are full of 8nteresting cafes and bars and we were happy to walk a lot. 17 mins or so to most theatres, 15 or so mins to the start of the high line at Hudson yards. There is a bus stop virtually outside the hotel. The rooftop bar is fantastic, if a little pricey and not run by the hotel, so you can’t charge to the room. In the evening, they lock out 2 of the 4 elevators for the bar, so getting to/from your room in the remain8ng two can take a while. The restaurant was great, we ate breakfast there once and dinner. Also a bit pricey, but food was good and service great. Of course, the Kimpton wine hour was its usual great self, although the area for it was a bit small and people moved into the main lobby as well. As I said, rooms were great. One complaint about the room, was that whilst the room was air conditioned/heated, the bathroom was freezing cold and we were there during a spring snow storm, so if you need the bathroom in the night, rug up. The gym was a little small and had no windows, but was useable with new equipment.  One other minor thing was that the front doors were heavy and It seemed that the doormen were always “too busy” to actually help us with the heavy door.they were pretty consistent with this over 8 days...probably too cold to stand outside and help with the outer doors.   All in all, enjoyable and I’d stay here again in a heartbeat....by the way. Thanks for the complimentary bottle of bubbly for my wife’s significant (let’s call it 30th😀) Birthday.

title: Nice hotel but they didn't honor my reservation
text:
I originally was going to stay at the Holiday Inn, but the skyline view pictures from Ink48 enticed me, so I splurged. I paid extra for the King Premier room, which according to the hotel website is on floors 6-15. This was for a special "treat yourself" trip and I daydreamed about eating room service while looking out at the skyline. 

When I got there they told me I'd be on the 3rd floor. I expressed that I paid a higher rate for a higher floor room and the attendant told me that they don't divide by floor anymore. I said that the website still does divide my room. She told me that they didn't have any higher floor rooms available. I still was charged the higher rate.

I wish I still had my picture of it, but my room literally faced a plain car show room wall. 

Other than that, the room was very nice, and the room service was delicious. But don't come here if you're hoping for a view, and definitely don't pay extra for a higher room floor. Even more annoyingly I completed the survey the manager sent me, and in the survey I indicated disappointment about the reservation not being honored. I gave them time to respond before writing a review, but that was 10 days ago and I never received a response. They just don't seem that they care. The website still says King Premiere is floors 6+ by the way.

title: Ink 48 is a prime location
text: Whrenever we want to stay on the west side of NYC we go to Ink48. It is a classy boutique hotel which thrives on great service. We recently stayed and got a nice upgrade which was awesome. The staff is super friendly and goes out of their way to please.

title: My new fav NYC hotel
text:
Love this hotel!  Room: Very large by NYC standards.  Very, very clean.  Bed, sheets & pillows are nice.  (Disclaimer I had a very tiny stain on my sheets but they changed them). Bathroom is fantastic, very large with separate shower & Deep soaking tub.  My room view was amazing.

Rooftop:One of the perks, view is one of the best.

Location:Just ok, you have to walk to Hell’s Kitchen to find anything...however if you have a uber budget don’t let the location deter you as the hotel is great.

title: Nice place
text:
This hotel was actually recommended by a local who attends the hotel for work events. I loved the location, we could walk to Rockefeller Center. A cab from Penn station is about $10 and (not within walking distance) but near by. I've never traveled alone and I felt comfortable walking the area alone.

The hotel was clean, I use a chlorox to wipe down stuff when I stay at hotels, nothing was on it after I wiped handles down. The view from the 11th floor was amazing, a bit noisy but it's NYC so I was fine with it.

Tip for breakfast, if you don't want to eat at the hotel, there's an amazing deli across the street on the corner. For a bagel and small black coffee was only $2. The guys are really friendly!

The rooftop bar has amazing views! But the music is like lobby music, slow and sleepy. We were yawning (11pm) and everyone in there was too. It's dark too so it doesn't help. I can see not having club music but something a bit more upbeat (maybe even some 80's?) would've kept us there longer ie- buying more drinks.

title: Everything was spotless
text: Great room, great décor, wanted for nothing, packed with accoutrements, friendly staff, accommodating concierge, efficient valet and bellhops, great bars and restaurant, highly recommend. Beautiful hotel in manhattan with a suberb overlook of the Hudson. Give it a stay, you wont be disappointed.

title: Great Cruise Port Hotel
text: If you are cruising from the Manhattan Cruise Terminal and just want a place to stay overnight, this hotel is a great choice. The rooms are updated and spacious and there is a great indoor/outdoor rooftop bar. In addition, there food options around the hotel with delivery options as well. The next morning we were are able to wheel our four pieces of luggage the one block to the Cruise Terminal with ease.

title: Business or Pleasure
text: Highly recommend Ink48.  Extremely friendly & professional from pulling up to valet, to checking out.  Beautiful, classy interior.  relaxing atmosphere with an awesome restaurant & a rooftop lounge.  Very affordable price.

title: Great spot to stay in NYC, close to everything but feels removed hustle and bustle of midtown
text: I'd stay here again - great hotel and room. Great customer service, staff was excellent all around. Awesome bars and restaurants in hell's kitchen, walkable to everything: times square, MSG, 5th ave, rockefeller center, etc. We were going to a game at MSG which is why we stayed here, definitely would recommend as opposed to staying right in midtown.

title: Een aanrader op East-Side
text:
Tweede keer dat ik hier ben geweest. Hoop er nog eens terug te komen. Neem een kamer als tourist op 12-17e etage met uitzicht op Hudson. Kamers vind ik perfect, ook hier prima matrassen.
Zeer vriendelijke balie , je loopt snel centrum, Broadway in . Voor cameraliefhebbers B&H camera’s op kwartier lopen. Redelijke eettenten in de omgeving.
Dit hotel heeft beperkt ontbijt, de oat porridge is perfect.
Ik was hier voor Columbia Celiac Centre meeting. 
Wat mij betreft ook prima uitvalsplek voor puur toeristisch bezoek.

title: The greatest concierge experience ever
text:
Firstly a little about the hotel. For New York the rooms are amazingly spacious. Modern, updated decor throughout and a great atmosphere. Very comfortable beds. The rooftop bar is to die for, gorgeous views with glass windows, you feel as if you're really in the heart of the city with all the lights.  

But for us the real highlight was Stephen at the Front Desk. I've stayed in many many wonderful hotels, and Stephen provided me with the best service I've ever experienced in any of them. After an amazingly smooth check in, Stephen discovered we were going to the opera later that evening, and charmingly told us about what to expect and tales of a friend of his who worked there, along with some useful practical information on its location in relation to our chosen restaurant.
