My husband forgot his cufflinks, and after calling down to Front Desk, Stephen called us back within minutes, with a detailed strategy on where to get a new pair. My husband went off to get the cufflinks, and while my grandmother and I were waiting we were offered some complimentary wine, and without asking or being prompted, Stephen realized we would be late for our restaurant reservation, called them immediately to let them know we would be late, and also requested quicker service since we were off to the Opera. He knew what time our show started without us telling him. 

When my husband arrived, soaking wet from his cufflink jaunt, Stephen hailed us a cab, and I kid you not, ran off to get some towels to offer him so that my husband  may enjoy his dinner while dry.  He also offered us two umbrellas to avoid a soaking since he knew we would be walking between the restaurant and the opera. 

Truly spectacular service, never to be forgotten.  I will forever recommend this New York hotel based on the service I received from Stephen.

title: Most Wonderful Hotel in NYC!
text: This beautiful hotel overlooking the Hudson, serene yet centrally located in Manhattan, simple but elegant, will forever be inked in my now fiancee and my hearts. Thanks to the world-class staff at the hotel who helped me plan the proposal of a lifetime, I had the greatest day of my life, thanks to Kimpton Ink48. The personalized touches were unbelievable - every staff member sincerely went way out of their way to ensure every detail was perfect for our proposal, which culminated in a proposal inside the gorgeous Heaven over Hell Suite. We stayed in the Hudson Suite for the night, and the views were breathtaking. The hotel is absolutely stunning and offers what NO OTHER MANHATTAN hotel could ever possibly match. Take advantage of Hell's Kitchen top rooftop bar and the complimentary wine evening reception as well! Please do yourself a favor, and stay at Ink48 - you will forever be appreciative.

title: Amazing return stay, can't wait until next time!
text:
This was another romantic weekend getaway stay at Ink 48.  We've stayed at the property many times now, and cannot say enough about the hotel, rooms, location, staff, restaurant, etc.

Every time we stay we are greeted warmly, professionally, and the entire weekend exceeds our expectations.

Although we are true native New Yorkers we can assure tourists who are either on an extended vacation or short visit to the restaurants and theatre that this property is in a wonderful location for both.  The hotel's restaurant, Print, is excellent, and the restaurant's staff and management are fabulous.  If you decide to venture out to eat, well, there are many, many options within walking distance, as well as all of the theatres in the event you are seeing a show. 

Kimpton cannot be beat when it comes to a large hotel chain as far as value for the luxurious accommodations.  The free wifi (which is excellent at this location) as well as the daily complimentary wine hour are very welcome and appreciated.

As for the staff at Ink 48, well, I cannot say enough.  Each individual, from housekeeping to valet to front desk to management is polite, professional and hospitable, and as the title of my review states, we can't wait until next time!

title: We have been staying here for years!
text: Always well taken care of by the entire staff and Stephen & America at the front desk. Bell staff greets us with a Welcome back each stay. Easy check in nice rooms and hospitality!  The Print restaurant is amazing and all the management take such good care of us and a special Thank You to Reyna & Orlando. Rooftop bar has an incredible view and wine hour in the lobby,  if we get back in time to enjoy.

title: Nice clean and well placed
text: Nice room, just like in the pictures and the staff is very helpful. Got us some great nice tickets to a Broadway show! The bar is surprisingly expebsive, especially the import beers, but the cosmopolitan made was worth it!!

title: Westminster Dog Show
text: Love this hotel! Spacious, beautiful, very clean room with great views of the city. Wonderful, super friendly employees who can't do enough to make you (and your dog's) welcome. Comfy lobby, great restaurant too. Will be back next year!

title: Posh comfy stay!!!
text: The room was super posh, spacious, bright and provided a great view of the city. The food (room services) was delicious and provided a great selection of options for our vegetarian family. The staff was extremely accommodating and made us feel like valued customers.

title: I always love this hotel
text:
I initially booked this hotel because I had business at the Javits Center.  The hotel is within walking distance to Javits and trust me, if you are leaving the shows at (or around) the same time as other attendees or exhibitors, you will never be able to catch a taxi.  The walk to the hotel is fine in both the winter and summer.
The hotel is clean, the rooms are fantastic.  I love the rooms that have a view of the Hudson River, but the view towards Time's Square isn't too shabby either.  The rooftop bar is amazing.  The view can't be beat and on a warm summer night you can stay up there for hours, take in the scenery and have some great drinks.  
If you have a dog, they are dog friendly so "Fido" doesn't have to stay home.  I've been upgraded many times due to my status as a Kimpton Member and it really doesn't take that many stays to start earning points that pay off for free nights.  I highly recommend this hotel.

title: Thank you!
text: It's not often I make the effort to review hotels, but after my recent visit to Ink48 on a business trip I wanted to make sure to make note of the exceptional service and care we enjoyed during our stay. The hotel was at full capacity and abuzz with many of us attending Coterie at the Javits Center but you would never have known it from the gracious and kind staff who made sure all of us were taken care of with the utmost professionalism. The concierge, Stephen, could not have been more pleasant or helpful. We had an associate unable to attend the trip and required modified room reservations and he took care of it seamlessly and showed us a room he thought we'd enjoy for our next visit and special event. He recommended restaurants, suggested tips to navigate the city and conference easier, politely listened to us after arriving back at the hotel after a long dinner with too much wine, and made us laugh when were exhausted from long days. He even gave me the name of a cologne which turned out to be the perfect gift for a friend! And all the staff - playful front desk employees, helpful and smiling doormen, doting cleaning staff as well as all the servers in the restaurant and bar - were friendly and truly a delight to interact with. The rooms were clean and the mini bar selections were exceptional. It's a very nice hotel that isn't stuffy or pretentious in any way while still maintaining an elevated level of service and commitment to guests. I definitely plan to stay again next time I'm in New York.

title: Tesla
text:
Beautiful hotel. Very friendly and helpful staff. 
The room , a studio is very nice with trendy decor. Nice temperature and no noisy aircon. 
Very quiet and no noise from the street or adjoining rooms. 
4 lifts no delays. 
Breakfast a bit on the pricy side. 
The rooftop bar is stunning. 
Opens at 17.00 hrs and the nighttime views are spectacular 
Very central to all activities in the city.

title: Fine room and beautiful view
text: The rooms are fine - typical.  But if you stay here, you will be right next to the spectacular PRESS LOUNGE on the top floor.  Seriously some of the best views you can ever get of the city.  Great for visitors, a staycation, or just a drink at Press Lounge.

title: Fantastic hotel
text: A friend and I met up in NYC for a long overdue friend weekend. I'm so glad we stayed here! There are a lot of things to like about this hotel. The rooms were clean, well appointed and had a great view! The bed was super comfortable and the turndown service was a nice touch. Whenever we had a small issue, the staff responded immediately and were so kind to boot! The location has it's positives and negatives but we never had an issue getting a cab thanks to the wonderful curbside staff! I look forward to staying here again!

title: Absolute Perfection!
text:
Booked this hotel as a surprise for my boyfriend for his birthday! The staff patiently assisted with all 500 requests that I had.. They assigned a beautiful room with the skyline view that I'd wanted. Young guy that checked me in was friendly, genuinely enthusiastic and helpful, he went over all the amenities and offered assistance with luggage. I'd mentioned to the hotel that we would be celebrating a birthday while there, so there were a couple of beers with a birthday card setup in the room when I got in. Their text message concierge service blew my mind! So prompt, fitting and efficient. Room was sparkling, amenities were great, lots of variety in the minibar, view was beautiful, tub was humongous, water pressure and temperature in the shower was really nice, double vanities very convenient. We went to the Print for dinner and Press lounge to ring in his birthday. The staff at the restaurant, hotel and lounge was very attentive. Whole stay was an absolute blast! 

11/10 would stay again.

title: Very Accomidating
text: I stayed here for business and it was the best hotel experience I've had not only in NYC but, anywhere. I requested early check in and not only were they able to accomidate me when I arrived about 2 hours prior to regular check in time but, they also gave me a room upgrade. Having spent a lot of time in various NYC hotels I was extremely please with how clean the room was and how friendly the staff was to me. Unfortunatly I was there for work and did not have much free time to explore the on-site amenties but, I am planning to visit Ink 48 again in April and will definietly make sure I get around to doing so. This is my new favorite hotel in NYC, can't wait to be back!

title: Great service and views
text:
I've been twice to the Ink48, and both times were excellent. Stephen checked me in both times, and the second time remembered our conversation from over a month prior! My second visit he also upgraded me to the Hudson suite, which has unbeatable views, and is just a gorgeous room all around (floor to ceiling windows, amazing bathroom, tastefully decorated). 

Kimpton always treats me well (thanks loyalty program) but this property is one of the best.

title: Canine Caring
text:
Loved Ink48 during the WestminsterDogShow! 
Staff is super dog friendly. 
The lobby was full of dogs, rolling creates and competitors.
The staff would rally to hep the guests, dogs/human get in and out .

title: Marvelous
text: We had had a horrible two days. Flights delayed due to a winter storm. JFK closed. NYC in state of emergency and I had walking pneumonia. But it only took walking into our gorgeous room at INK to make it all better. Warmth, both physical and visual, greeted us as the room’s wall to wall wrap around windows glowed with the night scene of a lighted NY night.  Lying in bed with a panorama of NYC may be fantastic to an ordinary person. Finding it after the two days of hell we endured was magical and healing for us. The comfortable bed and bedding did not hurt this magic either. Their coffee buffet was lovely and next door to a little cafe called interestingly enough PRINT where we bought what could be our favorite groan worthy croissants ever. We comfortably sat in the hotel lobby drinking and eating a most delicious breakfast while chatting with other guests from faraway lands. It has left us with a most perfect memory and one we cannot wait to repeat.

title: Kimpton is always wonderful!!!!
text: A friend had come from Los Angeles, and, stayed here. I joined her, and the experience was superlative, as all Kimpton properties, of which I have stayed in many, is just the BEST!!!! The restaurant, and rooftop are worthy of a visit, the service, and atmosphere, really terrific!!!

title: Excellent Spot on the West Side
text:
Stay Report - 2/10 - 2/11

Location: The hotel is located on the corner of 48th Street and 11th Avenue. This puts it a little far from the typical New York touristy neighborhoods which means it's nice and quiet. You can also walk to a large number of restaurants on 10th Avenue. Be advised the nearest subway station (50th Street and 8th Avenue on the C and E lines) is about .6 miles away. That said, it was no trouble getting an Uber and the hotel will help you get a cab. 

Hotel: Not much to look at on the outside, but it's gorgeous on the inside. The lobby has a pair of nice sitting areas including one where they do the nightly wine Happy Hour, a bar and a restaurant. There's also another restaurant and bar on the 16th Floor for which I recommend getting a reservation. 

Check In: We were able to get into our room at 12:30 PM which was a big plus. The check in agent was friendly and helpful and explained that we'd get a $15 minibar credit for being IHG Platinum.

Room: We received a corner King on the 7th floor which was very lovely. The bed was quite comfortable and there were outlets on both sides. The bathroom was also nice and having windows in there was a nice touch. Obviously as this is New York there was some noise pollution so if you are sensitive to this earplugs might not be a bad idea. The $15 minibar credit got us one split of Proseco with $3 left over which isn't worth much. 

Other: We had brunch in the lobby restaurant where the service, menu selections and food were all very impressive.

I used a Chase CC free night here and was glad I did. The hotel is a nice place to stay and a credit to the Kimpton chain. I'd gladly be back.

title: Fabulous Hotel
text: This was my first time staying at a Kimpton Hotel, but one of my friends told me I was going to love it and she was right.  They accommodated me when I said I wanted a room with a city view.  The room was very inviting.  It even already had an umbrella in the closet and a yoga mat.  It had a list of things that they would supply in case you forgot ranging from phone chargers, sewing kits to feminine products. The list was extensive.  I was so impressed I took a picture.  They have an awesome rooftop lounge with beautiful panoramic views of the NY Skyline.  My only complaints are that I asked for a late checkout and got it, but still two different people came to the room inquiring about my checkout and housekeeping despite the fact I had my privacy light on.  I mentioned this to the front desk upon checking out and they said this wasn't supposed to happen and they would alert the housekeeping supervisor.   Also, while at the rooftop lounge, I wanted to add the charges to my room, but found out that the lounge is separate and apart from the hotel, so you can't add to your room charges.  Other than those things, this hotel is fabulous and  I will stay again. Definitely when I come back to town to bring my father to see a Broadway play.  I've since joined their rewards program too.  This hotel knows how to accommodate their guests. 😊

title: Wonderful stay over Christmas...beautiful and close to everything.
text: My wife and I had a wonderful stay at this hotel.  The hotel itself is beautiful right in the heart of Hells Kitchen near all of the tourist spots.  We are not big tourist people.  We came to New York for the Christmas festivities and food...big foodies.  The service at this hotel is outstanding is the 1st hotel that I have ever stayed at where the cleaning staff cleaned and made our bed 3-4 times a day...that is amazing.  Every time we left the room to go do something on the town, the room was clean when we returned.(They might have been stalking us...for good kind of stalking!)  The rooftop bar has outstanding views and the lobby restaurant had great coffee and quick bites in the early morning for our walk on the town.  Going outside, the Sullivan Bakery is within a mile and is outstanding for coffee and fresh baked goods also.  This place is a must!

title: Weekend in NYC
text:
We booked at Ink48 based on our previous experience at Kimpton properties. From the moment we entered the lobby we knew we made an excellent choice.

From the hotel, we were able to walk to many of NYC's tourist attractions including: Times Square, Broadway, Radio City, Central Park, The Guggenheim, The Intrepid Air and Space Museum and lots of great food.

Elijah at the front desk was the consummate front-man for the operation. He was knowledgeable, friendly and helped us settle in and enjoy our trip. Thank you!

title: Pre Cruise destination
text:
I chose Kimpton Ink48 for it’s proximity to the cruise port (2 blocks)and it’s excellent reviews. We were coming in from multiple cities to Cruise out of NYC. I booked and pre-paid for the room in July for our September cruise on the Website. 

I called the hotel directly as directed by reservations to request early check in, as we all arrived prior to noon in NYC. Unfortunately they were not able to accommodate that request and we sat with many individuals in the lobby for our room to be ready for about 2 hours. It truly was not a big deal but our room wasn’t even ready at normal check-in time. Again no big deal as we lounged and had drinks. 

The hotel is beautiful just as described with a fabulous energetic rooftop deck that attracts many locals. Guest have priority entry to the rooftop. It has the best 360 degree view of NYC across the Hudson over to Jersey. 

The rooms are clean, spacious, beautiful and meticulously appointed. We were on a lower floor with a partial view of the Hudson. The noise that others mentioned was non existent during our stay. 

The staff is friendly, professional & honestly try to accommodate your every need. I would not think twice about staying at this hotel again. The only reason for 4 stars is the exceptionally long wait for our room for check-in.

title: Another wonderful stay at Ink48
text: I recently returned to this hotel and once again was very impressed with the value. Big, bright, clean, modern rooms. Coffee and newspapers in the lobby each morning. Prompt room service and friendly staff.

title: Fantastic Hotel
text: Great check in experience, big rooms and wonderful atmosphere.  The restaurant is great, too.  I wouldn’t change anything.  If you are looking for a hotel in this neighborhood, your search should end here.

title: If you are in NYC for any reason, business or pleasure, you must stay at Kimpton Ink48 Hotel!
text: My room was on the 9th floor facing the Hudson River. The room was clean, well lit, well decorated, and very very comfortable.  The hospitality is excellent, they greet you by name and the entire staff is dedicated to making sure that you feel at home and well cared for. The food is beyond delicious and the service is spectacular! I will never stay at another hotel when I am in NYC! And I will always look for a Kimpton wherever I go...I am telling you, the experience is that GOOD!

title: Great service, staff, rooms, and location
text:
My experience at Ink 48 has been AMAZING! For the past five months I've been staying at this hotel every weekend. My room is always clean, comfortable, and I enjoy the beautiful view. Every time I check in the staff always calls the room to make sure I like the room and I have everything I need. I think it is very important to have excellent staff at hotels because they make the guest experience so much BETTER. Ink 48 gets an A+ on customer service and I like that they always greet me with a smile. Some staff that have made my experience great are:

Elijah Ford: He is very efficient and helpful. His positive energy has been consistent from the first time I checked in to now five months later. I can always depend on Elijah to check me in fast and his customer service skills are EXCELLENT.

Kareem Urena: He is always doing a great job whether it is holding the door, getting me a cab, or bringing my bags to my room. I can always count on him when my hands are full to make my life easier.

Akil Ross: He is a great communicator and he learned my room preferences quick. Every hotel needs an Akil because he helpful and a great problem solver. I never have any complaints about the room he puts me in. 

Allison Sandoval: She is AMAZING! She is very consistent with asking about my experience and I appreciate that.

Mussau Fuseni: He never lets me down. When I park in front of the hotel he meets me at my door. I don't have to go inside and ask someone for help because he is already there looking to assist me. I appreciate his customer service and positive attitude.

Stephen Field: HE IS THE BEST!!!!!! He has been extremely helpful during my experience at Ink 48. For example when I was trying to figure out which restaurant to go to, he gave me a list of options. He didn't write down this list he printed out a list of places which in my opinion says a lot about him. Whenever I can't decide what I want to eat I refer to his list of wonderful options. His customer service skills are off the charts and he makes my stays worthwhile. I don't think I have seen him greet me once without a smile.

All of these staff member have made my Ink 48 experience great and I am glad that you have people like them doing an excellent job. 

From,

Rachel McNair from CBS Sports

title: Cool Hotel but Beware!
text: The hotel has elected to 3rd party out the resturant, lobby bar and rooftop resturant. What that means - if you are a hotel guest, you are NOT allowed to get a drink for either bar and take to your room. If you enjoy the comp coffee in the lobby - only 7 am - 9 am - you are NOT allowed to bring into resturant even if you are going to order their coffee - staff is very rude. In your guest room - there is a stocked mini bar with no price list and NO coffee options inroom. As a business traveler, I would choice another hotel. I have never stayed in a Kimpton and I am very disappointed. Will stick with my Diamond status at Hilton and Gold at Marriott.

title: Convenient, clean, place in central NYC.
text: Convenient, clean, place in central NYC.  Also not overly expensive. Location is ideal for NYC sightseeing. Good restaurants are nearby, so are many theaters.  Convenient to public transportation, easy walking to many local landmarks, parks and museums.

title: Great service, room and views.
text: This is a really nice hotel with great (admittedly better than I had expected) views. Love the Kimpton brand and the service it provides at their properties. Melissa at the front desk made sure the family and I had an awesome stay. Can't wait to come back.

title: Nothing beats a Kimpton!!! Outstanding
text:
Leaving tomorrow after 2 nights at the wonderful Ink48 - another amazing Kimpton hotel. 
Cant say enough amazing things about this brand! & this location!
Check in - though - before 730am - i was kindly advised to wait until later as they only had low floor rooms - i was told to leave my bag there & check in at 3pm so i could get a high floor room - result: i checked in & got upgraded to a corner suite on one of the top floors.  
Whats not to like abt that? Huge room for NYC- beautiful views of the Hudson River on one side (including from bathroom) and river&city from bedroom area.
Beautiful room with all the required things: from safe to plenty of closet space, yoga mat, extra pillow, bathrobe, hangers, iron, plenty of clothes storage, mini bar, tons of goodies & alcohol to enjoy (at a price but hey thats a hotel) great tv, chairs to lounge in & look outside the high windows. Bed super comfortable & warm blankets. Perfect shower pressure & temperature. 
Entire room is extremely clean/ spotless (one of my #1 criteria)
The heat works great, lights w different settings. All in all outstanding room.
Courteous & very friendly staff from bellman to elevator people to front desk agents. 
Tried breakfast and great with plenty of choices - ate at the Bar downstairs for dinner - awesome bartender, drinks & the food was delicious for dinner!!!!
Tried the bar on top floor but was too cold since packed but must be amazing during warmer days!
My next time in NYC in midtown area - ill be staying just here again!!!
Thank you! Best hotel in area hands down!

title: Perfect!
text: Beyond perfect. Staff was incredible, helpful, and welcoming. Room was upgraded for no charge and everyone at the front desk, front door, and restaurant were awesome. Great location off the beaten path but easy to get to all the hustle and bustle without being in a super touristy area. Two great coffee shops and bakery within a block of hotel were delicious.

title: Excellent guest service that made a birthday celebration complete!
text:
My stay at the Ink48 Kimpton in NYC helped reaffirm why I choose to stay at Kimpton hotels - there is nothing like the friendly, warm and attentive service you receive at the brand's venues.

We choose to stay at Ink48 to celebrate the January birthdays in my family and the staff at Ink48 helped to make sure the stay was as comfortable and special as possible.

From front desk to valet, everyone was very accommodating and welcoming and you can be sure that my family will definitely be back!

title: Our go-to for Manhattan getaways
text: My husband and I have stayed at Ink48 a few times now and we always have a great time. Reception is incredibly friendly and let us check in a bit early. They also texted me after check-in to make sure everything was ok, a nice touch. The room we like to stay in is the city-view suite with the big bathtub. It's spacious for NYC, well-decorated and perfect for us. The reason for only 4 out of 5 stars is the room service. We ordered breakfast and my husband's order was not as described in the menu at all. Prices are typical for NYC room-service, so when you pay $20 for an egg sandwich, the expectation is that it arrives as described. He ordered the egg sandwich with brioche and side of greens. Instead the sandwich was on whole wheat with a side of apple slices. Also, when ordering I asked for a muffin, from the menu, and was told that muffins were no longer offered. I guess it's time to update the menu.

title: First class stay.
text:
As a family we've airbnb'd all over Europe and a couple of times in Florida but couldn't find anything suitable in NYC as everything seemed like shoe boxes or was miles away from anywhere central . 
We scoured and scoured websites and eventually decided on Kimpton Ink 48, what a find.
We were checked in by Stephen who gave us SO much welcomed information about the area, where to eat, getting our bearings etc etc
Our rooms were superb, spacious, spotlessley clean, comfy bed and masssive bathroom with bath and separate shower with plenty of gels shampoos bath salts etc. (compliments to the chambermaids they even wound up my headphones tidely).
We booked room only as we usually  prefer to eat out for b'fast, however we did intend eating in one morning but were running late so sadly missed out.
This hotel is 15 mins stroll from 9th ave where there is an abundance of restaurants where you can chill and eat at your leisure away from the hustle and bustle of this mad mad city.
Kimpton have a 5 til 6 free wine happy hour night which we dropped on quite by chance 2 nights running, bonus.
All in all this hotel has everything you don't need to look any further.

title: loved it!
text: I am a big fan of Kimpton and this hotel did not disappoint. My room was chic, comfortable, and quiet -- LOVED having a bath in the bedroom area where I could gaze out at the NYC skyline! And the couch by the big windows where I could soak up the morning sun. The staff was excellent, the food from the restaurant was excellent. I want to live there.

title: Kimpton never disappoints.
text: As a freelance photographer who travels often for work, the first thing I do is find a Kimpton Hotel.  It is like staying at a home away from home.  The same detail to customer service and comfort is always welcoming.  I love wine and cheese hour and the fun mingling of guests.  If you are a pet lover, there is always a fur baby near by traveling with another guest. Become a Kimpton Member and enjoy your stay!

title: Top
text:
Ich fand das Hotel sehr gut. Gute Lage, freundliche Mitarbeiter. Die Zimmer sehr sauber und gepflegt. Wir haben nicht dort gegessen aber gutes gehört.
Wir hatten nichts zu meckern und werden beim nächsten NY Besuch wieder dort schlafen.

title: For What It Is ...
text: This new concept by Kimpton is a solid effort in an up and coming neighborhood in NYC. The hotel is all shiny and new and the staff work really hard at making sure you are well taken care of. That said, it's a hike from anywhere and you will have to get an Uber if you want to get downtown. The subway is also a hike and it's several blocks from anything (drugstore/coffeeshop etc.) The rooms are large and spacious and the king suite with the soaker tub is quite lovely. Couple of comments (and they may well be out of the purvue of the hotel) -- the bar doesn't hold any space for hotel guests, it need stools at the bar and also more seating (what's with the large empty space between the couches and the bar (with no stools). It was populated by what looked to be locals not drinking and taking up space the two nights that we tried to get a drink up there. If you can't into a bar at your hotel when there isn't another bar within miles then that's an issue ... small thing, but a big thing. The resto is lovely and breakfast there was imaginative and the staff great so that's a good thing. It's a solid hotel for NYC in the mid price range if you like quiet and don't care about access to NYC sites.

title: Needed a nice hotel to spend Christmas night with family after a recent loss of a loved one.
text: The staff were so accommodating and treated us with tenderness and care. We felt like we were insulated from some of the pain we were anticipating the Christmas holiday to bring. Our room was lovely and the views from our room and the rooftop bar were awesome

title: Location is quieter, yet convenient
text:
Sometimes you want to get away from the crowds, noise and traffic of Midtown Manhattan - this is the place to do it! It's located about 10-15 minutes walk away from the madness of Times Square in a quieter part of town. The nearest subway station is about a 10 minute walk with several subway lines being accessible from here.

We arrived early (8 am!) after a red-eye flight with the intention of dropping off our bags, but inquired whether we could check in; the desk staff were awesome in getting us a room so we could get some well-needed rest after the red-eye flight! The rooms are clean and spacious (by NYC Manhattan standards) with consumables; you can down call to ask for anything else you may need (razors, shaving cream). 

There are several elevators (so you aren't stuck waiting for 10 minutes for an elevator) and the lobby space is big enough for you to find a corner to chat should you want to get out of your room. I also like that access to the gym is 24 hours with well-maintained equipment. A little disappointing was the wifi; it was frustratingly slow during busy times of the day (evenings, mid-mornings). I would not count on it to make online bookings or to get work done.

title: Splendid hotel in Hell's Kitchen
text:
We are veteran Kimpton guests and this was our first visit at Ink48.  We checked in on Christmas day for a 4 night stay to be "tourists" in NYC. We arrived early @ 12:30pm and pleasantly surprised our room was ready. Check in was friendly, fast, and efficient. Elijah reminded us that happy hour was from 5-6pm and would feature a chardonnay and a cab plus a holiday special - a Spanish eggnog.  We made it back for happy hour later in the day and the cab was fabulous as was the eggnog.  Our corner room was an upper floor room with a lovely view of the Hudson and into MidTown.  The room was large by NYC standards, modern, and quite comfortable.  The full size bathroom was well stocked with amenities and a lovely large glassed in shower with rain shower head in the ceiling. We asked for a complimentary Keurig coffee machine to be brought up, and had our choice of making coffee in the room or going downstairs for the complimentary coffee in the lobby. Every, and I mean every staff member we met was friendly and asking how our stay was going and if they could help with anything. 

We liked that the location was quieter than being in Times Square/Theater district but still only a 10-15 minute walk away.  We walked to the Al Hirschfeld Theatre to see Kinky Boots and it was only a nice 15 min walk there. Search TripAdvisor for solid dining in Hell's Kitchen -- there's a lot to choose from. We enjoyed Lilly's, O'Neils, and The Mercury when dining nearby.  Rudy's, a classic and fun NYC dive bar was a treat, and The Jolly Goat, a coffee shop 5 minutes away that had lovely Stumptown coffee and baked delights was a must stop.  If you don't mind a 5-10 minute walk (burn off those calories) this is a great location. And, we never had a problem landing an Uber or a cab to get us to other parts of the city.

Also, the hotel has Print, it's first floor restaurant, which is a great option if you want to stay in with a varied menu of farm to table selections.

Definitely become a Karma member for free wifi and a $15 mini-bar credit (although they are merging in to IHG's rewards program in early 2018, but we belong to that, too).

title: deserve more than 4 stars
text:
Modern, simple but spacious room.
Rooms is very clean, you don't ear your neighbored rooms.
As usual with Kimpton you find everything you need in the room, good iron, hair dryer, & even a carpet for morning Yoga.
The roof Top lounge offers a great view of Manhattan.
The breakfast is basic.
I strongly recommend for the Value/Price relation.
Don't count on internet access to work, as it works very slowly, and not constantly.

title: Hidden Hotel Gem on 11th Ave!
text: My partner surprised me with a room here for a quick rendezvous in the city!  Upon arrival we were greeted by Akil & Elijah who were SO sweet & kind.  They surprised us with wine and cheese in the room after we had settled in.  It really was thoughtful of Akil & Elijah to do that us!  We both really enjoyed the decor & rooftop bar/lounge & the gorgeous sweeping view of the city. We cannot wait to come back soon!

title: The perfect place for us to stay
text:
My partner and I stayed at the Ink 48 over Christmas. We decided on this hotel for its midtown location and because of the many glowing reviews (including being in the recent Condé Nast top 50 nyc hotels list). We were so happy with our stay. The location is convenient for getting around manhattan and there are several great restaurants close by too. Our hotel room was huge by NYC standards. We upgraded to a city view and were happy with our choice. There was just so much space to move around in the room and we never felt like we were on top of each other. The bathroom was also huge with double sinks, big walk in shower (with rainfall option) and big soaker tub. The room ceilings were also really high which made the room feel that much more spacious.  The window was also big, offering plenty of natural light. 

The hotel itself was also well appointed. We joined kimpton rewards so got free WiFi (excellent) and a mini bar and spa credit. The 24hr gym was good. The lobby area and other common spaces were nicely decorated and clean. The morning coffee/tea service was convenient. The wine happy hour was a nice treat after being out all afternoon. The staff were incredibly friendly and accommodating - bringing us a coffee maker and extra robe, etc. 

We would stay here again in a heartbeat. The quality and value is just unbeatable. We’re also now hooked on the kimpton brand and will endeavor to explore other kimpton hotels when we travel.

title: Great, Centrally-Located Hotel in Hell's Kitchen
text: We stayed here on our annual family visit to see the Christmas Tree and Festivities at Rockefeller Center.  The hotel is clean, modern, and well appointed with high ceilings, comfortable beds, and a good size shower.  Excellent service by all employees.  Walking distance to Rockefeller Center and Times Square to the east and the Intrepid and High Line to the west.  Mere minutes to the Lincoln Tunnel for an easy get-away when leaving NYC.

title: Wonderful stay! Coming back!
text: Spacious rooms, excellent & prompt service, central location. Finally found a 'regular' hotel to come back to in NYC. Don't usually write reviews, but this hotel is outstanding. Travelled for business (stable and free wifi) as well as pleasure (with my mother) and we both really enjoyed our stay here!

title: Excellent!
text: We absolutely love this hotel! The staff are excellent and the location is perfect!  We traveled with our 14 year old black lab and everyone was very accommodating and helpful with her! I can't say enough great things about this place!! Our favorite place to stay in NYC!

title: New York holiday
text: Beautiful hotel. queen suites were lovely and very spacious hotel staff really helpful and nice if you want free coffee maker in room you only need to ask there is complimentary coffee tea and hot chocolate down in reception first thing in morning hotel is about 10to15 minute walk to Times Square

title: I'll  be Home for Christmas.....
text: Grest service by Elijah at the front desk. The 12th floor corner room and view take my breath away. nice set up.The roof top bar opens after 10:30pm (private party) tonight, however so far, so good. I will stay here again!

title: Solid Option in Far Midtown West
text: Very nice, comfortable rooms with a helpful staff. A walk to good dining options.Easy access to West Side and Times Square area. Valet parking is expensive but many cheaper garages within walking distance.

title: A secluded, modern=equiped place to stay
text: This hotel is 5 stars for everything...service, cleanliness, attention to details, and food, drink and ambience. We will make this our first place to book from now on, and bringing along our well-behaved dogs that are made to feel welcome is also a huge plus.

title: Great service and good value for NYC
text: I really enjoyed our stay at the Kimpton Ink48.  The service was amazing and the rooms were clean and perfect for our short trip to the city.   Times Square and Rockefeller Center are a short walk away as are a lot of great bars and restaurants.    I would say to request a room in a higher floor for better views of the city or the Hudson River.   Great boutique hotel for the price!

title: Ideal para novios
text:
Estuvimos hace 1 año de viaje de novios
No puse una opinión positiva porque tuvimos un pequeño incidente del que ya no nos acordamos.
Sólo tenemos recuerdos positivos y lo recomendamos para quien viaje a NYC en Luna de Miel o alguna celebración especial 
Eso si, que sea un piso alto y con vistas a la ciudad.

title: High class hotel in the city
text: We loved Ink48, because of the spacious rooms (a hard thing to find in NYC), great restaurant and incredible staff. Stephan at the front desk was a highlight for us- he made us feel like we were coming home at the end of the day and able to make some great recommendations.  The only downside is that the hotel is several blocks from the subway, but cabs were easy to find.

title: Love the kimpton hotels
text: Great place to stay. Away from the crowds but near broadway. Great views from the upper floors of the hotel. Wine tasting hour in the evening and coffee in the lobby in the morning. Friendly vibes and staff so helpful. Didn't get to visit the cocktail bar on the rooftop as booked for private events for xmas. Had a very lovely room. We would definitely stay there again and recommend it highly

title: Always love a kimpton
text: When we first stayed at a Kimpton in Philly many years ago I said it'd be a mission to stay at more of them, I was not kidding lol. Anyway after trying to stay here so many times but something always came up, we finally stayed for a late belated birthday of mine :) I have missed Kimpton so much and forgot how great they are. Our suite was amazing, my birthday wine was great (says my hubs who drank it all lol) Halloween wine hour in the penthouse was amazing. Again I always wish we had brought our dogs (yet as one dog barks as I type this I'm happy we did not lol) We stayed mostly in our room since it was so amazing, the views. I only wish we had breakfast here but we had to get home early today for our dogs. I can't wait to stay either here again or another Kimpton next. (Eventi looking at you!) I also always love the decor of all the kimptons. You cannot go wrong when staying in a Kimpton.

title: Great stay in NYC
text:
My wife and I just spent a long weekend in NYC and really enjoyed Ink48.  This was my first stay in the Hells Kitchen neighbourhood and it worked out really well.  

The rooms are large and the beds are comfortable. Its a short walk between the hotel and many of the Broadway theatres but far enough away that you aren't in the middle of things like the Kimpton Muse. 

We arrived around 7 am and the staff allowed us to check in early. It was a lower floor room but they moved us the following day.

title: INK48 is solid
text:
We have been coming to this hotel for over four years. It is consistently a great place to stay in Manhattan. The location is excellent way over on the west side on 11th avenue.
We also get a great room and the staff is super friendly.

title: Great experience and haven't even arrived!
text: So, it's holiday season in NYC - hotels are booked to the max with rooms and events - but I needed to arrange a 9 night stay for work at my "home away from home" Ink48.  Members of the hotel management team Stephen Field and Roger Sawh helped me work creatively through the reservation process, even incorporating my Kimpton Karma award night into the reservation. They were beyond patient, and just sent that feeling that they really wanted to help me get a room!  Then....in the wee hours of my flight date I realized I had a fever and decided to wait a day to fly in for work.  I was panicked that I might lose my reservation.....but alas - Allison Sandoval, Guest Service Manager  - answered the phone at this crazy hour, looked up my reservations, assured me she would help me with the cancellation, and would make sure everything was fine when I arrived today - and to try to get some sleep and feel better!  I got an email from Allison this morning around 6 am- hoping I am feeling better and letting me know that my reservation was all set, and she even managed to book my Kimpton Karma reward night despite what must be a high occupancy rate. I also worry I will leave someone out - but everyone at this property is amazing.  On my last visit, Olimpia came to my rescue -I don't even look at other hotels - I stay at this hotel despite it's location being all the way across town from my work client, and I will continue to stay with this team.  Thanks everyone, for being so amazing.  This review is about the people - the hotel itself is fabulous as well - but the people make it remarkable!

title: Mr. Hell's Kitchen and Hotel with great views
text:
I love this hotel but what makes it really special is Stephen Field, five years ago when we walked in he greeted as if we had been there for years and each trip gets better.  He is really an expert on Hell's Kitchen, and the city.  He even lives in the area.  He can fix a Kindle, suggest a restaurant, wine bar, a play and just general great history on the city.

The hotel has a boutique vibe and a fun wine hour where many quests gather in the lobby.  All of the staff is friendly and helpful but without Stephen it would not be the same place.  Check out his article in the local magazine....He's a celebrity.

title: Amazing Service and beautiful hotel!
text: It was our first time to a Kimpton property and we were greeted the second we entered the hotel. Melissa at the front desk went out of her way to make sure we had a fabulous room and even sent us a bottle of wine since I was celebrating a birthday. She was awesome but so were all of the staff! The room was spacious and the view of the city was exactly like the pictures portrayed online. We will definitely be back!

title: Very Nice
text: Hotel , nice lobby and Rooms are big 407, good and fast check in , restaurant and bar was nice and also the roof top area, Price was ok for this stay the only negative thing is that it is a boat off but no biggy close to Hells Kitchen

title: Amazing Experience and Views
text: When looking for a place to spend the night before Thanksgiving in Manhattan we choose the Kimpton Ink48 because of the great price for a 4.5 star hotel in Midtown. Upon checking in we were greeted by very friendly staff, the lobby area was decorated nicely with a very upscale feel. The room was spectacular with great views of the city as well as posh furnishings and decorations. We were lucky enough to get one of the rooms on the highest floor (17) and while it did come at a premium it was well worth it for the full length floor to celling window and amazing view. The room was the perfect size for two. Did not get a chance to checkout the rooftop area but I can imagine that it was amazing. Location was great and so was the staff, would definitely return in the future.

title: Room much smaller than pictured and strange cnfigurations
text:
We stayed in a queen/queen deluxe room as we are 3 adults in same family.  The photo on the web site of this style room does not resemble our room much. Our view was of a wall and we had a ton of street noise, including from a nearby club.  There was about 24 inches of space between the foot of the bed and the dresser so it was very narrow.  The bathroom door is frosted glass, so you can hear everything going on in there and it does not lock.  I just find that weird.  There are no hooks to hang towels or coats when there are plenty of spots on the walls where they would make great sense.  Our room did not get made up at all the first 2 days so we had to call housekeeping and have them bring towels, glasses, toilet paper, etc., even though we had pressed the housekeeping button by the door.

The wine happy hour is just a crowded mess and totally not worth it.  The staff seems very attentive when something is brought to their attention but we would probably not stay here again.  The price was not good enough for the room and the lack of detail.  They seem to miss a lot of conveniences that could be added and the noisiness of the street meant we did not sleep well.

title: Great time! Excellent view!
text: As Always Kimpton impresses.  My family and I love checking out different properties of Kimpton whenever we can and our trip to NYC Iink48 was wonderful.  They are always super friendly towards my family especially my 7 year old son.  Special shout out to Allison in guest services and Roger at the front desk!  Keep it up!

title: Séjour à NYC( première fois)
text:
Assez mitigé, nous avons choisis cette hôtel pour le Rooftop qui est un des plus exceptionnel de NYC faut que je le précise .
La vue est impressionnante & leurs cocktails sont très bons. 
Personnels extraordinaires,  toujours souriant , à l'écoute  nous avons obtenu tout ce que nous avons souhaité ( sauf la sécurité du Rooftop qui se permet des réflexions assez déplacer mais après avoir vu la direction je n'ai plus cet personne de notre séjour ).
Elijah vraiment merci pour votre accueil , votre patience et votre professionnalisme .

title: Amazing Experience
text: I discovered  Kimpton properties 2 years ago in Savannah Georgia. I was delighted to discover there was a property in NYC! The rooms and staff are spectacular! Everything was perfect! I'll definitely be staying here again! Perfection!

title: Responsive and friendly
text: This review could have been a bad one if it hadn’t been for Ink48’s wonderful, responsive manager Allison.  She stepped in to help sort out a solution to a room mixup. On top of that she went above and beyond to make sure we had a great visit.  The 5 stars is for her excellent service!  Well done and thank you!

title: Son’s Birthday
text:
We enjoy staying at all the Kimpton properties and this one in NYC was great. The location is nice and the staff is fantastic. When I told them we were celebrating my sons 6th birthday, they went out of their way to acknowledge him and even left him a note and some treats in our room. David on their staff was amazing. 

We had breakfast at PRINT which was great and the coffee was really good. Thanks to all the staff for a great weekend and we look forward to coming back.

title: Great location for BDNY 2017!
text: Highly recommend this fabulous boutique hotel in Hell’s Kitchen. Walkable to the Javits, and super convenient to the great restaurants in this part of town. Love NYC and Ink48 is a lovely upscale place to stay.

title: Kimpton Ink 185 Hotel a nice change for New York City
text:
We loved staying at the Kimpton Ink 185 Hotel in the Hell's Kitchen neighborhood.
The staff is great and the rooms are wonderful-we stayed at Times Square last time
and decided to try a different neighborhood. This is a very up and coming area with
lots of quercky restaurants nearby and tons of interesting stores with people galore
walking every which way.
Our room was very spacious with a bathtub and free standing shower and of course 
flat screen T.V.  They have a wine hour for their guests near dinner. We absolute love
Kimpton Hotels as they are boutiques and not huge monsters. Nice staff as I said before and very clean!! I am very fussy where I stay and becoming a hotel snob.
Maybe it might cost a little more but I want to be comfortable and get a good night sleep. Bed was very comfortable. We loved this Hotel!!

title: Great hotel!
text: We stayed here for the weekend and the hotel was great. The staff was all very friendly and accommodating and Stephen was super helpful! He gave us recommendations for places to eat and checked in with us multiple times to make sure we were having a great time and enjoying our stay. We also loved the rooftop bar!

title: Hospitality and service!
text:
We visit New York from Canada several times a year, mostly for the opera and theatre.  We made the switch from a hotel that was closer to Lincoln Centre a few years ago when we discovered a new Kimpton had opened. Being an extra few blocks away from the opera house is more than made up for by the staff at Ink 48 who make the Hotel feel more like a home than a hotel. 

Kimpton Hotels set the bar high for service, but the staff at Ink 48 are the reason it has become my favourite hotel in the world. Every time we check in, it’s the same friendly faces greeting us - front desk, bellmen, restaurant staff as well as housekeeping. The staff greet us with things like, “Nice to see you again”, “How are things up in Canada?”, “How long are you with us this time?” We feel more like old friends than just customers.

Concierge, Stephen Field, has been particularly attentive and an indispensable resource for us in making plans during our stay. His restaurant and theatre advice is always spot-on. He clearly loves what he does, and it’s the places where he eats and the shows that he sees that he is recommending. 

I will leave additional aspects of the hotel for other guests to describe, but suffice it to say we never have any complaints. While the hotel exceeds our expectations in every way, it’s the people who work at Ink 48 that keep us coming back.

title: Kimpton has nailed it every time!
text:
I'm a discerning traveler with near bi-monthly visits to New York and have stayed in every range of hotel.

History: I've stayed at this property in Oct 2016 and May 2017 and another Kimpton property The Eventi in New York City several times to extremely pleasant stays, which leads me to this rare 5-star recommendation.

Let there be White: the rooms are spacious and tremendously bright, with white platform beds and crisp modern furniture. I was upgraded by their always gracious staff with a sweeping view of the north side of the city and the Hudson River, with a separate bench banquet for window gazing.

Hip Bar & Happy Hour: there's always a complimentary wine hour with light snacks provided at the Kimpton properties which is lovely, but the true happiness here is on the happening rooftop bar, The Press Lounge, which is worth visiting for the sunset, the skyline and a quick cocktail if not the food (the menu is not extensive).

Quiet Please: I always request a quiet room because I only crash for a few hours and for those precious hours I need to sleep, but my room upgrade had me placed over 11th Avenue so there was middle-of-the-night truck noise--my only complaint. But how can you truly complain, really, over such a spacious and kind gesture? So I'm not complaining!

Insider's Tip: If you book directly through Kimpton, they have their own rewards program called Karma Rewards (with little bonuses like free wifi and a $10 mini bar credit to use as you please): I'm a member so I get the emails. If you book through another entity but are still in their Rewards program, they kindly still honor the free wifi which is a plus.

title: Cool vibe - but very long in the tooth
text:
Ok - not the most expensive hotel I've ever stayed at. Was on the top floor ("penthouse"). Room smelled like smoke from the person before me, was tiny and the AC unit sounded like a freight train. 

Clean and tidy. Great vibe downstairs (although the bar was closed at Midnight on a Thursday!!). 

Won't come back.

title: A pleasant stay in a peacefull place closed to Times Square
text: Un tres agreable hotel avec une belle decoration chaleureuse qui le place dans les Kimpton++. Tout est bien organisé, le personnel est tres attentif et le cafe ou the du matin est le bienvenu (meme si il s'arrete a 9heures). La chambre pour 4 est spacieuse et la salle de bain tres bien organisee avec une belle douche a l'italienne. C'est un excellent rapport qualite/prix pour Manhattan. En plus, la vue du rooftop ouvert apres 17h est superbe sur les rives et les buildings. Par contre, les enfants ne sont toleres que jusqu'a 18h. Apres, place au bar a coktails pour les amoureux. C'est bien aussi...

title: Home Away from Home
text: I travel to NYC a lot - and have been staying at Ink48 a fair amount over the last two years.  It has become my home away from home.  When I walk in, the people at the door and reception know my name and make a point of making me feel super welcome.  Reception is always helpful and many times finds me an upgrade on my room.  The location is especially good for me when I drive to NYC from Albany, because I can get right on and off the West Side Highway.  The rooms are excellent, super clean and comfortable - and the Print restaurant is excellent.  Give it a try - you will go again and again.

title: Mommy Getaway
text: Nice location. Easy to get to and near many attractions.  Within walking distance to theatre.  Loved the ambiance of the hotel and clean decor of the rooms.  Staff was very friendly and helpful. Would definitely stay again.

title: Personal service, great hotel
text:
I stay frequently at Ink 48.  It is my favorite address in New York.  I love the personal service provided to me by a fabulous staff, including Roger, Stephen, and Elijah.  It literally feels like coming home.

This last stay, I was upgraded to a beautiful suite overlooking the Hudson River.  The rooms are quiet and spacious.  They are spotlessly clean.  The large soaking tub in the bath is beautiful and the shower, with overhead rain shower head and side jets, is luxurious.  Your needs are all attended to by the adept and caring staff.

Stephen, one of the concierges at the hotel, offers amazing and informed advice as to the neighborhood.  His suggestions for wine bars to visit are particularly helpful.

The restaurant also offers, to me, the best breakfast in New York City.  Perfectly cooked to order and sourced fresh.

This is a great hotel with a staff who truly cares to make your stay the best.

title: Highly Disappointed
text:
I placed a reservation for this hotel through Expedia. The room was prepaid and guaranteed for late arrival. I spent the day in the city and was headed to the hotel to check in, (10:30 p.m.), I received a call from the hotel that they no longer had a room for me. Their solution was to move me to another hotel, the Kimpton Muse on Times Square. That room, apparently the last one they had, was on the second floor overlooking the sidewalk. The thermostat in the room was broken, so I was unable to get it below 78 degrees. Also, when I visit Manhattan, I prefer to avoid Times Square (except for theater).

This was upsetting on a number of levels. I had a reserved a room at the Kimpton Ink because I was attending an event there the next morning. Obviously, moving negated that convenience.The room they sent me to was inferior - not at all the "night in Manhattan" experience I had planned. Finally, it was highly unnerving to have placed my trust in having a room waiting for me, only to find out they had given it away.

It is highly unlikely I will book with the Kimpton franchise again. This was a pretty miserable experience.

title: Great boutique hotel
text:
If you don’t mind being on the far west side, this is a terrific hotel. Easy parking, a great lobby and solid restaurant. Reception was quick and upbeat. The rooms are comfortable- not huge but ample. Large bathroom with a great shower.
Great value - I will come back.

title: First time in NYC, amazing hotel!!
text: This was our first trip to New York and wow did they make us feel welcome.The hotel is amazing, the roof top bar view is insane, the PRINT restaurant is oh so bloody good, but the main good point is the customer service. All the staff there are incredibly friendly and helpful! Our room was stunning, modern and stylish, with one hell of a view! We got a corner room, therefore we had views of the Hudson River and the NYC skyline, amazing! Reading the reviews before we went I was quite worried about the area (having never been to NYC before), but once there I realised this wasn't a problem, only a 10min walk to Times Square and it gave us a chance to explore areas you wouldn't normally explore! There's so much I could say about this hotel, but I'd be here all day. I would 100% come back tomorrow if I could, it's everything you could want/need in a hotel. Book this hotel! You won't regret it!

title: It’s was OK :(
text:
Modern clean tidy hotel - you have a 15/20 minuet walk to Times Square & minutes walk from the Hudson River

Our room was clean & bright, apart from the filth windows! Bathroom - clean, but broken shower attachment - reported & nothing done & door Handel fell off but was sorted.

As expected, tea or coffee in the bar is expensive as is room service but you are in NY

They serve free coffee in reception every day & free wine 5-6 I think.

We also borrowed free to bicycles for the day that was nice - 1st come basis !

Main moan is most of the staff clearly love them selves & 1 young lady in the  was just plain rude & arrogant. Staff serving at breakfast (even though not packed restaurant) seemed more happy to talk to each other than serve us! I had to get up & get attention twice :((((

Lastly on check out - guy serving was appalling & a sad end to an otherwise pleasant stay - he was some what put out I wanted to see the bill before I paid! He reluctantly gave is the bill & did not like being questioned when I had a query about a couple of charges - once sorted he did not even have the common courtesy of asking us if we had a nice stay & see you again !!!!!  

SORT SOME OF YOUR STAFF OUT !!!!!

There are plenty of other hotels to choose from in NY - on our next visit in 3 weeks to NY we will stay else where - big shame a we have stayed in other Eventi hotels before........

title: Nice hotel, off beaten track
text: I usually stay at the Kimpton Eventi, my favorite, and close to Penn Station, but Ink48 had a better rate and I liked the sound of their restaurant, Print, which turned out to be excellent. They have good service, nice rooms, and a great lounge area where my friend and I played scrabble (had to bring it) and drank excellent, if expensive bloody marys. (New York prices). They also have a great rooftop where you can have drinks, lounge around, or go out into the open for a close to 360 view of the city, including a close view of the Hudson. The location is the one drawback: 11th and 48th street, with nothing around but a fairly good food court and the Hudson River, which is great for walking.

title: Sleek, modern, uncluttered, clean, bright room
text: For a 5-day get-away to visit museums and attend a Saturday night performance at the Metropolitan Opera, we selected this 11th Avenue hotel as an untraditional, more contemporary alternative to the mid-town offerings.  Hotel is very busy, seeming to attract a mostly younger, bustling urban professional crowd.  We chose a room in the mid-range of the price offerings: a 4th floor, king-bed, with a "view."  The "view" was of 11th Avenue--not much there except a few remarkably beautiful skyscrapers along with lots noise & traffic.  But the room itself was quite nice--clean, sleek, bright, and inviting with an all-glass window wall. Bathroom was all modern fixtures and spotless, with a very nice, quite large walk-in shower that would be especially appreciated by anyone with mobility problems.  Restaurant on the premises, "Print," offered very professional and attentive service at the two meals we had.  Food was top quality at what we judged to be moderate NYC prices.  Door staff and lobby staff were alert, quick to offer assistance for anything, and always accommodating.  Our only complaint: the noise from 11th Ave. penetrated throughout the night, especially on Saturday with young party folks on the street.  We advise taking along earplugs if you reserve a room on one of the lower floors.  We found the door staff to be alert and helpful--especially on Saturday evening for hailing a cab for us as we were trying to get to the opera. Very nice touch!  An alert, kind door man out in the rain getting a cab for you when all of New York is also trying to get a cab.

title: Escape to New York
text:
The room was excellent. After coming back to the room the first night, we found a had-written note with a bottle of champagne for our anniversary. 

Housekeeping performance was outstanding. Front desk people were pleasant and professional. 

Bar and restaurant staff were fantastic. I recommend the poached eggs for breakfast!

title: Outstanding Hotel and Customer Service!!!
text: From the minute we checked in, our stay at Kimpton Ink48 was above and beyond our expectations!  The staff took a personal interest in making sure our trip to NYC was everything it could possibly be for us.  Anthony made excellent restaurant recommendations and then took care of making reservations for us each evening.  And Stephen, our concierge, got us theater tickets to a sold out Broadway Show (Come From Away) at face value for the next day!  The rooftop bar is so cool, and has an AMAZING view of the sunset on the Hudson River.  We appreciated the free wine bar each day from 5pm-6pm...the wine was fabulous, and it was nice to relax after a day of sightseeing before we left for the evening.  For NYC, our room was Huge!  The amenities were WONDERFUL, but I can't say enough about their customer service!   We will definitely be back!

title: Fantastic
text:
Stayed here for 5 nights in a suite on the 12th floor overlooking the Hudson. Huge suite by any standard. Light and airy with floor to ceiling windows. 
Staff at all levels welcoming and attentive. 
Despite some negative reviews of location I must totally disagree. Out the way of the madness of Times Square but within easy walking distance of same and more.
As for the rooftop bar - fantastic. Views amazing and an absolute must even if there is a premium to pay for drinks - worth every penny.
If you're deliberating on which NYC hotel to go for as the list is endless, then I can't recommend the Ink48 enough.
Thanks to all for an amazing stay and helping to make our visit to NY special.

title: Modern, beautiful, welcoming and highly functional stay at Ink48
text:
My second business trip staying with Ink48 confirm my recommendation to my team that this was not only a modern, comfortable property, but that for our business needs it's highly functional systems and staff would support our intense professional workflow. 
Firstly, we are a highly respected creative agency with critical taste, and all agreed the property is gorgeous, modern, smart and tasteful. We welcomed the aesthetic and felt we were in a great spot. 
Next, the staff was eager to make our trip successful, from arranging concierge requests, to ensuring our functionality remained high, and just promoting our general ease with every conversation. 
My room was well appointed, larger than the average NYC room, and had sincerely beautiful views!
The restaurant is lovely, with the best menu in the area. As hotel guests, we were given priority. 
For entertaining, the rooftop bar is stunning, with a Manhattan skyline view very rarely available when in Manhattan. 
I can't recommend this hotel enough, and will surely be returning!!!

title: Amazing Hotel - Exceeded all Expectations!
text: Absolutely amazing stay at the Kimpton Ink48!  I selected this hotel based on location - in Hell’s Kitchen, near the Javits Center.  While all the online reviews and amenities looked great, they paled in comparison to the actual hotel.  Incredible service from the moment I arrived {I was the guest of the day and they upgraded my room to an amazing view of the city...} incredibly polite and helpful check in staff, a wine reception, an immaculate room and an overall incredible ambiance and experience.  Perfectly located near restaurants and shopping, this hotel lacks for nothing — and has great coffee in the morning.  I stayed three nights and it was the perfect hotel.  I will definitely stay again!

title: Amazing!
text:
Beautiful hotel with beautiful views of the Hudson River. The rooftop bar is incredible, the restaurant was fabulous.
Easy walking distance from Times Square.
Everything about it was perfect. Try the carwash donut shop around the corner too.

title: Exceeded Expectations. No, for real.
text:
Hotel: Clean, modern and service focused
Room: Larger than expected. High ceilings. Great view. 
Service: Wonderful and better than expected.
The service at the hotel was better than any I've experienced. A GENUINE smile and "Hi!" or "Hello! How are you today?" from everyone working on the property. Bellman, doorman, housekeeping, front desk, maintenance - everyone seemed to prioritize that guests feel welcome and happy to be there. I had no specials needs or requests out of the ordinary but was struck by the warm hospitality.
The restaurant was pricey but the food was quite good. Recommend the kale salad if it happens to still be on the menu. Don't roll your eyes about the kale. It really was a tasty salad.
Check-in/Check-out was friendly and efficient.
Normally I don't stay so far out on the West Side. I stay typically stay closer to mid-town because of its proximity to the subway and close to a majority of my clients but Ink changed my mind. I'll be back for sure! Special shout-out to the front desk "Fashionista" for her help when checking in!

title: Great staff, good location - but...
text:
Great staff, really helpful and knowledgeable about the area.  Well appointed hotel and location is good too.  However could have done with double glazing to keep the street noise down.   The Press Lounge has great views, you can even see the Intrepid Sea, Air & Space Museum from an impressive angle, but it is a separate business to the hotel so no using your room number to put the (pricey) bar bill onto… The other downside to the Press Lounge also closes at 2am making for a noisy (and sometime messy…) environment particularly at the weekend!

Ok for a short break but avoid weekends if you want a decent sleep.

title: Really Nice.
text: My wife and I just stayed here for the weekend and had a great time. She was checking in and mentioned that it was my birthday (which it was) and said that's why we were in the city for the weekend.  Don't you know that later that night when we got back to our room there was a bottle of white wine on ice with the nicest note wishing me a happy birthday. it was signed by the staff, and not the one person who she checked in with.  super nice detail, for sure! the location was fun (a little off the beaten path), the gym small but efficient, and our room overlooking the west side spacious (I think room 1008?). anyway, the staff is super helpful and friendly. we could easily stay here on a return trip.

title: food and wine weekend
text: Nice clean room, beautiful views of Hudson River, engaged staff.  The roof top bar is amazing and you get on the line before people who aren't the guests of the hotel.  Great location in hell's kitchen.

title: Perfect location before taking a cruise.
text:
We really did enjoy this hotel, the staff was super friendly and helpful. The room was comfortable and we did not have any problem with the noise level since we were on a side street and far away from the rooftop bar. We stayed on a Saturday and the line up for that bar was impressive... guess it means that it is great up there. Too crowed for us to even try to go even if hotel guest don't have to do the line. Great touch is the bathrobe :)
Ink48 is ideal for anyone taking a cruise as the pier is only one street away. Also super easy to walk up to TimeSquare. 
Only reason why I did not give it a 5 star is the 14$ Wifi charge.

title: Engagement weekend
text: First let me say, this review is long overdue! My, now Fiancé, and I stayed at the Kimpton Ink48 December 2016. From the moment we arrived, being greeted by multiple staff and what the hotel had to offer, I knew I had picked the perfect hotel for this special weekend! Our room was beautifu with views of the Hudson and the city! I had great help with planning and execution of the proposal from Stephen Field! He had great suggestions and ideas including the restaurant and lounge where we spent the evening before the proposal. Their attention to detail is amazing! With other staff being clued on the engagement to decorating our hotel room-- she still is talking about how beautiful it was! Christmas eve '16 was a night to remember because of the hotel!

title: Good
text: Stayed two nights on a business trip to NYC. And will absolutely stay here next time as well. Room was spacious, modern furnished and most importantly; very quiet! Bed was also very comfortable. Only  drawback is the area which is slightly "boring" / industrialised. However, 10 min walk to Times Square, So not a too big drawback.

title: EXCELLENT SERVICE AND FACILITY...VERY NOISY ROOM
text:
We were extremely impressed with the service, room, and atmosphere of the Kimpton Ink48 Hotel. 
Happy hour has free wine in a cozy setting. The 16th floor has a large terrace providing wonderful views of the city.
However, our room (212) was horribly noisy (late into the night and past 3 in the morning) that interfered with our sleep.

title: An overnight stay before a cruise
text: Excellent hotel very comfortable and perfect location for us as we were leaving from the Manhattan Cruise Terminal which is literally five minutes away so we walked. To get a taxi and driven would have taken longer. We were influenced by the fact that we had no luggage, it was somewhere between Amsterdam and JFK. However even if you had luggage you should be able to walk. It is only a $10 taxi ride from Times Square and Macys. I would have given it five stars apart from the fact that you have to pay fro wi-fi in your room unless you have an IHG Loyalty Card. I think that this is miserly. There is also free coffee in the lobby. Apart from being near the cruise terminal it is also just 10 minutes from USS Intrepid Aircraft Carrier museum which has both a Concorde and a Space Shuttle.

title: trendy hotel with nice roof top bar
text: trendy Hotel with Roof top bar, large, clean rooms with comfortable bed, spacious clean bath with excellent shower, nice view from rooml on Hudson river and cruise terminals. Close to large selection of reastaurant on 10th Ave, in Walking distance to "Hi Line" and Times Square

title: Kimpton brand never disappoints
text: 2nd time we stayed at this location. The staff is friendly, room is clean, shower is huge, view is amazing, service is top notch. Always a great experience when we stay at any Kimpton Hotel. Thank you!

title: Outstanding Customer Service!
text: From check-in through check-out, the hotel staff does not miss a beat in ensuring a top notch stay. I received a text message from the hotel manager shortly after checking in to confirm my satisfaction with the arrival process. The complimentary wine tasting in the lobby was an added bonus, ending with a nightcap at their comfortable and not too crowded rooftop bar. We had an amazing stay- we will be back!

title: DETAILED HOTEL REVIEW:  Some pros, some cons...  overall very good
text:
(If you read this review and it provides value, please click 'like', it helps me justify why I spend my time writing these reviews)

The Kimpton Ink48 is located on the west side of Manhattan in Hells Kitchen (corner 11th and 48th), one block east of the Hudson River and the cruise terminal for many cruise lines.  While this may make it convenient if arriving on a cruise ship, the location is probably the pro/con for this hotel.  On the pro side:  less chaotic area, great views either over the Hudson or the NY skyline as very few tall buildings in the area, and close to the Hudson River Parkway & USS Intrepid.  On the con side:  NO SUBWAY anywhere near here.  The ABC or 123 lines are a good 3-4 avenues away (avenues are much wider that the N/S streets) so the only way to get to/from is taxi, uber or bus, or a good long walk.  Also, directly across the street on the north side of 48th is an event space that hosts a male strip club on certain nights that lets out at 4am.  This can lead to a lot of street noise.

Rooms:  We stayed in a two queen room.  Very spacious for NY standards with comfortable linens and pillows providing a good nights sleep.  Window can be cracked open for natural air (lot of street noise), A/C only goes to 65F.  Plenty of storage. No desk. Free wifi (sign up for Karma rewards).  Minibar. Flat screen TV but with no HBO and no NBC Sports network.  Bathroom:  shower only (water far too hot and couldn't get a cool shower - likely valve problems), one sink.  Robes provided.

Lobby / Restaurants:  While Kimpton provides its customary happy hour and morning coffee / papers in lobby area, the hotel also has 'Print Restaurant' and the 'Press Bar' on premises.  See separate reviews for complete details.  In summary, neither are owned by hotel which leads to a few issues.  The popular Press Bar on the roof, with great views, appears to often be closed to private parties. People under 21 are not allowed on the roof which is annoying if staying here as a family, also would not allow you to charge anything to your room.  The ground floor restaurant (Print) offers breakfast, lunch and dinner.  Meals were excellent and could be charged to the room.  There is also a bar in the restaurant area.

Other local spots to eat:  Just south of the hotel is the Landmark Pub (oldest Irish pub in NY?) offering very good pub food at reasonable prices.  Also 2 blocks south is the West Gotham Market food hall offering counter style service from a broad selection of foodie-type spots at excellent prices.  Well worth a visit.

No pool.

OVERALL:  Recommended.  However, no convenient subway could be a big problem for many.

title: Great place to stay in midtown
text: Stayed here because my wife had a seminar in the area. The facility has many dining options. Clean, more modern establishment than most New York City hotels. Staff was very accommodating and friendly. Would definitely stay here again if in the area.

title: Best roof top bar in the city
text: While walking into the hotel the staff greets you with a smile. Rooms are always clean. We love the giant showers in the rooms. We love staying here the night before we take a cruise. We walk right down the street and get on our ship. If you have a room with the water view you can see the ships. One block from the hotel is a lot of great restaurants.  A short walk down the street is the  Gotham West Market it houses nearly a dozen of the city's best vendors -- such as Blue Bottle Coffee, Ivan Ramen Slurp Shop, and Choza Taqueria. We love walking there to get a beer and a taco. This hotel is in a great location. We love Ink 48 Hotel.

title: Rooftop bar, amazing Hudson suite, awesome service by Roger and Anthony
text: It has been nearly a year since I stayed at this property, but it continues to be my favorite place to stay in NYC. It's a short walk from Times Square, and right on the Hudson River. So you get some great views and relative quiet (for NYC anyway - still bring ear plugs, or ask the front desk for them) while still being an easy walk from the main attractions. I typically stay here for business, and because the service is so, so good, it's my go to hotel when I'm in NYC. This time, I got upgraded to the Hudson Suite, which is my favorite hotel room EVER! Thanks to Roger and Anthony for top notch, friendly service, which always keeps me coming back to Kimpton and especially to this hotel.

title: Avoid staying on 48th west side of this hotel
text:
There is a nightclub called 48 that goes until 5am and the noice is unbearable. When I complained all the could say is that they have a "good relationship" with them so "sorry"
I am a Kimpton karma member and this place is great if you intend on sleeping after five am. Also wanted the rooftop lounge it was closed for private events two of the three nights we stayed.

title: Top Hotel, mit ein paar negativen Bewertungen
text:
Bevor wir nach New York geflogen sind, haben wir uns natürlich auch die div. Bewertungen von Ink48 durchgelesen und waren teilweise etwas verunsichert. Wir haben aber dann trotzdem unseren Aufenthalt im Ink48 gebucht.
Wir hatten ein geiles Zimmer mit Blick zur Stadt und es ist richtig, dass es die ganzen Nacht (außer Sonntags) recht laut von der Straße ist. Wenn man also empfindlich ist, dass sollte man Ohropax einpacken. Aber das Zimmer selbst und der Blick aus dem Fenster (wenn man im Bett liegt) ist so mega, da sieht man über den Verkehrslärm gerne hinweg.
Ein weitere Kritikpunkt, welchen wir ein paar Mal gelesen haben, die nächste Metro Station ist so weit weg. Dies ist auch richtig, ca. 10-15 Minuten, aber wir haben diese nur einmal in der Früh und max. einmal abends benötigt und wenn man New York besichtigt, dann geht man sowieso extrem viel zu Fuß und verzichtet dementsprechend häufig auf die Metro. Das Hotel liegt so zentral, dass sehr viel fußläufig erreichbar ist und so toll ist es in der Metro wirklich nicht, dass man besonders scharf drauf sein dürfte, mit dieser zu fahren.
Ein absolutes Highlight ist die Dachterrasse (Rooftop Bar)!
