Uns wurde vor unserem Urlaub von der geilsten Rooftop Bar in New York erzählt und was gibt es besseres, wenn man dann feststellt, dass man in dem Hotel ist, zu welchem genau diese Rooftop Bar gehört :-). Die Sonnenuntergänge sind der Hammer, der Ausblick ist mega, einfach unbeschreiblich.
Noch ein letzter Punkt, der Service in dem Hotel ist ebenfalls top, das Personal sehr freundlich und zuvorkommend, da kann man nichts sagen.
Unser Fazit: Bei unserem nächsten New York Besuch werden wir wieder das Ink48 buchen!

title: Great Experience go and Enjoy.
text:
We arrived at lunch time by yellow cab from the airport. Had requested a room on a high 
floor and overlooking the Hudson. The room was perfect clean and overlooking the Hudson and 11th Avenue. The staff on reception Steven,Elijah and America were really great with suggestions of what to do and where to eat.
We ate in the Print restaurant one evening and the meal was exceptional. We also visited the roof top Press Lounge at sunset and the views and the atmosphere were special and memorable.
There were also suggestions to eat out on an evening at local restaurants B squared and also a local restaurant for an early breakfast.
The subway is easily in walking distance and we caught the E train down to thee world centre. Everywhere else just walked.
Went on the trip around New York by sea just from 12 th avenue and also visited the impressive Intrepid sea museum to see ship, The space shuttle Enterprise and Concorde BOAD.
We had a late flight back to the uk and the reception organised a late room and then stored the bags. They also organised a private vehicle back to JFK airport.
Wow I'm glad they did the Friday afternoon traffic was really busy and didn't expect the journey to take two hours.
Looking forward to staying here again when in New York.

title: Worst service ever! Will never stay at any Kimpton!
text:
The hotel seemed nice and they focused on the free drinks they offered but after spending 20 hours on the plane with a toddler when I finally reached the hotel that I had booked online they said my credit cards and debit cards, 4 of them were not working which is highly unlikely as they were from different countries and I had enough money in my account. So I offered to pay cash and settle everything in cash and offered advance payment and deposit, to which the manager Roger came and refused and said they needed a card for security reasons. I have no idea how a credit card is more secure than hard cash! They insisted I call up my banks that were NOT in the US on a Sunday and check with them as their machines could not be faulty. After having spent 40 mins on hold with my international bank as it was a Sunday. My toddler had been waiting patiently after a 20 hour flight and we had been trying to deal with this situation for over an hour I refused to get in touch with my bank and said u take the cash and I will sort this out tomorrow my child needs food and a room right now. They still refused claiming it's their policy to have a card on record. The manager Roger and front desk person Steven made it so difficult for me and were not understanding or cooperative at all and I am an international traveller who had been in the US for 10 days using all the cards before going to NYC. I left the hotel and checked into Westin Times Square who were most efficient, gave me an upgrade and all my cards worked perfectly fine here. 
Rest assured I will never be staying at any of the kimpton hotels anywhere in the world!

title: Great night in the city!
text:
We booked this place last minute for one night. The room was chic, comfy and spacious. Great shower and bed. Anthony at the front desk was wonderfully accommodating! Free coffee for all in the lobby in the AM! Walk to the sites!

A $15 bar credit if you're a Kimpton member is a nice reward, especially for a rewards program that you're not likely to accumulate tons of points on and, therefore, likely to never qualify for a free night!

I felt the $58 valet parking was also fairly priced! We looked to self park and it would have cost $48 for the night. Ten bucks to valet in NYC sounds like a deal!

title: Surprisingly large rooms in NYC
text: Having stayed in the Boston Kimpton property, I was expecting the hotel in NYC to have even smaller rooms. But I was pleasantly surprised at how amazing the room was and the large windows allowed enough light into the room. I loved the white decor. I did not visit the rooftop bar, but I am told that the place is drool worthy. I was on the higher floor so the street noise did not bother me much. I arrived early but despite being checked in with a large group and expressing my need to for an early check-in because I was arriving after a long flight - I did not get a room till 3pm (which was a bummer). I could have planned my travel arrangements better so I would not really blame the staff for it but still...

title: Wonderful hotel. Thanks
text: Thanks to all the staff at ink48. Great service. We celebrated our wedding Anniversary here and they put a complimentary bottle of prosecco in our room with a nice "happy anniversary" note. I also purchased a large expensive rug from Macy's and they were happy to store it for me. Skyline view from room was stunning. Roof top bar was great and so was the coffee in the reception area and complimentary wine for an hour at 5pm. Thanks guys, we'll definitely be back.

title: Amazing View and Fabulous Service!
text:
We are frequent travelers to NYC and have finally found our regular landing pad in Ink48.  We had two rooms because we were traveling with teenage kids, a Junior Suite and the Hudson River Suite.  We have never stayed in any NYC hotel with this much value and luxury for the room rate.  Both rooms were very spacious and comfortable with amazing views of the Hudson and even a fun view of the Intrepid Museum down below.  Waking up with panoramic scenes of the river, NJ across the water and sky were so invigorating I almost didn't want to leave the room for the day.  I couldn't get over the floor to ceiling/wall to wall windows.  The Hudson River Suite also allowed us some city scape views from our large side window as well.   The room itself was well appointed with a spacious bathroom with soaking tub.  The decor included a nod to the printing company which once occupied the space.  Regarding it's location, there was a bit of a walk to get to the busier restaurant area in Hell's Kitchen and the subway, but it was well worth it for the value, luxury and comfort of this hotel.
Something else that made our visit extra special was the care that the staff took with us.  Stephen Field in particular made sure that our stay was extra special by checking in as to what, if any, special accomodations we might need especially since we were traveling as a family.  He clearly went above and beyond any concierge we've ever worked with surprising us with extra treats for the kids and for my husband and me.  We also appreciated his help finding local places for some of our meals.  His recommendations were spot on.  Finally, I was particularly struck by his pride and "ownership" he had of Ink48. He also encouraged me to become part of the Karma program so that we could leverage additional perks.  The rest of the hotel staff was also fabulous - they seem to be a real family and seriously take pride in their space. Ink48 is now our new favorite place to stay in NYC.  We will be back for sure!

title: C'est dommage!
text:
Dommage parce que vous avez l'impression de dormir dans la rue!! L'insonorisation des vitrages est vraiment mauvaise, médiocre, nulle. On est à NY, la circulation ne s'arrête jamais! De plus il doit y avait une activité d'une entreprise dans la 47ème qui augmente encore le bruit! Bref donc comme le but premier dans un hôtel est de dormir le reste ne compense pas! Néanmoins si vous avez un sommeil de plomb pas de problème ! 
Personnel sympa, chambre impeccable ! Superbe vue de la terrasse.

title: Outstanding view
text: The room we stayed in was total perfection. The bed was large and soft, the deep soaking bath was deep and wide, the amenities were abundant. Overall it was a completely luxurious stay that my fiancee and I are dying to recreate. Topped it off with a killer view of NYC.

title: Kimpton does it right again
text:
Having stayed in what some call boutique(translate...miniscule rooms)hotels around the city...it was a wonderful surprise to actually get a hotel room that u did not feel claustrophobic .....rooms have huge windows
The staff was welcoming and knowledgeable......

title: Great Boutique Hotel
text: Great boutique hotel! Only a mile from Times Square, close enough to walk there but a quiet area at night so sleep is not interrupted by noise or light. Like most Kimpton hotels, rooms are modern, comfortable and clean. The rooftop bar Is very nice and has amazing views of Manhattan.  The restaurant is solid and overall great customer service from the hotel staff.

title: Great Modern hotel in a good location
text: We stayed here for 4 nights to explore the west side of NYC and it served well as a base for this, the hotel lobby is stunning and interestingly designed the rooms are ample with most things you need, they will supply a coffee machine for your room in you request one  but there is complimentary Tea and Coffee in the lobby/lounge every morning too. we have only given 4 stars as we feel the rooms don't quite live up to the brilliance of the rest of the hotel i.e. lobby/lounge and the Magnificently elegant roof top bar giving a magical panorama of the Hudson River and Midtown Skyline

title: Nice hotel but not convinced about location!
text: Stayed for 3 nights over weekend. The room I booked was a well appointed, modern room. The location is on 11th avenue and away from the hustle and bustle of Times Square and yet near enough to walk but the area not so nice to walk around in the evenings! I wouldn't book again mainly due to location but it is a nice hotel. If you are looking for a hotel where you can party on a rooftop terrace in Nyc, this would be a good option!

title: Good Location however......
text:
Pluses and Minuses for this hotel. Having just returned from NYC I wanted to review it sooner rather than later.  The hotel itself is not far from Times Square (approx. a brisk 15 minute walk straight up 48th Street) and you can walk to the Empire State, 5th Avenue and Central Park rather than sitting in a taxi in hideously busy traffic.

The Intrepid Aircraft Carrier is about 5 minutes walk, Battery Park (for the Statue of Liberty) and the 9/11 Memorial is definitely a taxi ride away.

The room(s) we had was big, clean and comfortable and the staff were very helpful.  We had a twin room first on the 6th and then the 11th floor.  Sadly, being higher up did not help with the noise emanating from the street below and the roof top bar/restaurant next door and thus we did not have one night's sleep that was uninterrupted.  The glass in the windows must be very thin and felt that we had left a window open.  

We had breakfast one morning that was nice and comparable given that we did not have to walk 20 minutes to get there.

Like another reviewer said, I'm not sure what the noise was like on the other side of the hotel.  However, we did have a view of the Hudson river which was nice and very pretty at night.  I guess its a lottery when it comes to any hotel but lack of sleep spoilt it a bit.

title: Great choice for NYC
text:
My husband and I stayed here recently when I was in NYC for business. While fans of Kimpton hotels in general, we had never stayed here before so we were not sure what to expect. It is located on the west side not far from the Javits Center. It is not near any subway lines so it is a walk to get there if a cab is not to be found. 

The hotel is contemporary and beautifully decorated. The service lives up to the top-notch Kimpton standard - which we love. We were warmly greeted after a long cross-country trip and walk in the rain with our luggage. Our room was a nice size, comfortable, quiet and had all of the amenities we needed. Their 'Forgot it? We've Got It' and 'Raid the Bar' programs are nice perks for Karma Rewards members. Our room had bathrobes, big fluffy white towels, nice Atelier Bloem toiletries, and king size bed with comfortable pillows and sheets. Internet was a bit sluggish and tricky to connect at times however it was complimentary as a Kimpton Karma rewards member. Water pressure was great and it was easy to sleep there. No noise from other rooms or outside (except for construction drilling way off in the distance but no one can do anything about that). 

We had dinner at the restaurant and drinks at the rooftop lounge. We enjoyed both very much. Amazing views!! Overall we were both really happy with the hotel and plan to stay there again in the future. I recommend it!

title: Nice hotel but...
text:
Stayed here for a week and there were mixed opinions. The hotel was clean, the rooms were spacious and the beds were nice. The view from our room wasn’t much and the noise from the night club on the weekend was pretty loud. Something else we didn’t enjoy was the food in the restaurant, it wasn’t that great. 

Location wise it isn’t that far from restaurants and grocery shops, it’s only a short walk to Times Square too or subways to get to other places... it’s also near the boat tours to see New York by boat which is cool. 

So I’d recommend this hotel, I guess the noise problem depends on where your room is :)

title: Great Hotel stay!
text:
Kimpton ink
My family spent 7 days at this smart hotel with a great vibe! Friendly welcoming staff, big modern rooms. Our room had an amazing side city and Hudson view. Print restaurant served really good food. The casual side Print counter (serving drinks, on the go breakfast and casual lunches) was a handy option, food was delicious and both girls who serve us were super friendly and accommodating.  The Press Lounge rooftop bar, although super pricey, was still an added bonus with the most spectacular views of the city and Hudson.  There is a complimentary wine hour, however we weren’t informed about it by staff so unfortunately only came across the info on the Kimpton awards website the day before.

title: perfect over night stay
text:
My wife & I stayed in the king city view room. i requested a higher floor and was placed on the 11th floor over looking the city (Just Perfect!!!) All staff were extremely nice and professional. it was a perfect location for the theater and so many choices of restaurants. The rooftop lounge was fabulous and i loved their system where one girl took the drink order, placed the order in a hand held computer and within minutes we had our drinks. once again with a smile on their faces. Elijah at the front desk was very helpful patiently answering our questions as well as making some recommendations. 
Room was spacious very well decorated and clean,. it was the best nights sleep i had in a long time. we did not have an issues with noise as i read some other reviews.
Next time we go to NYC to stay over this will be my go to place. thank you to the entire staff for making our 1 night get away spectacular!!!! .

title: A great hotel in Manhattan
text: The pool and the bar are great, overlooking the city. It's great at night. The rooms are great though New York City tight size. It's also well located, a short distance to great restaurants and clubs.

title: GOOD LOCATION
text:
Massive rooms, great location. 
Nice bar on roof top, you'll get some great views & pics.
Staff are ordinary don't expect a lot from them. 
Room service was fast, not a huge menu, but it was fast. 
Had to complain about rooms not being cleaned which was really disappointing. 
Breakfast is very basic before 9am - take away muffins & yoghurt.  - If your'e working like I was, you'll need to get breakfast else where. 
Check your bill on the way out - we were charged for a car parking & it look close to 10 emails to get it sorted  Out(!!?)
Overall though, things happen & the large room & location were worth it, so I'd stay again.

title: A fantastic New York hotel experience!
text: Staying at Ink48 is an experience of it's own.  It is located in Hell's Kitchen, making it walking distance to Times Square, Central Park, or a very short cab ride to anywhere midtown.  The rooftop bar is superb and offers a panoramic view of the entire midtown.  PRINT Restaurant is an excellent restaurant, located in the lobby.  The rooms are modern, well thought out, and very clean.  Staff of the hotel are extremely friendly and enhance the experience.  It offers all of what you would expect in New York, great door service, concierge, top notch food, and the thoughtfulness of the amenities of the room is one of the best I have seen.

title: First rate
text: This is our go-to, with couples or gal-pals. Never disappoints and often surprises in a great way. Super location and friendly staff. The Happy Hour is an add-on even though the space is small when there's a large group in attendance. Lobby is spacious and restrooms are handy.

title: New York, New York
text: My wife stayed in this hotel at the end of April 17.  She was on a trip with her brother and sister to New York and this was for the final 4 nights of the trip and I organised this hotel on there behalf. I chose the hotel as it had great reviews and seemed to be in an excellent location.  They were not disappointed!! From the rooftop bar, to the suite and the service they couldn't stop raving about how good the hotel was.  Made me jealous not to be there.  It was close to Broadway, were they attended Hello Dolly and all other sights.  Again I was not there, but I felt I was from the feedback.  Definitely give this hotel a go if you are in the city.  Also the suite was well worth the price.  I will be staying here when I visit with my wife in the future.

title: Great Hotel, Location is an issue
text:
I stayed for a combination of pleasure and business.  While the hotel itself was great, the staff friendly, and the rooms fair, it is situated next to a club that brings with it a ton of late night street noise.  The car horns and vehicles get started around 11pm and then return around 4am.
The staff was great: all very friendly and accommodating.

title: Just right
text:
We stayed overnight..we had dinner and Broadway tickets.. wanted to avoid the congestion that is Broadway/ Times Square 
This is the perfect location . Within reasonable walking distance.. 
the hotel itself has a nice lobby, bar , restaurant, and a very popular rooftop bar 
( can get pretty crowded, depending on evening).. spectacular views of the city
The staff is spot on.. customer service is excellent. They offer Valet parking as well 
Shoutout  to J. Colon( courteous, accommodating, informative( gave us suggestions to local eateries).
The rooms are clean and well equipped.
Only complaint ( I must emphasis I am a light sleeper).. 
we were on 5 floor, our windows facing what turned out to be several nightclubs, stage forty8, level 3, cantina rooftop).. they went on till way pass 4 am ( cars honking all through night)..

title: Loved the Hudson Suite
text:
The hotel is situated right near the Hudson and is extremely close to where the cruises come in. It is a pretty quiet area compared to the rest of New York with the exception of the amazing rooftop bar at the hotel, Press Lounge. Staying at the hotel, you do not have to wait in any lines to go to Press which is a nice perk. They also sent some beers and nuts up for my husband's birthday, which was a nice touch. All of the staff were also friendly and helpful.

The suite was large with high ceilings and floor to ceiling windows, as well as a huge bathroom with a deep soaking tub.

The bed was extremely comfortable and the hotel was clean.

My only minor complaints about the hotel were:

-Having to pay for wifi
-No coffee machine in your room unless you call down and request one (though the complimentary coffee and tea offered daily in the lobby were delicious)
-It is in Hells Kitchen and is at least a five block walk to get to anything else worth seeing and is about a mile from Central Park (but is less than a mile from the Theater district).

I really enjoyed staying in the Hudson Suite though and would definitely recommend it. It was a great value for the amount of space you get in New York.

title: NIce Upscale hotel near Cruise Terminal
text:
Stay one night prior to Cruise departure.  Location was just one block away from departing ship.  Area looks commercial with mainly warehouses and businesses.  Not too many restaurants in immediate area.  Located a little far from Times Square, but walkable

We paid for a standard room but was unexpectedly upgraded to a suite because we were selected as "Guest of the Day".  Room was huge and had separate bathtub and other amenities.  We were also presented with a bottle of wine and some nuts at night.  

As part of loyatly program we were allowed to "raid the frig" for $15 and had free wifi and early/late check-in.  Good Deal....

Coffee, tea and water was provided every morning..

Overall, good experience and would stay again if taking another cruise from NYC.

title: Clean and comfortable
text: This hotel is a little away from the centre (Times Square) but you can walk it.  It's worth it to get away from the taxi horns! The room was airy, a decent size (by NY standards) and spotlessly clean.  The bed was very comfortable.  Breakfast was OK but there is free coffee each morning and free wine in the afternoons.  Alot of rave reviews about the rooftop bar, which does have a great view, but it was always very busy when we were there.  Reception staff were friendly and very helpful in booking up trips.

title: Highly Recommend This Hotel!
text: This hotel was incredible! This was my first time visiting NYC and I will definitely be back to stay at INK48. I have stayed in many hotels and I have never received the kind of service that matched INK48. The staff were incredibly friendly and helped us with anything we needed without hesitation. They truly went above and beyond expectations.  The hotel was very clean and the room was beautiful. We even checked out the rooftop lounge which had a stunning view! I also loved that it was in walking distance to Times Square. I couldn't have asked for anything more! I loved my stay at INK48 and can't wait to come back!

title: Great spot.
text: This is my second visit to a kimpton hotel. I entered Ink48 to be greeted by friendly staff. New to the rewards program I chatted with the front desk ( so sorry I forgot his name) and the next thing I knew he told me I was the "guest of the day". Seriously. I got an upgrade and when I returned to the room that night there was an amazing fruit plate and wine waiting for me. I was intrigued by my first stay at the Kimpton Monaco in Pittsburgh. Now I'm hooked. Ink48 has sleek urban style. Very different than the Monaco. Can't wait to try other locations.

title: Top to bottom excellent!
text: We've stayed a lot of places and this was TOP NOTCH! The service, the room, the amenities and attention to detail. The turn down service was a nice touch. We will always pick this hotel when we're in NYC.

title: A true NYC gem!
text: Stayed recently for a weekend to celebrate my husband's birthday.  This was a return visit, we've stayed at Ink48 many times before.  This particular visit was a return stay after we had experienced some problems when we stayed in March.  We were celebrating our 30th anniversary, the hotel treated us wonderful as usual, sending us champagne and other gifts.  However, we actually checked out early due to noise from a club across the street.  We expressed our concerns and the hotel manager apologized, asked us to consider returning (which we did) and we experienced another wonderful stay!  Happy to recommend this hotel and we look forward to the next time!

title: Great New York Hotel
text: Have travelled to New York many times over the years, but have never experienced a better hotel stay in the city. These hotel rooms are quiet...you can actually sleep, and anyone that has ever travelled to New York City knows what that means and how much that is appreciated. And the rooms are BIG! And actually BRIGHT! All staff was excellent and pleasant from doormen, check-in, restaurant and bar. Wine tasting from 5 to 6 was a really nice touch, but even when paying for a glass of wine at the bar, the server was quick, the price reasonable and the pour decent for a change. I need a coffee before I face the world and they provided a keurig in the room when I requested one. The only thing one should know is that it is a little away from the 'sights' if you 're there to do touristy things. I am always there for business so that is not an issue for me. I wanted to experience the roof top bar which looked really cool but unfortunately there was a private function going on. Next Time :)

title: Excellent Stay
text: The views were beautiful. Loved my room, had a great gift of dessert and chocolates sent to the room for free, and found everything enjoyable. The bar up on the roof has some of the best views I've seen in the city. I'd stay here again and again.

title: Not close to anything (other than Intrepid)
text:
We again paid a premium to stay at a nice hotel - this time in NYC.

Again if you are not a loyalty member for that  hotel or you booked through a travel agency - then you receive poor room choice. Staff did not seem to care, because you were not a hotel rewards member - even though we were staying 5 nights.

While we had a King city view room, it was the smallest of these types of rooms as it had a large chunk of the room missing for the adjacent bathroom and the smallest width windows of any room.  You can see this if you look on the fire evacuation plan in the inside of the door.

Nether the hotel staff nor the travel agent - seemed to want to address this as we had prebooked the payment for this stay.

The rooms themselves were clean and very modern decor, thought he windows were absolutely filthy.

The hotel being at 48th and 11st was not close to any attraction nor any public transport - so if you are there to visit NYC, there could be other more convenient places to stay.

title: Great place to stay if you are going on a cruise
text: The hotel is stunning. The decor is cool and hip. The staff is friendly and extremely accommodating. We had an issue with our room as I requested 2 beds for 3 people but they had us in a room with 1 bed. They ended up giving us another room for free! We were able to see the cruise port right from our window and saw our ship pull in the morning we were scheduled to depart. The negatives are that there is a club across the street with loud people and music until ungodly hours of the night and there aren't a lot of restaurants nearby. There is one in the hotel but it wasn't the type of food we were looking for. There isn't much in walking distance as there are more car dealerships than restaurants and bars in the area but you can't go wrong with the walk across the street for your cruise!

title: BEYOND OUR EXPECTATIONS
text: Room was beautiful, contemporary,large with a view of the city enough to  inspire poetry!Bathroom large airy beautiful also. Staff awesome. Dining room as part of hotel had utterly beautiful farm to table food and the roof top lounge dynamic.Loved everything about this hotel

title: AMAZING Kimpton w/ Views in Hell's Kitchen
text:
Booked last minute while in New York and was I ever impressed. Upon check-in, due to my Kimpton Karma status, I received a free upgrade to the top floor suite overlooking the city (best view from a hotel I have ever had), not to mention top notch service from the staff at the front desk. Hotel room was spacious, clean, and tons of natural light. Workout facility was small, but did the trick, Wonderful/popular rooftop bar with killer views, along with a restaurant on site which I did not eat at. Did get delivery from a restaurant nearby (recommendation of the staff), which was perfect and just what I needed.

Some of the best Kimpton service I have had to date. Most definitely will be back!

title: "Very nice hotel"
text: We stayed 1 night during labor day weekend. Accommodations were excellent.  Corner deluxe king provided wonderful views. Downside was the hotel was packed with 2 weddings scheduled at the same time.  We was not able to access the rooftop lounge which was highly recommended.  :(  Also, valet parking was way to expensive at $75 per night.

title: Numerous issues, but STEPHEN the Front Desk Agent (FDA) is the Worst and should not be in the hotel business.
text:
We had several issues with our stay at this hotel. 

First, we (2 family's) booked 3 rooms, (2 of the rooms were suppose to be connectors) for 3 nights, over the Labor Day weekend. When we arrived, the hotel only had 2 of the 3 rooms. The hotel was sold out. We had no other choice but to take the 2 rooms. This made accommodations very uncomfortable. 

Second, neither of our guest room doors would not close and lock correctly. 

Third, the snacks at our snack bar in the room were old and stale. Also, the towels and linen sheets were old and worn. Not what you would expect at a boutique hotel. 

Forth, we had a minor emergency which required us to go to the emergency room. Unfortunately, we didn't get back to the hotel until 11:50am. I explained to the Front Desk Agent (FDA) about the situation. It took several minutes of conversation to convince her to allow us a "customary" late checkout to 1pm. The hotel was not sold out and 1pm late checkout is normally customary in the industry. 

And the fifth, my room along with another guest key cards timed out.  We both had a late checkouts. The keycard's timed out at noon. My family waited in the hallway while I went down to get the new key. STEPHEN the FDA was working alone at the front desk. He was assisting a guest with a billing issue.  We both waited patiently at the front desk while STEPHEN worked on the billing issue. STEPHEN never once acknowledged our presence. It took about 10-15 minutes to resolve the issue. After the guest walked away, STEPHEN continued to work on the guest's folio, again failing to acknowledge our presence. Finally, STEPHEN asked if there was something we needed. The other gentleman informed him that both of our room keys timed out for both of our rooms. STEPHEN proceeded to re-key the other gentleman's key. Once completed, he handed him the key. I then attempted to hand him my key. He intentionally turned away and asked a customer walking up to the front desk if he could assist them. I immediately asked why he was not taking my key. He completely ignored me!  It was the most oddest thing I've ever experienced from a FDA. I then moved next to the customer who had walked up to the desk and demanded STEPHEN'S attention. He finally looked at me and said he would be with me as soon as he finished with the customer. I informed him I that I had been standing there for over 15 minutes. The customer standing at the desk acknowledged to him that I was there before her. The guest stepped back and insisted he service me. He reluctantly agreed. 

I understand the previous guest with the billing issue may have aggravated him with the number of billing issues, but STEPHEN is suppose to be a trained professional.  I absolutely did nothing. I never once made him feel rushed to finish with the other guest. I'm completely baffled why he would have ignored me, knowing I had been there for sometime without assistance. 

I informed him I would write a review based on his rude behavior. It didn't seem to bother him, nor did he attempt to apologize for his behavior. 

Btw...  I never mentioned to him or the management we own several award winning IHG hotels. I understand the expectations and duties of the agents who work the Front Desk. I can certainly sympathize with the situations and guests they sometimes encounter daily. Although, STEPHEN's attitude was completely unacceptable and inexcusable.

title: Wonderful Stay
text:
Spent 5 nights here. We had a city view studio king with bath in the room. Bed was super comfy. View not as expansive as website pictures & windows very dirty. Overall excellent standard, just a few minor niggles so don't be put off going. Tea & coffee in room would have been nice, although you could fetch one from reception. Disappointed with "closed" areas. Would have been so nice in the morning to go up to roof terrace for a coffee but it's closed all through the day 🤷🏻‍♀️Breakfast up there would have been amazing, instead we ate out of hotel. 
The sumptuous seating in reception area are cordoned off unless you are special or dining 🤷🏻‍♀️
The staff were 10/10, very helpful. Room was spotless. If you don't want to walk everywhere or take taxis.....learn the bus routes near the hotel.

title: Nice, new hotel
text:
The hotel is new.  The decor is tastefully executed, beds are ok and amenities were fine.  Overall, there is nothing about the hotel that would disappoint.  

However, it is further from the subway and area attractions.  We found that we had to walk at least 10-15 minutes for decent restaurants and/or the subway.  Since it is in Hell's kitchen, it is a bit out of the way.

title: Great Customer Service and Location
text: My boyfriend planned an impromptu trip to see Lion King. He stayed at this hotel for something else so I had know knowledge about it. The room was very nice and modern. The people at check in and checkout were really friendly. Jose  Colon was especially helpful with giving us directions, our luggage, valet and ideas of what to do and told us about the rooftop which neither of knew about which had AMAZING view of the city. Will definitely come and stay again as it is less than 15 minute walk to Time Square! The bar area and roof top make for a cute date if you just feel like hanging around the hotel.

title: Kimpton Ink48 Evangelist!
text: From the minute you arrive, you are given WOW service. They treat their guests with love and care. My husband said the king bed we had was among the best sleep he's had. What a phenomenal staff this hotel has put together! Exceeded expectations. Love how each team-member OWN their work.

title: Always a pleasure
text: Whenever I have to travel to NYC for work (or play), I always prefer to stay here. The property is beautifully maintained, the staff is always friendly & the quality they choose for the individual rooms is deluxe. I sleep great, too! I look forward to each stay at Ink48.

title: Wonderful hotel
text: Great hotel in Hells Kitchen; friendly capable service everywhere; excellent interesting food in the restaurant; very comfortable modern room with good amenities; fabulous roof garden lounge on the top of the hotel with great views.  Highly recommended.

title: Superb value at any price, very conveniently located in Manhattan.
text: Excellent experience. Lovely room. Very nice fitness facility. Friendly and attentive staff. One of the best views in Manhattan from their rooftop bar. This hotel (and Kimpton in general) are at the top of my list for best places to stay for business or pleasure.

title: Midtown/HK Work Trip
text: I have stayed at the property many times, this time I was on a north/north west facing room.  Horrible noise coming from construction and the roof top cantina next door.  Overall the rooms are great, beds are amazing and the staff is usually top notch.

title: Wonderful
text:
We loved our overnight stay ! 
Thank you Stephen (front desk) 
Your kindness & upgrade 
Great roof top bar 
Room was spacious, clean, bright & 
Quiet 
Could not ask for more 
Would absolutely return 
Location is convenient to all we needed 
Lovely coffee bar 
Thank you

title: Wonderful stay - noice however a nightmare
text: The hotel and staff are great - during our 14 day stay we have been met by very accomodating and helpfull staff members. We were upgrated to a larger room on the 11th floor without extra costs which was great. The view of downtown Manhattan was absolutely breathtaking however the noice from the street below was constant at all hour. Room was large, comfortable bed, excellent shower - everthing neat and tidy. The rooftop bar is out of this world and a must at night. Unfortunately our last few nights turned were a total nightmare due to noice from a nearby construction sight - heavy traffic from trucks and loud beeping noice when the trucks were reversing, work with jackhammer and other loud tools - and this all took place all night. This unfortunately has an impact on my rating which is unfortunate.

title: Above and Beyond!
text: The staff at Ink48 cannot be beat! Welcoming, knowledgeable and ready to go above and beyond. Our air conditioning was not performing optimally, so the front desk promptly sent Jeffrey from engineering up to see us. He not only fixed the air (minor issue) but personally delivered wine, glasses and treats for the kids as a follow up. Seriously! We were already having a great time, but this act of kindness took it over the top for us. Jeffrey went above and beyond for us today.

title: Great hotel and location
text: We were sailing out of NYC on our cruise, and found Ink conveniently located just one block from the pier.   I called the hotel direct to request a high room which was not facing 11th Avenue.  We arrived and we're very impressed with the lobby, our room request was honored and we had a great view of the piers on the Hudson.   The manager had sent up a bottle of wine with a happy birthday note within minutes of us arriving in our room.  Very nice of her.  She also followed up with us daily to ensure our stay was perfect.

title: Amazing hotel
text: Excellent hotel with an amazing view from the rooftoop bar/lounge at 16th floor. Large and comfortable room with a queen size bed. Good american and continental breakfast. Perfect to have a day of rest in the big apple!

title: Lo mejor que vi en NYC
text: Estuve en visita de negocios en este hotel, no lo conocía y nunca había estado en esta zona pero si otras veces en la ciudad en otros hoteles. Definitivamente este hotel es realmente bueno para hospedarse unos días en la ciudad de NY. Me encantaron las habitaciones, muy amplias, silenciosas, muy nuevas, baños impecables, cama super cómoda.. en fin muy buena opción. Lo mejor: la habitación como conjunto y su ubicación. La terraza tiene un bar con mucho ambiente. Muy recomendable!

title: Great NYC Experience
text:
I spent a wonderful anniversary weekend away in NYC at the Ink48.  We were looking for a spot close to the theatre district but away from Times Square proper.  As with other Kimpton hotels we have stayed at, the hotel did not disappoint.  
The concierge, Stephen, was so engaging with us.  Made it a point to find out what we were planning for the stay, made suggestions about spots nearby, and even sent up a bottle of wine and cupcakes for our special weekend.   The staff as a whole, from doorman to housekeeping, were all very friendly and accommodating.
The room had everything we could need for the trip.   The rooftop bar is a busy attraction on weekends, so a top floor may not be ideal if you are looking for an early tuck in.  
Looking forward to staying at the Ink48 again!

title: Comodità
text: L'albergo è situato sulla 11 strada proprio in prossimità del fiume Hudson. Non è nel cuore di Manhattan ma sicuramente è apprezzabile la quiete anche considerando la quantità di persone che brulicano nella zona di Times Square. L'albergo è stato ristrutturato di recente con camere comodo e molto pulite. Il ristorante è di alto livello. La metropolitana è a 10 minuti a piedi. Insomma hotel di buonissima qualità anche considerando il costo degli altri alberghi. Consigliato.

title: Ink48 is Great!
text: Im a Kimpton fan, try to stay w them wherever and whenever i can. my 5th or 6th time to Ink48. I think its is a great hotel, w exceptional value, nice room, big clean bathrooms, linens etc  all great ... really cool roof top bar but this time i want to also commend the staff, the GM, Front Desk Manger and the fabulous lady who checked me in (and followed up to make sure everything was cool) . this trip i was there for 2 nights and the first night i had a city view room and the city workers decided it was a night for jackhammering til abt 430 (last time i saw my clock) .. i know the Kimpton folks tried to get them to stop and the next day did something very nice for me (even though it wasn't there fault) .moved my room to the back side (just in case) .....   and then today i stupidly forgot my laptop in my room and realized it when i was at Newark airport , called the hotel, they had it, arranged for a driver to bring it to men, problem solved. Thanks again to the front desk, security team, bellmen, housecleaning.... i mean this is GREAT service.

title: Great West Side View
text: Marvelous conversion of old building in Hell's Kitchen. Reasonably convenient to Javits and near great west side spots. Looks down on Constellation and Jersey shoreline. Fascinating rooftop bar and lounge is wonderful at night.

title: Killer View Suite
text:
We had stayed at this hotel several years ago when we were looking for a new place and area to stay in the city.  We enjoyed our stay enough to recently return and write a new updated review.  

For our second time around we booked a Hudson River Suite which was a very smart move and worth the extra money.  This suite has a major wow factor as soon as you walk in and see the sweeping views from the floor to ceiling windows that wrap around the corner, basically the entire length of the two rooms. Our view included a head on look at the Intrepid aircraft carrier with all of its toys on display including a Concorde. Of course the Hudson River is the star here and the busy boat traffic is fun to watch, not to mention cruise ships also docking right in front of you.  You even have decent city views from the side window. Outstanding view aside, the suite itself was very nice with a stylish modern décor with a touch of whimsy, and included a big couch facing the river.  The bedroom had a small table for two which was the perfect place to have some food while continuing to soak in the view in two directions. Standard rooms also offer nice views from big windows and the same stylish décor.   

The rest of the hotel is also very nice with a darkish hip looking lobby and an attractive on site restaurant.  The big deal at the hotel is the trendy roof top lounge and terrace with views of Manhattan in all directions.  We did not go up this time, but we did notice the line for entry, but assume hotel guests can cut in but don’t quote us on that.  There is also a standard small hotel gym.  Of course we enjoyed the Kimpton happy hour, but space is tight at this location and it was busy, so we just got a drink and went back up to our suite to continue to enjoy the view.   

We like this location as it pushes us into a part of the city that we otherwise do not visit much.  It is an interesting area but it is several blocks west of the action and subway lines if that matters to you. That said, Ninth Avenue is two long blocks away and continues to evolve into one the best streets in the city with tons of restaurants.

title: Loved this hotel!!
text: We've traveled to NYC many times and it's always a crap shoot when we choose a hotel.  We try to stay in different parts of the city so we can experience it differently each time.  Well....we will no longer be hotel hopping.  This hotel was fantastic.  Beyond our expectations. You can't go wrong staying here with great access to everything.

title: Week long business trip
text:
I had a week long trip for work, and was booked into this hotel as part of a group rate.  Make sure you sign up before your reservation for their program, Karma.  You'll get some extra rewards that will make the extra 3 minutes trouble week worth it.  

The location is not very convienient to restaurants and other venues. However, the hotel and staff more than make up for it.  9th avenue is about a 15 minute walk, and has a lot of offbeat and interesting restaurants.  The is also a food court 3 minutes south on 11th avenue, that has a very wide selection of foods, including vegan selections.  No table service, but the food choices are plentiful. 

The hotel is extremely well appointed and well thought out.  Since I was on a group rate I wasn't expecting much.  The room was the smaller of their layouts but still very large for Manhattan.  I have stayed a few places in Manhattan, and was very pleased with the size.  Additionally I had a city view from my room, which was possibly the best view in all Manhattan.  

I have stayed at some of the best hotels in the world, and the staff here is on-par with any I have ever experienced, which is amazing considering that even the rack rate.  The doorman who appears to be a body builder was exceptional, the desk staffers very knowledgable and friendly, and you could expect no better anywhere.  Whomever does the staffing here should be commended.

The room on arrival was perfectly clean, and every detail addressed by the cleaning staff.  Perfection!

Beware the so-called mini bar....it was the best I have ever seen, and while the prices are not cheap were lower than I have seen elsewhere. I have never seen a "minibar" that had full liter bottles...wow!

Despite the shortcoming on location, I would highly recommend this hotel, and would be very pleased to return.

Well done!

title: Great stay in NYC
text: I really enjoyed my stay at INK48. Hell's Kitchen is a great neighborhood and the hotel is staffed with some of the friendliest folks. We received a free upgrade to a deluxe king with an amazing view, complimentary bottle of wine because we were the "guests of the day," and express access to the rooftop lounge because we were hotel guests. The rooms were clean and the bed was very comfortable. I also really appreciated the modern decor and the very well dressed staff. They do this very cool thing of texting you to make sure you have everything you need. It really is above and beyond. Akil, the concierge, was great.

title: Weekend in NYC
text:
We really enjoyed our stay at Ink48 and would highly recommend it.  The location couldn't have been more perfect; close by everything but still away from all of the crowds.  The hotel staff was extremely helpful and accommodating, no matter how many questions we had for them.  We had a city view room and they were able to put us up on a high floor.  This was a wonderful perk that we weren't expecting.  The room was very clean and comfortable.  The wine happy hour is one of my favorite things. 
 Kimpton Hotels are our favorite and we will definitely be back!

title: Friendly people, stylish hotel, fantastic experience
text:
I arrived at 2pm and my room wasn't ready...yet. The staff member, America (yes, as in our country!) made me feel warm and welcomed despite a short wait.

The rooms are spacious for NYC, clean, and the view was great.

Aside from the warm experience, the rooftop bar was hip (two doorman at the elevator!) and the 5-6pm wine happy hour was wonderful to unwind to when I could get there in time.

100% would stay here again!

title: Love this hotel! Every time I visit NYC I'll stay here.
text:
I have stayed at the Kimpton Ink48 Hotel a few times now.  Previously I was an Inner Circle Member with Kimpton, so was always treated with the utmost care and respect.  My status has recently lapsed, so I was interested to see how the service differed, as a 'regular joe' guest.  

I am happy to say that it didn't.  The service was excellent, the perks are always fantastic and I felt like I was right at home.  

Out of the dozens of Kimpton Hotels I've stayed in, this one may be my favourite! 

For people visiting NYC this is a great choice of hotel.  You are close to Gotham Market, the River and it's an easy walk/Uber/Cab/Citi bike wherever you need to go.

title: Fijn hotel, maar gehorig
text: Dit is een fijn, modern en schoon hotel. Als uitvalsbasis voor uitstapjes in New York ligt het prima, binnen 10 minuten wandelen ben je bij Times Square of Rockefeller Center. Ik las diverse opmerkingen over herrie en hoewel wij geen last hadden van nachtclubs e.d., ben ik elke nacht wel Walker geword van de herrie van buiten. Zou verwachten dat zo'n mooi hotel beter geïsoleerd zou zijn tegen geluid.

title: Excellent hotel; Spectacular Service; Highly Recommend
text: Kimpton Ink48 is an excellent place to stay for your NYC vacation.  Located in Hell's Kitchen, right next to the Hudson River and the beautiful Hudson River Park, we weren't terribly close to a subway station, but still felt it was worth the little extra walking to get to the train station.  We seriously had the best check-in experience ever.  The gentleman at the counter (Friday, July 28 at 9:30 pm) could not have been more welcoming.  I hope his employers know what a great job he does and how well he represents the hotel.  I recommend going online before your visit and signing up for the Kimpton Hotel perks, which you do just by giving your email.  This will allow for some extras, like a $15 gift card for the mini bar, free wifi, and points toward other things, like an upgrade.  Our room on the 11th floor was spacious and decorated in a white modern theme, with black and white images surrounding the king-size bed frame and on the walls.  The bathroom was large enough, but not for two people at once.  The beds were comfortable, the shower had good water pressure, I really like the soaps and shampoos they provide, and we had a little view of the Hudson and the Intrepid.  I love that they texted me immediately to ask me how I liked the room.  They checked in on me via text from time to time, but were not intrusive.  I asked for a second bath robe, and it was brought to our room within fifteen minutes.  They allow dogs in the hotel, and there was a dog water bowl at the entry to the hotel, welcoming them.  There is construction in the area (always construction everywhere in NYC) and noise on the street from the bar adjacent, but the room fan blocked the noise out beautifully.  We ordered breakfast from their walk-up bar, which is in between their restaurant (Print) and the hotel lobby.  We really enjoyed our breakfast sandwich (called the Farmer's sandwich, I think).  It was $11, but hotel food is always expensive and so is everything in NYC, so we weren't shocked.  There is free coffee every morning in the lobby every morning until 10, and a free wine bar from 5-6 every afternoon, both of which we enjoyed very much.  The elevators were fast, but they seemed to be having a little bit of trouble with them on Saturday night.  One of the hotel employees, though, was right there to make sure they got us up to our rooms.  The hotel rooftop bar (called Press, I think?) has the most amazing views.  You must go up and check it out.  Yes, it is crowded, yes, there are some obnoxious people, yes, service can be pretty bad, and yes, a beer is around $12 and a glass of wine is $14.  It is expensive.  All of the comments and reviews we had read about the rooftop bar were accurate.  However, for the half hour we were up there, we took in the gorgeous views and relaxed with a drink (only one).  If you know what to expect before you go, you won't be so aggravated.  Hotel guests don't have to wait in line to go up to the rooftop bar, which is another great perk of staying in this hotel.  This hotel is just a short walk to Hudson River Park, which I highly recommend visiting and hanging out for a day.  We walked along the water, stopped for some drinks at Buoy Bar (thumbs up) and took a cruise on the Circle Line boat.  I would come back to this hotel again and again.  It was a great experience.  Thanks, Kimpton Ink48 people!

title: Quintessential NYC Experience
text: Ink48 is the perfect NYC choice...  the hotel is within moderate walking distance (or short uber ride) to Times Square, the Theater District, the High Line, and Central Park.  The service and food at the restaurant, Print, are outstanding.  Be sure to check out the Press Lounge -- spectacular NYC views, stunning really.  The cocktails are impeccably crafted (and come with NYC prices).  As with all Kimptons, Ink48 is pet friendly, and our two pups were welcomed as warmly as their human guests.  The hotel is in a quieter section of town during the day and 4 blocks to a dog park, which is nice for the pups.  All in all, a fantastic choice to experience the city.

title: Great service
text: Like every Kimpton, Ink48 has plenty of unique personality and charm that reflects the neighborhood, and creates a friendly, welcoming atmosphere. Our room was large for Manhattan, and the rooftop bar has killer views. I love the wine hour and complimentary morning coffee at all Kimptons. The hotel is really close to the cruise ship piers, west of Times Square and a little bit of a walk to the nearest subway station. Parking on the weekend is easy, but don't even think about it during the week. If street noise keeps you up at night, request a high floor. Finally a shout out to the front desk staff. Super friendly and accomodating. I visit my hometown often and will definitely stay here again.

title: Another Outstanding Visit
text:
Another outstanding visit to New York and the Ink48 Hotel!
It was a birthday trip for my husband, and staying at the Ink48 made it even better.
Our trip would not have been as great, without the Ink48 concierge, Stephen Field. Stephen assisted with many dinner reservations and theater tickets - in addition to some tips for taking the subway.
Cheers to the Ink48, a beautiful hotel and double Cheers to Stephen Field!

title: Hotel California - never stay here - terrible check in, rude and unprofessional front office
text: With the exception of the concierge coordinator no staff member good give a hoot about a customer - they love to argue and love the sound of their own voice regardless of any issue you may wish to discuss - they will even slam the phone on you.  Check in is a disaster - their card machines are messed up - using a defective Pos - also incompetent and uncooperative staff - my kid was hungry waiting for them to check in for 90 mins - eventually left and went to the Westin where all was taken care of without any nonsense experienced at this terrible hotel - wouldn't stay here because of their rudeness even if they pad me to

title: Will be back...
text: 2nd visit to Ink48 and certainly won't be the last. Stephen, the concierge, is a real gem and a fantastic source of information and laughs. The rooms are spacious, unlike most NY hotels and the views are beautiful. The wine hour on the rooftop was extra special and the service all the way around couldn't have been better. See you all next year.

title: 4 day Birthday getaway to NYC
text: This was my second time staying at Ink48 and it was just as fantastic--maybe even more so--than the first time in July 2016.  Our room was incredible.  All the services were great and the staff were all very welcoming and friendly AND polite AND helpful--I call that a triple threat! Stephen Field, concierge extraordinaire, really went above and beyond every expectation--calling and making dinner reservations at a moments notice and one time for a fairly large party(8), getting us special treatment at the different restaurants & special birthday treatment at Ink48, as well as just really helping make the whole trip flow smoothly and effortlessly, even in the 94º weather.  Can't wait to come back!

title: Lovely, off the beaten path
text:
I'm a loyal, and consistent Kimpton fan. While this hotel is off the beaten path, it has a wonderful vibe to it, and larger rooms and one would typically get in a more central Manhattan hotel. 

If you can live with the additional travel time to Midtown,it is a wonderful alternative.

title: Great Staff, cool Hotel
text:
After a nightmare travel day I was greeted by the front desk staff so warmly.  Stephen not only upgraded my room but also gave me his list of restaurant recommendations and a wealth of info.  A very hip, cool hotel with an incredible rooftop bar!

My room (1214) was great.  I ordered the hearty breakfast and had a nice healthy surprise with eggs served over fresh sautéed spinach and a generous bowl of blueberries. 

Only complaint is there was jack hammering every night starting.  It woke me up my 2nd night at midnight and heard it again starting at about 10pm the 3rd night.  I was here on business and would have appreciated being warned of this nuisance.

title: Loved loved our stay here
text: Fabulous roof top bar, comfy bed, great shower, yummy toiletries, delicious room service food, excellent snacks...this place has it all.  It's even pet-friendly, though we did not bring a pet. Come stay here & ENJOY!

title: Nice room & friendly staff
text: I have stayed at other Kimpton hotels, but this is my first time at Ink48. The room was nice, clean, modern & bright. Good wifi, robe, yoga mat, umbrella & minibar in the room. Coffee, WSJ, NYT in the lobby each morning. Kimpton always seems to provide a little more than expected. Small issue is the noise from police and/or other emergency vehicles. It would not keep me from returning, but if you are looking for a very quiet hotel this might not be the best place.

title: Go to place on the West Side
text: The staff never ceases to amaze and please. Always with great Hell's Kitchen restaurant recommendations, Stephen Field is the best Concierge in the biz. Print restaurant in the hotel, is amazing as well!

title: Amazing as always!
text: I can't say enough about INK48, such great service and the staff are top notch! Thank you Stephen for taking such good care of us! I surprised by husband for his 50th birthday. The hotel accommodated all 4 couples and everyone fell in love with INK. This is our 2nd time staying here, and wouldn't stay anywhere else when we are in NYC. Thanks again!!!

title: All around excellent stay
text: From the moment we arrived, the entire staff was there to help in every way they could.  This hotel is in a fantastic Hell's Kitchen location, with easy access to the theatre district. We always love it when the staff goes out of their way to treat not only us well, but also our chihuahua.

title: Always great
text: My 2nd time here and it doesn't let you down.  Great staff, comfortable beds and an upgrade!  Hoping for the same next week when I'm back.  Karma rewards with free wifi and a couple of comp items from the mini bar go well.  Have stayed in about 6 Kimpton properties, and they understand the modem traveller.  Thanks again.

title: Best hotel I ever stayed at!
text: I travel alot for work and stayed at many hotels but decided to spend my birthday weekend at ink48. They had awesome staff, the room was spacious and modern with great views of the city, and the roof top lounge was incredible! Me and my friends had a great experience and would definitely stay there again the next time we visit NYC.

title: Just stay here.  You won't regret it.
text: Always good times at Ink 48. Right as you walk through the door friendly staff greet you and get you on your way. There is never long lines. Very fast service. On this specific trip the print lounge had a party so they decided to do the free wine hour on the penthouse multi level outdoor patio. What an awesome idea and view! We had a great time. The rooms are super clean and have comfortable beds that you never want to leave. The whole hotel smells soooo good. I also love the bath soaps and lotions. I am always pleased how everyone remembers you and are genuinely happy to welcome you back. I was surprised with champagne and a fruit bowl waiting in my room. These little touches go a long way. This is my NYC hotel every time. I have tried many but this is home.

title: WOW
text: This hotel is a gem. The staff is so friendly. Elijah F. At the front desk was especially warm and welcoming. He gave us great recommendations in regards to really delicious places to eat, and great places to see.The hotel is immaculate. the hotel although busy was very quiet which was a plus. The lobby provides all types of beverages to help you beat the heat and stay hydrated. I will definitely be staying here again.

title: What a Find!!!
text:
I normally stay at a hotel midtown east.. but their summer prices were ridiculous.. so decided to try something new..  INK 48 is a fabulous hotel.  The staff was top notch- the lobby is beautiful.. lots of seating to hang out.. My room was perfect- bright and sunny- great bed- great shower- and most of all quiet. Slept like a baby-  Some may be shy of being so far on the westside but don't be. Subway and bus routes are nearby- its walking distance to chelsea, village, theater. Fun area with lots of restaurants and cafes. I went up to rooftop lounge but packed- looks great.
Can't wait to come back..

title: Always Perfect!
text: If you plan to visit NYC, you must stay here! Our stay was perfect! The room was very clean and comfortable with excellent bedding. It's close to great biking and running trails adjacent to the West Side Highway and wonderful restaurants in the Hell's Kitchen neighborhood. The hotel supplied complimentary bicycles for us to use which was a great bonus. What separates this hotels from most others is the people who work here and their commitment to their guests. We were made to feel like we were the only guests in the hotel. This level of service was not only at check in but during our entire stay. Everyone was so accommodating and pleasant. However, we must single out Kelsey who went above and beyond! Upon check in, she upgraded us to a wonderful room as we were celebrating our anniversary and provided us with a late checkout, which was so helpful!. She  constantly checked in with us during our stay asking us if we needed anything and sent up a nice bottle of wine for us (totally unexpected). Every company should have an employee like Kelsey. The hotel has a wine hour from 5-6. We had wine and sangria. Also, the view from the rooftop bar can't be beat. Great stay!!

title: Beautiful hotel
text: Beautiful hotel,very attentive front desk staff.the king room is very comfortable and very modern look which I like.the rooftop lounge (press lounge)has the most beautiful view of the city and the pool is really beautiful (it's not for swimming just for the look).

title: Great NYC Christmas!
text: The hotel was awesome.  The view was amazing, especially at night. The staff was very friendly.  Room was very clean. Pristine.  It was a nice relaxing getaway where you felt safe and where you could relax after a long day in the city. The area is close to many attractions.

title: Beyond Expectations!
text: Whenever I travel, Kimpton Hotels are always my first choice for several reasons, and my recent stay at the Ink48 validated each and every one of them.  Having arrived prior to our check-in time, the front desk was gracious enough to facilitate the storage of our bags, pointed out the complimentary water and ice tea in the lobby, and made suggestions for grabbing lunch.  When we returned, we were warmly greeted, given our room keys, and reminded that there was a complimentary wine happy hour from 5-6 in the lobby!  The room, a king city view suite, had the most amazing views of the mid-town skyline.  As always with Kimpton properties, the room was very clean, with modern decor.  As for the staff, everyone we encountered was smiling, polite, welcoming, and helpful.  My overall experience at Ink48 was superior, and I can not wait to stay again!

title: Wonderful hotel near the port!
text: I totally enjoyed my stay at the Kimpton Ink48 hotel.  The room was clean and spacious for NYC,  The service was perfection!  I am looking forward to staying there again next summer.  The location was close to the port.  We did have a long walk to the subway but that was no big deal.  We enjoyed the walk and always felt SAFE!

title: A Gem in the Big Apple
text:
Having relocated down south we tend to visit NYC often for family and work. Throughout the two years we stayed at a handful of hotels trying to find the right one in the area and we finally did! Our visit started after check in to a comfortable king size room with an amazing shower and a nice view of the city. After our first night I ran into the Guest Services Manager - Allison before heading out for work. She asked me about my stay and how they can make it better. I mentioned it would be amazing to be on a higher floor so I can be on top of the world. A few hours later my wife gets a call for a complementary upgrade. We went from the 8th floor to the 14th floor now I'm impressed! I had a few questions about billing since the company was cover the hotel stay. Just to ensure everything was taken care of I spoke to Gwyan - Front Office Manager and he got on the line with my company's booking service. Made my life even simple. Barbara made it super easy to get my car from valet and answer my super weird questions. Another perk is your paw-ter (paw daughter) or paw-on (paw son) stays at no additional cost! 

Overall Ink48 was a breath of fresh air. Loved the cool environment, friendly staff that aren't just there but are eager to help you and are passionate of making sure your stay is unique and comfortable! 

Traveling back up to NYC in a few weeks and guess where I am staying...ding ding ding! Ink48!!!!

title: Amazing place!
text: I visited a friend who was staying at the hotel. She uses the Kimpton line of hotels as often as she can. The service of the staff is impeccable! The rooms were clean and quite large for NYC hotel standards. The rooftop bar is AMAZING and a must if the weather is nice! I love that they are a pet friendly hotel and the rooms do not smell like the last guests pets at all. Good location to the theater district and not far from Times Square.

title: Spectacular!
text: We stayed in a beautiful and spacious corner Deluxe King Room with views of both the Hudson and Manhattan!  Absolutely stunning!  Staff was super helpful and kind.  Will definitely be staying at Ink48 on future visits to NYC!

title: Ink48 and Kimpton Over Deliver
text: We stayed in a City View Studio King Room, which was incredibly spacious and luxurious. Service was top-notch as always with Ink48 and Kimpton, from booking through exiting the front doors after checking out. The location is both convenient and a bit more relaxed from the hustle and bustle. I want the comfy pillows, spa-like toiletries, and state-of-the-art fitness center in my own home. Although I don't have a dog at the moment, I love that Kimpton is completely dog friendly. No complaints; all compliments ... thanks, Ink48 and Kimpton!

title: Great place!  Great staff!
text:
We had a great visit at Ink48!  Very conveniently located to theater district, time square, subway, etc...

Stephen at the front desk was amazing!  He helped us plan each day and always had the perfect suggestions for things for us to do.  Can't say enough nice things about him!

title: Fab Stay but Just Missing the Personal Touch
text:
We stayed here as a large group in October. 

The hotel was beautiful, the rooms were really spacious and we had some lovely views. Staff were also really friendly. 

In the morning you get free Coffee and Tea which was a bonus when you were up early for a full day of sightseeing!! It was really central and close to everything.

My only complaint is they messed up a few personal touches that we had planned for my mum as it was her 50th, i's pre-arranged for a gift basket to be delivered and put in her room for when she arrived and it was placed in mine and we asked for her to have a good view but they put her on the 8th floor with a view of the wall with the rest of us up top!

I would recommend the hotel though and stay again they just need to work on the personal aspects!

title: Spotless Hotel
text:
I recently stayed at the Kimpton Ink 48 for 3 nights and cannot praise the hotel enough. I stayed in a CityView Studio Suite and the view was amazing. The room was spotless and the decor was modern and light. The bed was very comfortable and the TV was modern etc and the USB ports next to the bed were also ideal.
The complimentary wine hour was great. Unfortunately when I checked out they recharged the 3 nights stay to my card so I notified the hotel when I realised and they were extremely efficient in rectifying the issue and refunded me immediately. The location of the hotel is great and all staff including the door staff were extremely friendly.

I can not recommend this hotel enough and would definitely stay here if returning to NYC.

title: Can't wait to return to this lovely hotel!
text: The staff was exceptionally friendly. The rooms are nicely appointed and spacious.  The lobby coffee bar is nice. There is a nice restaurant on site.The roof top bar is spectacular. The location is perfect with a subway stop close by.

title: Great place to stay in new yprk
text:
From the check in to the check out the stay at the kimpton ink 48 was perfect.

This is a great hotel, all staff are extremely friendly and helpful

It's not in the heart of manhattan, but a 10 dollar cab ride can bring you there in minutes. The doorman will happily flag down a cab for you.

The rooms are fresh and contemporary, the bathroom is exquisite with a shower that drills holes in your back.

Bar prices are extortionate, but that's the way things are in New York.

Will definitely stay there again

title: fantastic city getaway with furry children
text: We stayed in room 1012, facing north towards nyc. The night club (across the street, right below) was loud, but to city dwellers at heart, it felt invigorating to hear the city life again. This was a very last minute plan, to head into the city with our rescue mutt (48 lbs of love) in tow. Our only pre-requisite was that the hotel could accommodate our four legged family member. Kimpton not accommodated, but exceeded our expectation, setting up a large dog bed and two bowls for water/food for him, recommending delicious local restaurants but also pet friendly, etc. Their friendly staff knew him by his name by the time we left (we were only there for two short days). This hotel is only 4 blocks south of Clinton park (a small park with a fenced in section for small dogs and another for big dogs - perfect for some off leash socializing). Other more human amenities include the beautiful roof top deck as well as a delicious restaurant "Print" below. We have now been completely wowed by Kimpton, and will be looking for more excuses for city excursions again! :)

title: Friendly hotel
text: Being up on the 15th floor you were away from the street noise.  Only one downside, there was no literature on the hotel and services, for example, no menu for room service.  The staff are very helpful, especially the porters.  The hotel is in the Hell's Kitchen area so plenty of restaurants, to get to Times Square it is a bit of a walk.  On the whole would recommend this hotel.

title: Spectacular wedding venue
text:
My husband and I held our wedding at Ink48 in June. It was the most incredible venue. We hired the Heaven over Hell Suite that has a private roof terrace. We travelled from the UK to get married in NYC and decided not to give much about the reception venue away so that our guests could see the amazing views etc for themselves. We're so glad we did as everyone was pretty much speechless! 

The food was delicious, the staff superb and as I already mentioned, the venue itself simply stunning. Cory was our co-ordinator and she was fantastic. In fact every staff member was so polite and friendly. We can't wait to stay at the hotel again - I'm hinting to my husband that an anniversary visit will be due!

title: Medical Appointments in NYC
text: Great Hotel - Even Better staff! Warm and inviting, the staff adds a true Human touch to a stressful time in the city for cancer treatments. The rooms are clean and comfortable and the views are stunning! We enjoy the rooms with a view of the Hudson River. We have stayed multiple times and eaten at some of the suggested restaurants which were very good. It's great to get those suggestions as we are not familiar with NYC. The Rooftop lounge is amazing! A true Home away from home!

title: Hospitality was amazing
text:
I stayed at this hotel with my sisters and friends for a bachelorette weekend. The facility was clean with great modern design. But what really stood out was the hospitality of one of the valet drivers Jose Colon. To make a very long story short, I unfortunately was involved in a car accident the day of my arrival. Subsequently, the car had issues starting! Mr. Colon was helpful in assisting me while I got a tow trunk. His patience and professionalism was unmatched. Also, upon our departure from the hotel, he also neatly packed our vehicle (I think we had 8 pieces of luggage). 
Overall, beautiful hotel with great staff!

title: Jose Colon is the BEST
text: We were in town for a bachelorette party. As we pulled up to the hotel my friend was reared ended by another driver. Jose Colon was there to help. He helped us with unloading our things and just being overall super helpful during the ordeal. He gave us great suggestions of places to visit, etc. He is responsible for the very favorable impression I have of the hotel. Our stay at the hotel was great because of Jose.

title: Most excellent place to stay in Hells Kitchen NYC
text: I have travelled near and far across the USA as well as seven countries in Europe and am always thrilled with the service of Kimpton hotels.  Ink 48 exceeded my expectations. I was upgraded my first night to the 17h floor which had amazing city views with a floor to ceiling window. I transferred rooms to a double double and my luggage was moved from my original room to the new one when my bestie arrived from NJ.  The restaurant was amazing with an awesome flatbread, marinated olives, and goat cheese gnocchi. I am a semi carnivore/ex-vegetarian that loves flavor and combinations. During my trip over 4 days, I did not have a bit of meat and had no regrets.  Jose (doorman extraordinaire) was the  best I ever encountered.  He goes above and beyond his duties to give each and every guest the best experience, whether he is tipped well or not.

title: Super hotel, warm welcome, great service, top class
text: My daughter stayed just for one night in this hotel, while she was travelling to work in Columbia University Hospital.  After a long trans-atlantic journey, she was worn out.  The staff made her feel so welcome, she didn't want to leave!  Beautiful room, lovely views, fantastic customer service. We weren't familiar with this chain, but we will make sure we look out for it in the future.

title: Average hotel
text: Hotel is "ok" asked for room with view and paid a bit more but got a view of car dealership on second floor. We Went back down to front desk and was told that our room is one of the best since it has a tub AND shower. But no view (never use the tub). We were there for business so whatever and I'm not one to complain. The gentleman downstairs Jose Colon is the star employee at Ink48. Guy was awesome and helped with anything and everything we asked. I doubt we will come back with the variety of hotels in NYC but if we were to come back it would be because of the staff and not the hotel.  Rooftop is cool however if you stay here because of the rooftop be sure to check availability since it was closed for private parties 3 out of 4 nights we stayed. Place is clean and staff friendly. Perfect for anything at javits center however not much more to do.

title: Best NY Stay
text: This was my first trip to New York for my 21st birthday with my mum. We were honestly in awe of the hotel, it was so beautiful and the staff were so welcoming. The location is fantastic, we could actually walk to everywhere quite quickly in Midtown, it feels like a very safe area. There is a subway about 10 minutes away too for areas a bit further out like downtown Manhattan. Highly recommend for anyone wanting to see New York, really near lots of bars and restaurants too which is great. The view from the hotel bar was also phenomenal. Best view of Manhattan at night.

title: Excellence
text:
I recently stayed at this Hotel and from Valet to the Front Desk I was greeted with superior service and genuine pleasantness. 

This Hotel never compromises its level of service which is why I keep coming back! 

Thank you again to the Staff of Ink48 for your hospitality!

title: wonderful hotel NYC
text: The staff is unbelievably welcoming and helpful. The hotel feels like home. Especially loved Stephen, Anthony and America. They all helped us navigate the city and find restaurants to enjoy. The view from the upper floors facing the city  is incredible and the roof top bar is unparalleled. Great rooms- cleaning staff is wonderful. Call their reservs directly and join their Karma rewards. Check back before you go to make sure your rates are the best you can get as they can change with availability.

title: beautiful hotel
text: excellent service. they treat you like family. From the moment we arrived they were very friendly. They even had a happy hour with wine sampling from 5-7 pm. The rooms were clean and comfortable. Will be back

title: Terrific hotel in NYC and close to cruise terminal piers
text:
We booked the hotel as it was close to cruise terminal. Easy trip in from Newark by car.
Beautiful and clean hotel. Fantastic view from our room of the city. Popular place for New Yorkers to come to the roof top bar for drink, a chat and to take in the views.
Free coffee from 7am, grab breakfast bar and the nicest of staff.
Everyone has been great and really looked after us well.
There are clubs, restaurants and traffic nearby and some have complained about noise but we have slept well, enjoyed the life of the city and it has all been part of our experience.
I could not recommend this old print works more.

title: Fabulous for the Javitts
text:
Loved the decor in the hotel, what you see on the internet is what you get! We actually stayed in 3 rooms during our stay including a Hudson suite which we absolutely loved. Watching the summer sun go down was a treat coming from winter in Australia. The windows are large in all the rooms and a bonus is that they open!
All the bathrooms were very spacious, I felt 2 were not well designed as they almost felt empty - such a pity as with a bit more thought they could have been even more impressive. All clean which is more important and amenities more than adequate.
Overall, the staff were friendly and very helpful and special thanks to Barbara for moving us into the suite due to our unexpected needs, Elijah checking me in - I loved that you shook my hand and Roger for the great Mexican restaurant recommendation with a free margarita. 
The roof top bar (not operated by the hotel) is definitely worth a visit as is Print the farm to table restaurant - absolutely exquisite food - the poached eggs were so well cooked at breakfast. 
The 5pm complimentary drinks were a nice touch - to have the opportunity to meet other guests or take a glass up to your room!

title: Great river view
text: Roof top bar is a must.  Cocktails are expensive but this is prim NYC real estate.  Outside mid town hub bub, it is one of those places where the locals go to be seen.  That said service was great, met nice people and the drinks looking over the river were excellent
