title: A great surprise in Hell's Kirchen area of NYC!
text: It was a surprise to find a hotel so chic And trendy in The Hell's Kitchen area of NYC. An area full of bares and restaurants. My room was big and comfortable, with big windows in front of Hudson river and New Jersey. Just in front of The Intrepid Air Museum. Lovely hotel!

title: Very good, but...super noisy
text: Located on the 11th avenue 48th street, the hotel used to be a printing house, hence the name. Quite cool and woody decoration, very warm welcome, complimentary drink between 5 and 6, the first contact is very nice. I was in a superior room, with a huge bathroom and a nice view on the east part of the city. Bedding pretty nice, bathrobe in the cabinet, an impressive number of power outlets (I counted 22...!): really cool. On the 16th floor, a deck with an inside (including a bar) and an outside, with very nice view on the west Hudson river and also the north and east view. Very modern and woody design, nice staff. You can access to it from lobby (dedicated elevator) by showing your room key (if not a hotel customer, you might be turned down if too crowded). Great place to drink and watch the sunset. A romantic place to know if you want to make an impression to your beloved one. There is a BUT: even if my room was on a high floor (above 10th), there was just a very thin glass at the window, giving the impression that there was no sound barrier between you and the noise of the 11th avenue. I can tell that this is a VERY noisy avenue at any time of the day and the night. It is impossible (at least to me) to sleep without being woken up by the usual siren, super engine, loud music or else. For a four-star hotel, it should be a must to have the appropriate window glass thickness. I cannot imagine what is might be at a lower floor...So if you want to stay there, you can ask for a non-11th avenue room, then ensure you don't take a room with a number ending by 01 to 06, or bring your ear plugs and sleeping pills.

title: Elegant but comfortable.
text: We had a large group attending a wedding. The staff was very helpful at check in going out of their way to help my cousins to stay in my floor. We ended up next to each other!  Elyah came through. This boutique hotel provides an experience to match.  From the free organic coffee in the morning to the cocktail hour with nice choice of wines in the evening. The decoration is clean and unassuming. The rooms are good size for NYC hotel and the bed was very comfortable. Plenty of towels and nice robes. They offer a multitude of items if you forget including phone charges and flat irons! The mini bar is well stocked with premiums drinks even though the $9 water seem way over priced. The event was run very nicely and definitively an unique spot overlooking the Manhattan with amazing view. Only issues to consider are:  if you have a room over the lounge, noise level is high through the night and the room service stops at 10:30 which seemed too early for me. I would pick this hotel over many five star chain ones.

title: Great service, Thin Walls
text:
Fabulous customer service from the moment we arrived with the front desk/concierge Stephen offering great local restaurant advice to the housekeeping maid and her seemingly boundless enthusiasm. 

Only downside to the hotel is the walls are paper thin, a surprise for a Kimpton property. Normally Kimptons are in old, sturdy renovations, but here you can hear pretty much everything in the next room, a distracting downer in an otherwise great weekend.

title: Great Hotel!
text:
From the minute I walked in everyone was nice and friendly. I had a Room on the 15th Floor with view over Manhattan. It was so amazing and it's definitely worth it to book a Room with a view. Everything is clean and the rooms have a lot of space. 
I really enjoyed my stay and would always come back!

title: Hidden Gem in Midtown West/Hells Kitchen
text: This hotel is absolutely perfect for those attending theater in upper Midtown or attending events at Javits Center.  Once considered isolated, Hells Kitchen gentrification has come west to this hotel, so restaurants, bars and other attractions are mere blocks away. The hotel itself is luxe with commanding city skyline and Hudson River views.  Especially cool to see the big cruise ships docked just behind the hotel along the river.  Rooms are large and well appointed and Print the restaurant is quite good.  Lobby bar could have more atmosphere and vibe however this is more than made up for by the rooftop bar which non residents wait in long lines to have access.  The views are breathtaking and the cocktails quite solid. You have to see it to believe it.  Hip crowd up there but unintimidating for this 50-something.

title: Happy Customer
text: Ink 48 was a great time. The rooftop lounge view at night is incredible. Friendly front desk staff. Attentive to all of my requests. Clean facilities. I had an overall great experience spending my birthday with Ink 48!

title: Fabulous!
text: Absolutely love staying here. Room was just beautiful with great view! Staff just exceptional. They go out of their way to make sure you have everything you need. Celebrated 50th birthday and was sent 2 bottles of champagne to celebrate with our friends. Love the rooftop bar. Great to come back to hotel and have a cocktail with an amazing view. Will be back!

title: One of the best customer service experiences I've ever had!!!
text:
I decided to treat my friends to a ladies weekend in NYC! I am in management with one of the largest hotel brands in the world, and had never actually stayed in a Kimpton hotel before. This was my first time, and let me tell you, I cannot WAIT to go back. From the moment we came through the door, the front desk staff was friendly, helpful and kind. We had to wait a bit for our suite to be ready, and they brought us a couple rounds of champagne. Elijah was wonderfully kind right off the bat and made us feel very taken care of. I had booked the Hudson Suite, and when we did get up there, it was absolutely gorgeous. A beautiful view of the river, and partial of the city. We were given another complimentary bottle of champagne as we were celebrating a few little things with our girlfriends. Through out our stay, every interaction with the staff was beyond perfection. They all were smiling and happy the entire time. David brought us room service multiple times and I cannot stress enough how wonderfully accommodating and kind he was our entire weekend. Of course, you can't write a review about this place without noting the unbelievable views on the rooftop at The Press Lounge. Even though we had booked rooftops elsewhere in the city during our trip, we ended up spending our Saturday night in our very own hotel! There wasn't a view we could find that could beat it. 
When we were checking out, Daniel at the front desk could not have been kinder. Helped us keep our bags while waiting for the train, recommended the most PERFECT brunch spot. All the way around... i could NOT be more thrilled and impressed with this specific property. 
Being from the hotel industry, there were MORE than dozens of times I made note of how amazing this property ran, and how i wanted to take back to my own property some of the amazing things I saw. 

I can't stress enough... this place should be 100% your next stop when staying in NYC. I cannot WAIT to go back. Another huge thank you to Elijah, David, Daniel... and so SO many more than I know I am forgetting. 
You guys killed it!!!!

title: Fantastic Hotel & Location!
text:
Overall this hotel was amazing and in a brilliant location. The staff are really friendly and the hotel offers a lot. Definitely a very good 4 star and I would stay here if I ever visited New York again!

Hotel
The décor of the hotel was very modern and chic, great way to welcome you to New York. It was very clean and just a nice place to be throughout! My only very minor comment would be the lifts could do with sprucing up to match the rest of the hotel although it looked like it was being done up anyway. Could do with making the numbers easier to see in the lifts, save everyone squinting 

Room
As it was my friend’s birthday we were very kindly upgraded to a King Deluxe Room. It was lovely! We were on the 10th floor with great views over the city through the full length windows. There are all the amenities you could want, flat screen TV, fridge, hairdryer and lots of plug sockets! It was fairly spacious, clean and the bed was very comfortable. The bathroom was nicely decorated too and the shower was huge and very efficient!

Restaurant/Food
The hotel serve complimentary tea and coffee in the morning (7am-9am Mon-Sat, bit later on Sundays) which is useful and then there is always water infused with fruit available during the day. Unfortunately I was unable to take advantage of their hosted wine reception 5pm-6pm everyday but sounded good! We only dined in the restaurant (PRINT) for breakfast but it was really good – nice décor and the food was amazing (I recommend the blueberry pancakes and French toast) and actually fairly reasonable. Useful when you don’t have time to eat out. 

Staff
The staff were very friendly and helpful. They went the extra mile to make it special for my friend’s birthday by sending a card, cakes and a bottle of wine as well as the upgrade – thank you Daniel! Also when our safe wasn’t working, they came within minutes of us phoning to fix it and even though they had to replace the door they fixed it within 20-30mins – very impressed! 

Location
This is one of the best parts about this hotel,  its only about 10-15min walk to Times Square and only 5 min walk to the restaurants in Hell’s Kitchen (mostly along 9th Avenue). It’s also far enough away to provide some peace and quiet from the noisy and busy tourist areas which you will be grateful for when you constantly hear sirens and car horns all day and night!

title: Fantastic - stay here!
text: Sitting on the train from NY back to D.C., having just stayed 2 nights here.  Superb hotel in every single regard.  Staff was extra-friendly and helpful to a person.  Shout out to Daniel and front desk staff, but also to the oft unsung cleaning staff, who kept everything in great shape.  The hotel is a repurposed old printing building, and so ceiling are high.  Room was spacious, and the interior was modern but also warm and welcoming.  We are sort of coffee snobs, and the morning lobby coffee did not disappoint.  GM  Linda deserves kudos for this management, and the obvious atmosphere among guests in the lobby was that people enjoyed being here.  A great central location, a shade outside the Times Square craziness but close enough for a walk there or to Central Park.  And you are close to the river for a fun walk both up and down, to easily connect to the high line elevated walkway - very cool.  Good ethnic eats a few blocks away, but we also had breakfast at the restaurant which was just excellent.  Thanks Ink48 for a very special 2 night stay.  This is great hotel value as well.  Will definitely stay here or another Kimpton again!!

title: Ink 48
text:
Nice hotel and Friendly staff and nice location as not too far from Times Square by walking and impressed by room size 
Nice cool room and nice view over 11th avenue and could not fault staff and door staff and good internet  and nice bar and lounge area to enjoy 
Will return

title: Employees
text: Time of stay late night 5/27-- 6/5 2017.   The employees were WONDERFUL! especially the night crew! Nathan McNeil is the nicest guy! Very helpful & polite! I tried to get him to call me by my first name (Staci) but he wouldn't! It was always Ms. Baker! LOL!  Every night when my family & I would get back to the hotel, I would stay outside & smoke. When Nathan wasnt busy he would talk to me & give me ideas of what to do in the city! Some nights I was out there for 2 or 3 hours just enjoying the atmosphere! When he had a chance he would ask me about our day & just listen to this "old southern woman" from Texas talk about how amazing it was there! He really made NYC feel like home, even though that was not where I wanted to be @ the time! LOL!!!  Stalin was great as well. He worked days so I didn't see him as much but did enjoy talking to him as well!! He was also very nice & polite!!  Thank you all for a TREMENDOUS experience that I will never forget!! NYC is a wonderful place!! Oh, I  Hope all you locals are proud of your NYPD & FDNY!!! They are doing an EXCEPTIONAL job with as many people they have to contend with everyday let alone "us tourist"! LOL!! Take Care INK STAFF!! Hope to see you all again, SOON!      Staci Baker  "aka Ms. Baker" ;)

title: My favorite place to stay! Thanks, Ink 48!
text: This is my 3rd stay at Ink 48 and I will definitely stay there again.  Excellent service and accommodations. Great rooftop bar with the best view in town.  The rooms, services, and products are top notch.  Comfortable room, perfect place to unwind after a day of catching up with New York, the view from all 3 rooms I have had is amazing!  Thanks, Ink48

title: Always Delivers
text: Yes, the roof bar in unbelievable.  And absolutely, the Print Restaurant is delicious.  BUT, also the staff of the hotel is top notch.  I stopped in on Mother's Day and I'd like to single out one man behind the front desk.  Daniel went above and beyond to top off a wonderful and memorable afternoon with my mother. Will return for sure.

title: Suveränt hotell
text: Första gången jag var i NY och inte sista gången jag bor på limpton ink48, toppen personal i receptionen. Fina rum och excellent roof top bar. När till tunnelbanan och nära ner till hudson river. Ligger väldigt bra inte mitt i smeten men enrå inte långt till nånting.

title: Attentive Concierge Staff
text: What makes a hotel room more than just a reservation is the attentiveness of the Concierge Staff to your special requests. The personal attention the Kimpton Ink 48 hotel provides to make your stay special is unparalleled. This hotel excels from check-in to the quality of their rooms to special requests to the special guest amenities that they provide during your stay. It's more like staying at your best friend's home with a welcoming, relaxed, NYC chic vibe that makes you want to come back again and again.  It is my 'go to' NYC hotel and I have become an avid supporter of the Kimpton brand when traveling.

title: Nice rooms, but.....
text: We'd probably stay here again. The rooms are nice, and the staff is helpful.  Also, we attended an event in one of the rooftop suites, and the views are spectacular.  However, the food at the event was awful and, to our taste, not even edible.  Plus,surrounding clubs/restaurants are extremely loud.  We were on the fourth floor, but could hear full conversations/arguments from the sidewalk until 4:30 in the morning, so it's definitely not very soundproof.  We're a little older, and this is definitely a hotel for the younger crowd.

title: Go for the vibe not a good night's sleep
text: Stayed here on a Saturday night. Sharp looking accommodations with fab views of both the city and the Hudson River BUT... traffic around the hotel was congested after 11 as patrons lined up to get into Lucky Cheng's and perhaps a second club as well. As patrons lined up, vehicles double parked, someone was poorly managing traffic on the side street (perhaps the club employees ) & aggravated drivers behind the mess were honking horns.... for hours... even at 3am! We were above the 10th floor and STILL heard horns blaring after 11pm. For me, the bed was too firm but it was acceptable for my partner. The bathroom was contemporary but not practical - had to reach across shower head to turn it on, toilet was square so sitting on it made me feel like I was "falling in." Elevators were plentiful and quick, main lobby was contemporary and upscale.

title: Kimpton delivers....AGAIN!
text: Our first visit to Ink48 affirmed the excellent reputation we have in Kimpton properties.  Our gracious host, Daniel, made our day by informing us we were the "guests of the day!". A fitting and most proper welcome to another memorable stay.  Not a property to be missed!

title: Excellent Hotel! Great Views! Great Service!
text:
I returned to this hotel after almost 6 years and incidentally to have another reunion with the same group of friends buoyed by great memories from the last trip!

Check-In was very efficient and they had a room ready for me at 1pm even though I never asked in advance and simply popped in. When I used my Kimpton Karma credit to get an upgrade, I was given one of the best rooms in the hotel on the 17th floor with an amazing view and that too was ready at 1pm! Great start!

I missed the Press Lounge this time although I remember the awesome views from the last trip; this time the view from my room made up for it :). I had to call housekeeping to request a couple of items I forgot to bring and service was prompt even though it was a busy time!

Our friends, two other couples, also stayed at this hotel and one of them was welcomed with a bottle of wine and an upgrade and the other was also given an upgrade. Of course, none of them were expecting it, and I am so impressed that Ink48 treats both recurring guests such as myself and new guests to Kimpton so well!

Overall great stay and choosing Ink48 made our overall trip to NYC so much more memorable! Very much looking forward to my next stay at Ink48 and Kimpton Hotels!

title: Hospitality unlike any other!
text:
I cannot say enough amazing things about this hotel and the people. I've traveled to many hotels and this is by far my NYC favorite. My husband and I, being former Manhattan residents enjoy visiting our old Hell's Kitchen neighborhood with our young son and dog. They have a fabulous rooftop and we love that we can have our dog join us at their daily complimentary wine hour. 

Back in April, we gifted my parents a stay at Ink48. Daniel, the concierge is hospitality at its finest. He kindly upgraded my parents to the best room they had, complete with a private terrace. They are still talking about it! Every experience at the Kimpton is special and memorable and always stands out from other hotel chains I've stayed at. Thanks to Daniel for rolling out the red carpet for my parents and always my dog! 

Sidenote: My boss was displaced during Hurricane Sandy and Ink48 took him and many others with dogs for nearly 6 weeks while they had to vacate their buildings. 

They are simply the best at what they do! 

Colleen

title: Excellent hotel all-around
text: We really enjoyed our stay here. Lobby is trendy and quite pleasant to spend time lounging around. Happy hour with free wine in the evening was a real bonus. Front desk staff were friendly and helpful. The room was very large for New York City and had high end, beautiful furnishings. Bed was very comfortable. Bathroom vanity and shower were excellent. Views of NYC were quite nice, as well. The rooftop bar - while not officially part of the hotel - is a real asset for the hotel. As a guest, you get to skip the line and head on up. The gym was superb for a boutique hotel with good equipment. The neighborhood is good, but the hotel is a bit remote from Times Square and the heart of Hell's Kitchen. One (long) block to the East, there are quite a few restaurants, shops, and bars, however. The only negative I would like to point out is the street noise. It's not overwhelming, but even 11 floors up, you can hear what's going on at street-level. The windows do not effectively block out the noise.

title: Unresponsive Management
text:
Our family stayed at the Kimpton Ink48 Hotel in May. We enjoyed our stay, however, there were some difficulties.  I left my comments with the staff at the front desk and also sent an email to the hotel two weeks ago.  What bothers me is that I have not received any acknowledgement from the hotel.  The message is that the management does not care about its customers or about improving its services or accommodations.  Here is what I wrote:

"Thank you for sending the bill.  Overall, my family and I enjoyed our stay the Kimpton Ink48 Hotel.  The staff were helpful and the property was well maintained.

However,  here are some suggestions for improvement.

1. Room Air-conditioning. During our stay, the weather was unusually hot. The room air-conditioner needed to be activated.  When it periodically activated during the night, the fan was unusually loud, disturbing sleep.

2. PRINT Restaurant for Breakfast.  On the first morning, we ordered breakfast the the PRINT restaurant.  The service was EXTREMELY slow.  Our order was not that complicated. Worse, my daughter ordered a bowl of fruit and when it finally arrived, she found an inch worm in it.  The server took the bowl back to the kitchen and replaced it.  However, a more appropriate response should have been "sorry" and "no charge" for the order.  Instead, she defended the inch worm but telling us that the produce came directly from the farm.  Some of your staff needs to be better trained. In addition, the menu states the the orange juice is fresh squeezed.  It was not. I can tell the difference between fresh squeezed and bottled juice.

I hope that this feedback will help to improve your services."

title: Exceptional hotel in NYC
text: As with all Kimpton Hotels, this one is very nice with all the Karma amenities.  We had a lovely, spacious room on the 14th floor overlooking the city, it was an amazing view.  The shampoos and soaps smell wonderful and the room is so clean and bright.  The shower was large and no problems with water pressure or hot water, even on the high floor.  The nightly free wine hour is always enjoyable.  The free morning coffee and newspapers are a nice addition, along with the fruit-infused water in the lobby during the day.  For the price, you cannot beat this hotel.  The location was one block from pier 88, where Fleet Week was docked, so we enjoyed meeting the sailors and touring the Kearsarge while we were there.  All of the staff were super helpful when we needed directions or wondered where to eat.  Walkable to many areas of interest and to the subway.

title: affordable price for the 5 star service
text: This is the best that you can do in NYC. Hotel locate at the midtown west side, facing he Hudson River. This is not 5 star hotel, but rooms are very clean, and view from the window is amazing. We stayed in the Junior suite with the window view on the Hudson river, but regular room with  the city view also is very nice and a lot  cheaper. Try to get the room above 8th floor to avoid city noise. We ate at Print restaurant - food was so fresh  and delicious. We also visited the bar/lounge, but it was very crowded. The best time to go and see the view from the roof top is at 5pm when it is just open, and not a lot of people. Over roll this is a great place, with walking distance to Intrepid,  Circle Line, Museum of Modern Art, Times SQ and Broadway Theaters.

title: Incredible Staff!
text: I just wanted to say a huge thank you to the staff at Kimpton Ink48 - especially Stephen Field. Always so friendly and accommodating. Stephen was incredibly kind and welcoming on my arrival and I would highly recommend this hotel to all those wanting a place to stay in NYC.

title: Birthday Night in NYC
text: My husband and I came into NYC for the night and stayed at Ink48.  I had requested a higher floor and a room as far from the elevator as possible, based on other reviews.  The staff was wonderful! Our room was on the 12th floor and was as far from the elevator as possible.  We did not have any issues with noise.  The concierge, Daniel, was wonderful.  He checked to make sure we were happy with the room, and even addressed a billing issue after we checked out.  The hotel sent up complimentary wine and chocolate for our birthday, which was such a nice surprise.  The rooftop bar had beautiful views.  We ate breakfast at Print the following morning.  The food was delicious!  As far as location, it was a short walk to the High Line, which we took down to the Meatpacking District for dinner.  I enjoyed the location and was happy not to be in the middle of it all.  The area will not give you the typical NYC tourist feel, but that wasn't what we were looking for.  I would definitely stay here again.  I also highly recommend the Kimpton chain.  The hotels are reasonable and the staff always goes above and beyond.  Thank you for a great night!

title: Unbelievable service and accomodation in New York for an unbelievable price!
text: I lived in New York City for some time and left two years ago.  Visiting a friend I was in a last minute spot and needed a hotel.  Ink48 was booked and still managed to provide me a room.  The concierge, Stephen Field was incredibly friendly and  genuine in doing everything he could to help me.  I really felt like he cared about my situation.  Great style and beautiful, modern, clean rooms provided a much needed rest.  And let me tell you about the restaurant, Print.  I am a hospitality veteran of 30 years and am hypercritical of food and service.  That food was OFF THE HOOK delcious!!!  I'm not even going to shop around the next time I visit New York.  My decision is already made.  You will not be disappointed.

title: Ahhhh! Love ya, Kimpton
text: I do adore Kimpton hotels -- at a time when most other hotel chains settle for indifferent service, Kimpton keeps things top notch and classy. Rooms are lovely, spotless, and far more spacious than I expected. Lovely views from room,as well as rooftop bar. Though 11th Ave might at first feel a bit out of the way, in fact it was quite convenient -- 2 blocks down is the Gotham food market with excellent eating, and just around the corner is Sullivan St. Bakery for some of the best bread in NYC, and 10th Ave is filled with groceries markets and restaurants. I will definitely stay here again. Thanks to Stephen for the personalized service and excellent advice. One note though: 11th Ave is noisier than I expected, and even though I was on the 10 th floor, I still found it very noisy, I likely wouldn't stay here with my kids. And, for management, constructive feedback: my first two mornings, I had to wait for coffee, AND others gathered told me they had been waiting more than 20 minutes for the lobby coffee to be refilled. On a Sunday. Not cool. Moreover, the staff in the lobby should have found a way to resolve this quicker. Coffee is very important, and if you don't have coffee makers in rooms, best have it readily available. Still love you Kimpton. 😀

title: Beautiful Contemporary Hotel in Hell's Kitchen
text: I had a nice stay at Ink48 in NYC over the Memorial Day Weekend. Service was excellent. When I arrived by cab, the doorman immediately opened my cab door, took my bags, and escorted me to the front desk to check-in. I initially booked a King room but was upgraded to King Deluxe. The room was beautiful and comfortable. I did, however, end up switching rooms due to the noise across the street. I wouldn't recommend staying on the side of the hotel facing 48th Street. There is a club across the street called Studio48. Loud music starts around 6:00 PM and doesn't end until 4:00 AM. I called guest services and they were kind enough to move me from the 7th floor on 48th to the 14th floor on the other side of the building. I had no problems with noise after that.

title: The model for what a NYC experience should be.
text:
The friendly, cordial, happy service during our stay for our 25th Wedding Anniversary was the high point of our time in NY. 
The rooms are modern, yet comfortable. Very clean and housekeeping took care of our every request. 
The front desk team - of which I interacted with eight different members - was even more attentive and friendly. Every time we returned we were greeted with a smile. They responded to our requests with a cheerful, "Of course!" Every suggestion they made for restaurants, etc was spot on. They know the best "non-tourist" spots. 
Daniel was particularly helpful in taking care of our room change and seemed genuinely proud when we told him how hard it was for us to leave. 
If you like the idea of walking a mile or so to get to the Theater District and Times Square in a vibrant neighborhood, you can't beat Ink48 and Hells Kitchen. 
Normally, we like to try different places when we go to the city, but we will definitely be back to the Ink48.

title: Five Star Service & Rooms without the pretension
text:
You cannot find a better hotel in NYC for comfortable rooms, great ambiance and INCREDIBLE staff.  I've been fortunate enough to stay at Five Star hotels around the US and elsewhere, lived in a Ritz Carlton for several years, and feel I'm a pretty good judge of a great hotel property.  I tend to look for a great hotel and return if I love it.  I first stayed at Ink48 while my NYC apartment was having some work done, and love it so much I literally gave up my apartment and stay here exclusively when I travel to NYC for work or otherwise - over a dozen times at this point.  I just returned from another great stay and am booking again for next month.  
The hotel rooms are very accurately described on the website, and the staff is happy to give you further details by phone.  I prefer the rooms with separate walk in showers and large soaking tubs - a real treat for a NYC hotel.  Even the smallest rooms are large by NYC hotel standards, especially for a boutique hotel experience - and the bathrooms are massive.  The beds, linens and duvets are always fresh and incredibly comfortable, and the bathrooms incredibly clean. 
I joined the free Kimpton Karma program and the $15 free mini bar credit along with free wi-fi is another nice perk, along with the complimentary wine happy hour daily.  Although with my work schedule I don't typically make it in time for that, it's great when I do!
Hands down - the best thing about the hotel is the service = the staff.  I have had great experiences from housekeeping, front desk staff, all the doormen including Jose, and the incredibly patient and accommodating room service staff.  I particularly appreciate Stephen Field, Concierge, and Roger Sawh, Manager.  These gentlemen go above and beyond to help guests, and are willing to roll up their sleeves and get the job done whatever the need is.  I've had them personally help me with baggage, deliver extra pillows in the middle of the night, and so forth - and follow up with a text to make sure things are to my liking - something no other hotel I've stayed in provides.  During my stay last week, I made the mistake of lying down for "a minute" after my shower before getting packed and heading to the airport - and the comfortable bed took over and I fell asleep.  I woke up in a panic and running very late to catch my flight.  The hotel staff helped me quickly pack and zip things up and get into an Uber, and then double checked the room for me and emailed me to confirm everything had been packed - I thought I had left something but they had tucked it right into my suitcase!  Stephen Field checked in on me every day of my stay and after I checked out as well - has been particularly kind to me attending to my preferred room choices, expediting things for me, handling packages and such.  I can't thank Stephen and Roger enough, and all of the Ink48 team.  
The restaurant is incredibly delicious, great service, incredibly well managed.  I don't tend to take advantage of the upstairs bar but one of the great things about the hotel is that the rooftop bar patrons use a separate elevator and I don't experience noise from such a popular place.  Terrific rooms, beds and linens, bathrooms and people.  Excellent, all around.

title: Week end à New York
text: Idéal, belle vue sur Manhattan (mais il faut le préciser à la réservation) , au dernier étage un bar très très chic avec terrasse panoramique. Bien situé à 10 min à pied de time square, belles  chambres. Bon petit breakfast.C'était un deuxième séjour et encore une fois, très satisfait.

title: Nice hotel but not excellent
text:
Pro's:
Complimentary wine from 5pm to 6pm.
Amazing view.

Con's:
No pool
Poor rooftop bar
Pay extra for music/water/wifi

You would expect when you pay $500 p.n. you'd get things like wifi or a bottle of water in the room but not at Ink48. Why charge $15 for wifi on a $500 room?

title: Utmärkt service på ett mycket fräscht hotell som har det mesta.
text: Stora fräscha rum och badrum. Alltid fördel att bo högt upp för utsikt. Personalen väldigt trevlig och framför allt otroligt hjälpsamma. Vi fick underbar hjälp av Stephen F i receptionen av att fixa biljetter till hockey och mycket mer. Takbaren men sin utsikt är ett måste. Vi åt även på deras restaurang Print och var mer än nöjda. Återkommer mer än gärna.

title: Great Customer Service
text:
Everyone from the front desk, door man, maintenance to housekeeping extremely helpful and courteous. Rooms large compared to most NYC hotels, we booked a city view king. Room was very clean and comfortable. Eleventh Avenue is a busy street so it can be a bit noisy as other reviewers have stated. Press Lounge on the 16th floor is a must visit. The lounge affords beautiful views of the Hudson River and the NJ shoreline.  Coffee offered in the lobby in the morning and the wine hour later in the day is also a plus. 
We felt that the staff never missed a beat during our stay!

title: Fine dining! Fantastic service! Great view rooms!
text:
Where can I begin? We stayed at this location two adjacent weekends during which we had a cruise in between. First the arrival welcome and greeting by staff was top notch, they were courteous and welcoming. This was appreciated after a long trip with weather delays from the West Coast. Our room had a phenomenal corner view of the adjacent cruise terminal, only to be further surpassed a week later by a full onset view of the ship we sailed on! 

The service from the bellman and front management Stephen Field was again top notch. He provided recommendations on both arrivals, one for the delicious Print restaurant within the hotel which had the best gnocchi I've had and the short ribs which my spouse had.  The recommended brunch place with my lifelong friends from NYC upon our return was just as welcome. Absolutely delicious and the cocktails at the restaurant indeed were quality NYC! 

I would highly recommend this especially for the ease to mid town, the ease to NJ and the airport as well as the cruise terminals.....quiet location as well we found! 

We will return and have suggested already to friends who are traveling on a cruise to consider this hotel in Manhattan.

title: They put hostile into hospitality
text:
I went on a business trip to the Ink 48. It is a very nice hotel, the rooms are very modern, yet cosy. I slept well and the bath was really spacious.
The location is good. The next subway is a few blocks away; it is very close to the Hudson and the Interpid Museum.
The real downside of this hotel was any single interaction I had with the service staff. On check-in, the lady was just interested in me paying the bill in advance. Doing so, she completely forgot the check-in speech and did not talk about any services the hotel had to offer.
At a later point, waiting in the lobby, I was bossed away from the seating as it apparently did not belong to hotel but to the restaurant. The waitress was very determined to get me out of that space (it turned out, that it was one booth too deep into the restaurant, the one next to it would have been okay - i had to find this out on my own).
On check-out, the receptionist rolled his eyes on my request to adjust the billing address, gave me heavy attitude and gave me, once again, the feeling of not being welcome, even though I am definitely not a demanding guest. 
To sum up, this was one of the worst hotels, I have ever stayed in, in terms of their non-existing  compassion for guests.

title: Goed hotel
text: Goed hotel met vriendelijke bediening.Wij hadden een mooie schone kamer en badkamer.Het bed was heel comfortabel en er was geen geluidsoverlast.Restaurant Print beneden is een top restaurant!Dit hotel is echt een aanrader!

title: Semester & cykling
text: Hotellet uppfyller förväntningarna, ligger i ett bil återförsäljare område utmed 11avenyn. Nära Hudson river och Time Square. Flertal restauranger och barer inom ett par kvarter. Utmärkt cykelbana utmed Hudson River, hotellet har några cyklar man kan låna. I hotellet finns en poppis takbar med strålande utsikt. Restaurangen håller högklass. Personalen i receptionen hjälpsam och trevlig. Mycket trafik utmed 11:E avenyn, men det är det överallt.

title: Good Location and View
text:
This is my first stay at this Kimpton Property. The rooms are clean and your standard small size for NYC. We had a great view of the Hudson River. The staff at check in were great. We had a couple of small issues. When we arrived we could not get our air conditioner to work. I went to the front desk as our room was 79 degrees and they said they would send someone. I waited about 30 minutes and called guest services and someone finally came up and it started working. Our second issue is something that is probably not the hotels fault but I recommend you really inspect the mini bar before use. My husband got a bottle of beer from the mini bar one he had never tried before. He said this tastes terrible. I then tried it and to me it tasted like water. We then dumped it into a glass and it definitely did not look like beer more like water.  Not sure if someone had drank the beer that was in the bottle and put the cap back on. We did notify the front desk and they were extremely apologetic and made us feel like a valued guest. 

Loved the free bikes that you can take out for a spin. We went around central park and the city. They are first come first serve but definitely a great way to see the city. 

A must to go up to the roof top bar the views are fantastic. Children are not allowed and there is a dress code.

title: An oasis on a hot spring weekend
text: I snagged a King deluxe room with a beautiful west view--huge, comfortable, and mostly quiet...there is a nightclub across the street with a roof garden which can be noisy on the weekends. Great service at this Kimpton, and the food is excellent at Print, downstairs. Though the best time to come here is in the winter, when it it is less crowded.

title: Great stay and good location
text: Stayed for 4 nights for wife's birthday treat. Staff were great and easy to chat with. Room spotless and bathroom the size of my home. Slept very well, but knackered anyhow after walking, walking and more walking this fabulous city.. Room top bar offers amazing views but drink prices make sure you pay for it, and you cannot charge to room as not part of the hotel. Tea and Coffee in the foyer in the morning to help yourself to was great in a morning. 3/4 mile from Times Square and jogged there and back and Central Park while in area and if interested in running an excellent path by the river also past the Intrepid past the various Piers. No noise on street outside so a quiet area and walked back all hours and never felt threatened in any way..My only criticism, I asked that they may acknowledge my wife's birthday while there in some way and duly sent a card way in advance for my wife to open. never saw the card and no mention of her birthday so was a little disappointed in that as they said they would.. Small thing however and would stop here again without reservation...

title: Fantastic hotel with fabulous rooftop bar
text: This hotel is a little out of the way but is well worth the extra walk. Rooftop bar is absolutely fantastic, 360 views of the city skyline and Hudson River. Rooms were nice, larger than most midtown hotels and very clean. Staff were very helpful too.

title: excelente todo
text: elegimos este hotel por su terraza y ubicacion. fuimos con mi hija de 20 años. Cuando quisimos subir al Press lounge nos pidieron documentos y solo permiten mayor de 21. nos permitieron subir y permanecer un rato sin consumir nada porque eran las 17 hs. lo demas impecable. habitaciones mas grandes de la media normal, tenes batas y pantuflas y una vista increible del Hudson river y del upper west side. en el lobby del hotel siempre encontras aguas saborizadas.

title: Business Trip
text: I travel extensively for business and always stay at Ink 48 when in New York City. In an average year, I stay at Ink six to eight times. The hotel is in a great location with amazing staff that always make me feel like the hotel is my second home. The hotel has recently been renovated and all rooms are spacious with high ceilings. Lastly, there is a roof top bar that has great views of the city as well as the Hudson River.

title: Lovely Hotel
text:
I stayed for 4 nights here and it's wonderful
Bedroom very comfortable
Staff very polite
Extremely clean
From JFK cost of Uber is +\- $100
Food is good, although I felt a bit expensive 
Picture is view from bar- lovely !!
Hell's Kitchen area is getting better

title: Excellenter Service, hervorragende Zimmer, absolute Sauberkeit, sehr nettes Personal
text: Die Lage des Hotels ist sehr gut. Fünf Minuten bis zum Hudson River. 15 Minuten bis zum Broadway (Zu Fuß). Die Zimmeraussicht traumhaft. Bin das 2. Mal in diesem Hotel zu Gast, das Beste Hotel was ich bisher in NEW York hatte. Ich war bereits 7 Mal in NEW YORK.  Die Unterstützung an der Rezeption beispielsweise : Bestellung eines Shuttles zum Flughafen und vieles mehr, hervorragend!!

title: Fabulous Hotel and outstanding service
text:
I have stayed at this hotel many times. I love the welcoming staff.
Stephen is one of the best concierge in the city. The lobby is busy and exciting. The rooms are comfortable with fabulous views. I highly recommend it.

title: Lovely room! Fun environment!
text:
Stayed for the weekend. We were upgraded to a corner King. The ceilings are high, decor is lovely and modern without being edgy. Huge amount of room, especially for NYC hotels. One block from the Intrepid and piers, bike and walking paths. Easy walk from Times Square at night. Elijah at the front desk and John in sales who worked the wine reception were both very helpful, friendly with great suggestions. 

Highly recommended!

title: Ink, Stage and Print 48!
text: Ink Hotel is just great!  The newly renovated rooms are clean, quiet and spacious.  Clean comfortable bed, mini-bar and fridge.  Room has a beautiful view of the NY skyline.  The Print 48 restaurant is as advertised:  Farm Fresh to Table!  Late afternoon complimentary wine.  The Stage 48 on the rooftop Press Lounge has awesome views of the city!  Will definitely be back often.

title: Nice view
text: I stayed in Ink48 during easter. It was crowded and the service was a bit lazy and impersonal. I loved the view from my suite to the Hudson river. Luckily they gave me only the 7th floor because I am afraid of heights. You should know they don't give you their reward program points if you pay your room through some second party. Nice room, a bit far from where the real centre. But I chose it for the view.
